verses.sanskrit: मा चिदन्यद वि शंसत सखायो मा रिषण्यत इन्द्रमित्स्तोता वर्षणं सचा सुते मुहुरुक्था च शंसत |||
verses.transliteration: mā cidanyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata indramitstotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhurukthā ca śaṃsata

translations.griffith: GLORIFY naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you.  Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:

verses.sanskrit: अवक्रक्षिणं वर्षभं यथाजुरं गां न चर्षणीसहम विद्वेषणं संवननोभयंकरं मंहिष्ठमुभयाविनम |||
verses.transliteration: avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuraṃ ghāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham vidveṣaṇaṃ saṃvananobhayaṃkaraṃ maṃhiṣṭhamubhayāvinam

translations.griffith: Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's Conqueror, bounteous like a cow;  Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि तवा जना इमे नाना हवन्त ऊतये अस्माकं बरह्मेदमिन्द्र भूतु ते.अह विश्वा च वर्धनम |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye asmākaṃ brahmedamindra bhūtu te.aha viśvā ca vardhanam

translations.griffith: Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid,  Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exaltation every day.

verses.sanskrit: वि तर्तूर्यन्ते मघवन विपश्चितो.अर्यो विपो जनानाम उप करमस्व पुरुरूपमा भर वाजं नेदिष्ठमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito.aryo vipo janānām upa kramasva pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye

translations.griffith: Those skilled in song, O Maghavan among these men o’ercome with might the foeman's songs.  Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.

verses.sanskrit: महे चन तवामद्रिवः परा शुल्काय देयाम न सहस्रायनायुताय वज्रिवो न शताय शतामघ |||
verses.transliteration: mahe cana tvāmadrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām na sahasrāyanāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha

translations.griffith: O Caster of the Stone, I would not sell thee for a mighty price,  Not for a thousand, Thunderer! nor ten thousand, nor a hundred, Lord of countless wealth!

verses.sanskrit: वस्यानिन्द्रासि मे पितुरुत भरातुरभुञ्जतः माता चमे छदयथः समा वसो वसुत्वनाय राधसे |||
verses.transliteration: vasyānindrāsi me pituruta bhrāturabhuñjataḥ mātā came chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase

translations.griffith: O Indra, thou art more to me than sire or niggard brother is.  Thou and my mother, O Good Lord, appear alike, to give me wealth abundantly.

verses.sanskrit: कवेयथ कवेदसि पुरुत्रा चिद धि ते मनः अलर्षि युध्म खजक्र्त पुरन्दर पर गायत्रा अगासिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: kveyatha kvedasi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt purandara pra ghāyatrā aghāsiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Where art thou? Whither art thou gone? For many a place attracts thy mind.  Haste, Warrior, Fort-destroyer, Lord of battle's din, haste, holy songs have sounded forth.

verses.sanskrit: परास्मै गायत्रमर्चत वावातुर्यः पुरन्दरः याभिःकाण्वस्योप बर्हिरासदं यासद वज्री भिनत पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: prāsmai ghāyatramarcata vāvāturyaḥ purandaraḥ yābhiḥkāṇvasyopa barhirāsadaṃ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ

translations.griffith: Sing out the psalm to him who breaks down castles for his faithful friend,  Verses to bring the Thunderer to destroy the forts and sit on Kaṇva's sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते सन्ति दशग्विनः शतिनो ये सहस्रिणः अश्वासो येते वर्षणो रघुद्रुवस्तेभिर्नस्तूयमा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: ye te santi daśaghvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ aśvāso yete vṛṣaṇo raghudruvastebhirnastūyamā ghahi

translations.griffith: The Horses which are thine in tens, in hundreds, yea, in thousands thine,  Even those vigorous Steeds, fleet-footed in the course, with those come quickly near to us.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवद्य सबर्दुघां हुवे गायत्रवेपसम इन्द्रं धेनुंसुदुघामन्यामिषमुरुधारामरंक्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvadya sabardughāṃ huve ghāyatravepasam indraṃ dhenuṃsudughāmanyāmiṣamurudhārāmaraṃkṛtam

translations.griffith: This day I call Sabardughā who animates the holy song,  Indra the richly-yielding Milch-cow who provides unfailing food in ample stream.

verses.sanskrit: यत तुदत सूर एतशं वङकू वातस्य पर्णिना वहत कुत्समार्जुनेयं शतक्रतुः तसरद गन्धर्वमस्त्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yat tudat sūra etaśaṃ vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā vahat kutsamārjuneyaṃ śatakratuḥ tsarad ghandharvamastṛtam

translations.griffith: When Sūra wounded Etaśa, with Vāta's rolling winged car.  Indra bore Kutsa Ārjuneya off, and mocked Gandharva. the unconquered One.

verses.sanskrit: य रते चिदभिश्रिषः पुरा जत्रुभ्य आत्र्दः सन्धातासन्धिं मघवा पुरूवसुरिष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛte cidabhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ sandhātāsandhiṃ maghavā purūvasuriṣkartā vihrutaṃ punaḥ

translations.griffith: He without ligature, before making incision in the neck,  Closed up the wound again, most wealthy Maghavan, who maketh whole the injured part.

verses.sanskrit: मा भूम निष्ट्या इवेन्द्र तवदरणा इव वनानि न परजहितान्यद्रिवो दुरोषासो अमन्महि |||
verses.transliteration: mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvadaraṇā iva vanāni na prajahitānyadrivo duroṣāso amanmahi

translations.griffith: May we be never cast aside, and strangers, as it were, to thee.  We, Thunder-wielding Indra, count ourselves as trees rejected and unfit to burn.

verses.sanskrit: अमन्महीदनाशवो.अनुग्रासश्च वर्त्रहन सक्र्त सु ते महता शूर राधसानु सतोमं मुदीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: amanmahīdanāśavo.anughrāsaśca vṛtrahan sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasānu stomaṃ mudīmahi

translations.griffith: O Vṛtra-slayer, we were thought slow and unready for the fray.  Yet once in thy great bounty may we have delight, O Hero, after praising thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदि सतोमं मम शरवदस्माकमिन्द्रमिन्दवः तिरः पवित्रं सस्र्वांस आशवो मन्दन्तु तुग्र्याव्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: yadi stomaṃ mama śravadasmākamindramindavaḥ tiraḥ pavitraṃ sasṛvāṃsa āśavo mandantu tughryāvṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: If he will listen to my laud, then may out Soma-drops that flow  Rapidly through the strainer gladden Indra, drops due to the Tugryas’ Strengthener.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवद्य सधस्तुतिं वावातुः सख्युरा गहि उपस्तुतिर्मघोनां पर तवावत्वधा ते वश्मि सुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvadya sadhastutiṃ vāvātuḥ sakhyurā ghahi upastutirmaghonāṃ pra tvāvatvadhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim

translations.griffith: Come now unto the common laud of thee and of thy faithful friend.  So may our wealthy nobles’ praise give joy to thee. Fain would I sing thine eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: सोता हि सोममद्रिभिरेमेनमप्सु धावत गव्या वस्त्रेव वासयन्त इन नरो निर्धुक्षन वक्षणाभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sotā hi somamadribhiremenamapsu dhāvata ghavyā vastreva vāsayanta in naro nirdhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Press out the Soma with the stones, and in the waters wash it clean.  The men investing it with raiment made of milk shall milk it forth from out the stems.

verses.sanskrit: अध जमो अध वा दिवो बर्हतो रोचनादधि अया वर्धस्व तन्वा गिरा ममा जाता सुक्रतो पर्ण |||
verses.transliteration: adha jmo adha vā divo bṛhato rocanādadhi ayā vardhasva tanvā ghirā mamā jātā sukrato pṛṇa

translations.griffith: Whether thou come from earth or from the lustre of the lofty heaven,  Wax stronger in thy body through my song of praise: fill full all creatures, O most Wise.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राय सु मदिन्तमं सोमं सोता वरेण्यम शक्र एणं पीपयद विश्वया धिया हिन्वानं न वाजयुम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāya su madintamaṃ somaṃ sotā vareṇyam śakra eṇaṃ pīpayad viśvayā dhiyā hinvānaṃ na vājayum

translations.griffith: For India press the Soma out, most gladdening and most excellent.  May Śakra make it swell sent forth with every prayer and asking, as it were, for strength.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवा सोमस्य गल्दया सदा याचन्नहं गिरा भूर्णिं मर्गं न सवनेषु चुक्रुधं क ईशानं न याचिषत |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvā somasya ghaldayā sadā yācannahaṃ ghirā bhūrṇiṃ mṛghaṃ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṃ ka īśānaṃ na yāciṣat

translations.griffith: Let me not, still beseeching thee with earnest song at Soma rites,  Anger thee like  some  wild beast. Who would not beseech him who hath power to grant his prayer?

verses.sanskrit: मदेनेषितं मदमुग्रमुग्रेण शवसा विश्वेषां तरुतारं मदच्युतं मदे हि षमा ददाति नः |||
verses.transliteration: madeneṣitaṃ madamughramughreṇa śavasā viśveṣāṃ tarutāraṃ madacyutaṃ made hi ṣmā dadāti naḥ

translations.griffith: The draught made swift with rapturous joy, effectual with its mighty strength,  All-conquering, distilling transport, let him drink: for he in ecstasy gives us gifts.

verses.sanskrit: शेवारे वार्या पुरु देवो मर्ताय दाशुषे स सुन्वते चस्तुवते च रासते विश्वगूर्तो अरिष्टुतः |||
verses.transliteration: śevāre vāryā puru devo martāya dāśuṣe sa sunvate castuvate ca rāsate viśvaghūrto ariṣṭutaḥ

translations.griffith: Where bliss is not, may he, All-praised, God whom the pious glorify,  Bestow great wealth upon the mortal worshipper who sheds the juice and praises him.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्र याहि मत्स्व चित्रेण देव राधसा सरो न परास्युदरं सपीतिभिरा सोमेभिरुरु सफिरम |||
verses.transliteration: endra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā saro na prāsyudaraṃ sapītibhirā somebhiruru sphiram

translations.griffith: Come, Indra, and rejoice thyself, O God, in manifold affluence.  Thou fillest like a lake thy vast capacious bulk with Soma and with draughts besides.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा सहस्रमा शतं युक्ता रथे हिरण्यये बरह्मयुजो हरय इन्द्र केशिनो वहन्तु सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā sahasramā śataṃ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye brahmayujo haraya indra keśino vahantu somapītaye

translations.griffith: A thousand and a hundred Steeds are harnessed to thy golden car.  So may the long-maned Bays, yoked by devotion, bring Indra to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा रथे हिरण्यये हरी मयूरशेप्या शितिप्र्ष्ठा वहतां मध्वो अन्धसो विवक्षणस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūraśepyā śitipṛṣṭhā vahatāṃ madhvo andhaso vivakṣaṇasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Yoked to thy chariot wrought of gold, may thy two Bays with peacock tails,  Convey thee hither, Steeds with their white backs, to quaff sweet juice that makes us eloquent.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा तवस्य गिर्वणः सुतस्य पूर्वपा इव परिष्क्र्तस्य रसिन इयमासुतिश्चारुर्मदाय पत्यते |||
verses.transliteration: pibā tvasya ghirvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrvapā iva pariṣkṛtasya rasina iyamāsutiścārurmadāya patyate

translations.griffith: So drink, thou Lover of the Song, as the first drinker, of this juice.  This the outpouring of the savoury sap prepared is good and meet to gladden thee.

verses.sanskrit: य एको अस्ति दंसना महानुग्रो अभि वरतैः गमत स शिप्री न स योषदा गमद धवं न परि वर्जति |||
verses.transliteration: ya eko asti daṃsanā mahānughro abhi vrataiḥ ghamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣadā ghamad dhavaṃ na pari varjati

translations.griffith: He who alone by wondrous deed is Mighty, Strong by holy works,  May he come, fair of cheek; may he not stay afar, but come and turn not from our call.

verses.sanskrit: तवं पुरं चरिष्ण्वं वधैः शुष्णस्य सं पिणक तवम्भा अनु चरो अध दविता यदिन्द्र हव्यो भुवः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ puraṃ cariṣṇvaṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya saṃ piṇak tvambhā anu caro adha dvitā yadindra havyo bhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: Śuṣṇa's quick moving castle thou hast crushed to pieces with thy bolts.  Thou, Indra, from of old, hast followed after light, since we have had thee to invoke.

verses.sanskrit: मम तवा सूर उदिते मम मध्यन्दिने दिवः मम परपित्वेपिशर्वरे वसवा सतोमासो अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: mama tvā sūra udite mama madhyandine divaḥ mama prapitveapiśarvare vasavā stomāso avṛtsata

translations.griffith: My praises when the Sun hath risen, my praises at the time of noon,  My praises at the coming of the gloom of night, O Vasu, have gone forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit: सतुहि सतुहीदेते घा ते मंहिष्ठासो मघोनाम निन्दिताश्वः परपथी परमज्या मघस्य मेध्यातिथे |||
verses.transliteration: stuhi stuhīdete ghā te maṃhiṣṭhāso maghonām ninditāśvaḥ prapathī paramajyā maghasya medhyātithe

translations.griffith: Praise yea, praise him. Of princes these are the most liberal of their gifts,  These, Paramajyā, Ninditāśva, Prapathī, most bounteous, O Medhyātithi.

verses.sanskrit: आ यदश्वान वनन्वतः शरद्धयाहं रथे रुहम उतवामस्य वसुनश्चिकेतति यो अस्ति याद्वः पशुः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yadaśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayāhaṃ rathe ruham utavāmasya vasunaściketati yo asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ

translations.griffith: When to the car, by faith, I yoked the horses longing for the way-  For skilled is Yadu's son in dealing precious wealth, he who is rich in herds of kine.

verses.sanskrit: य रज्रा मह्यं मामहे सह तवचा हिरण्यया एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु सौभगासङगस्य सवनद्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛjrā mahyaṃ māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā eṣa viśvānyabhyastu saubhaghāsaṅghasya svanadrathaḥ

translations.griffith: May he who gave me two brown steeds together with their cloths of gold,  May he, Āsaṅga's son Svanadratha, obtain all joy and high felicities.

verses.sanskrit: अध पलायोगिरति दासदन्यानासङगो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैः अधोक्षणो दश मह्यं रुशन्तो नळा इव सरसो निरतिष्ठन |||
verses.transliteration: adha plāyoghirati dāsadanyānāsaṅgho aghne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ adhokṣaṇo daśa mahyaṃ ruśanto naḷā iva saraso niratiṣṭhan

translations.griffith: Playoga's son Āsaṅga, by ten thousand, O Agni, hath surpassed the rest in giving.  For me ten bright-hued oxen have come forward like lotus-stalks from out a lake upstanding.

verses.sanskrit: अन्वस्य सथूरं दद्र्शे पुरस्तादनस्थ ऊरुरवरम्बमाणः शश्वती नार्यभिचक्ष्याह सुभद्रमर्य भोजनं बिभर्षि |||
verses.transliteration: anvasya sthūraṃ dadṛśe purastādanastha ūruravarambamāṇaḥ śaśvatī nāryabhicakṣyāha subhadramarya bhojanaṃ bibharṣi

translations.griffith: What time her husband's perfect restoration to his lost strength and manhood was apparent,  His consort Śaśvatī with joy addressed him, Now art thou well, my lord, and shalt be happy.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वसो सुतमन्धः पिबा सुपूर्णमुदरम अनाभयिन ररिमा ते |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vaso sutamandhaḥ pibā supūrṇamudaram anābhayin rarimā te

translations.griffith: HERE is the Soma juice expressed; O Vasu, drink till thou art full:  Undaunted God, we give it thee.

verses.sanskrit: नर्भिर्धूतः सुतो अश्नैरव्यो वारैः परिपूतः अश्वोन निक्तो नदीषु |||
verses.transliteration: nṛbhirdhūtaḥ suto aśnairavyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ aśvona nikto nadīṣu

translations.griffith: Washed by the men, pressed out with stones, strained through the filter made of wool,  ’Tis like a courser bathed in stream.

verses.sanskrit: तं ते यवं यथा गोभिः सवादुमकर्म शरीणन्तः इन्द्र तवास्मिन सधमादे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ te yavaṃ yathā ghobhiḥ svādumakarma śrīṇantaḥ indra tvāsmin sadhamāde

translations.griffith: This juice have we made sweet for thee like barley, blending it with milk.  Indra, I call thee to our feast.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र इत सोमपा एक इन्द्रः सुतपा विश्वायुः अन्तर्देवान मर्त्यांश्च |||
verses.transliteration: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ antardevān martyāṃśca

translations.griffith: Beloved of all, Indra alone drinks up the flowing Soma juice  Among the Gods and mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: न यं शुक्रो न दुराशीर्न तर्प्रा उरुव्यचसम अपस्प्र्ण्वते सुहार्दम |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ śukro na durāśīrna tṛprā uruvyacasam apaspṛṇvate suhārdam

translations.griffith: The Friend, whom not the brilliant-hued, the badly-mixt or bitter draught,  Repels, the far-extending God;

verses.sanskrit: गोभिर्यदीमन्ये अस्मन मर्गं न वरा मर्गयन्ते अभित्सरन्ति धेनुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ghobhiryadīmanye asman mṛghaṃ na vrā mṛghayante abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ

translations.griffith: While other men than we with milk chase him as hunters chase a deer,  And with their kine inveigle him.

verses.sanskrit: तरय इन्द्रस्य सोमाः सुतासः सन्तु देवस्य सवे कषये सुतपाव्नः |||
verses.transliteration: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya sve kṣaye sutapāvnaḥ

translations.griffith: For him, for Indra, for the God, be pressed three draughts of Soma juice  In the juice-drinker's own abode.

verses.sanskrit: तरयः कोशासः शचोतन्ति तिस्रश्चम्वः सुपूर्णाः समाने अधि भार्मन |||
verses.transliteration: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraścamvaḥ supūrṇāḥ samāne adhi bhārman

translations.griffith: Three reservoirs exude their drops, filled are three beakers to the brim,  All for one offering to the God.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिरसि पुरुनिष्ठाः कषीरैर्मध्यत आशीर्तः दध्ना मन्दिष्ठः शूरस्य |||
verses.transliteration: śucirasi puruniṣṭhāḥ kṣīrairmadhyata āśīrtaḥ dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya

translations.griffith: Pure art thou, set in many a place, and blended in the midst with milk  And curd, to cheer the Hero best.

verses.sanskrit: इमे त इन्द्र सोमास्तीव्रा अस्मे सुतासः शुक्रा आशिरंयाचन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: ime ta indra somāstīvrā asme sutāsaḥ śukrā āśiraṃyācante

translations.griffith: Here, Indra, are thy Soma-draughts pressed out by us, the strong, the pure:  They crave admixture of the milk.

verses.sanskrit: तानाशिरं पुरोळाशमिन्द्रेमं सोमं शरीणीहि रेवन्तं हि तवा शर्णोमि |||
verses.transliteration: tānāśiraṃ puroḷāśamindremaṃ somaṃ śrīṇīhi revantaṃ hi tvā śṛṇomi

translations.griffith: O Indra, pour in milk, prepare the cake, and mix the Soma-draught.  I hear them say that thou art rich.

verses.sanskrit: हर्त्सु पीतासो युध्यन्ते दुर्मदासो न सुरायाम ऊधर्न नग्ना जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: hṛtsu pītāso yudhyante durmadāso na surāyām ūdharna naghnā jarante

translations.griffith: Quaffed juices fight within the breast. The drunken praise not by their wine,  The naked praise not when it rains.

verses.sanskrit: रेवानिद रेवत सतोता सयात तवावतो मघोनः परेदु हरिवः शरुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: revānid revata stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ predu harivaḥ śrutasya

translations.griffith: Rich be the praiser of one rich, munificent and famed like thee:  High rank be his, O Lord of Bays.

verses.sanskrit: उक्थं चन शस्यमानमगोररिरा चिकेत न गायत्रंगीयमानम |||
verses.transliteration: ukthaṃ cana śasyamānamaghorarirā ciketa na ghāyatraṃghīyamānam

translations.griffith: Foe of the man who adds no milk, he heeds not any chanted hymn  Or holy psalm that may he sung.

verses.sanskrit: मा न इन्द्र पीयत्नवे मा शर्धते परा दाः शिक्षा शचीवः शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ śikṣā śacīvaḥ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Give us not, Indra, as a prey unto the scornful or the proud:  Help, Mighty One, with power and might.

verses.sanskrit: वयमु तवा तदिदर्था इन्द्र तवायन्तः सखायः कण्वाुक्थेभिर्जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: vayamu tvā tadidarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ kaṇvāukthebhirjarante

translations.griffith: This, even this, O Indra, we implore. as thy devoted friends,  The Kaṇvas praise thee with their hymns.

verses.sanskrit: न घेमन्यदा पपन वज्रिन्नपसो नविष्टौ तवेदु सतोमं चिकेत |||
verses.transliteration: na ghemanyadā papana vajrinnapaso naviṣṭau tavedu stomaṃ ciketa

translations.griffith: Naught else, O Thunderer, have I praised in the skilled singer's eulogy:  On thy land only have I thought.

verses.sanskrit: इछन्ति देवाः सुन्वन्तं न सवप्नाय सप्र्हयन्ति यन्ति परमादमतन्द्राः |||
verses.transliteration: ichanti devāḥ sunvantaṃ na svapnāya spṛhayanti yanti pramādamatandrāḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods seek him who presses out the Soma; they desire not sleep  They punish sloth unweariedly.

verses.sanskrit: ओ षु पर याहि वाजेभिर्मा हर्णीथा अभ्यस्मान महानिव युवजानिः |||
verses.transliteration: o ṣu pra yāhi vājebhirmā hṛṇīthā abhyasmān mahāniva yuvajāniḥ

translations.griffith: Come hither swift with gifts of wealth - be not thou angry with us-like  A great man with a youthful bride.

verses.sanskrit: मो षवद्य दुर्हणावान सायं करदारे अस्मत अश्रीर इव जामाता |||
verses.transliteration: mo ṣvadya durhaṇāvān sāyaṃ karadāre asmat aśrīra iva jāmātā

translations.griffith: Let him not, wrathful with us, spend the evening far from us to-day,  Like some unpleasant son-in-law.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हयस्य वीरस्य भूरिदावरीं सुमतिम तरिषु जातस्य मनांसि |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hyasya vīrasya bhūridāvarīṃ sumatim triṣu jātasya manāṃsi

translations.griffith: For well we know this Hero's love, most liberal of the boons he gives,  His plans whom the three worlds display.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू षिञ्च कण्वमन्तं न घा विद्म शवसानात यशस्तरं शतमूतेः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū ṣiñca kaṇvamantaṃ na ghā vidma śavasānāt yaśastaraṃ śatamūteḥ

translations.griffith: Pour forth the gift which Kaṇvas bring, for none more glorious do we know  Than the Strong Lord with countless aids.

verses.sanskrit: जयेष्ठेन सोतरिन्द्राय सोमं वीराय शक्राय भरा पिबन नर्याय |||
verses.transliteration: jyeṣṭhena sotarindrāya somaṃ vīrāya śakrāya bharā piban naryāya

translations.griffith: O presser, offer Soma first to Indra, Hero, Śakra, him  The Friend of man, that he may drink;

verses.sanskrit: यो वेदिष्ठो अव्यथिष्वश्वावन्तं जरित्र्भ्यः वाजं सतोत्र्भ्यो गोमन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vediṣṭho avyathiṣvaśvāvantaṃ jaritṛbhyaḥ vājaṃ stotṛbhyo ghomantam

translations.griffith: Who, in untroubled ways, is best provider, for his worshippers.  Of strength in horses and in kine.

verses.sanskrit: पन्यम-पन्यमित सोतार आ धावत मद्याय सोमं वीरय शूरय |||
verses.transliteration: panyam-panyamit sotāra ā dhāvata madyāya somaṃ vīraya śūraya

translations.griffith: Pressers, for him blend Soma juice, each draught most excellent, for him  The Brave, the Hero, for his joy.

verses.sanskrit: पाता वर्त्रहा सुतमा घा गमन नारे अस्मत नि यमते शतमूतिः |||
verses.transliteration: pātā vṛtrahā sutamā ghā ghaman nāre asmat ni yamate śatamūtiḥ

translations.griffith: The Vṛtra-slayer drinks the juice. May he who gives a hundred aids  Approach, nor stay afar from us.

verses.sanskrit: एह हरी बरह्मयुजा शग्मा वक्षतः सखायम गीर्भिःश्रुतं गिर्वणसम |||
verses.transliteration: eha harī brahmayujā śaghmā vakṣataḥ sakhāyam ghīrbhiḥśrutaṃ ghirvaṇasam

translations.griffith: May the strong Bay Steeds, yoked by prayer, bring hither unto us our Friend,  Lover of Song, renowned by songs.

verses.sanskrit: सवादवः सोमा आ याहि शरीताः सोमा आ याहि शिप्रिन्न्र्षीवः शचीवो नायमछा सधमादम |||
verses.transliteration: svādavaḥ somā ā yāhi śrītāḥ somā ā yāhi śiprinnṛṣīvaḥ śacīvo nāyamachā sadhamādam

translations.griffith: Sweet are the Soma juices, come! Blent are the Soma juices, come!  Ṛṣi-like, mighty, fair of cheek, come hither quickly to the feast.

verses.sanskrit: सतुतश्च यास्त्वा वर्धन्ति महे राधसे नर्म्णाय इन्द्रकारिणं वर्धन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: stutaśca yāstvā vardhanti mahe rādhase nṛmṇāya indrakāriṇaṃ vṛdhantaḥ

translations.griffith: And lauds which strengthen thee for great bounty and valour, and exalt  Indra who doeth glorious deeds,

verses.sanskrit: गिरश्च यास्ते गिर्वाह उक्था च तुभ्यं तानि सत्रा दधिरे शवांसि |||
verses.transliteration: ghiraśca yāste ghirvāha ukthā ca tubhyaṃ tāni satrā dadhire śavāṃsi

translations.griffith: And songs to thee who lovest song, and all those hymns addressed to thee-  These evermore confirm thy might.

verses.sanskrit: एवेदेष तुविकूर्मिर्वाजानेको वज्रहस्तः सनदम्र्क्तोदयते |||
verses.transliteration: evedeṣa tuvikūrmirvājāneko vajrahastaḥ sanadamṛktodayate

translations.griffith: Thus he, sole doer of great deeds whose hand holds thunder, gives us strength,  He who hath never been subdued.

verses.sanskrit: हन्त वर्त्रं दक्षिणेनेन्द्रः पुरु पुरुहूतः महान महीभिः शचिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: hanta vṛtraṃ dakṣiṇenendraḥ puru puruhūtaḥ mahān mahībhiḥ śacibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Vṛtra he slays with his right hand, even Indra, great with mighty power,  And much-invoked in many a place.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन विश्वाश्चर्षणय उत चयौत्ना जरयांसि च अनु घेन मन्दी मघोनः |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin viśvāścarṣaṇaya uta cyautnā jrayāṃsi ca anu ghen mandī maghonaḥ

translations.griffith: He upon whom all men depend, all regions, all achievements, he  Takes pleasure in our wealthy chiefs.

verses.sanskrit: एष एतानि चकारेन्द्रो विश्वा यो.अति शर्ण्वे वाजदावा मघोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa etāni cakārendro viśvā yo.ati śṛṇve vājadāvā maghonām

translations.griffith: All this hath he accomplished, yea, Indra, most gloriously renowned,  Who gives our wealthy princes strength.

verses.sanskrit: परभर्ता रथं गव्यन्तमपाकच्चिद यमवति इनो वसुस हि वोळ्हा |||
verses.transliteration: prabhartā rathaṃ ghavyantamapākaccid yamavati ino vasusa hi voḷhā

translations.griffith: Who drives his chariot seeking spoil, from afar, to him he loves:  For swift is he to bring men wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सनिता विप्रो अर्वद्भिर्हन्ता वर्त्रं नर्भिः शूरः सत्यो.अविता विधन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: sanitā vipro arvadbhirhantā vṛtraṃ nṛbhiḥ śūraḥ satyo.avitā vidhantam

translations.griffith: The Sage who, winning spoil with steeds, slays Vṛtra, Hero with the men,  His servant's faithful succourer.

verses.sanskrit: यजध्वैनं परियमेधा इन्द्रं सत्राचा मनसा यो भूत सोमैः सत्यमद्वा |||
verses.transliteration: yajadhvainaṃ priyamedhā indraṃ satrācā manasā yo bhūt somaiḥ satyamadvā

translations.griffith: O Priyamedhas, worship with collected mind this Indra whom  The Soma hath full well inspired.

verses.sanskrit: गाथश्रवसं सत्पतिं शरवस्कामं पुरुत्मानम कण्वासोगात वाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: ghāthaśravasaṃ satpatiṃ śravaskāmaṃ purutmānam kaṇvāsoghāta vājinam

translations.griffith: Ye Kaṇvas, sing the Mighty One, Lord of the Brave, who loves renown,  All-present, glorified by song.

verses.sanskrit: य रते चिद गास पदेभ्यो दात सखा नर्भ्यः शचीवान येस्मिन काममश्रियन |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛte cid ghās padebhyo dāt sakhā nṛbhyaḥ śacīvān yeasmin kāmamaśriyan

translations.griffith: Strong Friend, who, with no trace of feet, restores the cattle to the men,  Who rest their wish and hope on him.

verses.sanskrit: इत्था धीवन्तमद्रिवः काण्वं मेध्यातिथिम मेषो भूतोऽभि यन्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: itthā dhīvantamadrivaḥ kāṇvaṃ medhyātithim meṣo bhūto'bhi yannayaḥ

translations.griffith: Shaped as a Ram, Stone-hurler I once thou camest hither to the son  Of Kaṇva, wise Medhyātithi.

verses.sanskrit: शिक्षा विभिन्दो अस्मै चत्वार्ययुता ददत अष्टा परः सहस्रा |||
verses.transliteration: śikṣā vibhindo asmai catvāryayutā dadat aṣṭā paraḥ sahasrā

translations.griffith: Vibhindu, thou hast helped this man, giving him thousands four times ten,  And afterward eight thousand more.

verses.sanskrit: उत सु तये पयोव्र्धा माकी रणस्य नप्त्या जनित्वनाय मामहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta su tye payovṛdhā mākī raṇasya naptyā janitvanāya māmahe

translations.griffith: And these twain pouring streams of milk, creative, daughters of delight,  For wedlock sake I glorify.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा सुतस्य रसिनो मत्स्वा न इन्द्र गोमतः आपिर्नो बोधिसधमाद्यो वर्धे.अस्मानवन्तु ते धियः |||
verses.transliteration: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra ghomataḥ āpirno bodhisadhamādyo vṛdhe.asmānavantu te dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: DRINK, Indra, of the savoury juice, and cheer thee with our milky draught.  Be, for our weal, our Friend and sharer of the feast, and let thy wisdom guard us well.

verses.sanskrit: भूयाम ते सुमतौ वाजिनो वयं मा न सतरभिमातये अस्माञ्चित्राभिरवतादभिष्टिभिरा नः सुम्नेषु यामय |||
verses.transliteration: bhūyāma te sumatau vājino vayaṃ mā na starabhimātaye asmāñcitrābhiravatādabhiṣṭibhirā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya

translations.griffith: In thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong: expose us not to foe's attack.  With manifold assistance guard and succour us, and bring us to felicity.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ तवा पुरूवसो गिरो वर्धन्तु या मम पावकवर्णाःशुचयो विपश्चितो.अभि सतोमैरनूषत |||
verses.transliteration: imā u tvā purūvaso ghiro vardhantu yā mama pāvakavarṇāḥśucayo vipaścito.abhi stomairanūṣata

translations.griffith: May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord, who hast abundant wealth.  Men skilled in holy hymns, pure, with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सहस्रं रषिभिः सहस्क्र्तः समुद्र इव पप्रथे सत्यः सो अस्य महिमा गर्णे शवो यज्ञेषु विप्रराज्ये |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ sahasraṃ ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe satyaḥ so asya mahimā ghṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye

translations.griffith: He, with his might enhanced by Ṛṣis thousandfold, hath like an ocean spread himself.  His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमिद देवतातय इन्द्रं परयत्यध्वरे इन्द्रं समीकेवनिनो हवामह इन्द्रं धनस्य सातये |||
verses.transliteration: indramid devatātaya indraṃ prayatyadhvare indraṃ samīkevanino havāmaha indraṃ dhanasya sātaye

translations.griffith: Indra for worship of the Gods, Indra while sacrifice proceeds,  Indra, as worshippers in battle-shock, we call, Indra that we may win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो मह्ना रोदसी पप्रथच्छव इन्द्रः सूर्यमरोचयत इन्द्रे ह विश्वा भुवनानि येमिर इन्द्रे सुवानास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: indro mahnā rodasī paprathacchava indraḥ sūryamarocayat indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemira indre suvānāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: With might hath Indra spread out heaven and earth, with power hath Indra lighted up the Sun.  In Indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling Soma-drops.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा पूर्वपीतय इन्द्र सतोमेभिरायवः समीचीनासर्भवः समस्वरन रुद्रा गर्नन्त पूर्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā pūrvapītaya indra stomebhirāyavaḥ samīcīnāsaṛbhavaḥ samasvaran rudrā ghṛnanta pūrvyam

translations.griffith: Men with their lauds are urging thee, Indra, to drink the Soma first.  The Ṛbhus in accord have lifted up their voice, and Rudras sung thee as the first.

verses.sanskrit: अस्येदिन्द्रो वाव्र्धे वर्ष्ण्यं शवो मदे सुतस्य विष्णवि अद्या तमस्य महिमानमायवो.अनु षटुवन्ति पूर्वथा |||
verses.transliteration: asyedindro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi adyā tamasya mahimānamāyavo.anu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā

translations.griffith: Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice.  And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty.

verses.sanskrit: तत तवा यामि सुवीर्यं तद बरह्म पूर्वचित्तये येना यतिभ्यो भर्गवे धने हिते येन परस्कण्वमाविथ |||
verses.transliteration: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṃ tad brahma pūrvacittaye yenā yatibhyo bhṛghave dhane hite yena praskaṇvamāvitha

translations.griffith: I crave of thee that hero strength, that thou mayst first regard this prayer,  Wherewith thou holpest Bhṛgu and the Yatis and Praskaṇva when the prize was staked.

verses.sanskrit: येना समुद्रमस्र्जो महीरपस्तदिन्द्र वर्ष्णि ते शवः सद्यः सो अस्य महिमा न संनशे यं कषोणीरनुचक्रदे |||
verses.transliteration: yenā samudramasṛjo mahīrapastadindra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yaṃ kṣoṇīranucakrade

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea, that, Indra, is thy manly strength.  For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.

verses.sanskrit: शग्धी न इन्द्र यत तवा रयिं यामि सुवीर्यम शग्धि वाजाय परथमं सिषासते शग्धि सतोमाय पूर्व्य |||
verses.transliteration: śaghdhī na indra yat tvā rayiṃ yāmi suvīryam śaghdhi vājāya prathamaṃ siṣāsate śaghdhi stomāya pūrvya

translations.griffith: Help us, O Indra, when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might.  First help thou on to strength the man who strives to win, and aid our laud, O Ancient One.

verses.sanskrit: शग्धी नो अस्य यद ध पौरमाविथ धिय इन्द्र सिषासतः शग्धि यथा रुशमं शयावकं कर्पमिन्द्र परावः सवर्णरम |||
verses.transliteration: śaghdhī no asya yad dha pauramāvitha dhiya indra siṣāsataḥ śaghdhi yathā ruśamaṃ śyāvakaṃ kṛpamindra prāvaḥ svarṇaram

translations.griffith: Help for us, Indra, as thou holpest Paura once, this man's devotions bent on gain.  Help, as thou gavest Ruśama and Śyāvaka and Svarṇara and Kṛpa aid.

verses.sanskrit: कन नव्यो अतसीनां तुरो गर्णीत मर्त्यः नही नवस्य महिमानमिन्द्रियं सवर्ग्र्णन्त आनशुः |||
verses.transliteration: kan navyo atasīnāṃ turo ghṛṇīta martyaḥ nahī nvasya mahimānamindriyaṃ svarghṛṇanta ānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: What newest of imploring prayers shall, then, the zealous mortal sing?  For have not they who laud his might, and Indra-power won for themselves the light of heaven?

verses.sanskrit: कदु सतुवन्त रतयन्त देवत रषिः को विप्र ओहते कदा हवं मघवन्निन्द्र सुन्वतः कदु सतुवत आ गमः |||
verses.transliteration: kadu stuvanta ṛtayanta devata ṛṣiḥ ko vipra ohate kadā havaṃ maghavannindra sunvataḥ kadu stuvata ā ghamaḥ

translations.griffith: When shall they keep the Law and praise thee mid the Gods? Who counts as Ṛṣi and as sage?  When ever wilt thou, Indra Maghavan, come nigh to presser's or to praiser's call?

verses.sanskrit: उदु तये मधुमत्तमा गिर सतोमास ईरते सत्राजितो धनसा अक्षितोतयो वाजयन्तो रथा इव |||
verses.transliteration: udu tye madhumattamā ghira stomāsa īrate satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva

translations.griffith: These songs of ours exceeding sweet, these hymns of praise ascend to thee,  Like ever-conquering chariots that display their strength, gain wealth, and give unfailing aid.

verses.sanskrit: कण्वा इव भर्गवः सूर्या इव विश्वमिद धीतमानशुः इन्द्रं सतोमेभिर्महयन्त आयवः परियमेधासो अस्वरन |||
verses.transliteration: kaṇvā iva bhṛghavaḥ sūryā iva viśvamid dhītamānaśuḥ indraṃ stomebhirmahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran

translations.griffith: The Bhṛgus are like Suns, like Kaṇvas, and have gained all that their thoughts were bent upon.  The living men of Priyamedha's race have sung exalting Indra with their lauds.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हि वर्त्रहन्तम हरी इन्द्र परावतः अर्वाचीनो मघवन सोमपीतय उग्र रष्वेभिरा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā hi vṛtrahantama harī indra parāvataḥ arvācīno maghavan somapītaya ughra ṛṣvebhirā ghahi

translations.griffith: Best slayer of the Vṛtras, yoke thy Bay Steeds, Indra, from afar.  Come with the High Ones hither, Maghavan, to us, Mighty, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इमे हि ते कारवो वावशुर्धिया विप्रासो मेधसातये सत्वं नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणो वेनो न शर्णुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ime hi te kāravo vāvaśurdhiyā viprāso medhasātaye satvaṃ no maghavannindra ghirvaṇo veno na śṛṇudhī havam

translations.griffith: For these, the bards and singers, have cried out to thee with prayer, to gain the sacrifice.  As such, O Maghavan, Indra, who lovest song, even as a lover bear my call.

verses.sanskrit: निरिन्द्र बर्हतीभ्यो वर्त्रं धनुभ्यो अस्फुरः निरर्बुदस्य मर्गयस्य मायिनो निः पर्वतस्य गा आजः |||
verses.transliteration: nirindra bṛhatībhyo vṛtraṃ dhanubhyo asphuraḥ nirarbudasya mṛghayasya māyino niḥ parvatasya ghā ājaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou from the lofty plains above, O Indra, hurledst Vṛtra down.  Thou dravest forth the kine of guileful Mṛgaya and Arbuda from the mountain's hold.

verses.sanskrit: निरग्नयो रुरुचुर्निरु सूर्यो निः सोम इन्द्रियो रसः निरन्तरिक्षादधमो महामहिं कर्षे तदिन्द्र पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: niraghnayo rurucurniru sūryo niḥ soma indriyo rasaḥ nirantarikṣādadhamo mahāmahiṃ kṛṣe tadindra pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: Bright were the flaming fires, the Sun gave forth his shine, and Soma, Indra's juice, shone clear.  Indra, thou blewest the great Dragon from the air: men must regard that valorous deed.

verses.sanskrit: यं मे दुरिन्द्रो मरुतः पाकस्थामा कौरयाणः विश्वेषां तमना शोभिष्ठमुपेव दिवि धावमानम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ me durindro marutaḥ pākasthāmā kaurayāṇaḥ viśveṣāṃ tmanā śobhiṣṭhamupeva divi dhāvamānam

translations.griffith: The fairest courser of them all, who runneth on as ’twere to heaven.  Which Indra and the Maruts gave, and Pākasthāman Kaurayāṇ.

verses.sanskrit: रोहितं मे पाकस्थामा सुधुरं कक्ष्यप्राम अदाद रायो विबोधनम |||
verses.transliteration: rohitaṃ me pākasthāmā sudhuraṃ kakṣyaprām adād rāyo vibodhanam

translations.griffith: To me hath Pākasthāman given, a ruddy horse, good at the pole,  Filling is girth and rousing wealth;

verses.sanskrit: यस्मा अन्ये दश परति धुरं वहन्ति वह्नयः अस्तं वयो न तुग्र्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmā anye daśa prati dhuraṃ vahanti vahnayaḥ astaṃ vayo na tughryam

translations.griffith: Compared with whom no other ten strong coursers, harnessed to the pole,  Bear Tugrya to his dwelling place.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मा पितुस्तनूर्वास ओजोदा अभ्यञ्जनम तुरीयमिद रोहितस्य पाकस्थामानं भोजं दातारमब्रवम |||
verses.transliteration: ātmā pitustanūrvāsa ojodā abhyañjanam turīyamid rohitasya pākasthāmānaṃ bhojaṃ dātāramabravam

translations.griffith: Raiment is body, food is life, and healing ointment giveth strength.  As the free-handed giver of the ruddy steed, I have named Pākasthāman fourth.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र परागपागुदं नयग वा हूयसे नर्भिः सिमा पुरू नर्षूतो अस्यानवे.असि परशर्ध तुर्वशे |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra prāghapāghudaṃ nyagh vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ simā purū nṛṣūto asyānave.asi praśardha turvaśe

translations.griffith: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south,  Thou chiefly art with Ānava and Turvaśa, brave Champion I urged by men to Come.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा रुमे रुशमे शयावके कर्प इन्द्र मादयसे सचा कण्वासस्त्वा बरह्मभि सतोमवाहस इन्द्रा यछन्त्या गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā kaṇvāsastvā brahmabhi stomavāhasa indrā yachantyā ghahi

translations.griffith: Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Ruśama, Śyāvaka, and Kṛpa thou rejoicest thee,  Still do the Kaṇvas, bringing praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.

verses.sanskrit: यथा गौरो अपा कर्तं तर्ष्यन्नेत्यवेरिणम आपित्वे नः परपित्वे तूयमा गहि कण्वेषु सु सचा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: yathā ghauro apā kṛtaṃ tṛṣyannetyaveriṇam āpitve naḥ prapitve tūyamā ghahi kaṇveṣu su sacā piba

translations.griffith: Even as the wild-bull, when he thirsts, goes to the desert's watery pool,  Come hither quickly both at morning and at eve, and with the Kaṇvas drink thy fill.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दन्तु तवा मघवन्निन्द्रेन्दवो राधोदेयाय सुन्वते आमुष्या सोममपिबश्चमू सुतं जयेष्ठं तद दधिषे सहः |||
verses.transliteration: mandantu tvā maghavannindrendavo rādhodeyāya sunvate āmuṣyā somamapibaścamū sutaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ tad dadhiṣe sahaḥ

translations.griffith: May the drops gladden thee, rich Indra, and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice.  Soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink, and hence hast won surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit: पर चक्रे सहसा सहो बभञ्ज मन्युमोजसा विश्वे त इन्द्र पर्तनायवो यहो नि वर्क्षा इव येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: pra cakre sahasā saho babhañja manyumojasā viśve ta indra pṛtanāyavo yaho ni vṛkṣā iva yemire

translations.griffith: With mightier strength he conquered strength, with energy he crushed their wrath.  O Indra, Strong in youth, all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रेणेव सचते यवीयुधा यस्त आनळ उपस्तुतिं पुत्रं परावर्गं कर्णुते सुवीर्ये दाश्नोति नमौक्तिभिः ||
verses.transliteration: sahasreṇeva sacate yavīyudhā yasta ānaḷ upastutiṃ putraṃ prāvarghaṃ kṛṇute suvīrye dāśnoti namauktibhiḥ

translations.griffith: He who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war.  He makes his son preeminent in hero might: he serves with reverential prayer.

verses.sanskrit: मा भेम मा शरमिष्मोग्रस्य सख्ये तव महत ते वर्ष्णो अभिचक्ष्यं कर्तं पश्येम तुर्वशं यदुम |||
verses.transliteration: mā bhema mā śramiṣmoghrasya sakhye tava mahat te vṛṣṇo abhicakṣyaṃ kṛtaṃ paśyema turvaśaṃ yadum

translations.griffith: With thee, the Mighty, for our Friend, we will not fear or feel fatigue.  May we see Turvaśa and Yadu: thy great deed, O Hero, must be glorified.

verses.sanskrit: सव्यामनु सफिग्यं वावसे वर्षा न दानो अस्य रोषति मध्वा सम्प्र्क्ताः सारघेण धेनवस्तूयमेहि दरवा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: savyāmanu sphighyaṃ vāvase vṛṣā na dāno asya roṣati madhvā sampṛktāḥ sāragheṇa dhenavastūyamehi dravā piba

translations.griffith: On his left hip the Hero hath reclined himself: the proffered feast offends him not.  The milk is blended with the honey of the bee: quickly come hither, baste, and drink.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वी रथी सुरूप इद गोमानिदिन्द्र ते सखा शवात्रभजा वयसा सचते सदा चन्द्रो याति सभामुप |||
verses.transliteration: aśvī rathī surūpa id ghomānidindra te sakhā śvātrabhajā vayasā sacate sadā candro yāti sabhāmupa

translations.griffith: Indra, thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses, cars, and kine.  He evermore hath food accompanied by wealth, and radiant joins the company.

verses.sanskrit: रश्यो न तर्ष्यन्नवपानमा गहि पिबा सोमं वशाननु निमेघमानो मघवन दिवे-दिव ओजिष्ठं दधिषे सहः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛśyo na tṛṣyannavapānamā ghahi pibā somaṃ vaśānanu nimeghamāno maghavan dive-diva ojiṣṭhaṃ dadhiṣe sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Come like a thirsty antelope to the drinking-place: drink Soma to thy heart's desire.  Raining it down, O Maghavan, day after day, thou gainest thy surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यो दरावया तवं सोममिन्द्रः पिपासति उप नूनंयुयुजे वर्षणा हरी आ च जगाम वर्त्रहा |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryo drāvayā tvaṃ somamindraḥ pipāsati upa nūnaṃyuyuje vṛṣaṇā harī ā ca jaghāma vṛtrahā

translations.griffith: Priest, let the Soma juice flow forth, for Indra longs to drink thereof.  He even now hath yoked his vigorous Bay Steeds: the Vṛtra-slayer hath come near.

verses.sanskrit: सवयं चित स मन्यते दाशुरिर्जनो यत्रा सोमस्य तर्म्पसि इदं ते अन्नं युज्यं समुक्षितं तस्येहि पर दरवा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: svayaṃ cit sa manyate dāśurirjano yatrā somasya tṛmpasi idaṃ te annaṃ yujyaṃ samukṣitaṃ tasyehi pra dravā piba

translations.griffith: The man with whom thou fillcst thee with Soma deems himself a pious worshipper.  This thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee: come, hasten forward. drink of it,

verses.sanskrit: रथेष्ठायाध्वर्यवः सोममिन्द्राय सोतन अधि बरध्नस्याद्रयो वि चक्षते सुन्वन्तो दाश्वध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: ratheṣṭhāyādhvaryavaḥ somamindrāya sotana adhi bradhnasyādrayo vi cakṣate sunvanto dāśvadhvaram

translations.griffith: Press out the Soma juice, ye priests, for Indra borne upon his car.  The pressing-stones speak loud of Indra, while they shed the juice which, offered, honours him.

verses.sanskrit: उप बरध्नं वावाता वर्षणा हरी इन्द्रमपसु वक्षतः अर्वाञ्चं तवा सप्तयो.अध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप |||
verses.transliteration: upa bradhnaṃ vāvātā vṛṣaṇā harī indramapasu vakṣataḥ arvāñcaṃ tvā saptayo.adhvaraśriyo vahantu savanedupa

translations.griffith: To the brown juice may his dear vigorous Bay Steeds bring Indra, to our holy task.  Hither let thy Car-steeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit: पर पूषणं वर्णीमहे युज्याय पुरूवसुम स शक्र शिक्ष पुरुहूत नो धिया तुजे राये विमोचन |||
verses.transliteration: pra pūṣaṇaṃ vṛṇīmahe yujyāya purūvasum sa śakra śikṣa puruhūta no dhiyā tuje rāye vimocana

translations.griffith: Pūṣan, the Lord of ample wealth, for firm alliance we elect.  May he with wisdom, Śakra! Looser! Much-invoked! aid us to riches and to seed.

verses.sanskrit: सं नः शिशीहि भुरिजोरिव कषुरं रास्व रायो विमोचन तवे तन नः सुवेदमुस्रियं वसु यं तवं हिनोषि मर्त्यम |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ naḥ śiśīhi bhurijoriva kṣuraṃ rāsva rāyo vimocana tve tan naḥ suvedamusriyaṃ vasu yaṃ tvaṃ hinoṣi martyam

translations.griffith: Sharpen us like a razor in the barber's hands: send riches thou who settest free.  Easy to find with thee are treasures of the Dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed.

verses.sanskrit: वेमि तवा पूषन्न्र्ञ्जसे वेमि सतोतव आघ्र्णे न तस्य वेम्यरणं हि तद वसो सतुषे पज्राय साम्ने |||
verses.transliteration: vemi tvā pūṣannṛñjase vemi stotava āghṛṇe na tasya vemyaraṇaṃ hi tad vaso stuṣe pajrāya sāmne

translations.griffith: Pūṣan, I long to win thy love, I long to praise thee, Radiant God.  Excellent Lord, ’tis strange tome, no wish have I to sing the psalm that Pajra sings.

verses.sanskrit: परा गावो यवसं कच्चिदाघ्र्णे नित्यं रेक्णो अमर्त्य अस्माकं पूषन्नविता शिवो भव मंहिष्ठो वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: parā ghāvo yavasaṃ kaccidāghṛṇe nityaṃ rekṇo amartya asmākaṃ pūṣannavitā śivo bhava maṃhiṣṭho vājasātaye

translations.griffith: My kine, O Radiant God, seek pasture where they will, my during wealth, Immortal One.  Be our protector, Pūṣan! be, most liberal Lord, propitious to our gathering strength.

verses.sanskrit: सथूरं राधः शताश्वं कुरुङगस्य दिविष्टिषु राज्ञस्त्वेषस्य सुभगस्य रातिषु तुर्वशेष्वमन्महि |||
verses.transliteration: sthūraṃ rādhaḥ śatāśvaṃ kuruṅghasya diviṣṭiṣu rājñastveṣasya subhaghasya rātiṣu turvaśeṣvamanmahi

translations.griffith: Rich was the gift Kurunga gave, a hundred steeds at morning rites.  Among the gifts of Turvaśas we thought of him, the opulent, the splendid King.

verses.sanskrit: धीभिः सातानि काण्वस्य वाजिनः परियमेधैरभिद्युभिः षष्टिं सहस्रानु निर्मजामजे निर्यूथानि गवां रषिः |||
verses.transliteration: dhībhiḥ sātāni kāṇvasya vājinaḥ priyamedhairabhidyubhiḥ ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrānu nirmajāmaje niryūthāni ghavāṃ ṛṣiḥ

translations.griffith: What by his morning songs Kaṇva, the powerful, hath, with the Priyamedhas, gained-

verses.sanskrit: वर्क्षाश्चिन मे अभिपित्वे अरारणुः गां भजन्त मेहनाश्वं भजन्त मेहन |||
verses.transliteration: vṛkṣāścin me abhipitve arāraṇuḥ ghāṃ bhajanta mehanāśvaṃ bhajanta mehana

translations.griffith: The herds of sixty thousand pure and spotless kine, have I, the Ṛṣi, driven away.

verses.sanskrit: दूरादिहेव यत सत्यरुणप्सुरशिश्वितत वि भानुं विश्वधातनत |||
verses.transliteration: dūrādiheva yat satyaruṇapsuraśiśvitat vi bhānuṃ viśvadhātanat

translations.griffith: WHEN, even as she were present here, red Dawn hath shone from far away,  She spreadeth light on every side.

verses.sanskrit: नर्वद दस्रा मनोयुजा रथेन पर्थुपाजसा सचेथे अश्विनोषसम |||
verses.transliteration: nṛvad dasrā manoyujā rathena pṛthupājasā sacethe aśvinoṣasam

translations.griffith: Like Heroes on your will-yoked car farshining, Wonder-Workers! ye  Attend, O Aśvins, on the Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: युवाभ्यां वाजिनीवसू परति सतोम अद्र्क्षत वाचं दूतोयथोहिषे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ vājinīvasū prati stoma adṛkṣata vācaṃ dūtoyathohiṣe

translations.griffith: By you, O Lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed:  As envoy have I brought the prayer.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुप्रिया ण ऊतये पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू सतुषे कण्वासोश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: purupriyā ṇa ūtaye purumandrā purūvasū stuṣe kaṇvāsoaśvinā

translations.griffith: Kaṇvas must praise the Aśvins dear to many, making many glad,  Most rich, that they may succour us.

verses.sanskrit: मंहिष्ठा वाजसातमेषयन्ता शुभस पती गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhā vājasātameṣayantā śubhas patī ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛham

translations.griffith: Most liberal, best at winning strength, inciters, Lords of splendour who  Visit the worshipper's abode.

verses.sanskrit: ता सुदेवाय दाशुषे सुमेधामवितारिणीम घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम |||
verses.transliteration: tā sudevāya dāśuṣe sumedhāmavitāriṇīm ghṛtairghavyūtimukṣatam

translations.griffith: So for devout Sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead,  And make it rich for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आ न सतोममुप दरवत तूयं शयेनेभिराशुभिः यातमश्वेभिरश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: ā na stomamupa dravat tūyaṃ śyenebhirāśubhiḥ yātamaśvebhiraśvinā

translations.griffith: Hitherward running speedily with horses, as with rapid hawks,  Come, Aśvins, to our song of praise

verses.sanskrit: येभिस्तिस्रः परावतो दिवो विश्वानि रोचना तरीन्रक्तून परिदीयथः |||
verses.transliteration: yebhistisraḥ parāvato divo viśvāni rocanā trīnraktūn paridīyathaḥ

translations.griffith: Wherewith the three wide distances, and all the lights that are in heaven.  Ye traverse, and three times of night.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोमतीरिष उत सातीरहर्विदा वि पथः सातये सितम |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghomatīriṣa uta sātīraharvidā vi pathaḥ sātaye sitam

translations.griffith: O Finders of the Day, that we may win us food of kine and wealth,  Open the paths for us to tread.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गोमन्तमश्विना सुवीरं सुरथं रयिम वोळ्हमश्वावतीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghomantamaśvinā suvīraṃ surathaṃ rayim voḷhamaśvāvatīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, bring us wealth in kine, in noble heroes, and in cars:  Bring us the strength that horses give.

verses.sanskrit: वाव्र्धाना शुभस पती दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: vāvṛdhānā śubhas patī dasrā hiraṇyavartanī pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: Ye Lords of splendour, glorified, ye Wonder-Workers borne on paths  Of gold, drink sweets with Somajuice.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं वाजिनीवसू मघवद्भ्यश्च सप्रथः छर्दिर्यन्तमदाभ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ vājinīvasū maghavadbhyaśca saprathaḥ chardiryantamadābhyam

translations.griffith: To us, ye Lords of ample wealth, and to our wealth chiefs extend  Wide shelter, ne’er to be assailed.

verses.sanskrit: नि षु बरह्म जनानां याविष्टं तूयमा गतम मो षवन्यानुपारतम |||
verses.transliteration: ni ṣu brahma janānāṃ yāviṣṭaṃ tūyamā ghatam mo ṣvanyānupāratam

translations.griffith: Come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most:  Approach not unto other folk.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य पिबतमश्विना युवं मदस्य चारुणः मध्वो रातस्यधिष्ण्या |||
verses.transliteration: asya pibatamaśvinā yuvaṃ madasya cāruṇaḥ madhvo rātasyadhiṣṇyā

translations.griffith: Ye Aśvins whom our minds perceive, drink of this lovely gladdening draught,  The mcath which we present to you.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे आ वहतं रयिं शतवन्तं सहस्रिणम पुरुक्षुं विश्वधायसम |||
verses.transliteration: asme ā vahataṃ rayiṃ śatavantaṃ sahasriṇam purukṣuṃ viśvadhāyasam

translations.griffith: Bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands, source  Of plenteous food, sustaining all.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुत्रा चिद धि वां नरा विह्वयन्ते मनीषिणः वाघद्भिरश्विना गतम |||
verses.transliteration: purutrā cid dhi vāṃ narā vihvayante manīṣiṇaḥ vāghadbhiraśvinā ghatam

translations.griffith: Verily sages call on you, ye Heroes, in full many a place.  Moved by the priests, O Aśvins, conic.

verses.sanskrit: जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषो हविष्मन्तो अरंक्र्तः युवां हवन्ते अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: janāso vṛktabarhiṣo haviṣmanto araṃkṛtaḥ yuvāṃ havante aśvinā

translations.griffith: Men who have trimmed the sacred grass, bringing oblations and prepared,  O Aśvins, are invoking you.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमद्य वामयं सतोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamadya vāmayaṃ stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ yuvābhyāṃ bhūtvaśvinā

translations.griffith: May this our hymn of praise to-day, most powerful to bring you, be,  O Aśvins, nearest to your hearts.

verses.sanskrit: यो ह वां मधुनो दर्तिराहितो रथचर्षणे ततः पिबतमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yo ha vāṃ madhuno dṛtirāhito rathacarṣaṇe tataḥ pibatamaśvinā

translations.griffith: The skin filled full of savoury meath, laid in the pathway of your car-  O Aśvins, drink ye both therefrom.

verses.sanskrit: तेन नो वाजिनीवसू पश्वे तोकाय शं गवे वहतं पीवरीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: tena no vājinīvasū paśve tokāya śaṃ ghave vahataṃ pīvarīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: For this, ye Lords of ample wealth, bring blessing for our herd, our kine,  Our progeny, and plenteous food.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो दिव्या इष उत सिन्धून्रहर्विदा अप दवारेव वर्षथः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no divyā iṣa uta sindhūnraharvidā apa dvāreva varṣathaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye too unclose to us like doors the strengthening waters of the sky,  And rivers, ye who find the day.

verses.sanskrit: कदा वां तौग्र्यो विधत समुद्रे जहितो नरा यद वां रथो विभिष पतात |||
verses.transliteration: kadā vāṃ taughryo vidhat samudre jahito narā yad vāṃ ratho vibhiṣ patāt

translations.griffith: When did the son of Tugra serve you, Men? Abandoned in the sea,  That with winged steeds your car might fly.

verses.sanskrit: युवं कण्वाय नासत्यापिरिप्ताय हर्म्ये शश्वदूतीर्दशस्यथः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ kaṇvāya nāsatyāpiriptāya harmye śaśvadūtīrdaśasyathaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye, O Nāsatyas, ministered to Kaṇva with repeated aid,  When cast into the heated pit.

verses.sanskrit: ताभिरा यातमूतिभिर्नव्यसीभिः सुशस्तिभिः यद वां वर्षण्वसू हुवे |||
verses.transliteration: tābhirā yātamūtibhirnavyasībhiḥ suśastibhiḥ yad vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū huve

translations.griffith: Come near with those most recent aids of yours which merit eulogy,  When I invoke you, Wealthy Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यथा चित कण्वमावतं परियमेधमुपस्तुतम अत्रिं शिञ्जारमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yathā cit kaṇvamāvataṃ priyamedhamupastutam atriṃ śiñjāramaśvinā

translations.griffith: As ye protected Kaṇva erst, Priyamedha and Upastuta,  Atri, Sinjara, Aśvins Twain

verses.sanskrit: यथोत कर्त्व्ये धने.अंशुं गोष्वगस्त्यम यथा वाजेषु सोभरिम |||
verses.transliteration: yathota kṛtvye dhane.aṃśuṃ ghoṣvaghastyam yathā vājeṣu sobharim

translations.griffith: And Amsu in decisive fight, Agastya in the fray for kine.  And, in his battles, Sobhari.

verses.sanskrit: एतावद वां वर्षण्वसू अतो वा भूयो अश्विना गर्णन्तः सुम्नमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: etāvad vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ato vā bhūyo aśvinā ghṛṇantaḥ sumnamīmahe

translations.griffith: For so much bliss, or even more, O Aśvins, Wealthy Gods, than this,  We pray white singing hymns to you.

verses.sanskrit: रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरं हिरण्याभीशुमश्विना आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuraṃ hiraṇyābhīśumaśvinā ā hi sthātho divispṛśam

translations.griffith: Ascend your car with golden seat, O Aśvins, and with reins of gold,  That reaches even to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्ययी वां रभिरीषा अक्षो हिरण्ययः उभा चक्रा हिरण्यया |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyayī vāṃ rabhirīṣā akṣo hiraṇyayaḥ ubhā cakrā hiraṇyayā

translations.griffith: Golden is its supporting shaft, the axle also is of gold,  And both the wheels are made of gold.

verses.sanskrit: तेन नो वाजिनीवसू परावतश्चिदा गतम उपेमां सुष्टुतिं मम |||
verses.transliteration: tena no vājinīvasū parāvataścidā ghatam upemāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama

translations.griffith: Thereon, ye Lords of ample wealth, come to us even from afar,  Come ye to this mine eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: आ वहेथे पराकात पूर्वीरश्नन्तावश्विना इषो दासीरमर्त्या |||
verses.transliteration: ā vahethe parākāt pūrvīraśnantāvaśvinā iṣo dāsīramartyā

translations.griffith: From far away ye come to us, Aśvins, enjoying plenteous food  Of Dāsas, O Immortal Ones.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो दयुम्नैरा शरवोभिरा राया यातमश्विना पुरुश्चन्द्रा नासत्या |||
verses.transliteration: ā no dyumnairā śravobhirā rāyā yātamaśvinā puruścandrā nāsatyā

translations.griffith: With splendour, riches, and renown, O Aśvins, hither come to us,  Nāsatyas, shining brilliantly.

verses.sanskrit: एह वां परुषितप्सवो वयो वहन्तु पर्णिनः अछा सवध्वरं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: eha vāṃ pruṣitapsavo vayo vahantu parṇinaḥ achā svadhvaraṃ janam

translations.griffith: May dappled horses, steeds who fly with pinions, bring you hitherward  To people skilled in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: रथं वामनुगायसं य इषा वर्तते सह न चक्रमभि बाधते |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ vāmanughāyasaṃ ya iṣā vartate saha na cakramabhi bādhate

translations.griffith: The whcel delayeth not that car of yours accompanied by song,  That cometh with a store of food.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्ययेन रथेन दरवत्पाणिभिरश्वैः धीजवना नासत्या |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyayena rathena dravatpāṇibhiraśvaiḥ dhījavanā nāsatyā

translations.griffith: Borne on that chariot wrought of gold, with coursers very fleet of foot,  Come, O Nāsatyas, swift as thought.

verses.sanskrit: युवं मर्गं जाग्र्वांसं सवदथो वा वर्षण्वसू ता नःप्र्ङकतमिषा रयिम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ mṛghaṃ jāghṛvāṃsaṃ svadatho vā vṛṣaṇvasū tā naḥpṛṅktamiṣā rayim

translations.griffith: O Wealthy Gods, ye taste and find the brisk and watchful wild beast good.  Associate wealth with food for us.

verses.sanskrit: ता मे अश्विना सनीनां विद्यातं नवानाम यथा चिच्चैद्यः कशुः शतमुष्ट्रानां ददत सहस्रा दश गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tā me aśvinā sanīnāṃ vidyātaṃ navānām yathā ciccaidyaḥ kaśuḥ śatamuṣṭrānāṃ dadat sahasrā daśa ghonām

translations.griffith: As such, O Aśvins, find for me my share of new-presented gifts,  As Kasu, Cedi's son, gave me a hundred head of buffaloes, and ten thousand kine.

verses.sanskrit: यो मे हिरण्यसन्द्र्शो दश राज्ञो अमंहत अधस्पदा इच्चैद्यस्य कर्ष्टयश्चर्मम्ना अभितो जनाः |||
verses.transliteration: yo me hiraṇyasandṛśo daśa rājño amaṃhata adhaspadā iccaidyasya kṛṣṭayaścarmamnā abhito janāḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath given me for mine own ten Kings like gold to look upon.  At Caidya's feet are all the people round about, all those who think upon the shield.

verses.sanskrit: माकिरेना पथा गाद येनेमे यन्ति चेदयः अन्यो नेत सूरिरोहते भूरिदावत्तरो जनः |||
verses.transliteration: mākirenā pathā ghād yeneme yanti cedayaḥ anyo net sūrirohate bhūridāvattaro janaḥ

translations.griffith: No man, not any, goes upon the path on which the Cedis walk.  No other prince, no folk is held more liberal of gifts than they.

verses.sanskrit: महानिन्द्रो य ओजसा पर्जन्यो वर्ष्टिमानिव सतोमैर्वत्सस्य वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: mahānindro ya ojasā parjanyo vṛṣṭimāniva stomairvatsasya vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: INDRA, great in his power and might, and like Parjanya rich in rain,  Is magnified by Vatsa's lauds.

verses.sanskrit: परजां रतस्य पिप्रतः पर यद भरन्त वह्नयः विप्रा रतस्य वाहसा |||
verses.transliteration: prajāṃ ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yad bharanta vahnayaḥ viprā ṛtasya vāhasā

translations.griffith: When the priests, strengthening the Son of Holy Law, present their gifts,  Singers with Order's hymn of praiser.

verses.sanskrit: कण्वा इन्द्रं यदक्रत सतोमैर्यज्ञस्य साधनम जामिब्रुवत आयुधम |||
verses.transliteration: kaṇvā indraṃ yadakrata stomairyajñasya sādhanam jāmibruvata āyudham

translations.griffith: Since Kaṇvas with their lauds have made Indra complete the sacrifice.  Words are their own appropriate arms.

verses.sanskrit: समस्य मन्यवे विशो विश्वा नमन्त कर्ष्टयः समुद्रायेव सिन्धवः |||
verses.transliteration: samasya manyave viśo viśvā namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ

translations.griffith: Before his hot displeasure all the peoples, all the men, bow down,  As rivers bow them to the sea.

verses.sanskrit: ओजस्तदस्य तित्विष उभे यद समवर्तयत इन्द्रश्चर्मेवरोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: ojastadasya titviṣa ubhe yad samavartayat indraścarmevarodasī

translations.griffith: This power of his shone brightly forth when Indra brought together, like  A skin, the worlds of heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit: वि चिद वर्त्रस्य दोधतो वज्रेण शतपर्वणा शिरो बिभेदव्र्ष्णिना |||
verses.transliteration: vi cid vṛtrasya dodhato vajreṇa śataparvaṇā śiro bibhedavṛṣṇinā

translations.griffith: The fiercely-moving Vṛtra's head he severed with his thunderbolt,  His mighty hundred-knotted bolt.

verses.sanskrit: इमा अभि पर णोनुमो विपामग्रेषु धीतयः अग्नेः शोचिर्न दिद्युतः |||
verses.transliteration: imā abhi pra ṇonumo vipāmaghreṣu dhītayaḥ aghneḥ śocirna didyutaḥ

translations.griffith: Here are-we sing them loudly forth-our thoughts among-the best of songs.  Even lightnings like the blaze of fire.

verses.sanskrit: गुहा सतीरुप तमना पर यच्छोचन्त धीतयः कण्वार्तस्य धारया |||
verses.transliteration: ghuhā satīrupa tmanā pra yacchocanta dhītayaḥ kaṇvāṛtasya dhārayā

translations.griffith: When bidden thoughts, spontaneously advancing, glow, and with the stream  Of sacrifice the Kaṇvas shine.

verses.sanskrit: पर तमिन्द्र नशीमहि रयिं गोमन्तमश्विनम पर बरह्मपूर्वचित्तये |||
verses.transliteration: pra tamindra naśīmahi rayiṃ ghomantamaśvinam pra brahmapūrvacittaye

translations.griffith: Indra, may we obtain that wealth in horses and in herds of cows,  And prayer that may be noticed first.

verses.sanskrit: अहमिद धि पितुष परि मेधां रतस्य जग्रभ अहं सूर्य इवाजनि |||
verses.transliteration: ahamid dhi pituṣ pari medhāṃ ṛtasya jaghrabha ahaṃ sūrya ivājani

translations.griffith: I from my Father have received deep knowledge of the Holy Law  I was born like unto the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: अहं परत्नेन मन्मना गिरः शुम्भामि कण्ववत येनेन्द्रःशुष्ममिद दधे |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ pratnena manmanā ghiraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇvavat yenendraḥśuṣmamid dadhe

translations.griffith: After the lore of ancient time I make, like Kaṇva, beauteous songs,  And Indra's selfgains strength thereby.

verses.sanskrit: ये तवामिन्द्र न तुष्टुवुरषयो ये च तुष्टुवुः ममेद्वर्धस्व सुष्टुतः |||
verses.transliteration: ye tvāmindra na tuṣṭuvurṣayo ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ mamedvardhasva suṣṭutaḥ

translations.griffith: Whatever Ṛṣis have not praised thee, Indra, or have lauded thee,  By me exalted wax thou strong.

verses.sanskrit: यदस्य मन्युरध्वनीद वि वर्त्रं पर्वशो रुजन अपः समुद्रमैरयत |||
verses.transliteration: yadasya manyuradhvanīd vi vṛtraṃ parvaśo rujan apaḥ samudramairayat

translations.griffith: When his wrath thundered, when he rent Vṛtra to pieces, limb by limb,  He sent the waters to the sea.

verses.sanskrit: नि शुष्ण इन्द्र धर्णसिं वज्रं जघन्थ दस्यवि वर्षाह्युग्र शर्ण्विषे |||
verses.transliteration: ni śuṣṇa indra dharṇasiṃ vajraṃ jaghantha dasyavi vṛṣāhyughra śṛṇviṣe

translations.griffith: Against the Dasyu gusna thou, Indra, didst hurl thy during bolt:  Thou, Dread one, hast a hero's fame.

verses.sanskrit: न दयाव इन्द्रमोजसा नान्तरिक्षाणि वज्रिणम न विव्यचन्त भूमयः |||
verses.transliteration: na dyāva indramojasā nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam na vivyacanta bhūmayaḥ

translations.griffith: Neither the heavens nor firmaments nor regions of the earth contain  Indra, the Thunderer with his might.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त इन्द्र महीरप सतभूयमान आशयत नि तं पद्यासु शिश्नथः |||
verses.transliteration: yasta indra mahīrapa stabhūyamāna āśayat ni taṃ padyāsu śiśnathaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra him who lay at length staying thy copious waters thou,  In his own footsteps, smotest down

verses.sanskrit: य इमे रोदसी मही समीची समजग्रभीत तमोभिरिन्द्र तं गुहः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ime rodasī mahī samīcī samajaghrabhīt tamobhirindra taṃ ghuhaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou hiddest deep in darkness itim, O Indra, who had set his grasp  On spacious heaven and earth conjoined.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्र यतयस्त्वा भर्गवो ये च तुष्टुवुः ममेदुग्र शरुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ya indra yatayastvā bhṛghavo ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ mamedughra śrudhī havam

translations.griffith: Indra, whatever Yatis and Bhṛgus have offered praise to thee,  Listen, thou Mighty, to my call.

verses.sanskrit: इमास्त इन्द्र पर्श्नयो घर्तं दुहत आशिरम एनां रतस्य पिप्युषीः |||
verses.transliteration: imāsta indra pṛśnayo ghṛtaṃ duhata āśiram enāṃ ṛtasya pipyuṣīḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, these spotted cows yield thee their butter and the milky draught;  Aiders, thereby, of sacrifice;

verses.sanskrit: या इन्द्र परस्वस्त्वासा गर्भमचक्रिरन परि धर्मेव सूर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yā indra prasvastvāsā gharbhamacakriran pari dharmeva sūryam

translations.griffith: Which, teeming, have received thee as a life-germ, Indra, with their mouth,  Like Sūrya who sustaineth all.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिच्छवसस पते कण्वा उक्थेन वाव्र्धुः तवां सुतास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmicchavasas pate kaṇvā ukthena vāvṛdhuḥ tvāṃ sutāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: O Lord of Might, with hymns of praise the Kaṇvas have increased thy power,  The drops poured forth have strengthened thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवेदिन्द्र परणीतिषूत परशस्तिरद्रिवः यज्ञो वितन्तसाय्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tavedindra praṇītiṣūta praśastiradrivaḥ yajño vitantasāyyaḥ

translations.griffith: Under thy guidance, Indra, mid thy praises, Lord of Thunder, shall  The sacrifice be soon performed.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्द्र महीमिषं पुरं न दर्षि गोमतीम उत परजां सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indra mahīmiṣaṃ puraṃ na darṣi ghomatīm uta prajāṃ suvīryam

translations.griffith: Indra, disclose much food for us, like a stronghold with store of kine:  Give progeny and heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयदाश्वश्व्यं यदिन्द्र नाहुषीष्वा अग्रे विक्षुप्रदीदयत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyadāśvaśvyaṃ yadindra nāhuṣīṣvā aghre vikṣupradīdayat

translations.griffith: And, Indra, grant us all that wealth of fleet steeds which shone bright of old  Among the tribes of Nahusas.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वरजं न तत्निषे सूर उपाकचक्षसम यदिन्द्र मर्ळयासि नः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vrajaṃ na tatniṣe sūra upākacakṣasam yadindra mṛḷayāsi naḥ

translations.griffith: Hither thou seemest to attract heaven's fold which shines before our eyes,  When, Indra, thou art kind to us.

verses.sanskrit: यदङग तविषीयस इन्द्र परराजसि कषितीः महानपार ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: yadaṅgha taviṣīyasa indra prarājasi kṣitīḥ mahānapāra ojasā

translations.griffith: Yea, when thou puttest forth thy power, Indra, thou governest the folk.  Mighty, unlimited in strength.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा हविष्मतीर्विश उप बरुवत ऊतये उरुज्रयसमिन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā haviṣmatīrviśa upa bruvata ūtaye urujrayasamindubhiḥ

translations.griffith: The tribes who bring oblations call to thee, to thee to give them help,  With drops to thee who spreadest far.

verses.sanskrit: उपह्वरे गिरीणां संगथे च नदीनाम धिया विप्रो अजायत |||
verses.transliteration: upahvare ghirīṇāṃ saṃghathe ca nadīnām dhiyā vipro ajāyata

translations.griffith: There where the mountains downward slope, there by the meeting of the streams  The Sage was manifest with song.

verses.sanskrit: अतः समुद्रमुद्वतश्चिकित्वानव पश्यति यतो विपान एजति |||
verses.transliteration: ataḥ samudramudvataścikitvānava paśyati yato vipāna ejati

translations.griffith: Thence, marking, from his lofty place downward he looks upon the sea,  And thence with rapid stir he moves.

verses.sanskrit: आदित परत्नस्य रेतसो जयोतिष पश्यन्ति वासरम परो यदिध्यते दिवा |||
verses.transliteration: ādit pratnasya retaso jyotiṣ paśyanti vāsaram paro yadidhyate divā

translations.griffith: Then, verify, they see the light refulgent of primeval seed,  Kindled on yonder side of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: कण्वास इन्द्र ते मतिं विश्वे वर्धन्ति पौंस्यम उतो शविष्ठ वर्ष्ण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: kaṇvāsa indra te matiṃ viśve vardhanti pauṃsyam uto śaviṣṭha vṛṣṇyam

translations.griffith: Indra, the Kaṇvas all exalt thy wisdom and thy manly power,  And, Mightiest! thine heroic strength.

verses.sanskrit: इमां म इन्द्र सुष्टुतिं जुषस्व पर सु मामव उत परवर्धया मतिम |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ ma indra suṣṭutiṃ juṣasva pra su māmava uta pravardhayā matim

translations.griffith: Accept this eulogy of mine, Indra, and guard me carefully:  Strengthen my thought and prosper it.

verses.sanskrit: उत बरह्मण्या वयं तुभ्यं परव्र्द्ध वज्रिवः विप्रा अतक्ष्म जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: uta brahmaṇyā vayaṃ tubhyaṃ pravṛddha vajrivaḥ viprā atakṣma jīvase

translations.griffith: For thee, O Mighty, Thunder-armed, we singers through devotionhave  Fashioned the hymn that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: अभि कण्वा अनूषतापो न परवता यतीः इन्द्रं वनन्वती मतिः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi kaṇvā anūṣatāpo na pravatā yatīḥ indraṃ vananvatī matiḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra have the Kaṇvas sung, like waters speeding down a slope:  The song is fain to go to him.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमुक्थानि वाव्र्धुः समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः अनुत्तमन्युमजरम |||
verses.transliteration: indramukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ samudramiva sindhavaḥ anuttamanyumajaram

translations.griffith: As rivers swell the ocean, so our hymns of praise make Indra strong,  Eternal, of resistIess wrath.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो याहि परावतो हरिभ्यां हर्यताभ्याम इममिन्द्र सुतं पिब |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yāhi parāvato haribhyāṃ haryatābhyām imamindra sutaṃ piba

translations.griffith: Come with thy lovely Bay Steeds, come to us from regions far away  O Indra, drink this Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: तवामिद वर्त्रहन्तम जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः हवन्ते वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmid vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ havante vājasātaye

translations.griffith: Best slayer of Vṛtras, men whose sacred grass is ready trimmed  Invoke thee for the gain of spoil.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तवा रोदसी उभे चक्रं न वर्त्येतशम अनु सुवानास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: anu tvā rodasī ubhe cakraṃ na vartyetaśam anu suvānāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: The heavens and earth come after thee as the wheel follows Etaśa:  To thee flow Soma-drops effused.

verses.sanskrit: मन्दस्वा सु सवर्णर उतेन्द्र शर्यणावति मत्स्वा विवस्वतो मती |||
verses.transliteration: mandasvā su svarṇara utendra śaryaṇāvati matsvā vivasvato matī

translations.griffith: Rejoice, O Indra, in the light, rejoice in Saryandyan, be Glad in the sacrificer's hymn.

verses.sanskrit: वाव्र्धान उप दयवि वर्षा वज्र्यरोरवीत वर्त्रहा सोमपातमः |||
verses.transliteration: vāvṛdhāna upa dyavi vṛṣā vajryaroravīt vṛtrahā somapātamaḥ

translations.griffith: Grown strong in heaven, the Thunder-armed hath bellowed, Vṛtra-slayer, Bull,  Chief drinker of the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: रषिर्हि पूर्वजा अस्येक ईशान ओजसा इन्द्र चोष्कूयसे वसु |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣirhi pūrvajā asyeka īśāna ojasā indra coṣkūyase vasu

translations.griffith: Thou art a Ṛṣi born of old, sole Ruler over all by might:  Thou, Indra, guardest well our wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं तवा सुतानुप वीतप्र्ष्ठा अभि परयः शतंवहन्तु हरयः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ tvā sutānupa vītapṛṣṭhā abhi prayaḥ śataṃvahantu harayaḥ

translations.griffith: May thy Bay Steeds with beauteous backs, a hundred, bring thee to the feast,  Bring thee to these our Soma-draughts.

verses.sanskrit: इमां सु पूर्व्यां धियं मधोर्घ्र्तस्य पिप्युषीम कण्वा उक्थेन वाव्र्धुः |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ su pūrvyāṃ dhiyaṃ madhorghṛtasya pipyuṣīm kaṇvā ukthena vāvṛdhuḥ

translations.griffith: The Kaṇvas with their hymns of praise have magnified this ancient thought  That swells with streams of meath and oil.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमिद विमहीनां मेधे वर्णीत मर्त्यः इन्द्रं सनिष्युरूतये |||
verses.transliteration: indramid vimahīnāṃ medhe vṛṇīta martyaḥ indraṃ saniṣyurūtaye

translations.griffith: Mid mightiest Gods let mortal man choose Indra at the sacrifice,  Indra, whoe’er would win, for help.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चं तवा पुरुष्टुत परियमेधस्तुता हरी सोमपेयायवक्षतः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī somapeyāyavakṣataḥ

translations.griffith: Thy steeds, by Priyamedhas praised, shall bring thee, God whom all invoke,  Hither to drink the Somajuice.

verses.sanskrit: शतमहं तिरिन्दिरे सहस्रं पर्शावा ददे राधांसियाद्वानाम |||
verses.transliteration: śatamahaṃ tirindire sahasraṃ parśāvā dade rādhāṃsiyādvānām

translations.griffith: A hundred thousand have I gained from Parsu, from Tirindira,  And presents of the Yadavas.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि शतान्यर्वतां सहस्रा दश गोनाम ददुष पज्राय साम्ने |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi śatānyarvatāṃ sahasrā daśa ghonām daduṣ pajrāya sāmne

translations.griffith: Ten thousand head of kine, and steeds three times a hundred they bestowed  On Pajra for the Sāma-song.

verses.sanskrit: उदानट ककुहो दिवमुष्ट्राञ्चतुर्युजो ददत शरवसा याद्वं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: udānaṭ kakuho divamuṣṭrāñcaturyujo dadat śravasā yādvaṃ janam

translations.griffith: Kakuha hath reached up to heaven, bestowing buffaloes yoked in fours,  And matched in fame the Yadavas.

verses.sanskrit: पर यद वस्त्रिष्टुभमिषं मरुतो विप्रो अक्षरत वि पर्वतेषु राजथ |||
verses.transliteration: pra yad vastriṣṭubhamiṣaṃ maruto vipro akṣarat vi parvateṣu rājatha

translations.griffith: O MARUTS, when the sage hath poured the Tṛṣṭup forth as food for you,  Ye shine amid the mountain-clouds.

verses.sanskrit: यदङग तविषीयवो यामं शुभ्रा अचिध्वम नि पर्वता अहासत |||
verses.transliteration: yadaṅgha taviṣīyavo yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam ni parvatā ahāsata

translations.griffith: When, Bright Ones, fain to show your might ye have determined on your course,  The mountain-clouds have bent them down.

verses.sanskrit: उदीरयन्त वायुभिर्वाश्रासः पर्श्निमातरः धुक्षन्तपिप्युशीमिषम |||
verses.transliteration: udīrayanta vāyubhirvāśrāsaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ dhukṣantapipyuśīmiṣam

translations.griffith: Loud roaring with the winds the Sons of Pṛśni have upraised themselves:  They have poured out the streaming food.

verses.sanskrit: वपन्ति मरुतो मिहं पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान यद यामं यान्ति वायुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: vapanti maruto mihaṃ pra vepayanti parvatān yad yāmaṃ yānti vāyubhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Maruts spread the mist abroad and make mountains rock and reel,  When with the winds they go their way

verses.sanskrit: नि यद यामाय वो गिरिर्नि सिन्धवो विधर्मणे महे शुष्माय येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ni yad yāmāya vo ghirirni sindhavo vidharmaṇe mahe śuṣmāya yemire

translations.griffith: What time the rivers and the hills before your coming bowed them down,  So to sustain your mighty force.

verses.sanskrit: युष्मानु नक्तमूतये युष्मान दिवा हवामहे युष्मान परयत्यध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmānu naktamūtaye yuṣmān divā havāmahe yuṣmān prayatyadhvare

translations.griffith: We call on you for aid by night, on you for succour in the day,  On you while sacrifice proceeds.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तये अरुणप्सवश्चित्रा यामेभिरीरते वाश्रा अधिष्णुना दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: udu tye aruṇapsavaścitrā yāmebhirīrate vāśrā adhiṣṇunā divaḥ

translations.griffith: These, verily, wondrous, red of hue, speed on their courses with a roar  Over the ridges of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: सर्जन्ति रश्मिमोजसा पन्थां सूर्याय यातवे ते भानुभिर्वि तस्थिरे |||
verses.transliteration: sṛjanti raśmimojasā panthāṃ sūryāya yātave te bhānubhirvi tasthire

translations.griffith: With might they drop the loosened rein so that the Sun may run his course,  And spread themselves with beams of light.

verses.sanskrit: इमां मे मरुतो गिरमिमं सतोमं रभुक्षणः इमं मे वनता हवम |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ me maruto ghiramimaṃ stomaṃ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ imaṃ me vanatā havam

translations.griffith: Accept, ye Maruts, this my song, accept ye this mine hymn of praise,  Accept, Ṛbhukṣans, this my call.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि सरांसि पर्श्नयो दुदुह्रे वज्रिणे मधु उत्सं कवन्धमुद्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi sarāṃsi pṛśnayo duduhre vajriṇe madhu utsaṃ kavandhamudriṇam

translations.griffith: The dappled Cows have poured three lakes, meath for the Thunder-wielding God,  From the great cask, the watery cloud.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतो यद ध वो दिवः सुम्नायन्तो हवामहे आ तू न उपगन्तन |||
verses.transliteration: maruto yad dha vo divaḥ sumnāyanto havāmahe ā tū na upaghantana

translations.griffith: O Maruts, quickly come to us when, longing for felicity,  We call you hither from the sky.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं हि षठा सुदानवो रुद्रा रभुक्षणो दमे उत परचेतसो मदे |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānavo rudrā ṛbhukṣaṇo dame uta pracetaso made

translations.griffith: For, Rudras and Ṛbhukṣans, ye, Most Bountiful, are in the house,  Wise when the gladdening draught is drunk.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो रयिं मदच्युतं पुरुक्षुं विश्वधायसम इयर्ता मरुतो दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no rayiṃ madacyutaṃ purukṣuṃ viśvadhāyasam iyartā maruto divaḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, send us down from heaven riches distilling rapturous joy,  With plenteous food, sustaining all.

verses.sanskrit: अधीव यद गिरीणां यामं शुभ्रा अचिध्वम सुवानैर्मन्दध्व इन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: adhīva yad ghirīṇāṃ yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam suvānairmandadhva indubhiḥ

translations.griffith: When, Bright Ones, hither from the hills ye have resolved to take your way,  Ye revel in the drops effused.

verses.sanskrit: एतावतश्चिदेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः अदाभ्यस्य मन्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: etāvataścideṣāṃ sumnaṃ bhikṣeta martyaḥ adābhyasya manmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Man should solicit with his lauds happiness which belongs to them,  So great a band invincible.

verses.sanskrit: ये दरप्सा इव रोदसी धमन्त्यनु वर्ष्टिभिः उत्सं दुहन्तो अक्षितम |||
verses.transliteration: ye drapsā iva rodasī dhamantyanu vṛṣṭibhiḥ utsaṃ duhanto akṣitam

translations.griffith: They who like fiery sparks with showers of rain blow through the heaven and earth,  Milking the spring that never fails.

verses.sanskrit: उदु सवानेभिरीरत उद रथैरुदु वायुभिः उत सतोमैः पर्श्निमातरः |||
verses.transliteration: udu svānebhirīrata ud rathairudu vāyubhiḥ ut stomaiḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ

translations.griffith: With chariots and tumultuous roar, with tempests and with hymns of praise  The Sons of Pṛśni hurry forth.

verses.sanskrit: येनाव तुर्वशं यदुं येन कण्वं धनस्प्र्तम राये सु तस्य धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: yenāva turvaśaṃ yaduṃ yena kaṇvaṃ dhanaspṛtam rāye su tasya dhīmahi

translations.griffith: For wealth, we think of that whereby ye aided Yadu, Turvaśa,  And KanVa who obtained the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: इमा उ वः सुदानवो घर्तं न पिप्युषीरिषः वर्धान काण्वस्य मन्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: imā u vaḥ sudānavo ghṛtaṃ na pipyuṣīriṣaḥ vardhān kāṇvasya manmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: May these our viands Bounteous Ones I that flow in streams like holy oil,  With Kaṇva's hymns, increase your might.

verses.sanskrit: कव नूनं सुदानवो मदथा वर्क्तबर्हिषः बरह्मा को वःसपर्यति |||
verses.transliteration: kva nūnaṃ sudānavo madathā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ brahmā ko vaḥsaparyati

translations.griffith: Where, Bounteous Lords for whom the grass is trimmed, are ye rejoicing now?  What Brahman is adoring you?

verses.sanskrit: नहि षम यद ध वः पुरा सतोमेभिर्व्र्क्तबर्हिषः शर्धान रतस्य जिन्वथ |||
verses.transliteration: nahi ṣma yad dha vaḥ purā stomebhirvṛktabarhiṣaḥ śardhān ṛtasya jinvatha

translations.griffith: Is it not there where ye of old, supplied with sacred grass, for lauds  Inspired the strong in sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit: समु तये महतीरपः सं कषोणी समु सूर्यम सं वज्रं पर्वशो दधुः |||
verses.transliteration: samu tye mahatīrapaḥ saṃ kṣoṇī samu sūryam saṃ vajraṃ parvaśo dadhuḥ

translations.griffith: They brought together both the worlds, the mighty waters, and the Sun,  And, joint by joint, the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: वि वर्त्रं पर्वशो ययुर्वि पर्वतानराजिनः चक्राणा वर्ष्णि पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vi vṛtraṃ parvaśo yayurvi parvatānarājinaḥ cakrāṇā vṛṣṇi pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: They sundered Vṛtra limb from limb and split the gloomy mountain-clouds,  Performing a heroic deed.

verses.sanskrit: अनु तरितस्य युध्यतः शुष्ममावन्नुत करतुम अन्विन्द्रं वर्त्रतूर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: anu tritasya yudhyataḥ śuṣmamāvannuta kratum anvindraṃ vṛtratūrye

translations.griffith: They reinforced the power and strength of Trita as he fought, and helped  Indra in battle with the foe.

verses.sanskrit: विद्युद्धस्ता अभिद्यवः शिप्राः शीर्षन हिरण्ययीः शुभ्रा वयञ्जत शरिये |||
verses.transliteration: vidyuddhastā abhidyavaḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣan hiraṇyayīḥ śubhrā vyañjata śriye

translations.griffith: They deck themselves for glory, bright, celestial, lightning in their hands,  And helms of gold upon their heads.

verses.sanskrit: उशना यत परावत उक्ष्णो रन्ध्रमयातन दयौर्न चक्रदद भिया |||
verses.transliteration: uśanā yat parāvata ukṣṇo randhramayātana dyaurna cakradad bhiyā

translations.griffith: When eagerly ye from far away came to the cavern of the Bull,  He bellowed in his fear like Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो मखस्य दावने.अश्वैर्हिरण्यपाणिभिः देवास उप गन्तन |||
verses.transliteration: ā no makhasya dāvane.aśvairhiraṇyapāṇibhiḥ devāsa upa ghantana

translations.griffith: Borne by your golden-footed steeds, O Gods, come hither to receive  The sacrifice we offer you.

verses.sanskrit: यदेषां पर्षती रथे परष्टिर्वहति रोहितः यान्ति शुभ्रा रिणन्नपः |||
verses.transliteration: yadeṣāṃ pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭirvahati rohitaḥ yānti śubhrā riṇannapaḥ

translations.griffith: When the red leader draws along their spotted deer yoked to the car.  The Bright Ones come, and shed the rain.

verses.sanskrit: सुषोमे शर्यणावत्यार्जीके पस्त्यावति ययुर्निचक्रया नरः |||
verses.transliteration: suṣome śaryaṇāvatyārjīke pastyāvati yayurnicakrayā naraḥ

translations.griffith: Susoma, Saryakiavan, and Arjika full of homes, have they.  These Heroes, sought with downward car.

verses.sanskrit: कदा गछाथ मरुत इत्था विप्रं हवमानम मार्डीकेभिर्नाधमानम |||
verses.transliteration: kadā ghachātha maruta itthā vipraṃ havamānam mārḍīkebhirnādhamānam

translations.griffith: When, Maruts, ye come to him, the singer who invokes you thus,  With favours to your suppliant?
