verses.sanskrit: कद ध नूनं कधप्रियो यदिन्द्रमजहातन को वः सखित्व ओहते |||
verses.transliteration: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyo yadindramajahātana ko vaḥ sakhitva ohate

translations.griffith: What now? where have ye still a friend since ye left Indra all alone?  Who counteth on your friendship now?

verses.sanskrit: सहो षु णो वज्रहस्तैः कण्वासो अग्निं मरुद्भिः सतुषेहिरण्यवाशीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: saho ṣu ṇo vajrahastaiḥ kaṇvāso aghniṃ marudbhiḥ stuṣehiraṇyavāśībhiḥ

translations.griffith: The Kaṇvas sing forth Agni's praise together with our Maruts’ who  Wield thunder and wear swords of gold.

verses.sanskrit: ओ षु वर्ष्णः परयज्यूना नव्यसे सुविताय वव्र्त्यां चित्रवाजान |||
verses.transliteration: o ṣu vṛṣṇaḥ prayajyūnā navyase suvitāya vavṛtyāṃ citravājān

translations.griffith: Hither for new felicity may I attract the Impetuous Ones,  The Heroes with their wondrous strength

verses.sanskrit: गिरयश्चिन नि जिहते पर्शानासो मन्यमानाः पर्वताश्चिन नि येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ghirayaścin ni jihate parśānāso manyamānāḥ parvatāścin ni yemire

translations.griffith: Before them sink the very hills deerning themseives abysses: yea,  Even the mountains bend them down.

verses.sanskrit: आक्ष्णयावानो वहन्त्यन्तरिक्षेण पततः धातारः सतुवते वयः |||
verses.transliteration: ākṣṇayāvāno vahantyantarikṣeṇa patataḥ dhātāraḥ stuvate vayaḥ

translations.griffith: Steeds flying on their tortuous path through mid-air carry them, and give  The man who lauds them strength and life.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्हि जानि पूर्व्यश्छन्दो न सूरो अर्चिषा ते भानुभिर्वि तस्थिरे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirhi jāni pūrvyaśchando na sūro arciṣā te bhānubhirvi tasthire

translations.griffith: Agni was born the first of all, like Sūrya lovely with his light:  With lustre these have spread abroad.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिरश्विना गछतं युवम दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी पिबतं सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśvābhirūtibhiraśvinā ghachataṃ yuvam dasrā hiraṇyavartanī pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: WITH all the succours that are yours, O Aśvins, hither come to us:  Wonderful, borne on paths of gold, drink ye the meath with Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनं यातमश्विना रथेन सूर्यत्वचा भुजी हिरण्यपेशसा कवी गम्भीरचेतसा |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnaṃ yātamaśvinā rathena sūryatvacā bhujī hiraṇyapeśasā kavī ghambhīracetasā

translations.griffith: Come now, ye Aśvins, on your car decked with a sun-bright canopy,  Bountiful, with your golden forms, Sages with depth of intellect.

verses.sanskrit: आ यातं नहुषस पर्यान्तरिक्षात सुव्र्क्तिभिः पिबाथोश्विना मधु कण्वानां सवने सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātaṃ nahuṣas paryāntarikṣāt suvṛktibhiḥ pibāthoaśvinā madhu kaṇvānāṃ savane sutam

translations.griffith: Come hither from the Nahusas, come, drawn by pure hymns, from mid-air.  O Aśvins, drink the savoury juice shed in the Kaṇvas' sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यातं दिवस पर्यान्तरिक्षादधप्रिया पुत्रः कण्वस्य वामिह सुषाव सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yātaṃ divas paryāntarikṣādadhapriyā putraḥ kaṇvasya vāmiha suṣāva somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: Come to us hither from the heavens, come from mid-air, well-loved by us:  Here Kaṇva's son hath pressed for you the pleasant meath of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यातमुपश्रुत्यश्विना सोमपीतये सवाहा सतोमस्य वर्धना पर कवी धीतिभिर्नरा |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yātamupaśrutyaśvinā somapītaye svāhā stomasya vardhanā pra kavī dhītibhirnarā

translations.griffith: Come, Aśvins, to give car to us, to drink the Soma, Aśvins, come.  Hail, Strengtheners of the praise-song speed onward, ye Heroes, with your thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि वां पुर रषयो जुहूरे.अवसे नरा आ यातमश्विना गतमुपेमां सुष्टुतिं मम |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi vāṃ pura ṛṣayo juhūre.avase narā ā yātamaśvinā ghatamupemāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama

translations.griffith: As, Heroes, in the olden time the Ṛṣis called you to their aid,  So now, O Aśvins, come to us, come near to this mine eulogy.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश्चिद रोचनादध्या नो गन्तं सवर्विदा धीभिर्वत्सप्रचेतसा सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुता |||
verses.transliteration: divaścid rocanādadhyā no ghantaṃ svarvidā dhībhirvatsapracetasā stomebhirhavanaśrutā

translations.griffith: Even from the luminous sphere of heaven come to us, ye who find the light,  Carers for Vatsa, through our prayers and lauds, O yewho hearour call.

verses.sanskrit: किमन्ये पर्यासते.अस्मत सतोमेभिरश्विना पुत्रः कण्वस्य वां रषिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत |||
verses.transliteration: kimanye paryāsate.asmat stomebhiraśvinā putraḥ kaṇvasya vāṃ ṛṣirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat

translations.griffith: Do others more than we adore the Aśvins with their hymns of praise?  The Ṛṣi Vatsa, Kaṇva's son, hath magnified you with his songs.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां विप्र इहावसे.अह्वत सतोमेभिरश्विना अरिप्रा वर्त्रहन्तमा ता नो भूतं मयोभुवा |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ vipra ihāvase.ahvat stomebhiraśvinā ariprā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtaṃ mayobhuvā

translations.griffith: The holy singer with his hymns hath called you, Aśvins, hither-ward;  Best Vṛtra-slayers, free from stain, as such bring us felicity.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद वां योषणा रथमतिष्ठद वाजिनीवसू विश्वान्यश्विना युवं पर धीतान्यगछतम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad vāṃ yoṣaṇā rathamatiṣṭhad vājinīvasū viśvānyaśvinā yuvaṃ pra dhītānyaghachatam

translations.griffith: What time, ye Lords of ample wealth, the Lady mounted on your car,  Then, O ye Aśvins, ye attained all wishes that your hearts desired.

verses.sanskrit: अतः सहस्रनिर्णिजा रथेना यातमश्विना वत्सो वां मधुमद वचो.अशंसीत काव्यः कविः |||
verses.transliteration: ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātamaśvinā vatso vāṃ madhumad vaco.aśaṃsīt kāvyaḥ kaviḥ

translations.griffith: Come thence, O Aśvins, on your car that hath a thousand ornaments:  Vatsa the sage, the sage's son, hath sung a song of sweets to you.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू मनोतरा रयीणाम सतोमं मे अश्विनाविममभि वह्नी अनूषाताम |||
verses.transliteration: purumandrā purūvasū manotarā rayīṇām stomaṃ me aśvināvimamabhi vahnī anūṣātām

translations.griffith: Cheerers of many, rich in goods, discoverers of opulence,  The Aśvins, Riders through the sky, have welcomed this my song of praise.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वान्यश्विना धत्तं राधांस्यह्रया कर्तं न रत्वियावतो मा नो रीरधतं निदे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśvānyaśvinā dhattaṃ rādhāṃsyahrayā kṛtaṃ na ṛtviyāvato mā no rīradhataṃ nide

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, grant us all rich gifts wherewith no man mav interfere.  Make us observe the stated times: give us not over to reproach.

verses.sanskrit: यन नास्त्या परावति यद वा सथो अध्यम्बरे अतः सहस्रनिर्णिजा रथेना यातमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yan nāastyā parāvati yad vā stho adhyambare ataḥ sahasranirṇijā rathenā yātamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Whether, Nāsatyas, ye be nigh, or whether ye be far away,  Come thence, O Aśvins, on your car that hath a thousand ornaments.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां नासत्याव रषिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत तस्मै सहस्रनिर्णिजमिषं धत्तं घर्तश्चुतम |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ nāsatyāv ṛṣirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat tasmai sahasranirṇijamiṣaṃ dhattaṃ ghṛtaścutam

translations.griffith: Vatsa the Ṛṣi with his songs, Nāsatyas, hath exalted you:  Grant him rich food distilling oil, graced with a thousand ornaments.

verses.sanskrit: परास्मा ऊर्जं घर्तश्चुतमश्विना यछतं युवम यो वां सुम्नाय तुष्टवद वसूयाद दानुनस पती |||
verses.transliteration: prāsmā ūrjaṃ ghṛtaścutamaśvinā yachataṃ yuvam yo vāṃ sumnāya tuṣṭavad vasūyād dānunas patī

translations.griffith: Bestow on him, O Aśvins, food that strengthens, and that drops with oil,  On him who praises you for bliss, and, Lords of bounty, prays for wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गन्तं रिशादसेमं सतोमं पुरुभुजा कर्तं नः सुश्रियो नरेमा दातमभिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghantaṃ riśādasemaṃ stomaṃ purubhujā kṛtaṃ naḥ suśriyo naremā dātamabhiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Come to us, ye who slay the foe, Lords of rich treasure, to this hymn.  O Heroes, give us high renown and these good things of earth for help.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां विश्वाभिरूतिभिः परियमेधा अहूषत राजन्तावध्वराणामश्विना यामहूतिषु |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ viśvābhirūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata rājantāvadhvarāṇāmaśvinā yāmahūtiṣu

translations.griffith: The Priyamedhas have invoked you with all succours that are yours,  You, Aśvins, Lords of solemn rites, with calls entreating you to come.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गन्तं मयोभुवाश्विना शम्भुवा युवम यो वां विपन्यू धीतिभिर्गीर्भिर्वत्सो अवीव्र्धत |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghantaṃ mayobhuvāśvinā śambhuvā yuvam yo vāṃ vipanyū dhītibhirghīrbhirvatso avīvṛdhat

translations.griffith: Come to us, Aśvins, ye Who bring felicity, auspicious Ones,  To Vatsa who with prayer and hymn, lovers of song, hath honoured you.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः कण्वं मेधातिथिं याभिर्वशं दशव्रजम याभिर्गोशर्यमावतं ताभिर्नो.अवतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvaṃ medhātithiṃ yābhirvaśaṃ daśavrajam yābhirghośaryamāvataṃ tābhirno.avataṃ narā

translations.griffith: Aid us, O Heroes, for those hymns for which ye helped GoSarya erst,  Gave Vaśa, Dasavraja aid, and Kaṇva and Medhatithi:

verses.sanskrit: याभिर्नरा तरसदस्युमावतं कर्त्व्ये धने ताभिः षवस्मानश्विना परावतं वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: yābhirnarā trasadasyumāvataṃ kṛtvye dhane tābhiḥ ṣvasmānaśvinā prāvataṃ vājasātaye

translations.griffith: And favoured Trasadasyu, ye Heroes, in spoil-deciding fray:  For these, O Aśvins, graciously assist us in acquiring strength.

verses.sanskrit: पर वां सतोमाः सुव्र्क्तयो गिरो वर्धन्त्वश्विना पुरुत्रा वर्त्रहन्तमा ता नो भूतं पुरुस्प्र्हा |||
verses.transliteration: pra vāṃ stomāḥ suvṛktayo ghiro vardhantvaśvinā purutrā vṛtrahantamā tā no bhūtaṃ puruspṛhā

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, may pure hymns of ours, and songs and praises, honour you:  Best slayers everywhere of foes, as such we fondly yearn for you.

verses.sanskrit: तरीणि पदान्यश्विनोराविः सान्ति गुहा परः कवी रतस्य पत्मभिरर्वाग जीवेभ्यस परि |||
verses.transliteration: trīṇi padānyaśvinorāviḥ sānti ghuhā paraḥ kavī ṛtasya patmabhirarvāgh jīvebhyas pari

translations.griffith: Three places of the Aśvins, erst concealed, are made apparent now.  Both Sages, with the flight of Law come hither unto those who live.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनमश्विना युवं वत्सस्य गन्तमवसे परास्मै यछतमव्र्कं पर्थु छर्दिर्युयुतं या अरातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnamaśvinā yuvaṃ vatsasya ghantamavase prāsmai yachatamavṛkaṃ pṛthu chardiryuyutaṃ yā arātayaḥ

translations.griffith: To help and favour Vatsa now, O Aśvins, come ye hitherward.  Bestow on him a dwelling spacious and secure, and keep malignities away.

verses.sanskrit: यदन्तरिक्षे यद दिवि यत पञ्च मानुषाननु नर्म्णन्तद धत्तमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yadantarikṣe yad divi yat pañca mānuṣānanu nṛmṇantad dhattamaśvinā

translations.griffith: All manliness that is in heaven, with the Five Tribes, or in mid-air,  Bestow, ye Aśvins, upon us.

verses.sanskrit: ये वां दंसांस्यश्विना विप्रासः परिमाम्र्शुः एवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: ye vāṃ daṃsāṃsyaśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ evet kāṇvasya bodhatam

translations.griffith: Remember Kaṇva first of all among the singers, Aśvins, who  Have thought upon your wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वां घर्मो अश्विना सतोमेन परि षिच्यते अयं सोमो मधुमान वाजिनीवसू येन वर्त्रं चिकेतथः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ gharmo aśvinā stomena pari ṣicyate ayaṃ somo madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtraṃ ciketathaḥ

translations.griffith: Aśvins, for you with song of praise this hot oblation is effused,  This your sweet Soma juice, ye Lords of ample wealth, through which ye think upon the foe.

verses.sanskrit: यदप्सु यद वनस्पतौ यदोषधीषु पुरुदंससा कर्तम तेन माविष्टमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yadapsu yad vanaspatau yadoṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam tena māviṣṭamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Whatever ye have done in floods, in the tree, Wonder-Workers, and in growing plants,  Therewith, O Aśvins, succour me.

verses.sanskrit: यन नासत्या भुरण्यथो यद वा देव भिषज्यथः अयं वां वत्सो मतिभिर्न विन्धते हविष्मन्तं हि गछथः |||
verses.transliteration: yan nāsatyā bhuraṇyatho yad vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ ayaṃ vāṃ vatso matibhirna vindhate haviṣmantaṃ hi ghachathaḥ

translations.griffith: What force, Nāsatyas, ye exert, whatever, Gods, ye tend and heal,  This your own Vatsa gains not by his hymns alone: ye visit him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनमश्विनोरषिः सतोमं चिकेत वामया आ सोमं मधुमत्तमं घर्मं सिञ्चादथर्वणि |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnamaśvinorṣiḥ stomaṃ ciketa vāmayā ā somaṃ madhumattamaṃ gharmaṃ siñcādatharvaṇi

translations.griffith: Now hath the Ṛṣi splendidly thought out the Aśvins' hymn of praise.  Let the Atharvan pour the warm oblation forth, and Soma very rich in sweets.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनं रघुवर्तनिं रथं तिष्ठाथो अश्विना आ वां सतोमा इमे मम नभो न चुच्यवीरत |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnaṃ raghuvartaniṃ rathaṃ tiṣṭhātho aśvinā ā vāṃ stomā ime mama nabho na cucyavīrata

translations.griffith: Ye Aśvins, now ascend your car that lightly rolls upon its way.  May these my praises make you speed hitherward like a cloud of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य वां नासत्योक्थैराचुच्युवीमहि यद वा वाणीभिरश्विनेवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya vāṃ nāsatyokthairācucyuvīmahi yad vā vāṇībhiraśvinevet kāṇvasya bodhatam

translations.griffith: When, O Nāsatyas, we this day make you speed hither with our hymns,  Or, Aśvins, with our songs of praise, remember Kanya specially.

verses.sanskrit: यद वां कक्षीवानुत यद वयश्व रषिर्यद वां दीर्घतमा जुहाव पर्थी यद वां वैन्यः सादनेष्वेवेदतो अश्विना चेतयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: yad vāṃ kakṣīvānuta yad vyaśva ṛṣiryad vāṃ dīrghatamā juhāva pṛthī yad vāṃ vainyaḥ sādaneṣvevedato aśvinā cetayethām

translations.griffith: As erst Kakṣīvān and the Ṛṣi Vyaśva, as erst Dīrghatamas invoked your presence,  Or, in the sacrificial chambers, Vainya Pṛthi, so be ye mindful of us here, O Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: यातं छर्दिष्पा उत नः परस्पा भूतं जगत्पा उत नस्तनूपा वर्तिस्तोकाय तनयाय यातम |||
verses.transliteration: yātaṃ chardiṣpā uta naḥ paraspā bhūtaṃ jaghatpā uta nastanūpā vartistokāya tanayāya yātam

translations.griffith: Come as home-guardians, saving us from foemen, guarding our living creatures and our bodies,  Come to the house to give us seed and offspring,

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्रेण सरथं याथो अश्विना यद वा वायुना भवथः समोकसा यदादित्येभिरभुभिः सजोषसा यद वा विष्णोर्विक्रमणेषु तिष्ठथः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindreṇa sarathaṃ yātho aśvinā yad vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā yadādityebhirbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yad vā viṣṇorvikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ

translations.griffith: Whether with Indra ye be faring, Aśvins, or resting in one dwelling-place with Vāyu,  In concord with the Ṛbhus or Ādityas, or standing still in Viṣṇu's striding-places.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्याश्विनावहं हुवेय वाजसातये यत पर्त्सु तुर्वणे सहस्तच्छ्रेष्ठमश्विनोरवः |||
verses.transliteration: yadadyāśvināvahaṃ huveya vājasātaye yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sahastacchreṣṭhamaśvinoravaḥ

translations.griffith: When I, O Aśvins, call on you to-day that I may gather strength,  Or as all-conquering might in war, be that the Aśvins' noblest grace.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनं यातमश्विनेमा हव्यानि वां हिता इमे सोमासोधि तुर्वशे यदाविमे कण्वेषु वामथ |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnaṃ yātamaśvinemā havyāni vāṃ hitā ime somāsoadhi turvaśe yadāvime kaṇveṣu vāmatha

translations.griffith: Now come, ye Aśvins, hitherward: here are oblations set for you;  These Soma-draughts to aid Yadu and  Turvaśa, these offered you mid Kaniva's Sons.

verses.sanskrit: यन नासत्या पराके अर्वाके अस्ति भेषजम तेन नूनं विमदाय परचेतसा छर्दिर्वत्साय यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: yan nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam tena nūnaṃ vimadāya pracetasā chardirvatsāya yachatam

translations.griffith: Whatever healing balm is yours, Nisatyas, near or far away,  Therewith, great Sages, grant a home to Vatsa and to Vimada.

verses.sanskrit: अभुत्स्यु पर देव्या साकं वाचाहमश्विनोः वयावर्देव्या मतिं वि रातिं मर्त्येभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: abhutsyu pra devyā sākaṃ vācāhamaśvinoḥ vyāvardevyā matiṃ vi rātiṃ martyebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Together with the Goddess, with the Aśvins' Speech have I awoke.  Thou, Goddess, hast disclosed the hymn, and holy gift from mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: पर बोधयोषो अश्विना पर देवि सून्र्ते महि पर यज्ञहोतरानुषक पर मदाय शरवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: pra bodhayoṣo aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi pra yajñahotarānuṣak pra madāya śravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: Awake the Aśvins, Goddess Dawn! Up Mighty Lady of sweet strains!  Rise, straightway, priest of sacrifice! High glory to the gladdening draught!

verses.sanskrit: यदुषो यासि भानुना सं सूर्येण रोचसे आ हायमश्विनो रथो वर्तिर्याति नर्पाय्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yaduṣo yāsi bhānunā saṃ sūryeṇa rocase ā hāyamaśvino ratho vartiryāti nṛpāyyam

translations.griffith: Thou, Dawn, approaching with thy light shinest together with the Sun,  And to this man-protecting home the chariot ofthe Aśvins comes.

verses.sanskrit: यदापीतासो अंशवो गावो न दुह्र ऊधभिः यद वा वाणीरनूषत पर देवयन्तो अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yadāpītāso aṃśavo ghāvo na duhra ūdhabhiḥ yad vā vāṇīranūṣata pra devayanto aśvinā

translations.griffith: When yellow stalks give forth the juice, as cows from udders pour their milk,  And voices sound the song of praise, the Aśvins' worshippers show first.

verses.sanskrit: पर दयुम्नाय पर शवसे पर नर्षाह्याय शर्मणे पर दक्षाय परचेतसा |||
verses.transliteration: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe pra dakṣāya pracetasā

translations.griffith: Forward for glory and for strength, protection that shall conquer men,  And power and skill, most sapient Ones!

verses.sanskrit: यन नूनं धीभिरश्विना पितुर्योना निषीदथः यद वासुम्नेभिरुक्थ्या ||
verses.transliteration: yan nūnaṃ dhībhiraśvinā pituryonā niṣīdathaḥ yad vāsumnebhirukthyā

translations.griffith: When Aśvins, worthy of our lauds, ye seat you in the father's house.  With wisdom or the bliss ye bring.

verses.sanskrit: यत सथो दीर्घप्रसद्मनि यद वादो रोचने दिवः यद वा समुद्रे अध्याक्र्ते गर्हे.अत आ यातमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yat stho dīrghaprasadmani yad vādo rocane divaḥ yad vā samudre adhyākṛte ghṛhe.ata ā yātamaśvinā

translations.griffith: WHETHER ye travel far away or dwell in yonder light of heaven,  Or in a mansion that is built above the sea, come thence, ye Aśvins, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा यज्ञं मनवे सम्मिमिक्षथुरेवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम बर्हस्पतिं विश्वान देवानहं हुव इन्द्राविष्णू अश्विनावाशुहेषसा |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā yajñaṃ manave sammimikṣathurevet kāṇvasya bodhatam bṛhaspatiṃ viśvān devānahaṃ huva indrāviṣṇū aśvināvāśuheṣasā

translations.griffith: Or if for Manu.ye prepared the sacrifice, remember also Kaṇva's son.  I call Bṛhaspati, Indra, Viṣṇu, all the gods, the Aśvins borne by rapid steeds.

verses.sanskrit: तया नवश्विना हुवे सुदंससा गर्भे कर्ता ययोरस्ति परणः सख्यं देवेष्वध्याप्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tyā nvaśvinā huve sudaṃsasā ghṛbhe kṛtā yayorasti praṇaḥ sakhyaṃ deveṣvadhyāpyam

translations.griffith: Those Aśvins I invoke who work marvels, brought hither to receive,  With whom our friendship is most famed, and kinship passing that of Gods.

verses.sanskrit: ययोरधि पर यज्ञा असूरे सन्ति सूरयः ता यज्ञस्याध्वरस्य परचेतसा सवधाभिर्या पिबतः सोम्यं मधु |||
verses.transliteration: yayoradhi pra yajñā asūre santi sūrayaḥ tā yajñasyādhvarasya pracetasā svadhābhiryā pibataḥ somyaṃ madhu

translations.griffith: On whom the solemn rites depend, whose worshippers rise without the Sun:  These who foreknow the holy work of sacrifice, and by their Godhead drink the sweets of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्याश्विनावपाग यत पराक सथो वाजिनीवसू यद दरुह्यव्यनवि तुर्वशे यदौ हुवे वामथ मा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: yadadyāśvināvapāgh yat prāk stho vājinīvasū yad druhyavyanavi turvaśe yadau huve vāmatha mā ghatam

translations.griffith: Whether ye, Lords of ample wealth, now linger in the cast or west,  With Druhyu, or with Anu, Yadu, Turvaga, I call you hither; come to me.

verses.sanskrit: यदन्तरिक्षे पतथः पुरुभुजा यद वेमे रोदसी अनु यद्वा सवधाभिरधितिष्ठथो रथमत आ यातमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yadantarikṣe patathaḥ purubhujā yad veme rodasī anu yadvā svadhābhiradhitiṣṭhatho rathamata ā yātamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Lords of great riches, whether through the firmament ye fly or speed through heaven and earth,  Or with your Godlike natures stand upon your cars, come thence, O Aśvins, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: तवमग्ने वरतपा असि देव आ मर्त्येष्वा तवं यज्ञेष्वीड्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣvā tvaṃ yajñeṣvīḍyaḥ

translations.griffith: THOU Agni, God mid mortal men, art guard of sacred rites, thou art  To be adored at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तवमसि परशस्यो विदथेषु सहन्त्य अग्ने रथीरध्वराणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamasi praśasyo vidatheṣu sahantya aghne rathīradhvarāṇām

translations.griffith: O Mighty Agni, thou must be glorified at our festivals,  Bearing our offerings to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स तवमस्मदप दविषो युयोधि जातवेदः अदेवीरग्ने अरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvamasmadapa dviṣo yuyodhi jātavedaḥ adevīraghne arātīḥ

translations.griffith: O Jātavedas Agni, fight and drive our foes afar from us,  Themand their godless enmities.

verses.sanskrit: अन्ति चित सन्तमह यज्ञं मर्तस्य रिपोः नोप वेषि जातवेदः |||
verses.transliteration: anti cit santamaha yajñaṃ martasya ripoḥ nopa veṣi jātavedaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Jātavedas, seekest not the worship of a hostile man,  However nigh itbe to thee.

verses.sanskrit: मर्ता अमर्त्यस्य ते भूरि नाम मनामहे विप्रासो जातवेदसः |||
verses.transliteration: martā amartyasya te bhūri nāma manāmahe viprāso jātavedasaḥ

translations.griffith: We sages, mortals as we are, adore the mighty name oof thee,  Immortal Jātavedas' name.

verses.sanskrit: विप्रं विप्रासो.अवसे देवं मर्तास ऊतये अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: vipraṃ viprāso.avase devaṃ martāsa ūtaye aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe

translations.griffith: Sages, we call the Sage to help, mortals, we call the God to aid:  We call on Agni with our songs.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते वत्सो मनो यमत परमाच्चित सधस्थात अग्ने तवां कामया गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: ā te vatso mano yamat paramāccit sadhasthāt aghne tvāṃ kāmayā ghirā

translations.griffith: May Vatsa draw- thy mind away even from thy loftiest dwelling-place,  Agni, with song that yearns for thee.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुत्रा हि सद्रंं असि विशो विश्वा अनु परभुः समत्सुत्वा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: purutrā hi sadṛṃṃ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ samatsutvā havāmahe

translations.griffith: Thou art the same in many a place: mid all the people thou art Lord.  In fray and fightt we call on thee.

verses.sanskrit: समत्स्वग्निमवसे वाजयन्तो हवामहे वाजेषु चित्रराधसम |||
verses.transliteration: samatsvaghnimavase vājayanto havāmahe vājeṣu citrarādhasam

translations.griffith: When we are seeking strength we call Agni to help us in the strife,  The giver of rich gifts in war.

verses.sanskrit: परत्नो हि कमीड्यो अध्वरेषु सनाच्च होता नव्यश्च सत्सि सवां चाग्ने तन्वं पिप्रयस्वास्मभ्यं च सौभगमा यजस्व |||
verses.transliteration: pratno hi kamīḍyo adhvareṣu sanācca hotā navyaśca satsi svāṃ cāghne tanvaṃ piprayasvāsmabhyaṃ ca saubhaghamā yajasva

translations.griffith: Ancient, adorablie at sacrifices, Priest from of old, meet for our praise, thou sittest.  Fill full and satisfy thy body, Agni, and win us happiness by offering worship.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्र सोमपातमो मदः शविष्ठ चेतति येना हंसि नयत्रिणं तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: ya indra somapātamo madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati yenā haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ tamīmahe

translations.griffith: JOY, Mightiest Indra, known and marked, sprung most from Soma-draughts, wherewith  Thou smitest down the greedy fiend, for that we long.

verses.sanskrit: येना दशग्वमध्रिगुं वेपयन्तं सवर्णरम येना समुद्रमाविथा तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: yenā daśaghvamadhrighuṃ vepayantaṃ svarṇaram yenā samudramāvithā tamīmahe

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou bolpest Adhrigu, the great Daśagva, and the God  Who stirs the sunlight, and the sea, for that we long.

verses.sanskrit: येन सिन्धुं महीरपो रथानिव परचोदयः पन्थां रतस्य यातवे तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: yena sindhuṃ mahīrapo rathāniva pracodayaḥ panthāṃ ṛtasya yātave tamīmahe

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou dravest forth like cars Sindhu and all the mighty floods  To go the way ordained by Law, for that we long.

verses.sanskrit: इमं सतोममभिष्टये घर्तं न पूतमद्रिवः येना नुसद्य ओजसा ववक्षिथ |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ stomamabhiṣṭaye ghṛtaṃ na pūtamadrivaḥ yenā nusadya ojasā vavakṣitha

translations.griffith: Accept this laud for aid, made pure like oil, thou Caster of the Stone,  Whereby even in a moment thou hast waxen great.

verses.sanskrit: इमं जुषस्व गिर्वणः समुद्र इव पिन्वते इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्ववक्षिथ |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ juṣasva ghirvaṇaḥ samudra iva pinvate indra viśvābhirūtibhirvavakṣitha

translations.griffith: Be pleased, Song-lover, with this song it flows abundant like the sea.  Indra, with all thy succours thou hast waxen great.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो देवः परावतः सखित्वनाय मामहे दिवो न वर्ष्टिं परथयन ववक्षिथ |||
verses.transliteration: yo no devaḥ parāvataḥ sakhitvanāya māmahe divo na vṛṣṭiṃ prathayan vavakṣitha

translations.griffith: The God who from afar hath sent gifts to maintain our friendship's bond,  Thou. spreading them like rain from heaven, hast waxen great.

verses.sanskrit: ववक्षुरस्य केतवो उत वज्रो गभस्त्योः यत सूर्यो न रोदसी अवर्धयत |||
verses.transliteration: vavakṣurasya ketavo uta vajro ghabhastyoḥ yat sūryo na rodasī avardhayat

translations.griffith: The beams that mark him have grown strong, the thunder rests between his arms,  When, like the Sun, he hath increased both Heaven and Earth.

verses.sanskrit: यदि परव्र्द्ध सत्पते सहस्रं महिषानघः आदित त इन्द्रियं महि पर वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: yadi pravṛddha satpate sahasraṃ mahiṣānaghaḥ ādit ta indriyaṃ mahi pra vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: When, Mighty Lord of Heroes, thou didst cat a thousand buffaloes,  Then grew and waxed exceeding great thine Indra-power.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिर्न्यर्शसानमोषति अग्निर्वनेव सासहिः पर वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sūryasya raśmibhirnyarśasānamoṣati aghnirvaneva sāsahiḥ pra vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: Indra consumeth with the rays of Sūrya the malicious man:  Like Agni conquering the woods, he hath grown strong.

verses.sanskrit: इयं त रत्वियावती धीतिरेति नवीयसी सपर्यन्ती पुरुप्रिया मिमीत इत |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ ta ṛtviyāvatī dhītireti navīyasī saparyantī purupriyā mimīta it

translations.griffith: This newest thought of ours that suits the time approaches unto thee:  Serving, beloved in many a place it metes and marks.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भो यज्ञस्य देवयुः करतुं पुनीत आनुषक सतोमैरिन्द्रस्य वाव्र्धे मिमीत इत |||
verses.transliteration: gharbho yajñasya devayuḥ kratuṃ punīta ānuṣak stomairindrasya vāvṛdhe mimīta it

translations.griffith: The pious germ of sacrifice directly purifies the soul.  By Indra's lauds it waxes great, it metes and marks.

verses.sanskrit: सनिर्मित्रस्य पप्रथ इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये पराची वाशीव सुन्वते मिमीत इत |||
verses.transliteration: sanirmitrasya papratha indraḥ somasya pītaye prācī vāśīva sunvate mimīta it

translations.griffith: Indra who wins the friend hath spread himself to drink the Soma-draught:  Like worshipper's dilating praise; it metes and marks.

verses.sanskrit: यं विप्रा उक्थवाहसो.अभिप्रमन्दुरायवः घर्तं न पिप्य आसन्य रतस्य यत |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ viprā ukthavāhaso.abhipramandurāyavaḥ ghṛtaṃ na pipya āsany ṛtasya yat

translations.griffith: He whom the sages, living men, have gladdened, offering up their hymns,  Hath swelled like oil of sacrifice in Agni's mouth.

verses.sanskrit: उत सवराजे अदिति सतोममिन्द्राय जीजनत पुरुप्रशस्तमूतय रतस्य यत |||
verses.transliteration: uta svarāje aditi stomamindrāya jījanat purupraśastamūtaya ṛtasya yat

translations.griffith: Aditi also hath brought forth a hymn for Indra, Sovran Lord:  The work of sacrifice for help is glorified.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वह्नय ऊतये.अनूषत परशस्तये न देव विव्रता हरी रतस्य यत |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vahnaya ūtaye.anūṣata praśastaye na deva vivratā harī ṛtasya yat

translations.griffith: The ministering priests have sung their songs for aid and eulogy:  God, thy Bays turn not from the rite which Law ordains.

verses.sanskrit: यत सोममिन्द्र विष्णवि यद वा घ तरित आप्त्ये यद वा मरुत्सु मन्दसे समिन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yat somamindra viṣṇavi yad vā gha trita āptye yad vā marutsu mandase samindubhiḥ

translations.griffith: If, Indra, thou drink Soma by Viṣṇu's or Tṛta Āptya's side,  Or with the Maruts take delight in flowing drops;

verses.sanskrit: यद वा शक्र परावति समुद्रे अधि मन्दसे अस्माकमित सुते रणा समिन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase asmākamit sute raṇā samindubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Or, Śakra, if thou gladden thee afar or in the sea of air,  Rejoice thee in this juice of ours, in flowing drops.

verses.sanskrit: यद वासि सुन्वतो वर्धो यजमानस्य सत्पते उक्थे वा यस्यरण्यसि समिन्दुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yad vāsi sunvato vṛdho yajamānasya satpate ukthe vā yasyaraṇyasi samindubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Or, Lord of Heroes if thou aid the worshipper who shed; the, juice,  Or him whose laud delights thee, and his flowing drops.

verses.sanskrit: देवं-देवं वो.अवस इन्द्रम-इन्द्रं गर्णीषणि अधा यज्ञाय तुर्वणे वयानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ vo.avasa indram-indraṃ ghṛṇīṣaṇi adhā yajñāya turvaṇe vyānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: To magnify the God, the God, Indra, yea, Indra for your help,  And promptly end the sacrifice-this have they gained.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेभिर्यज्ञवाहसं सोमेभिः सोमपातमम होत्राभिरिन्द्रं वाव्र्धुर्व्यानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñebhiryajñavāhasaṃ somebhiḥ somapātamam hotrābhirindraṃ vāvṛdhurvyānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: With worship, him whom men adore, with Soma, him who drinks it most,  Indra with lauds have they increasedthis have they gained.

verses.sanskrit: महीरस्य परणीतयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः विश्वा वसूनि दाशुषे वयानशुः |||
verses.transliteration: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ viśvā vasūni dāśuṣe vyānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: His leadings are with power and might and his instructions manifold:  He gives the worshipper all wealth: this have they gained.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे देवासो दधिरे पुरः इन्द्रं वाणीरनूषता समोजसे |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave devāso dadhire puraḥ indraṃ vāṇīranūṣatā samojase

translations.griffith: For slaying Vṛtra have the Gods set Indra in the foremost place.  Indra the choral bands have sung, for vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: महान्तं महिना वयं सतोमेभिर्हवनश्रुतम अर्कैरभिप्र णोनुमः समोजसे |||
verses.transliteration: mahāntaṃ mahinā vayaṃ stomebhirhavanaśrutam arkairabhipra ṇonumaḥ samojase

translations.griffith: We to the Mighty with our might, with lauds to him who hears our call,  With holy hymns have sung aloud, for vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: न यं विविक्तो रोदसी नान्तरिक्षाणि वज्रिणम अमादिदस्य तित्विषे समोजसः |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ vivikto rodasī nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam amādidasya titviṣe samojasaḥ

translations.griffith: Not earth, nor heaven, nor firmaments contain the Thunder-wielding God:  They shake before his violent rush and vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र पर्तनाज्ये देवास्त्वा दधिरे पुरः आदित ते हर्यता हरी ववक्षतुः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra pṛtanājye devāstvā dadhire puraḥ ādit te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ

translations.griffith: What time the Gods, O Indra, get thee foremost in the furious fight,  Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

verses.sanskrit: यदा वर्त्रं नदीव्र्तं शवसा वज्रिन्नवधीः आदित ते ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadā vṛtraṃ nadīvṛtaṃ śavasā vajrinnavadhīḥ ādit te ...

translations.griffith: When Vṛtra, stayer of the floods, thou si"est, Thundeicr with might,  Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

verses.sanskrit: यदा ते विष्णुरोजसा तरीणि पदा विचक्रमे आदित ते . .. |||
verses.transliteration: yadā te viṣṇurojasā trīṇi padā vicakrame ādit te . ..

translations.griffith: When Viṣṇu, through thine energy, strode wide those three great steps of his,  Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.

verses.sanskrit: यदा ते हर्यता हरी वाव्र्धाते दिवे-दिवे आदित ते विश्वा भुवनानि येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: yadā te haryatā harī vāvṛdhāte dive-dive ādit te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire

translations.griffith: When thy two beautiful Bay Steeds grew great and greater day by day,  Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदा ते मारुतीर्विशस्तुभ्यमिन्द्र नियेमिरे आ इत ते व. ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadā te mārutīrviśastubhyamindra niyemire ā it te v. ...

translations.griffith: When, Indra, all the Marut folk humbly submitted them to thee,  Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

verses.sanskrit: यदा सूर्यममुं दिवि शुक्रं जयोतिरधारयः आदित्ते व. ... |||
verses.transliteration: yadā sūryamamuṃ divi śukraṃ jyotiradhārayaḥ āditte v. ...

translations.griffith: When yonder Sun, that brilliant light, thou settest in the heaven above,  Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.

verses.sanskrit: इमां त इन्द्र सुष्टुतिं विप्र इयर्ति धीतिभिः जामिं पदेव पिप्रतीं पराध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ ta indra suṣṭutiṃ vipra iyarti dhītibhiḥ jāmiṃ padeva pipratīṃ prādhvare

translations.griffith: To thee, O Indra, with this thought the sage lifts up this eulogy,  Akin and leading as on foot to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यदस्य धामनि परिये समीचीनासो अस्वरन नाभा यज्ञस्य दोहना पराध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: yadasya dhāmani priye samīcīnāso asvaran nābhā yajñasya dohanā prādhvare

translations.griffith: When in thine own dear dwelling all gathered have lifted up the voice  Milk-streams at worship's central spot, for sacrifice,

verses.sanskrit: सुवीर्यं सवश्व्यं सुगव्यं इन्द्र दद्धि नः होतेव पूर्वचित्तये पराध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ sughavyaṃ indra daddhi naḥ hoteva pūrvacittaye prādhvare

translations.griffith: As Priest, O Indra, give us wealth in brave men and good steeds ana kine  That we may first remember thee for sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुतेषु सोमेषु करतुं पुनीत उक्थ्यम विदे वर्धस्यदक्षसो महान हि षः |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratuṃ punīta ukthyam vide vṛdhasyadakṣaso mahān hi ṣaḥ

translations.griffith: INDRA, when Soma juices flow, makes his mind pure and meet for lauds.  He gains the power that brings success, for great is he.

verses.sanskrit: स परथमे वयोमनि देवानां सदने वर्धः सुपारः सुश्रवस्तमः समप्सुजित |||
verses.transliteration: sa prathame vyomani devānāṃ sadane vṛdhaḥ supāraḥ suśravastamaḥ samapsujit

translations.griffith: In heaven's first region, in the seat of Gods, is he who brings success,  Most glorious, prompt to save, who wins the water-floods.

verses.sanskrit: तमह्वे वाजसातय इन्द्रं भराय शुष्मिणम भवा नःसुम्ने अन्तमः सखा वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: tamahve vājasātaya indraṃ bharāya śuṣmiṇam bhavā naḥsumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Him, to win strength, have I invoked, even Indra mighty for the fray.  Be thou most near to us for bliss, a Friend to aid.

verses.sanskrit: इयं त इन्द्र गिर्वणो रातिः कषरति सुन्वतः मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि |||
verses.transliteration: iyaṃ ta indra ghirvaṇo rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi

translations.griffith: Indra, Song -lover, here for thee the worshipper's libation flows.  Rejoicing in this sacred grass thou shinest forth.

verses.sanskrit: नूनं तदिन्द्र दद्धि नो यत तवा सुन्वन्त ईमहे रयिं नश्चित्रमा भरा सवर्विदम |||
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ tadindra daddhi no yat tvā sunvanta īmahe rayiṃ naścitramā bharā svarvidam

translations.griffith: Even now, O Indra, give us that which, pressing juice, we crave of thee.  Bring us wealth manifold which finds the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सतोता यत ते विचर्षणिरतिप्रशर्धयद गिरः वया इवानु रोहते जुषन्त यत |||
verses.transliteration: stotā yat te vicarṣaṇiratipraśardhayad ghiraḥ vayā ivānu rohate juṣanta yat

translations.griffith: What time the zealous worshipper hath boldly sung his songs to thee,  Like branches of a tree up-grows what they desire.

verses.sanskrit: परत्नवज्जनया गिरः शर्णुधी जरितुर्हवम मदे-मदे ववक्षिथा सुक्र्त्वने |||
verses.transliteration: pratnavajjanayā ghiraḥ śṛṇudhī jariturhavam made-made vavakṣithā sukṛtvane

translations.griffith: Generate songs even as of old, give car unto the singer's call.  Thou for the pious hast grown great at each carouse.

verses.sanskrit: करीळन्त्यस्य सून्र्ता आपो न परवता यतीः अया धिया य उच्यते पतिर्दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: krīḷantyasya sūnṛtā āpo na pravatā yatīḥ ayā dhiyā ya ucyate patirdivaḥ

translations.griffith: Sweet strains that glorify him play like waters speeding down a slope,  Yea, him who in this song is called the Lord of Heaven;

verses.sanskrit: उतो पतिर्य उच्यते कर्ष्टीनामेक इद वशी नमोव्र्धैरवस्युभिः सुते रण |||
verses.transliteration: uto patirya ucyate kṛṣṭīnāmeka id vaśī namovṛdhairavasyubhiḥ sute raṇa

translations.griffith: Yea, who alone is called the Lord, the single Ruler of the folk,  By worshippers seeking aid: may he joy in the draught.

verses.sanskrit: सतुहि शरुतं विपश्चितं हरी यस्य परसक्षिणा गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हं नमस्विनः |||
verses.transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ vipaścitaṃ harī yasya prasakṣiṇā ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛhaṃ namasvinaḥ

translations.griffith: Praise him, the Glorious, skilled in song, Lord of the two victorious Bays:  They seek the worshipper's abode who bows in prayer.

verses.sanskrit: तूतुजानो महेमते.अश्वेभिः परुषितप्सुभिः आ याहि यज्ञमाशुभिः शमिद धि ते |||
verses.transliteration: tūtujāno mahemate.aśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ ā yāhi yajñamāśubhiḥ śamid dhi te

translations.griffith: Put forth thy strength: with dappled Steeds come, thou of mighty intellect,  With swift Steeds to the sacrifice, for ’tis thy joy.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र शविष्ठ सत्पते रयिं गर्णत्सु धारय शरवः सूरिभ्यो अम्र्तं वसुत्वनम |||
verses.transliteration: indra śaviṣṭha satpate rayiṃ ghṛṇatsu dhāraya śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanam

translations.griffith: Grant wealth to those who praise thee, Lord of Heroes, Mightiest Indra: give  Our princes everlasting fame and opulence.

verses.sanskrit: हवे तवा सूर उदिते हवे मध्यन्दिने दिवः जुषाण इन्द्र सप्तिभिर्न आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: have tvā sūra udite have madhyandine divaḥ juṣāṇa indra saptibhirna ā ghahi

translations.griffith: I call thee when the Sun is risen, I call thee at the noon of day:  With thy car-horses, Indra, come wellpleased to us.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू गहि पर तु दरव मत्स्वा सुतस्य गोमतः तन्तुं तनुष्व पूर्व्यं यथा विदे |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū ghahi pra tu drava matsvā sutasya ghomataḥ tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyaṃ yathā vide

translations.griffith: Speed forward hither, come to us, rejoice thee in the milky draught:  Spin out the thread of ancient time, as well is known.

verses.sanskrit: यच्छक्रासि परावति यदर्वावति वर्त्रहन यद वा समुद्रे अन्धसो.अवितेदसि |||
verses.transliteration: yacchakrāsi parāvati yadarvāvati vṛtrahan yad vā samudre andhaso.avitedasi

translations.griffith: If, Śakra, Vṛtra-slayer, thou be far away or near to us.  Or in the sea, thou art the guard of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तु नो गिर इन्द्रं सुतास इन्दवः इन्द्रे हविष्मतीर्विशो अराणिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhantu no ghira indraṃ sutāsa indavaḥ indre haviṣmatīrviśo arāṇiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Let songs we sing and Soma-drops expressed by us make Indra strong:  The tribes who bring oblations find delight in him.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद विप्रा अवस्यवः परवत्वतीभिरूतिभिः इन्द्रं कषोणीरवर्धयन वया इव |||
verses.transliteration: tamid viprā avasyavaḥ pravatvatībhirūtibhiḥ indraṃ kṣoṇīravardhayan vayā iva

translations.griffith: Him sages longing for his aid, with offerings brought in eager haste,  Him. even as branches, all mankind have made to grow.

verses.sanskrit: तरिकद्रुकेषु चेतनं देवासो यज्ञमत्नत तमिद वर्धन्तुनो गिरः सदाव्र्धम |||
verses.transliteration: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṃ devāso yajñamatnata tamid vardhantuno ghiraḥ sadāvṛdham

translations.griffith: At the Trkadrukas the Gods span sacrifice that stirred the mind:  May our songs strengthen him who still hath strengthened us.

verses.sanskrit: सतोता यत ते अनुव्रत उक्थान्य रतुथा दधे शुचिः पावक उच्यते सो अद्भुतः |||
verses.transliteration: stotā yat te anuvrata ukthāny ṛtuthā dadhe śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate so adbhutaḥ

translations.griffith: When, true to duty, at due times the worshipper offers lauds to thee,  They call him Purifier, Pure, and Wonderful.

verses.sanskrit: तदिद रुद्रस्य चेतति यह्वं परत्नेषु धामसु मनो यत्रावि तद दधुर्विचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: tadid rudrasya cetati yahvaṃ pratneṣu dhāmasu mano yatrāvi tad dadhurvicetasaḥ

translations.griffith: That mind of Rudra, fresh and strong, moves conscious in the ancient ways,  With reference whereto the wise have ordered this.

verses.sanskrit: यदि मे सख्यमावर इमस्य पाह्यन्धसः येन विश्वा अति दविषो अतारिम |||
verses.transliteration: yadi me sakhyamāvara imasya pāhyandhasaḥ yena viśvā ati dviṣo atārima

translations.griffith: If thou elect to be my Friend drink of this sacrificial juice,  By help whereof we may subdue all enemies.

verses.sanskrit: कदा त इन्द्र गिर्वण सतोता भवाति शन्तमः कदा नो गव्ये अश्व्ये वसौ दधः |||
verses.transliteration: kadā ta indra ghirvaṇa stotā bhavāti śantamaḥ kadā no ghavye aśvye vasau dadhaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lover of the song, when shall thy praiser be most blest?  When wilt thou grant us wealth in herds of kine and steeds?

verses.sanskrit: उत ते सुष्टुता हरी वर्षणा वहतो रथम अजुर्यस्य मदिन्तमं यमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta te suṣṭutā harī vṛṣaṇā vahato ratham ajuryasya madintamaṃ yamīmahe

translations.griffith: And thy two highIy-lauded Bays, strong stallions, draw thy car who art  Untouched by age, most gladdening car for which we pray.

verses.sanskrit: तमीमहे पुरुष्टुतं यह्वं परत्नाभिरूतिभिः नि बर्हिषि परिये सददध दविता |||
verses.transliteration: tamīmahe puruṣṭutaṃ yahvaṃ pratnābhirūtibhiḥ ni barhiṣi priye sadadadha dvitā

translations.griffith: With ancient offerings we implore the Young and Strong whom many praise.  He from of old hath sat upon dear sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: वर्धस्वा सु पुरुष्टुत रषिष्टुताभिरूतिभिः धुक्षस्वपिप्युषीमिषमवा च नः |||
verses.transliteration: vardhasvā su puruṣṭuta ṛṣiṣṭutābhirūtibhiḥ dhukṣasvapipyuṣīmiṣamavā ca naḥ

translations.griffith: Wax miglity, thou whom many laud for aids which Ṛṣis have extolled.  Pour down for us abundant food and guard us well.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र तवमवितेदसीत्था सतुवतो अद्रिवः रतादियर्मि ते धियं मनोयुजम |||
verses.transliteration: indra tvamavitedasītthā stuvato adrivaḥ ṛtādiyarmi te dhiyaṃ manoyujam

translations.griffith: O Indra, Caster of the Stone, thou helpest him who praises thee:  From sacrifice I send to thee a mindyoked hymn.

verses.sanskrit: इह तया सधमाद्य युजानः सोमपीतये हरी इन्द्र परतद्वसू अभि सवर |||
verses.transliteration: iha tyā sadhamādya yujānaḥ somapītaye harī indra pratadvasū abhi svara

translations.griffith: Here, yoking for the Soma-draught these Horses, sharers of thy feast,  Thy Bay Steeds, Indra, fraught with weal tb, consent to come.

verses.sanskrit: अभि सवरन्तु ये तव रुद्रासः सक्षत शरियम उतो मरुत्वतीर्विशो अभि परयः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi svarantu ye tava rudrāsaḥ sakṣata śriyam uto marutvatīrviśo abhi prayaḥ

translations.griffith: Attendants on thy glory, let the Rudras roar assent to thee,  And all the Marut companies come tothe feast.

verses.sanskrit: इमा अस्य परतूर्तयः पदं जुषन्त यद दिवि नाभा यज्ञस्य सं दधुर्यथा विदे |||
verses.transliteration: imā asya pratūrtayaḥ padaṃ juṣanta yad divi nābhā yajñasya saṃ dadhuryathā vide

translations.griffith: These his victorious followers bold in the heavens the place they love,  Leagued in the heart of sacrifice, as well we know.

verses.sanskrit: अयं दीर्घाय चक्षसे पराचि परयत्यध्वरे मिमीते यज्ञमानुषग विचक्ष्य |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ dīrghāya cakṣase prāci prayatyadhvare mimīte yajñamānuṣagh vicakṣya

translations.griffith: That we may long behold the light, what time the ordered rite proceeds,  He duly measures, as he views, the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षायमिन्द्र ते रथ उतो ते वर्षणा हरी वर्षा तवंशतक्रतो वर्षा हवः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣāyamindra te ratha uto te vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvaṃśatakrato vṛṣā havaḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, strong is this thy car, and strong are these Bay Steeds of thine:  O Śatakratu, thou art strong, strong is our call.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः वर्षायज्ञो यमिन्वसि वर्षा हवः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā ghrāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ vṛṣāyajño yaminvasi vṛṣā havaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong is the press-stone, strong thy joy, strong is the flowing Soma juice:  Strong is the rite thou furtherest, strong is our call.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ्चित्राभिरुतिभिः वावन्थ हि परतिष्टुतिं वर्षा हवः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñcitrābhirutibhiḥ vāvantha hi pratiṣṭutiṃ vṛṣā havaḥ

translations.griffith: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunderer with thy thousand aids:  For thou hast won the hymn of praise. Strong is our call.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राहं यथा तवमीशीय वस्व एक इत सतोता मेगोषखा सयात |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāhaṃ yathā tvamīśīya vasva eka it stotā meghoṣakhā syāt

translations.griffith: IF I, O Indra, were, like thee, the single Sovran of all wealth,  My worshipper should be rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit: शिक्षेयमस्मै दित्सेयं शचीपते मनीषिणे यदहं गोपतिः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: śikṣeyamasmai ditseyaṃ śacīpate manīṣiṇe yadahaṃ ghopatiḥ syām

translations.griffith: I should be fain, O Lord of Power, to strengthen and enrich the sage,  Were I the Lord of herds of kine.

verses.sanskrit: धेनुष ट इन्द्र सून्र्ता यजमानाय सुन्वते गामश्वं पिप्युषी दुहे |||
verses.transliteration: dhenuṣ ṭa indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate ghāmaśvaṃ pipyuṣī duhe

translations.griffith: To worshippers who press the juice thy goodness, Indra, is a cow  Yielding in plenty kine and steeds.

verses.sanskrit: न ते वर्तास्ति राधस इन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यः यद दित्ससिस्तुतो मघम |||
verses.transliteration: na te vartāsti rādhasa indra devo na martyaḥ yad ditsasistuto magham

translations.griffith: None is there, Indra, God or man, to hinder thy munificence,  The wealth which, lauded, thou wilt give.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञ इन्द्रमवर्धयद यद भूमिं वयवर्तयत चक्राण ओपशं दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: yajña indramavardhayad yad bhūmiṃ vyavartayat cakrāṇa opaśaṃ divi

translations.griffith: The sacrifice made Indra strong when he unrolled the earth, and made  Himself a diadem in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वाव्र्धानस्य ते वयं विश्वा धनानि जिग्युषः ऊतिमिन्द्रा वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: vāvṛdhānasya te vayaṃ viśvā dhanāni jighyuṣaḥ ūtimindrā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Thine aid we claim, O Indra, thine who after thou hast waxen great  Hast won all treasures for thine own.

verses.sanskrit: वयन्तरिक्षमतिरन मदे सोमस्य रोचना इन्द्रो यदभिनद्वलम |||
verses.transliteration: vyantarikṣamatiran made somasya rocanā indro yadabhinadvalam

translations.griffith: In Soma's ecstasy Indra spread the firmament and realms of light,  When he cleft Vala limb from limb.

verses.sanskrit: उद गा आजदङगिरोभ्य आविष कर्ण्वन गुहा सतीः अर्वाञ्चं नुनुदे वलम |||
verses.transliteration: ud ghā ājadaṅghirobhya āviṣ kṛṇvan ghuhā satīḥ arvāñcaṃ nunude valam

translations.griffith: Showing the hidden he drave forth the cows for the Aṅgirases,  And Vala he cast headlong down.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रेण रोचना दिवो दर्ळ्हानि दरंहितानि च सथिराणि नपराणुदे |||
verses.transliteration: indreṇa rocanā divo dṛḷhāni dṛṃhitāni ca sthirāṇi naparāṇude

translations.griffith: By Indra were the lumirious realms of heaven established and secured,  Firm and immovable from their place.

verses.sanskrit: अपामूर्मिर्मदन्निव सतोम इन्द्राजिरायते वि ते मदा अराजिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: apāmūrmirmadanniva stoma indrājirāyate vi te madā arājiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, thy laud moves quickly like a joyous wave of water-floods:  Bright shine the drops that gladden thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि सतोमवर्धन इन्द्रास्युक्थवर्धनः सतोतॄणामुत भद्रक्र्त |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi stomavardhana indrāsyukthavardhanaḥ stotṝṇāmuta bhadrakṛt

translations.griffith: For thou, O Indra, art the God whom hymns and praises magnify:  Thou blessest those who worship thee.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रमित केशिना हरी सोमपेयाय वक्षतः उप यज्ञंसुराधसम |||
verses.transliteration: indramit keśinā harī somapeyāya vakṣataḥ upa yajñaṃsurādhasam

translations.griffith: Let the two long-maned Bay Steeds bring Indra to drink the Soma juice,  The Bountiful to our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अपां फेनेन नमुचेः शिर इन्द्रोदवर्तयः विश्वा यदजयः सप्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: apāṃ phenena namuceḥ śira indrodavartayaḥ viśvā yadajayaḥ spṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: With waters' foam thou torest off, Indra, the head of Namuci,  Subduing all contending hosts.

verses.sanskrit: मायाभिरुत्सिस्र्प्सत इन्द्र दयामारुरुक्षतः अव दस्यून्रधूनुथाः |||
verses.transliteration: māyābhirutsisṛpsata indra dyāmārurukṣataḥ ava dasyūnradhūnuthāḥ

translations.griffith: The Dasyus, when they fain would climb  by magic arts and mount to heaven,  Thou, Indra, castest down to earth.

verses.sanskrit: असुन्वामिन्द्र संसदं विषूचीं वयनाशयः सोमपा उत्तरो भवन |||
verses.transliteration: asunvāmindra saṃsadaṃ viṣūcīṃ vyanāśayaḥ somapā uttaro bhavan

translations.griffith: As Soma-drinker conquering all, thou scatteredst to every side  Their settlement who poured no gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तं वभि पर गायत पुरुहूतं पुरुष्टुतम इन्द्रं गीर्भिस्तविषमा विवासत |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vabhi pra ghāyata puruhūtaṃ puruṣṭutam indraṃ ghīrbhistaviṣamā vivāsata

translations.griffith: SING forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud.  Invite the powerful Indra with your songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य दविबर्हसो बर्हत सहो दाधार रोदसी गिरीन्रज्रानपः सवर्व्र्षत्वना |||
verses.transliteration: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī ghirīnrajrānapaḥ svarvṛṣatvanā

translations.griffith: Whose lofty might-for doubly strong is he-supports the heavens and earth,  And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.

verses.sanskrit: स राजसि पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि जिघ्नसे इन्द्र जैत्रा शरवस्या च यन्तवे |||
verses.transliteration: sa rājasi puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave

translations.griffith: Such, Praised by many! thou art King alone thou smitest Vṛtras dead,  To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.

verses.sanskrit: तं ते मदं गर्णीमसि वर्षणं पर्त्सु सासहिम उ लोकक्र्त्नुमद्रिवो हरिश्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ te madaṃ ghṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtsu sāsahim u lokakṛtnumadrivo hariśriyam

translations.griffith: We sing this strong and wild delight of thine which conquers in the fray,  Which, Caster of the Stone! gives room and shines like gold.

verses.sanskrit: येन जयोतींष्यायवे मनवे च विवेदिथ मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि |||
verses.transliteration: yena jyotīṃṣyāyave manave ca viveditha mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou also foundest lights for Āyu and for Manu's sake:  Now joying in this sacred grass thou beamest forth.

verses.sanskrit: तदद्या चित त उक्थिनो.अनु षटुवन्ति पूर्वथा वर्षपत्नीरपो जया दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: tadadyā cit ta ukthino.anu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā vṛṣapatnīrapo jayā dive-dive

translations.griffith: This day too singers of the hymn praise, as of old, this might of thine:  Win thou the waters day by day, thralls of the strong.

verses.sanskrit: तव तयदिन्द्रियं बर्हत तव शुष्ममुत करतुम वज्रं शिशाति धिषणा वरेण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tava tyadindriyaṃ bṛhat tava śuṣmamuta kratum vajraṃ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam

translations.griffith: That lofty Indra-power of thine, thy strength and thine intelligence,  Thy thunderbolt for which we long, the wish makes keen.

verses.sanskrit: तव दयौरिन्द्र पौंस्यं पर्थिवी वर्धति शरवः तवामापः पर्वतासश्च हिन्विरे |||
verses.transliteration: tava dyaurindra pauṃsyaṃ pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ tvāmāpaḥ parvatāsaśca hinvire

translations.griffith: O Indra, Heaven and Earth augment thy manly power and thy renown;  The waters and thy mountains stir and urge thee on.

verses.sanskrit: तवां विष्णुर्ब्र्हन कषयो मित्रो गर्णाति वरुणः तवांशर्धो मदत्यनु मारुतम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ viṣṇurbṛhan kṣayo mitro ghṛṇāti varuṇaḥ tvāṃśardho madatyanu mārutam

translations.griffith: Viṣṇu the lofty ruling Power, Varuṇa, Mitra sing thy praise:  In thee the Marut3' company have great delight.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वर्षा जनानां मंहिष्ठ इन्द्र जज्ञिषे सत्रा विश्वा सवपत्यानि दधिषे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ vṛṣā janānāṃ maṃhiṣṭha indra jajñiṣe satrā viśvā svapatyāni dadhiṣe

translations.griffith: O Indra, thou wast born the Lord of men, most liberal of thy gifts:  Excellent deeds for evermore are all thine own.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रा तवं पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि तोशसे नान्य इन्द्रात्करणं भूय इन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: satrā tvaṃ puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi tośase nānya indrātkaraṇaṃ bhūya invati

translations.griffith: Ever, alone, O highly-praised, thou sendest Vṛtras to their rest:  None else than Indra executes the mighty deed.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र मन्मशस्त्वा नाना हवन्त ऊतये अस्माकेभिर्न्र्भिरत्रा सवर्जय |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra manmaśastvā nānā havanta ūtaye asmākebhirnṛbhiratrā svarjaya

translations.griffith: Though here and there, in varied hymns, Indra, men call on thee for aid,  Still with our heroes fight and win the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अरं कषयाय नो महे विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन इन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षया शचीपतिम |||
verses.transliteration: araṃ kṣayāya no mahe viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan indraṃ jaitrāya harṣayā śacīpatim

translations.griffith: Already have all forms of him entered our spacious dwelling-place:  For victory stir thou Indra, up, the Lord of Might.

verses.sanskrit: पर सम्राजं चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं सतोता नव्यं गीर्भिः नरं नर्षाहं मंहिष्ठम |||
verses.transliteration: pra samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāmindraṃ stotā navyaṃ ghīrbhiḥ naraṃ nṛṣāhaṃ maṃhiṣṭham

translations.griffith: PRAISE Indra whom our songs must laud, sole Sovran of mankind, the Chief  Most liberal who controlleth men.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन्नुक्थानि रण्यन्ति विश्वानि च शरवस्या अपामवोन समुद्रे |||
verses.transliteration: yasminnukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā apāmavona samudre

translations.griffith: In whom the hymns of praise delight, and all the glory-giving songs.  Like the floods' longing for the sea.

verses.sanskrit: तं सुष्टुत्या विवासे जयेष्ठराजं भरे कर्त्नुम महो वाजिनं सनिभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājaṃ bhare kṛtnum maho vājinaṃ sanibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Him I invite with eulogy, best King, effective in the fight,  Strong for the gain of mighty spoil.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यानूना गभीरा मदा उरवस्तरुत्राः हर्षुमन्तःशूरसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: yasyānūnā ghabhīrā madā uravastarutrāḥ harṣumantaḥśūrasātau

translations.griffith: Whose perfect ecstasies are wide, profound, victorious, and give  joy in the field where heroes win.

verses.sanskrit: तमिद धनेषु हितेष्वधिवाकाय हवन्ते येषामिन्द्रस्ते जयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: tamid dhaneṣu hiteṣvadhivākāya havante yeṣāmindraste jayanti

translations.griffith: Him, when the spoils of war are staked, men call to be their advocate:  They who have Indra win the day.

verses.sanskrit: तमिच्च्यौत्नैरार्यन्ति तं कर्तेभिश्चर्षणयः एषैन्द्रो वरिवस्क्र्त |||
verses.transliteration: tamiccyautnairāryanti taṃ kṛtebhiścarṣaṇayaḥ eṣaindro varivaskṛt

translations.griffith: Men honour him with stirring songs and magnify with solemn rites:  Indra is he who giveth case.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो बरह्मेन्द्र रषिरिन्द्रः पुरू पुरुहूतः महान महीभिः शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: indro brahmendra ṛṣirindraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Indra is priest and Ṛṣi, he is much invoked by many men,  And mighty by his mighty powers.

verses.sanskrit: स सतोम्यः स हव्यः सत्यः सत्वा तुविकूर्मिः एकश्चित्सन्नभिभूतिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ ekaścitsannabhibhūtiḥ

translations.griffith: Meet to be lauded and invoked, true Hero with his deeds of might,  Victorious even when alone.

verses.sanskrit: तमर्केभिस्तं सामभिस्तं गायत्रैश्चर्षणयः इन्द्रं वर्धन्ति कषितयः |||
verses.transliteration: tamarkebhistaṃ sāmabhistaṃ ghāyatraiścarṣaṇayaḥ indraṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ

translations.griffith: The men, the people magnify that Indra with their Slina. songs,  With hymns and sacred eulogies

verses.sanskrit: परणेतारं वस्यो अछा कर्तारं जयोतिः समत्सु सासह्वांसं युधामित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: praṇetāraṃ vasyo achā kartāraṃ jyotiḥ samatsu sāsahvāṃsaṃ yudhāmitrān

translations.griffith: Him who advances them to wealth, sends light to lead them in the war,  And quells their foemen in the fray.

verses.sanskrit: स नः पप्रिः पारयाति सवस्ति नावा पुरुहूतः इन्द्रो विश्वा अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: May he, the saviour much-invoked, may Indra bear us in a ship  Safely beyond all enemies.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र वाजेभिर्दशस्या च गातुया च अछा चनः सुम्नं नेषि |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra vājebhirdaśasyā ca ghātuyā ca achā canaḥ sumnaṃ neṣi

translations.griffith: As such, O Indra, honour us with gifts of booty, further us,  And lead us to felicity.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि सुषुमा हि त इन्द्र सोमं पिबा इमम एदं बर्हिः सदो मम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somaṃ pibā imam edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama

translations.griffith: COME, we have pressed the juice for thee; O Indra, drink this Soma here  Sit thou on this my sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा बरह्मयुजा हरी वहतामिन्द्र केशिना उप बरह्मणि नः शर्णु |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatāmindra keśinā upa brahmaṇi naḥ śṛṇu

translations.griffith: O Indra, let thy long-maned Bays, yoked by prayer, bring thee hitherward  Give car and listen to our prayers.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्माणस्त्वा वयं युजा सोमपामिन्द्र सोमिनः सुतावन्तो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: brahmāṇastvā vayaṃ yujā somapāmindra sominaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe

translations.griffith: We Soma-bearing Brahmans call thee Soma-drinker with thy friend,  We, Indra, bringing Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो याहि सुतावतो.अस्माकं सुष्टुतीरुप पिबा सु शिप्रिन्नन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yāhi sutāvato.asmākaṃ suṣṭutīrupa pibā su śiprinnandhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Come unto us who bring the juice, come unto this our eulogy,  Fair-visored! drink thou of the juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते सिञ्चामि कुक्ष्योरनु गात्रा वि धावतु गर्भाय जिह्वया मधु |||
verses.transliteration: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoranu ghātrā vi dhāvatu ghṛbhāya jihvayā madhu

translations.griffith: I pour it down within thee, so through all thy members let it spread:  Take with. thy tongue the pleasant drink.

verses.sanskrit: सवादुष टे अस्तु संसुदे मधुमान तन्वे तव सोमः शमस्तु ते हर्दे |||
verses.transliteration: svāduṣ ṭe astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava somaḥ śamastu te hṛde

translations.griffith: Sweet to thy body let it be, delicious be the savoury juice:  Sweet be the Soma to thine heart.

verses.sanskrit: अयमु तवा विचर्षणे जनीरिवाभि संव्र्तः पर सोम इन्द्र सर्पतु |||
verses.transliteration: ayamu tvā vicarṣaṇe janīrivābhi saṃvṛtaḥ pra soma indra sarpatu

translations.griffith: Like women, let this Soma-draught, invested with its robe, approach,  O active Indra, close to thee.

verses.sanskrit: तुविग्रीवो वपोदरः सुबाहुरन्धसो मदे इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते |||
verses.transliteration: tuvighrīvo vapodaraḥ subāhurandhaso made indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate

translations.griffith: Indra, transported with the juice, vast in his bulk, strong in his neck  And stout arms, smites the Vṛtras down.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र परेहि पुरस्त्वं विश्वस्येशान ओजसा वर्त्राणि वर्त्रहञ जहि |||
verses.transliteration: indra prehi purastvaṃ viśvasyeśāna ojasā vṛtrāṇi vṛtrahañ jahi

translations.griffith: O Indra, go thou forward, thou who rulest over all by might:  Thou Vṛtra-slayer slay the fiends,

verses.sanskrit: दीर्घस्ते अस्त्वङकुशो येना वसु परयछसि यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: dīrghaste astvaṅkuśo yenā vasu prayachasi yajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: Long be thy grasping-hook wherewith thou givest ample wealth to him  Who sheds the juice and worships thee.

verses.sanskrit: अयं त इन्द्र सोमो निपूतो अधि बर्हिषि एहीमस्य दरवापिब |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ ta indra somo nipūto adhi barhiṣi ehīmasya dravāpiba

translations.griffith: Here, Indra, is thy Soma-draught, made pure upon the sacred grass:  Run hither, come and drink thereof.

verses.sanskrit: शाचिगो शाचिपूजनायं रणाय ते सुतः आखण्डल पर हूयसे |||
verses.transliteration: śācigho śācipūjanāyaṃ raṇāya te sutaḥ ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase

translations.griffith: Famed for thy radiance, worshipped well this juice is shed for thy delight  Thou art invoked, Akhandala!

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते शर्ङगव्र्षो नपात परणपात कुण्डपाय्यः नयस्मिन दध्र आ मनः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste śṛṅghavṛṣo napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ nyasmin dadhra ā manaḥ

translations.griffith: To Kundapayya, grandson's son, grandson of Srngavrs! to thee,  To him have I addressed my thought.

verses.sanskrit: वास्तोष पते धरुवा सथूणांसत्रं सोम्यानाम दरप्सो भेत्ता पुरां शश्वतीनामिन्द्रो मुनीनां सखा |||
verses.transliteration: vāstoṣ pate dhruvā sthūṇāṃsatraṃ somyānām drapso bhettā purāṃ śaśvatīnāmindro munīnāṃ sakhā

translations.griffith: Strong pillar thou, Lord of the home armour of Soma-offerers:  The drop of Soma breaketh all the strongholds down, and Indra is the Ṛṣis’ Friend.

verses.sanskrit: पर्दाकुसानुर्यजतो गवेषण एकः सन्नभि भूयसः भूर्णिमश्वं नयत तुजा पुरो गर्भेन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: pṛdākusānuryajato ghaveṣaṇa ekaḥ sannabhi bhūyasaḥ bhūrṇimaśvaṃ nayat tujā puro ghṛbhendraṃ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Holy Prdikusanu, winner of the spoil, one eminent o’er many men,  Lead on the wild horse Indra with his vigorous grasp forward to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ह नूनमेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः आदित्यानामपूर्व्यं सवीमनि |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ ha nūnameṣāṃ sumnaṃ bhikṣeta martyaḥ ādityānāmapūrvyaṃ savīmani

translations.griffith: Now let the mortal offer prayer to win the unexampled grace  Of these Ādityas and their aid to cherish life.

verses.sanskrit: अनर्वाणो हयेषां पन्था आदित्यानाम अदब्धाः सन्ति पायवः सुगेव्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: anarvāṇo hyeṣāṃ panthā ādityānām adabdhāḥ santi pāyavaḥ sughevṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: For not an enemy molests the paths which these Ādityas tread:  Infallible guards, they strengthen us in happiness.

verses.sanskrit: तत सु नः सविता भगो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा शर्म यछन्तु सप्रथो यदीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tat su naḥ savitā bhagho varuṇo mitro aryamā śarma yachantu sapratho yadīmahe

translations.griffith: Now soon may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman  Give us the shelter widely spread which we implore.

verses.sanskrit: देवेभिर्देव्यदिते.अरिष्टभर्मन्ना गहि समत सूरिभिः पुरुप्रिये सुशर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: devebhirdevyadite.ariṣṭabharmannā ghahi smat sūribhiḥ purupriye suśarmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: With Gods come thou whose fostering care none checks, O Goddesss Aditi:  Come, dear to many, with the Lords who guard us well.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि पुत्रासो अदितेर्विदुर्द्वेषांसि योतवे अंहोश्चिदुरुचक्रयो.अनेहसः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi putrāso aditervidurdveṣāṃsi yotave aṃhościdurucakrayo.anehasaḥ

translations.griffith: For well these Sons of Aditi know to keep enmities aloof,  Unrivalled, giving ample room, they save from woe.

verses.sanskrit: अदितिर्नो दिवा पशुमदितिर्नक्तमद्वयाः अदितिः पात्वंहसः सदाव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: aditirno divā paśumaditirnaktamadvayāḥ aditiḥ pātvaṃhasaḥ sadāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: Aditi guard our herd by day, Aditi, free from guile, by night,  Aditi, ever strengthening, save us from grief!

verses.sanskrit: उत सया नो दिवा मतिरदितिरूत्या गमत सा शन्ताति मयस करदप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā no divā matiraditirūtyā ghamat sā śantāti mayas karadapa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: And in the day our hymn is this: May Aditi come nigh to help,  With loving-kindness bring us weal and chase our foes.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया दैव्या भिषजा शं नः करतो अश्विना युयुयातामितो रपो अप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā daivyā bhiṣajā śaṃ naḥ karato aśvinā yuyuyātāmito rapo apa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: And may the Aśvins, the divine Pair of Physicians, send us health:  May they remove iniquity and chase our foes.

verses.sanskrit: शमग्निरग्निभिः करच्छं नस्तपतु सूर्यः शं वातो वात्वरपा अप सरिधः |||
verses.transliteration: śamaghniraghnibhiḥ karacchaṃ nastapatu sūryaḥ śaṃ vāto vātvarapā apa sridhaḥ

translations.griffith: May Agni bless us with his fires, and Sūrya warm us pleasantly:  May the pure Wind breathe sweet on us, and chase our foes.

verses.sanskrit: अपामीवामप सरिधमप सेधत दुर्मतिम आदित्यासो युयोतना नो अंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: apāmīvāmapa sridhamapa sedhata durmatim ādityāso yuyotanā no aṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Drive ye disease and strife away, drive ye away malignity:  Ādityas, keep us ever far from sore distress.

verses.sanskrit: युयोता शरुमस्मदानादित्यास उतामतिम रधग दवेषःक्र्णुत विश्ववेदसः |||
verses.transliteration: yuyotā śarumasmadānādityāsa utāmatim ṛdhagh dveṣaḥkṛṇuta viśvavedasaḥ

translations.griffith: Remove from us the arrow, keep famine, Ādityas! far away:  Keep enmities afar from us, Lords of all wealth!

verses.sanskrit: तत सु नः शर्म यछतादित्या यन मुमोचति एनस्वन्तं चिदेनसः सुदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: tat su naḥ śarma yachatādityā yan mumocati enasvantaṃ cidenasaḥ sudānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Now, O Ādityas, grant to us the shelter that lets man go free,  Yea, even the sinner from his sin, ye Bounteous Gods 1

verses.sanskrit: यो नः कश्चिद रिरिक्षति रक्षस्त्वेन मर्त्यः सवैः षेवै रिरिषीष्ट युर्जनः |||
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ kaścid ririkṣati rakṣastvena martyaḥ svaiḥ ṣaevai ririṣīṣṭa yurjanaḥ

translations.griffith: Whatever mortal with the powe r of demons fain would injure us,  May he, impetuous, suffer harm by his own deeds.

verses.sanskrit: समित तमघमश्नवद दुःशंसं मर्त्यं रिपुम यो अस्मत्रा दुर्हणावानुप दवयुः |||
verses.transliteration: samit tamaghamaśnavad duḥśaṃsaṃ martyaṃ ripum yo asmatrā durhaṇāvānupa dvayuḥ

translations.griffith: May sin o’ertake our human foe, the man who speaketh evil thing,  Him who would cause our misery, whose heart is false.

verses.sanskrit: पाकत्रा सथन देवा हर्त्सु जानीथ मर्त्यम उप दवयुं चाद्वयुं च वसवः |||
verses.transliteration: pākatrā sthana devā hṛtsu jānītha martyam upa dvayuṃ cādvayuṃ ca vasavaḥ

translations.griffith: Gods, ye are with the simple ones, ye know each mortal in your hearts;  Ye, Vasus, well discriminate the false and true.

verses.sanskrit: आ शर्म पर्वतानामोतापां वर्णीमहे दयावाक्षामारे अस्मद रपस कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ā śarma parvatānāmotāpāṃ vṛṇīmahe dyāvākṣāmāre asmad rapas kṛtam

translations.griffith: Fain would we have the sheltering aid of mountains and of water-floods:  Keep far from us iniquity, O Heaven and Earth.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो भद्रेण शर्मणा युष्माकं नावा वसवः अति विश्वानि दुरिता पिपर्तन |||
verses.transliteration: te no bhadreṇa śarmaṇā yuṣmākaṃ nāvā vasavaḥ ati viśvāni duritā pipartana

translations.griffith: So with auspicious sheltering aid do ye, O Vasus, carry us  Beyond all trouble and distress, borne in your ship.

verses.sanskrit: तुचे तनाय तत सु नो दराघीय आयुर्जीवसे आदित्यासःसुमहसः कर्णोतन |||
verses.transliteration: tuce tanāya tat su no drāghīya āyurjīvase ādityāsaḥsumahasaḥ kṛṇotana

translations.griffith: Ādityas, ye Most Mighty Ones, grant to our children and their seed  Extended term of life that they may live long days.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञो हीळो वो अन्तर आदित्या अस्ति मर्ळत युष्मे इद वो अपि षमसि सजात्ये |||
verses.transliteration: yajño hīḷo vo antara ādityā asti mṛḷata yuṣme id vo api ṣmasi sajātye

translations.griffith: Sacrifice, O Ādityas, is your inward monitor: be kind,  For in the bond of kindred we are bound to you.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद वरूथं मरुतां देवं तरातारमश्विना मित्रमीमहे वरुणं सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhad varūthaṃ marutāṃ devaṃ trātāramaśvinā mitramīmahe varuṇaṃ svastaye

translations.griffith: The Maruts’ high protecting aid, the Aśvins, and the God who saves,  Mitra and Varuṇa for weal we supplicate.

verses.sanskrit: अनेहो मित्रार्यमन नर्वद वरुण शंस्यम तरिवरूथं मरुतो यन्त नश्छर्दिः |||
verses.transliteration: aneho mitrāryaman nṛvad varuṇa śaṃsyam trivarūthaṃ maruto yanta naśchardiḥ

translations.griffith: Grant us a home with triple guard, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa!  Unthreatened, Maruts! meet for praise, and filled with men.

verses.sanskrit: ये चिद धि मर्त्युबन्धव आदित्या मनवः समसि पर सू नायुर्जीवसे तिरेतन |||
verses.transliteration: ye cid dhi mṛtyubandhava ādityā manavaḥ smasi pra sū naāyurjīvase tiretana

translations.griffith: And as we human beings, O Ādityas, are akin to death,  Graciously lengthen ye our lives that we may live.

verses.sanskrit: तं गूर्धया सवर्णरं देवासो देवमरतिं दधन्विरे देवत्रा हव्यमोहिरे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ ghūrdhayā svarṇaraṃ devāso devamaratiṃ dadhanvire devatrā havyamohire

translations.griffith: SING praise to hiin, the Lord of Light. The Gods have made the God to be their messenger,  And sent oblation to Gods.

verses.sanskrit: विभूतरातिं विप्र चित्रशोचिषमग्निमीळिष्व यन्तुरम अस्य मेधस्य सोम्यस्य सोभरे परेमध्वराय पूर्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vibhūtarātiṃ vipra citraśociṣamaghnimīḷiṣva yanturam asya medhasya somyasya sobhare premadhvarāya pūrvyam

translations.griffith: Agni, the Bounteous Giver, bright with varied flames, laud thou, O singer Sobhari-  Him who controls this sacred food with Soma blent, who hath first claim to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यजिष्ठं तवा वव्र्महे देवं देवत्रा होतारममर्त्यम अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम |||
verses.transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā vavṛmahe devaṃ devatrā hotāramamartyam asya yajñasya sukratum

translations.griffith: Thee have we chosen skilftillest in sacrifice, Immortal Priest among the Gods,  Wise finisher of this holy rite:

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपातं सुभगं सुदीदितिमग्निं शरेष्ठशोचिषम स नो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य सो अपामा सुम्नं यक्षते दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napātaṃ subhaghaṃ sudīditimaghniṃ śreṣṭhaśociṣam sa no mitrasya varuṇasya so apāmā sumnaṃ yakṣate divi

translations.griffith: The Son of Strength, the blessed, brightly shining One, Agni whose light is excellent.  May be by sacrifice win us in heaven the grace of Mitra, Varuṇa, and the Floods.

verses.sanskrit: यः समिधा य आहुती यो वेदेन ददाश मर्तो अग्नये यो नमसा सवध्वरः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ samidhā ya āhutī yo vedena dadāśa marto aghnaye yo namasā svadhvaraḥ

translations.griffith: The mortal who hath ministered to Agni with oblation, fuel, ritual lore,  And reverence, skilled in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तस्येदर्वन्तो रंहयन्त आशवस्तस्य दयुम्नितमं यशः न तमंहो देवक्र्तं कुतश्चन न मर्त्यक्र्तं नशत |||
verses.transliteration: tasyedarvanto raṃhayanta āśavastasya dyumnitamaṃ yaśaḥ na tamaṃho devakṛtaṃ kutaścana na martyakṛtaṃ naśat

translations.griffith: Verily swift to run are his fleet-footed steeds, and most resplendent fame is his.  No trouble caused by Gods or wrought by mortal man from any side o’ertaketh him.

verses.sanskrit: सवग्नयो वो अग्निभिः सयाम सूनो सहस ऊर्जां पते सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः |||
verses.transliteration: svaghnayo vo aghnibhiḥ syāma sūno sahasa ūrjāṃ pate suvīrastvamasmayuḥ

translations.griffith: May we by thine own fires be well supplied with fire, O Son of Strength, O Lord of Might:  Thou as our Friend hast worthy men.

verses.sanskrit: परशंसमानो अतिथिर्न मित्रियो.अग्नी रथो न वेद्यः तवे कषेमासो अपि सन्ति साधवस्त्वं राजा रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: praśaṃsamāno atithirna mitriyo.aghnī ratho na vedyaḥ tve kṣemāso api santi sādhavastvaṃ rājā rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Agni, who praises like a guest of friendly mind, is as a car that brings us gear.  Also in thee is found perfect security thou art the Sovran Lord of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: सो अद्धा दाश्वध्वरो.अग्ने मर्तः सुभग स परशंस्यः स धीभिरस्तु सनिता |||
verses.transliteration: so addhā dāśvadhvaro.aghne martaḥ subhagha sa praśaṃsyaḥ sa dhībhirastu sanitā

translations.griffith: That man, moreover, merits praise who brings, auspicious Agni, sacrificial gifts  May he win riches by his thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तवमूर्ध्वो अध्वराय तिष्ठसि कषयद्वीरः स साधते सो अर्वद्भिः सनिता स विपन्युभिः स शूरैः सनिता कर्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tvamūrdhvo adhvarāya tiṣṭhasi kṣayadvīraḥ sa sādhate so arvadbhiḥ sanitā sa vipanyubhiḥ sa śūraiḥ sanitā kṛtam

translations.griffith: He for whose sacrifice thou standest up erect is prosperous and rules o’er men.  He wins with coursers and with singers killed in song: with heroes he obtains the prize.

verses.sanskrit: यस्याग्निर्वपुर्ग्र्हे सतोमं चनो दधीत विश्ववार्यः हव्या वा वेविषद विषः |||
verses.transliteration: yasyāghnirvapurghṛhe stomaṃ cano dadhīta viśvavāryaḥ havyā vā veviṣad viṣaḥ

translations.griffith: He in whose dwelling Agni is chief ornament, and, all-desired, loves his laud well,  And zealously tends his offerings-

verses.sanskrit: विप्रस्य वा सतुवतः सहसो यहो मक्षूतमस्य रातिषु अवोदेवमुपरिमर्त्यं कर्धि वसो विविदुषो वचः |||
verses.transliteration: viprasya vā stuvataḥ sahaso yaho makṣūtamasya rātiṣu avodevamuparimartyaṃ kṛdhi vaso vividuṣo vacaḥ

translations.griffith: His, or the lauding sage's word, his, Son of Strength! who Is most prompt with sacred gifts,  Set thou beneath the Gods, Vasu, above mankind, the speech of the intelligent.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निं हव्यदातिभिर्नमोभिर्वा सुदक्षमाविवासति गिरा वाजिरशोचिषम |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniṃ havyadātibhirnamobhirvā sudakṣamāvivāsati ghirā vājiraśociṣam

translations.griffith: He who with sacrificial gifts or homage bringeth very skilful Agni nigh,  Or him who flashes fast with song,

verses.sanskrit: समिधा यो निशिती दाशददितिं धामभिरस्य मर्त्यः विश्वेत स धीभिः सुभगो जनानति दयुम्नैरुद्न इव तारिषत |||
verses.transliteration: samidhā yo niśitī dāśadaditiṃ dhāmabhirasya martyaḥ viśvet sa dhībhiḥ subhagho janānati dyumnairudna iva tāriṣat

translations.griffith: The mortal who with blazing fuel, as his laws command, adores the Perfect God,  Blest with his thoughts in splendour shall exceed all men, as though he overpassed the floods.

verses.sanskrit: तदग्ने दयुम्नमा भर यत सासहत सदने कं चिदत्रिणम मन्युं जनस्य दूढ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tadaghne dyumnamā bhara yat sāsahat sadane kaṃ cidatriṇam manyuṃ janasya dūḍhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Give us the splendour, Agni, which may overcome each greedy fiend in our abode,  The wrath of evil-hearted folk.

verses.sanskrit: येन चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा येन नासत्या भगः वयं तत ते शवसा गातुवित्तमा इन्द्रत्वोता विधेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: yena caṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamā yena nāsatyā bhaghaḥ vayaṃ tat te śavasā ghātuvittamā indratvotā vidhemahi

translations.griffith: That, wherewith Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, the Aśvins, Bhaga give us light,  That may we, by thy power finding best furtherance, worship, O Indra, helped by thee.

verses.sanskrit: ते घेदग्ने सवाध्यो ये तवा विप्र निदधिरे नर्चक्षसम विप्रासो देव सुक्रतुम |||
verses.transliteration: te ghedaghne svādhyo ye tvā vipra nidadhire nṛcakṣasam viprāso deva sukratum

translations.griffith: O Agni, most devout are they, the sages who have set thee Sage exceeding wise,  O God, for men to look upon:

verses.sanskrit: त इद वेदिं सुभग त आहुतिं ते सोतुं चक्रिरे दिवि तैद वाजेभिर्जिग्युर्महद धनं ये तवे कामं नयेरिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ta id vediṃ subhagha ta āhutiṃ te sotuṃ cakrire divi taid vājebhirjighyurmahad dhanaṃ ye tve kāmaṃ nyerire

translations.griffith: Who have arranged thine altar Blessed God, at morn brought thine oblation, pressed the juice.  They by their deeds of strength have won diem, mighty wealth, who have set all their hope in thee.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रो नो अग्निराहुतो भद्रा रातिः सुभग भद्रो अध्वरः भद्रा उत परशस्तयः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadro no aghnirāhuto bhadrā rātiḥ subhagha bhadro adhvaraḥ bhadrā uta praśastayaḥ

translations.griffith: -May Agni worshipped bring us bliss, may the gift, Blessed One, and sacrifice bring bliss;  Yea, may our praises bring us bliss.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये येना समत्सु सासहः अव सथिरा तनुहि भूरि शर्धतां वनेमा ते अभिष्टिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye yenā samatsu sāsahaḥ ava sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatāṃ vanemā te abhiṣṭibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Show forth the mind that brings success in war with fiends, wherewith thou conquerest in fight.  Bring down the many firm hopes of our enemies, and let us vanquish with thine aid.

verses.sanskrit: ईळे गिरा मनुर्हितं यं देवा दूतमरतिं नयेरिरे यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहनम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷe ghirā manurhitaṃ yaṃ devā dūtamaratiṃ nyerire yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhanam

translations.griffith: I praise with song the Friend of man, whom Gods sent down to be herald and messenger,  Best worshipper, bearer of our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तिग्मजम्भाय तरुणाय राजते परयो गायस्यग्नये यः पिंशते सून्र्ताभिः सुवीर्यमग्निर्घ्र्तेभिराहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: tighmajambhāya taruṇāya rājate prayo ghāyasyaghnaye yaḥ piṃśate sūnṛtābhiḥ suvīryamaghnirghṛtebhirāhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou unto sharp-toothed Agni, Young and Radiant God, proclaimest with thy song the feast-  Agni, who for our sweet strains moulds heroic strength when sacred oil is offered him,

verses.sanskrit: यदी घर्तेभिराहुतो वाशीमग्निर्भरत उच्चाव च असुर इव निर्णिजम |||
verses.transliteration: yadī ghṛtebhirāhuto vāśīmaghnirbharata uccāva ca asura iva nirṇijam

translations.griffith: While, served with sacrificial oil, now upward and now downward Agni moves his sword,  As doth the Asura his robe.

verses.sanskrit: यो हव्यान्यैरयता मनुर्हितो देव आसा सुगन्धिना विवासते वार्याणि सवध्वरो होता देवो अमर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yo havyānyairayatā manurhito deva āsā sughandhinā vivāsate vāryāṇi svadhvaro hotā devo amartyaḥ

translations.griffith: The God, the Friend of man, who bears our gifts to heaven, the God with his sweet-smelling mouth,  Distributes, skilled in sacrifice, his precious things, Invoking Priest, Immortal God.

verses.sanskrit: यदग्ने मर्त्यस्त्वं सयामहं मित्रमहो अमर्त्यः सहसः सूनवाहुत |||
verses.transliteration: yadaghne martyastvaṃ syāmahaṃ mitramaho amartyaḥ sahasaḥ sūnavāhuta

translations.griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, if thou wert the mortal, bright as Mitra, I worshipped with our gifts!  And I were the Immortal God

verses.sanskrit: न तवा रासीयाभिशस्तये वसो न पापत्वाय सन्त्य न मे सतोतामतीवा न दुर्हितः सयादग्ने न पापया |||
verses.transliteration: na tvā rāsīyābhiśastaye vaso na pāpatvāya santya na me stotāmatīvā na durhitaḥ syādaghne na pāpayā

translations.griffith: I would not give thee up, Vasu, to calumny, or misery, O Bounteous One.  My worshipper should feel no hunger or distress, nor, Agni, should he live in sin.

verses.sanskrit: पितुर्न पुत्रः सुभ्र्तो दुरोण आ देवानेतु पर णो हविः ||
verses.transliteration: piturna putraḥ subhṛto duroṇa ā devānetu pra ṇo haviḥ

translations.griffith: Like a son cherished in his father's houi§e, let our oblation rise unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तवाहमग्न ऊतिभिर्नेदिष्ठाभिः सचेय जोषमा वसो सदा देवस्य मर्त्यः |||
