verses.transliteration: tavāhamaghna ūtibhirnediṣṭhābhiḥ saceya joṣamā vaso sadā devasya martyaḥ

translations.griffith: With thine immediate aid may I, excellent Agni, ever gain my wish  A mortal with a God to help.

verses.sanskrit: तव करत्वा सनेयं तव रातिभिरग्ने तव परशस्तिभिः तवामिदाहुः परमतिं वसो ममाग्ने हर्षस्व दातवे |||
verses.transliteration: tava kratvā saneyaṃ tava rātibhiraghne tava praśastibhiḥ tvāmidāhuḥ pramatiṃ vaso mamāghne harṣasva dātave

translations.griffith: O Agni, by thy wisdom, by thy bounties, by thy leading may I gather wealth.  Excellent Agni, thou art called my Providence: delight thou to be liberal.

verses.sanskrit: पर सो अग्ने तवोतिभिः सुवीराभिस्तिरते वाजभर्मभिः यस्य तवं सख्यमावरः |||
verses.transliteration: pra so aghne tavotibhiḥ suvīrābhistirate vājabharmabhiḥ yasya tvaṃ sakhyamāvaraḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, he conquers by thine aid that brings him store of noble heroes and great strength,  Whose bond of friendship is thy choice.

verses.sanskrit: तव दरप्सो नीलवान वाश रत्विय इन्धानः सिष्णवा ददे तवं महीनामुषसामसि परियः कषपो वस्तुषु राजसि |||
verses.transliteration: tava drapso nīlavān vāśa ṛtviya indhānaḥ siṣṇavā dade tvaṃ mahīnāmuṣasāmasi priyaḥ kṣapo vastuṣu rājasi

translations.griffith: Thy spark is black and crackling, kindled in due time, O Bounteous, it is taken up.  Thou art the dear Friend of the mighty Mornings: thou shinest in glimmerings of the night.

verses.sanskrit: तमागन्म सोभरयः सहस्रमुष्कं सवभिष्टिमवसे सम्राजं तरासदस्यवम |||
verses.transliteration: tamāghanma sobharayaḥ sahasramuṣkaṃ svabhiṣṭimavase samrājaṃ trāsadasyavam

translations.griffith: We Sobharis have come to him, for succour, who is good to help with thousand powers,  The Sovran, Trasadasyu's Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते अग्ने अन्ये अग्नय उपक्षितो वया इव विपो न दयुम्ना नि युवे जनानां तव कषत्राणि वर्धयन |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te aghne anye aghnaya upakṣito vayā iva vipo na dyumnā ni yuve janānāṃ tava kṣatrāṇi vardhayan

translations.griffith: O Agni, thou on whom all other fires depend, as branches on the parent stem,  I make the treasures of the folk, like songs, mine own, while I exalt thy sovran might.

verses.sanskrit: यमादित्यासो अद्रुहः पारं नयथ मर्त्यम मघोनां विश्वेषां सुदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: yamādityāso adruhaḥ pāraṃ nayatha martyam maghonāṃ viśveṣāṃ sudānavaḥ

translations.griffith: The mortal whom, Ādityas, ye, Guilelew, lead to the farther bank  Of all the princes, Bounteous Ones

verses.sanskrit: यूयं राजानः कं चिच्चर्षणीसहः कषयन्तं मानुषाननु वयं ते वो वरुण मित्रार्यमन सयामेद रतस्य रथ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ rājānaḥ kaṃ ciccarṣaṇīsahaḥ kṣayantaṃ mānuṣānanu vayaṃ te vo varuṇa mitrāryaman syāmed ṛtasya rathyaḥ

translations.griffith: Whoe’er he be, Man-ruling Kings! the Regent of the race of men-  May we, O Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, like him be furtherers of your law.

verses.sanskrit: अदान मे पौरुकुत्स्यः पञ्चाशतं तरसदस्युर्वधूनाम मंहिष्ठो अर्यः सत्पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: adān me paurukutsyaḥ pañcāśataṃ trasadasyurvadhūnām maṃhiṣṭho aryaḥ satpatiḥ

translations.griffith: A gift of fifty female slaves hath Trasadasyu given me, Purukutsa's son,  Most liberal, kind, lord of the brave.

verses.sanskrit: उत मे परयियोर्वयियोः सुवास्त्वा अधि तुग्वनि तिसॄणांसप्ततीनां शयावः परणेता भुवद वसुर्दियानां पतिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta me prayiyorvayiyoḥ suvāstvā adhi tughvani tisṝṇāṃsaptatīnāṃ śyāvaḥ praṇetā bhuvad vasurdiyānāṃ patiḥ

translations.griffith: And Śyāva too for me led forth a strong steed at Suvastu's ford:  A herd of three times seventy kine, good lord of gifts, he gave to me.

verses.sanskrit: आ गन्ता मा रिषण्यत परस्थावानो माप सथाता समन्यवः सथिरा चिन नमयिष्णवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghantā mā riṣaṇyata prasthāvāno māpa sthātā samanyavaḥ sthirā cin namayiṣṇavaḥ

translations.griffith: LET none, Swift Travellers! check you: come hither, like-spirited, stay not far away,  Ye benders even of what is firm.

verses.sanskrit: वीळुपविभिर्मरुत रभुक्षण आ रुद्रासः सुदीतिभिः इषा नो अद्या गता पुरुस्प्र्हो यज्ञमा सोभरीयवः |||
verses.transliteration: vīḷupavibhirmaruta ṛbhukṣaṇa ā rudrāsaḥ sudītibhiḥ iṣā no adyā ghatā puruspṛho yajñamā sobharīyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Maruts, Ṛbhukṣans, Rudras come ye with your cars strong-fellied and exceeding bright.  Come, ye for whom we long, with food, to sacrifice, come ye with love to Sobbari.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हि रुद्रियाणां शुष्ममुग्रं मरुतां शिमीवताम विष्णोरेषस्य मीळ्हुषाम |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hi rudriyāṇāṃ śuṣmamughraṃ marutāṃ śimīvatām viṣṇoreṣasya mīḷhuṣām

translations.griffith: For well we know the vigorous might of Rudra's Sons, the Martits, who are passing strong,  Swift Viṣṇu's band, who send the rain.,

verses.sanskrit: वि दवीपानि पापतन तिष्ठद दुछुनोभे युजन्त रोदसी पर धन्वान्यैरत शुभ्रखादयो यदेजथ सवभानवः |||
verses.transliteration: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhad duchunobhe yujanta rodasī pra dhanvānyairata śubhrakhādayo yadejatha svabhānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed: the heaven and earth are joined in one.  Decked with bright rings, ye spread the broad expanses out, when ye, Self. luminous, stirred yourselves.

verses.sanskrit: अच्युता चिद वो अज्मन्ना नानदति पर्वतासो वनस्पतिः भूमिर्यामेषु रेजते |||
verses.transliteration: acyutā cid vo ajmannā nānadati parvatāso vanaspatiḥ bhūmiryāmeṣu rejate

translations.griffith: Even things immovable shake and reel, the mountains and the forest trees at your approach,  And the earth trembles as ye come.

verses.sanskrit: अमाय वो मरुतो यातवे दयौर्जिहीत उत्तरा बर्हत यत्रा नरो देदिशते तनूष्वा तवक्षांसि बाह्वोजसः |||
verses.transliteration: amāya vo maruto yātave dyaurjihīta uttarā bṛhat yatrā naro dediśate tanūṣvā tvakṣāṃsi bāhvojasaḥ

translations.griffith: To lend free course, O Maruts, to your furious rush, heaven high and higher still gives way,  Where they, the Heroes mighty with their arms, display their gleaming omaments on their forms.

verses.sanskrit: सवधामनु शरियं नरो महि तवेषा अमवन्तो वर्षप्सवः वहन्ते अह्रुतप्सवः |||
verses.transliteration: svadhāmanu śriyaṃ naro mahi tveṣā amavanto vṛṣapsavaḥ vahante ahrutapsavaḥ

translations.griffith: After their Godlike nature they, the bull. like Heroes, dazzling and impetuous, wear  Great splendour as they show erect.

verses.sanskrit: गोभिर्वाणो अज्यते सोभरीणां रथे कोशे हिरण्यये गोबन्धवः सुजातास इषे भुजे महान्तो नः सपरसे नु |||
verses.transliteration: ghobhirvāṇo ajyate sobharīṇāṃ rathe kośe hiraṇyaye ghobandhavaḥ sujātāsa iṣe bhuje mahānto naḥ sparase nu

translations.griffith: The pivot of the Sobharis' chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk.  May they the Well-born, Mighty, kindred of the Cow, aid us to food and to delight.

verses.sanskrit: परति वो वर्षदञ्जयो वर्ष्णे शर्धाय मारुताय भरध्वम हव्या वर्षप्रयाव्णे |||
verses.transliteration: prati vo vṛṣadañjayo vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam havyā vṛṣaprayāvṇe

translations.griffith: Bring, ye who sprinkle balmy drops. oblations to your vigorous Marut company,  To those whose leader is the Bull.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षणश्वेन मरुतो वर्षप्सुना रथेन वर्षनाभिना आ शयेनासो न पक्षिणो वर्था नरो हव्या नो वीतये गत |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣaṇaśvena maruto vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣanābhinā ā śyenāso na pakṣiṇo vṛthā naro havyā no vītaye ghata

translations.griffith: Come hither, O ye Mares, on your stronghorsed car, solid in look, with solid naves.  Lightly like winged falcons, O ye Heroes, come, come to enjoy our ofrerings.

verses.sanskrit: समानमञ्ज्येषां वि भराजन्ते रुक्मासो अधि बाहुषु दविद्युतत्य रष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: samānamañjyeṣāṃ vi bhrājante rukmāso adhi bāhuṣu davidyutaty ṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Their decoration is the same: their omaments of gold are bright upon their arms;  Their lances glitter splendidly.

verses.sanskrit: त उग्रासो वर्षण उग्रबाहवो नकिष टनूषु येतिरे सथिरा धन्वान्यायुधा रथेषु वो.अनीकेष्वधि शरियः |||
verses.transliteration: ta ughrāso vṛṣaṇa ughrabāhavo nakiṣ ṭanūṣu yetire sthirā dhanvānyāyudhā ratheṣu vo.anīkeṣvadhi śriyaḥ

translations.griffith: They toil not to defend their bodies from attack, strong Heroes with their mighty arms.  Strong are your bows and strong the weapons in your cars, and glory sits on every face.

verses.sanskrit: येषामर्णो न सप्रथो नाम तवेषं शश्वतामेकमिद्भुजे वयो न पित्र्यं सहः |||
verses.transliteration: yeṣāmarṇo na sapratho nāma tveṣaṃ śaśvatāmekamidbhuje vayo na pitryaṃ sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Whose name extendeth like a sea, alone, resplendent, so that all have joy in it,  And life-power like ancestral might.

verses.sanskrit: तान वन्दस्व मरुतस्तानुप सतुहि तेषां हि धुनीनाम अराणां न चरमस्तदेषां दाना मह्ना तदेषाम |||
verses.transliteration: tān vandasva marutastānupa stuhi teṣāṃ hi dhunīnām arāṇāṃ na caramastadeṣāṃ dānā mahnā tadeṣām

translations.griffith: Pay honour to these Maruts and sing praise to them, for of the wheel-spokes of the car  Of these loud roarers none is last: this is their power, this moves them to give mighty gifts.

verses.sanskrit: सुभगः स व ऊतिष्वास पूर्वासु मरुतो वयुष्टिषु योवा नूनमुतासति |||
verses.transliteration: subhaghaḥ sa va ūtiṣvāsa pūrvāsu maruto vyuṣṭiṣu yovā nūnamutāsati

translations.griffith: Blest by your favouring help was he, O Maruts, at the earlier flushings of the morn,  And even now shall he be blest.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य वा यूयं परति वाजिनो नर आ हव्या वीतये गथ अभि ष दयुम्नैरुत वाजसातिभिः सुम्ना वो धूतयो नशत |||
verses.transliteration: yasya vā yūyaṃ prati vājino nara ā havyā vītaye ghatha abhi ṣa dyumnairuta vājasātibhiḥ sumnā vo dhūtayo naśat

translations.griffith: The strong man to whose sacrifice, O Heroes, ye approach that ye may taste thereof,  With glories and with war that winneth spoil shall gain great bliss, ye Shakers of the world.

verses.sanskrit: यथा रुद्रस्य सूनवो दिवो वशन्त्यसुरस्य वेधसः युवानस्तथेदसत |||
verses.transliteration: yathā rudrasya sūnavo divo vaśantyasurasya vedhasaḥ yuvānastathedasat

translations.griffith: Even as Rudra's Sons, the brood of the Creator Dyaus, the Asura, desire,  O Youthful Ones, so shall it be:

verses.sanskrit: ये चार्हन्ति मरुतः सुदानवः समन मीळ्हुषश्चरन्ति ये अतश्चिदा न उप वस्यसा हर्दा युवान आ वव्र्ध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: ye cārhanti marutaḥ sudānavaḥ sman mīḷhuṣaścaranti ye ataścidā na upa vasyasā hṛdā yuvāna ā vavṛdhvam

translations.griffith: And these the bounteous, worthy of the Maruts who move onward pouring down the rain-  Even for their sake, O Youthful Ones, with kindest heart take us to you to be your own.

verses.sanskrit: यून ऊ षु नविष्ठया वर्ष्णः पावकानभि सोभरे गिरा गाय गा इव चर्क्र्षत |||
verses.transliteration: yūna ū ṣu naviṣṭhayā vṛṣṇaḥ pāvakānabhi sobhare ghirā ghāya ghā iva carkṛṣat

translations.griffith: O Sobhari, with newest song sing out unto the youthful purifying Bulls,  Even as a plougher to his steers.

verses.sanskrit: साहा ये सन्ति मुष्टिहेव हव्यो विश्वासु पर्त्सु होत्र्षु वर्ष्णश्चन्द्रान न सुश्रवस्तमान गिरा वन्दस्व मरुतो अह |||
verses.transliteration: sāhā ye santi muṣṭiheva havyo viśvāsu pṛtsu hotṛṣu vṛṣṇaścandrān na suśravastamān ghirā vandasva maruto aha

translations.griffith: Who, like a celebrated boxer, overcome the challengers in every fight:  They who, like shining bulls, are most illustrious-honour those Maruts with thy song.

verses.sanskrit: गावश्चिद घा समन्यवः सजात्येन मरुतः सबन्धवः रिहते ककुभो मिथः |||
verses.transliteration: ghāvaścid ghā samanyavaḥ sajātyena marutaḥ sabandhavaḥ rihate kakubho mithaḥ

translations.griffith: Allied by common ancestry, ye Maruts, even the Cows, alike in energy,  Lick, all by turns, each other's head.

verses.sanskrit: मर्तश्चिद वो नर्तवो रुक्मवक्षस उप भरात्र्त्वमायति अधिनो गात मरुतः सदा हि व आपित्वमस्ति निध्रुवि |||
verses.transliteration: martaścid vo nṛtavo rukmavakṣasa upa bhrātṛtvamāyati adhino ghāta marutaḥ sadā hi va āpitvamasti nidhruvi

translations.griffith: Even mortal man, ye Dancers breast adorned with gold, attains to brotherhood with you.  Mark ye and notice us, O Maruts; evermore your friendship is secured to us.

verses.sanskrit: मरुतो मारुतस्य न आ भेषजस्य वहता सुदानवः यूयंसखायः सप्तयः |||
verses.transliteration: maruto mārutasya na ā bheṣajasya vahatā sudānavaḥ yūyaṃsakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, rich in noble gifts, bring us a portion of the Maruts’ medicine,  Ye Coursers who are Friends to us.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः सिन्धुमवथ याभिस्तूर्वथ याभिर्दशस्यथाक्रिविम मयो नो भूतोतिभिर्मयोभुवः शिवाभिरसचद्विषः |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ sindhumavatha yābhistūrvatha yābhirdaśasyathākrivim mayo no bhūtotibhirmayobhuvaḥ śivābhirasacadviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: Haters of those who serve you not, bliss-bringers, bring us bliss with those auspicious aids  Wherewith ye are victorious and guard Sindhu well, and succour Krvi in his need.

verses.sanskrit: यत सिन्धौ यदसिक्न्यां यत समुद्रेषु मरुतः सुबर्हिषः यत पर्वतेषु भेषजम |||
verses.transliteration: yat sindhau yadasiknyāṃ yat samudreṣu marutaḥ subarhiṣaḥ yat parvateṣu bheṣajam

translations.griffith: Maruts, who rest on fair trimmed grass, what balm soever Sindhu or Asikni hath,  Or mountains or the seas contain.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वं पश्यन्तो बिभ्र्था तनूष्वा तेना नो अधि वोचत कषमा रपो मरुत आतुरस्य न इष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvaṃ paśyanto bibhṛthā tanūṣvā tenā no adhi vocata kṣamā rapo maruta āturasya na iṣkartā vihrutaṃ punaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye carry on your bodies, ye who see it all: so bless us graciously therewith.  Cast, Maruts, to the ground our sick man's malady: replace the dislocated limb.

verses.sanskrit: वयमु तवामपूर्व्य सथूरं न कच्चिद भरन्तो.अवस्यवः वाजे चित्रं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: vayamu tvāmapūrvya sthūraṃ na kaccid bharanto.avasyavaḥ vāje citraṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: WE call on thee, O Matchless One! We seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves,  Call on thee wonderful in fight

verses.sanskrit: उप तवा कर्मन्नूतये स नो युवोग्रश्चक्राम यो धर्षत तवामिद धयवितारं वव्र्महे सखाय इन्द्र सानसिम |||
verses.transliteration: upa tvā karmannūtaye sa no yuvoghraścakrāma yo dhṛṣat tvāmid dhyavitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim

translations.griffith: On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gonse forth.  We therefore, we thy friends, Indra, havie chosen thee, free-giver, as our Guardian God.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहीम इन्दवो.अश्वपते गोपत उर्वरापते सोमं सोमपते पिब |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhīma indavo.aśvapate ghopata urvarāpate somaṃ somapate piba

translations.griffith: Come hither, for the drops are here, O Lord of corn-lands. Lord of horses, Lord of kine:  Drink thou the Soma, Soma's Lord!

verses.sanskrit: वयं हि तवा बन्धुमन्तमबन्धवो विप्रास इन्द्र येमिम या ते धामानि वर्षभ तेभिरा गहि विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ hi tvā bandhumantamabandhavo viprāsa indra yemima yā te dhāmāni vṛṣabha tebhirā ghahi viśvebhiḥ somapītaye

translations.griffith: For we the kinless singers have drawn hither thee, O Indra, who hast numerous kin.  With all the forms thou hast, comic thou of bull-like strength, come near to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: सीदन्तस्ते वयो यथा गोश्रीते मधौ मदिरे विवक्षणे अभि तवामिन्द्र नोनुमः |||
verses.transliteration: sīdantaste vayo yathā ghośrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe abhi tvāmindra nonumaḥ

translations.griffith: Sitting like birds beside thy meath., mingled with milk, that gladdeneth and exalteth thee,  Indra, to thee we sing aloud.

verses.sanskrit: अछा च तवैना नमसा वदामसि किं मुहुश्चिद वि दीधयः सन्ति कामासो हरिवो ददिष टवं समो वयं सन्ति नो धियः |||
verses.transliteration: achā ca tvainā namasā vadāmasi kiṃ muhuścid vi dīdhayaḥ santi kāmāso harivo dadiṣ ṭvaṃ smo vayaṃ santi no dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: We speak to thee with this our reverential prayer. Why art thou pondering yet awhile?  Here are our wishes; thou art liberal, Lord of Bays: we and our hymns are present here.

verses.sanskrit: नूत्ना इदिन्द्र ते वयमूती अभूम नहि नू ते अद्रिवः विद्मा पुरा परीणसः |||
verses.transliteration: nūtnā idindra te vayamūtī abhūma nahi nū te adrivaḥ vidmā purā parīṇasaḥ

translations.griffith: For not in recent times alone, O Indra, Thunder-armed, have we obtained thine aid.  Of old we knew thy plenteous wealth.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा सखित्वमुत शूर भोज्यमा ते ता वज्रिन्नीमहे उतो समस्मिन्ना शिशीहि नो वसो वाजे सुशिप्र गोमति |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā sakhitvamuta śūra bhojyamā te tā vajrinnīmahe uto samasminnā śiśīhi no vaso vāje suśipra ghomati

translations.griffith: Hero, we knew thy friendship and thy rich rewards: these, Thunderer, now we crave of thee.  O Vasu, for all wealth that cometh of the kine, sharpen our powers, fair-visored God.

verses.sanskrit: यो न इदम-इदं पुरा पर वस्य आनिनाय तमु व सतुषे सखाय इन्द्रमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: yo na idam-idaṃ purā pra vasya ānināya tamu va stuṣe sakhāya indramūtaye

translations.griffith: Him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing, him I magnify for you,  Even Indra, O my friends, for help

verses.sanskrit: हर्यश्वं सत्पतिं चर्षणीसहं स हि षमा यो अमन्दत आ तु नः स वयति गव्यमश्व्यं सतोत्र्भ्यो मघवा शतम |||
verses.transliteration: haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata ā tu naḥ sa vayati ghavyamaśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam

translations.griffith: Borne by Bay Steeds, the Lord of heroes, ruling men, for it is he who takes; delight.  May Maghavan bestow on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.

verses.sanskrit: तवया ह सविद युजा वयं परति शवसन्तं वर्षभ बरुवीमहि संस्थे जनस्य गोमतः |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā ha svid yujā vayaṃ prati śvasantaṃ vṛṣabha bruvīmahi saṃsthe janasya ghomataḥ

translations.griffith: Hero, may we, with thee for Friend, withstand the man who pants against us in his wrath,  In fight with people rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit: जयेम कारे पुरुहूत कारिणो.अभि तिष्ठेम दूढ्यः नर्भिर्व्र्त्रं हन्याम शूशुयाम चावेरिन्द्र पर णो धियः |||
verses.transliteration: jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇo.abhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ nṛbhirvṛtraṃ hanyāma śūśuyāma cāverindra pra ṇo dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: May we be victors in the singer's battlesong, and meet the wicked, Much invoked!  With heroes smite the foeman and show forth our strength. O Indra, further thou our thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्रात्र्व्यो अना तवमनापिरिन्द्र जनुषा सनादसि युधेदापित्वमिछसे |||
verses.transliteration: abhrātṛvyo anā tvamanāpirindra januṣā sanādasi yudhedāpitvamichase

translations.griffith: O Indra, from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou:  Thou seekest comradeship in war.

verses.sanskrit: नकी रेवन्तं सख्याय विन्दसे पीयन्ति ते सुराश्वः यदा कर्णोषि नदनुं समूहस्यादित पितेव हूयसे |||
verses.transliteration: nakī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṃ samūhasyādit piteva hūyase

translations.griffith: Thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend: those scorn thee who are flown with wine.  What time thou thunderest and gatherest, then thou, even as a Father, art invoked.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते अमाजुरो यथा मूरास इन्द्र सख्ये तवावतः नि षदाम सचा सुते |||
verses.transliteration: mā te amājuro yathā mūrāsa indra sakhye tvāvataḥ ni ṣadāma sacā sute

translations.griffith: O Indra, let us not, like fools who waste their lives at home, with friendship such as thine  Sit idly by the poured-out juice.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते गोदत्र निरराम राधस इन्द्र मा ते गर्हामहि दर्ळ्हा चिदर्यः पर मर्शाभ्या भर न ते दामान आदभे |||
verses.transliteration: mā te ghodatra nirarāma rādhasa indra mā te ghṛhāmahi dṛḷhā cidaryaḥ pra mṛśābhyā bhara na te dāmāna ādabhe

translations.griffith: Giver of kine, may we not miss thy gracious gifts: let us not rob thee of thine own.  Strip even the strong places of the foe, and bring: thy gifts can never be made vain.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो वा घेदियन मघं सरस्वती वा सुभगा ददिर्वसु तवं वा चित्र दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: indro vā ghediyan maghaṃ sarasvatī vā subhaghā dadirvasu tvaṃ vā citra dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Indra or blest Sarasvatī alone bestows such wealth, treasure so great, or thou,  O Citra, on the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: चित्र इद राजा राजका इदन्यके यके सरस्वतीमनु पर्जन्य इव ततनद धि वर्ष्ट्या सहस्रमयुता ददत |||
verses.transliteration: citra id rājā rājakā idanyake yake sarasvatīmanu parjanya iva tatanad dhi vṛṣṭyā sahasramayutā dadat

translations.griffith: Citra is King, and only kinglings are the rest who dwell beside Sarasvatī.  He, like Parjanya with his rain, hath spread himself with thousand, yea, with myriad gifts.

verses.sanskrit: ओ तयमह्व आ रथमद्या दंसिष्ठमूतये यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी आ सूर्यायै तस्थथुः |||
verses.transliteration: o tyamahva ā rathamadyā daṃsiṣṭhamūtaye yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ

translations.griffith: HITHERWARD have I called to-day, for succour, that most wondrous car  Which ye ascended, Aśvins, ye whose paths are red, swift to give Car, for Sūrya's sake.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वायुषं सुहवं पुरुस्प्र्हं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम सचनावन्तं सुमतिभिः सोभरे विद्वेषसमनेहसम |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvāyuṣaṃ suhavaṃ puruspṛhaṃ bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrvyam sacanāvantaṃ sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasamanehasam

translations.griffith: Car ever young, much longed-for, easily invoked, soon guided, first in deeds of might,  Which waits and serves, O Sobhari, with benevolence, without a rival or a foe.

verses.sanskrit: इह तया पुरुभूतमा देवा नमोभिरश्विना अर्वाचीना सववसे करामहे गन्तारा दशुषो गर्हम |||
verses.transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā devā namobhiraśvinā arvācīnā svavase karāmahe ghantārā daśuṣo ghṛham

translations.griffith: These Aśvins with our homage, these Two Omnipresent Deities  Hitherward will we bring for kind help, these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: युवो रथस्य परि चक्रमीयत ईर्मान्यद वामिषण्यति अस्मानछा सुमतिर्वां शुभस पती आ धेनुरिव धावतु |||
verses.transliteration: yuvo rathasya pari cakramīyata īrmānyad vāmiṣaṇyati asmānachā sumatirvāṃ śubhas patī ā dhenuriva dhāvatu

translations.griffith: One of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round, one speeds for you its onward course.  Like a milch-cow, O Lords of splendour, and with haste let your benevolence come to us.

verses.sanskrit: रथो यो वां तरिवन्धुरो हिरण्यभीशुरश्विना परि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूषति शरुतस्तेन नासत्या गतम |||
verses.transliteration: ratho yo vāṃ trivandhuro hiraṇyabhīśuraśvinā pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutastena nāsatyā ghatam

translations.griffith: That chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold,  The famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth, thereon Nāsatyas, Aśvins, come.

verses.sanskrit: दशस्यन्ता मनवे पूर्व्यं दिवि यवं वर्केण कर्षथः ता वामद्य सुमतिभिः शुभस पती अश्विना पर सतुवीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: daśasyantā manave pūrvyaṃ divi yavaṃ vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ tā vāmadya sumatibhiḥ śubhas patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi

translations.griffith: Ye with your plough, when favouring Manu with your help, ploughed the first harvest in the sky.  As such will we exalt you, Lords of splendour, now, O Aśvins, with our prayer and praise.

verses.sanskrit: उप नो वजिनीवसू यातं रतस्य पथिभिः येभिस्त्र्क्षिं वर्षणा तरसदस्यवं महे कषत्राय जिन्वथः |||
verses.transliteration: upa no vajinīvasū yātaṃ ṛtasya pathibhiḥ yebhistṛkṣiṃ vṛṣaṇā trasadasyavaṃ mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ

translations.griffith: Come to us, Lords of ample wealth, by paths of everlasting Law,  Whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised Trksi, Trasadasyu's son.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वामद्रिभिः सुतः सोमो नर वर्षण्वसु आ यातं सोमपीतये पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāmadribhiḥ sutaḥ somo nara vṛṣaṇvasu ā yātaṃ somapītaye pibataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhe

translations.griffith: This Soma pressed with stones is yours, ye Heroes, Lords of plenteous wealth.  Approach to drink the Soma, come, drink in the worshipper's abode.

verses.sanskrit: आ हि रुहतमश्विना रथे कोशे हिरण्यये वर्षण्वसू युञ्जाथां पीवरीरिषः |||
verses.transliteration: ā hi ruhatamaśvinā rathe kośe hiraṇyaye vṛṣaṇvasū yuñjāthāṃ pīvarīriṣaḥ

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, mount the chariot, mount the golden seat, ye who are Lords of plenteous wealth,  And bring to us abundant food.

verses.sanskrit: याभिः पक्थमवथो याभिरध्रिगुं याभिर्बभ्रुं विजोषसम ताभिर्नो मक्षू तूयमश्विना गतं भिषज्यतंयदातुरम |||
verses.transliteration: yābhiḥ pakthamavatho yābhiradhrighuṃ yābhirbabhruṃ vijoṣasam tābhirno makṣū tūyamaśvinā ghataṃ bhiṣajyataṃyadāturam

translations.griffith: The aids wherewith ye helped Paktha and Adhrigt;, and Babhru severed from his friends,—  With those, O Aśvins, come hither with speed and soon, and heal whatever is diseased.

verses.sanskrit: यदध्रिगावो अध्रिगू इदा चिदह्नो अश्विना हवामहे वयं गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: yadadhrighāvo adhrighū idā cidahno aśvinā havāmahe vayaṃ ghīrbhirvipanyavaḥ

translations.griffith: When we continually invoke the Aśvins, the resistless, at this time of day,  We lovers of the song, with songs.

verses.sanskrit: ताभिरा यातं वर्षणोप मे हवं विश्वप्सुं विश्ववार्यम इषा मंहिष्ठा पुरुभूतमा नरा याभिः करिविं वव्र्धुस्ताभिरा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: tābhirā yātaṃ vṛṣaṇopa me havaṃ viśvapsuṃ viśvavāryam iṣā maṃhiṣṭhā purubhūtamā narā yābhiḥ kriviṃ vavṛdhustābhirā ghatam

translations.griffith: Through these, ye Mighty Ones, come hither to my call which brings all blessings, wears all forms,—  Tlirough which, All-present Heroes, lavishest of food ye strengthened Krvi, come through these.

verses.sanskrit: ताविदा चिदहानां तावश्विना वन्दमान उप बरुवे ता उ नमोभिरीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tāvidā cidahānāṃ tāvaśvinā vandamāna upa bruve tā u namobhirīmahe

translations.griffith: I speak to both of these as such, these Aśvins whom I reverence at this time of day:  With homage we entreat them both.

verses.sanskrit: ताविद दोषा ता उषसि शुभस पती ता यामन रुद्रवर्तनी मा नो मर्ताय रिपवे वाजिनीवसू परो रुद्रावति खयतम |||
verses.transliteration: tāvid doṣā tā uṣasi śubhas patī tā yāman rudravartanī mā no martāya ripave vājinīvasū paro rudrāvati khyatam

translations.griffith: Ye who are Lords of splendour, ye whose paths are red, at eve, at mom, at sacrifice,  Give us not utterly as prey to mortal foe, ye Rudras, Lords of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ सुग्म्याय सुग्म्यं पराता रथेनाश्विना वा सक्षणी हुवे पितेव सोभरी |||
verses.transliteration: ā sughmyāya sughmyaṃ prātā rathenāśvinā vā sakṣaṇī huve piteva sobharī

translations.griffith: For bliss I call. the blissful car, at morn the inseparable Aśvins with their car  I call, like Sobhari our sire.

verses.sanskrit: मनोजवसा वर्षणा मदच्युता मक्षुंगमाभिरुतिभिः आरात्ताच्चिद भूतमस्मे अवसे पुर्वीभिः पुरुभोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: manojavasā vṛṣaṇā madacyutā makṣuṃghamābhirutibhiḥ ārāttāccid bhūtamasme avase purvībhiḥ purubhojasā

translations.griffith: Rapid as thought, and strong, and speeding to thejoy, bringing.your swiftly-coming help,  Be to us a protection even from far away Lords of great wealth, with many aids.'

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अश्वावदश्विना वर्तिर्यासिष्टं मधुपातमा नरा गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत |||
verses.transliteration: ā no aśvāvadaśvinā vartiryāsiṣṭaṃ madhupātamā narā ghomad dasrā hiraṇyavat

translations.griffith: Come, Wonder-Workers, to our home, our home, O Aśvins, rich in cattle, steeds, and gold,  Chief drinkers of the Soma's juice

verses.sanskrit: सुप्रावर्गं सुवीर्यं सुष्ठु वार्यमनाध्र्ष्टं रक्षस्विना अस्मिन्ना वामायाने वाजिनीवसू विश्वा वामानि धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: suprāvarghaṃ suvīryaṃ suṣṭhu vāryamanādhṛṣṭaṃ rakṣasvinā asminnā vāmāyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi

translations.griffith: Choice-worthy strength, heroic, firm and excellent, uninjured by the Rakṣas foe,  At this your coming nigh, ye Lords of ample wealth and all good things, may we obtain.

verses.sanskrit: ईळिष्वा हि परतीव्यं यजस्व जातवेदसम चरिष्णुधूममग्र्भीतशोचिषम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷiṣvā hi pratīvyaṃ yajasva jātavedasam cariṣṇudhūmamaghṛbhītaśociṣam

translations.griffith: WORSHIP thou Jātavedas, pray to him who willingly accepts,  Whose smoke wanders at will, and none may grasp his flame.

verses.sanskrit: दामानं विश्वचर्षणे.अग्निं विश्वमनो गिरा उत सतुषे विष्पर्धसो रथानाम |||
verses.transliteration: dāmānaṃ viśvacarṣaṇe.aghniṃ viśvamano ghirā uta stuṣe viṣpardhaso rathānām

translations.griffith: Thou, all men's friend, Visvamanas, exaltest Agni with thy song,  The Giver, and his flames with which no cars contend.

verses.sanskrit: येषामाबाध रग्मिय इषः पर्क्षश्च निग्रभे उपविदावह्निर्विन्दते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: yeṣāmābādha ṛghmiya iṣaḥ pṛkṣaśca nighrabhe upavidāvahnirvindate vasu

translations.griffith: Whose resolute assault, to win vigour and food, deserves our praise,—  Through whose discovering power the priest obtaineth wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उदस्य शोचिरस्थाद दीदियुषो वयजरम तपुर्जम्भस्य सुद्युतो गणश्रियः |||
verses.transliteration: udasya śocirasthād dīdiyuṣo vyajaram tapurjambhasya sudyuto ghaṇaśriyaḥ

translations.griffith: Up springs the imperishable flame, the flame of the Refulgent One  Most bright, with glowing jaws and glory in his train.

verses.sanskrit: उदु तिष्ठ सवध्वर सतवानो देव्या कर्पा अभिख्या भासा बर्हता शुशुक्वनिः |||
verses.transliteration: udu tiṣṭha svadhvara stavāno devyā kṛpā abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ

translations.griffith: Skilled in fair sacrifice, extolled, arise in Godlike loveliness,  Shining with lofty splendour, with effulgent light.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने याहि सुशस्तिभिर्हव्या जुह्वान आनुषक यथा दूतो बभूथ हव्यवाहनः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne yāhi suśastibhirhavyā juhvāna ānuṣak yathā dūto babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ

translations.griffith: Called straight to our oblations, come, O Agni, through our eulogies,  As thou hast been our envoy bearing up our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं वः पूर्व्यं हुवे होतारं चर्षणीनाम तमया वाचा गर्णे तमु व सतुषे |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ vaḥ pūrvyaṃ huve hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām tamayā vācā ghṛṇe tamu va stuṣe

translations.griffith: I call your Agni, from of old Invoking Priest of living men:  Him with this song I laud and magnify for you.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञेभिरद्भुतक्रतुं यं कर्पा सूदयन्त इत मित्रं न जने सुधितं रतावनि |||
verses.transliteration: yajñebhiradbhutakratuṃ yaṃ kṛpā sūdayanta it mitraṃ na jane sudhitaṃ ṛtāvani

translations.griffith: Whom, wondrous wise, they animate with solemn rites and his fair form,  Kind as a friend to men who keep the holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: रतावानं रतायवो यज्ञस्य साधनं गिरा उपो एनं जुजुषुर्नमसस पदे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ ṛtāyavo yajñasya sādhanaṃ ghirā upo enaṃ jujuṣurnamasas pade

translations.griffith: Him, true to Law, who perfecteth the sacrifice,. Law-loving ones!  Ye with your song have gratified in the place of prayer.

verses.sanskrit: अछा नो अङगिरस्तमं यज्ञासो यन्तु संयतः होता यो अस्ति विक्ष्वा यशस्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: achā no aṅghirastamaṃ yajñāso yantu saṃyataḥ hotā yo asti vikṣvā yaśastamaḥ

translations.griffith: May all our sacrifices go to him the truest Aṅgiras,  Who is among mankind the most illustrious Priest.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तव तये अजरेन्धानासो बर्हद भाः अश्वा इव वर्षणस्तविषीयवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tava tye ajarendhānāso bṛhad bhāḥ aśvā iva vṛṣaṇastaviṣīyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Imperishable Agni, thine are all these high enkindled lights,  Like horses and like stallions showing forth their strength.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं न ऊर्जां पते रयिं रास्व सुवीर्यम पराव नस्तोके तनये समत्स्वा |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na ūrjāṃ pate rayiṃ rāsva suvīryam prāva nastoke tanaye samatsvā

translations.griffith: So give us, Lord of Power and Might, riches combined with hero strength,  And guard us with our sons and grand. sons in our frays.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा उ विश्पतिः शितः सुप्रीतो मनुषो विसि विश्वेदग्निः परति रक्षांसि सेधति |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ suprīto manuṣo visi viśvedaghniḥ prati rakṣāṃsi sedhati

translations.griffith: Soon as the eager Lord of men is friendly unto Manti's race,  Agni averteth from us all the demon host.

verses.sanskrit: शरुष्ट्यग्ने नवस्य मे सतोमस्य वीर विश्पते नि मायिनस्तपुष रक्षसो दह |||
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭyaghne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate ni māyinastapuṣa rakṣaso daha

translations.griffith: O Hero Agni, Lord of men, on hearing this new laud of mine,  Burn down the Rākṣasas, enchanters, with thy flame.

verses.sanskrit: न तस्य मायया चन रिपुरीशीत मर्त्यः यो अग्नये ददाश हव्यदातिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: na tasya māyayā cana ripurīśīta martyaḥ yo aghnaye dadāśa havyadātibhiḥ

translations.griffith: No mortal foe can e’er prevail by arts of magic over him  Who serveth Agni well with sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit: वयश्वस्त्वा वसुविदमुक्षण्युरप्रीणाद रषिः महो रयेतमु तवा समिधीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: vyaśvastvā vasuvidamukṣaṇyuraprīṇād ṛṣiḥ maho rayetamu tvā samidhīmahi

translations.griffith: Vyaśva the sage, who sought the Bull, hath won thee, finder of good things:  As such may we enkindle thee for ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उशना कव्यस्त्वा नि होतारमसादयत आयजिं तवा मनवेजातवेदसम |||
verses.transliteration: uśanā kavyastvā ni hotāramasādayat āyajiṃ tvā manavejātavedasam

translations.griffith: Uśanā Kāvya stablished thee, O Agni, as Invoking Priest:  Thee, Jātavedas, Sacrificing Priest for man.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो देवासो दूतमक्रत शरुष्टी देव परथमो यज्ञियो भुवः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso devāso dūtamakrata śruṣṭī deva prathamo yajñiyo bhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: All Deities of one accord appointed thee their messenger:  Thou, God, through hearing, hadst first claim to sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इमं घा वीरो अम्र्तं दूतं कर्ण्वीत मर्त्यः पावकंक्र्ष्णवर्तनिं विहायसम |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ ghā vīro amṛtaṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇvīta martyaḥ pāvakaṃkṛṣṇavartaniṃ vihāyasam

translations.griffith: Him may the mortal hero make his own immortal messenger.  Far-spreading, Purifier, him whose path is black.

verses.sanskrit: तं हुवेम यतस्रुचः सुभासं शुक्रशोचिषम विशामग्निमजरं परत्नमीड्यम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ huvema yatasrucaḥ subhāsaṃ śukraśociṣam viśāmaghnimajaraṃ pratnamīḍyam

translations.griffith: With lifted ladles let us call him splendid with his brilliant flame,  Men's ancient Agni, wasting not, adorable.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्मै हव्यदातिभिराहुतिं मर्तो.अविधत भूरि पोषंस धत्ते वीरवद यशः |||
verses.transliteration: yo asmai havyadātibhirāhutiṃ marto.avidhat bhūri poṣaṃsa dhatte vīravad yaśaḥ

translations.griffith: The man who pays the worship due to him with sacrificial gifts  Obtains both plenteous nourishment and hero fame.

verses.sanskrit: परथमं जातवेदसमग्निं यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यम परति सरुगेति नमसा हविष्मती |||
verses.transliteration: prathamaṃ jātavedasamaghniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam prati srugheti namasā haviṣmatī

translations.griffith: To Jātavedas Agni, chief in sacrifices, first of all  With homage goes the ladle rich with sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit: आभिर्विधेमाग्नये जयेष्ठाभिर्व्यश्ववत मंहिष्ठाभिर्मतिभिः शुक्रशोचिषे |||
verses.transliteration: ābhirvidhemāghnaye jyeṣṭhābhirvyaśvavat maṃhiṣṭhābhirmatibhiḥ śukraśociṣe

translations.griffith: Even as Vyatya did, may we with these most high and liberal hymns  Pay worship unto Agni of the splendid flame.

verses.sanskrit: नूनमर्च विहायसे सतोमेभिः सथूरयूपवत रषे वैयश्वदम्यायाग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: nūnamarca vihāyase stomebhiḥ sthūrayūpavat ṛṣe vaiyaśvadamyāyāghnaye

translations.griffith: Now sing, as Sthurayupa sang, with lands to him who spreadeth far,  To Agni of the home, O Ṛṣi, Vyaśva's son.

verses.sanskrit: अतिथिं मानुषाणां सूनुं वनस्पतीनाम विप्रा अग्निमवसे परत्नमीळते |||
verses.transliteration: atithiṃ mānuṣāṇāṃ sūnuṃ vanaspatīnām viprā aghnimavase pratnamīḷate

translations.griffith: As welcome guest of human kind, as offspring of the forest kings,  The sages worship ancient Agni for his aid.

verses.sanskrit: महो विश्वानभि षतो.अभि हव्यानि मानुषा अग्ने नि षत्सि नमसाधि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: maho viśvānabhi ṣato.abhi havyāni mānuṣā aghne ni ṣatsi namasādhi barhiṣi

translations.griffith: For men's oblations brought to him who is the mighty Lord of all,  Sit, Agni, mid our homage, on the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: वंस्वा नो वार्या पुरु वंस्व रायः पुरुस्प्र्हः सुवीर्यस्य परजावतो यशस्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: vaṃsvā no vāryā puru vaṃsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ suvīryasya prajāvato yaśasvataḥ

translations.griffith: Grant us abundant. treasures, grant the opulence which many crave,  With store of heroes, progeny, and high renown.

verses.sanskrit: तवं वरो सुषाम्णे.अग्ने जनाय चोदय सदा वसो रातिं यविष्ठ शश्वते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe.aghne janāya codaya sadā vaso rātiṃ yaviṣṭha śaśvate

translations.griffith: Agni, Most Youthful of the Gods, send evermore the gift of wealth  Unto Varosusaman and to all his folk.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि सुप्रतूरसि तवं नो गोमतीरिषः महो रायः सातिमग्ने अपा वर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi supratūrasi tvaṃ no ghomatīriṣaḥ maho rāyaḥ sātimaghne apā vṛdhi

translations.griffith: A mighty Conqueror art thou, O Agni, so disclose to us  Food in our herds of kine and gain of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तवं यशा अस्या मित्रावरुणा वह रतावाना सम्राजा पूतदक्षसा |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tvaṃ yaśā asyā mitrāvaruṇā vaha ṛtāvānā samrājā pūtadakṣasā

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art a glorious God: bring hither Mitra, Varuṇa,  Imperial Sovrans, holy-minded, true to Law.

verses.sanskrit: सखाय आ शिषामहि बरह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे सतुष ऊ षुवो नर्तमाय धर्ष्णवे |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāya ā śiṣāmahi brahmendrāya vajriṇe stuṣa ū ṣuvo nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave

translations.griffith: COMPANIONS, let us learn a prayer to Indra. whom the thunder arms,  To glorify your bold and most heroic Friend.

verses.sanskrit: शवस हयसि शरुतो वर्त्रहत्येन वर्त्रहा मघैर्मघोनो अति शूर दाशसि |||
verses.transliteration: śavasa hyasi śruto vṛtrahatyena vṛtrahā maghairmaghono ati śūra dāśasi

translations.griffith: For thou by slaying Vṛtra art the Vṛtra-slayer, famed for might.  Thou, Hero, in rich gifts surpassest wealthy chiefs.

verses.sanskrit: स न सतवान आ भर रयिं चित्रश्रवस्तमम निरेके चिद यो हरिवो वसुर्ददिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa na stavāna ā bhara rayiṃ citraśravastamam nireke cid yo harivo vasurdadiḥ

translations.griffith: As such, when glorified, bring us riches of very wondrous fame,  Set in the highest rank, Wealth-giver, Lord of Bays!

verses.sanskrit: आ निरेकमुत परियमिन्द्र दर्षि जनानाम धर्षता धर्ष्णो सतवमान आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: ā nirekamuta priyamindra darṣi janānām dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo stavamāna ā bhara

translations.griffith: Yea, Indra, thou disclosest that preeminent dear wealth of men:  Boldly, O Bold One, glorified, bring it to us.

verses.sanskrit: न ते सव्यं न दक्षिणं हस्तं वरन्त आमुरः न परिबाधो हरिवो गविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: na te savyaṃ na dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ varanta āmuraḥ na paribādho harivo ghaviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: The workers of destruction stay neither thy right hand nor thy left:  Nor hosts that press about thee, Lord of Bays, in fight.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा गोभिरिव वरजं गीर्भिरणोम्यद्रिवः आ सम कामं जरितुरा मनः पर्ण |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā ghobhiriva vrajaṃ ghīrbhirṇomyadrivaḥ ā sma kāmaṃ jariturā manaḥ pṛṇa

translations.griffith: O Thunder-armed, I come with songs to thee as to a stall with kine:  Fulfil the wish and thought of him who sings thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वनि विश्वमनसो धिया नो वर्त्रहन्तम उग्र परणेतरधि षु वसो गहि |||
verses.transliteration: viśvani viśvamanaso dhiyā no vṛtrahantama ughra praṇetaradhi ṣu vaso ghahi

translations.griffith: Chief Vṛtra-slayer, through the hymn of Visvamanas think of all,  All that concerneth us, Excellent, Mighty Guide.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अस्य वर्त्रहन विद्याम शूर नव्यसः वसो सपार्हस्य पुरुहूत राधसः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ vaso spārhasya puruhūta rādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: May we, O Vṛtra-slayer, O Hero, find this thy newest boon, Longed-for, and excellent, thou who art much invoked!

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र यथा हयस्ति ते.अपरीतं नर्तो शवः अम्र्क्त रातिः पुरुहूत दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: indra yathā hyasti te.aparītaṃ nṛto śavaḥ amṛkta rātiḥ puruhūta dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: O Indra, Dancer, Much-invoked! as thy great power is unsurpassed,  So be thy bounty to the worshipper unchecked.

verses.sanskrit: आ वर्षस्व महामह महे नर्तम राधसे दर्ळ्हश्चिद दर्ह्य मघवन मघत्तये |||
verses.transliteration: ā vṛṣasva mahāmaha mahe nṛtama rādhase dṛḷhaścid dṛhya maghavan maghattaye

translations.griffith: Most Mighty, most heroic One, for mighty bounty fill thee full.  Though strong, strengthen thyself to win wealth, Maghavan!

verses.sanskrit: नू अन्यत्रा चिदद्रिवस्त्वन नो जग्मुरशसः मघवञ्छग्धि तव तन न उतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: nū anyatrā cidadrivastvan no jaghmuraśasaḥ maghavañchaghdhi tava tan na utibhiḥ

translations.griffith: O Thunderer, never have our prayers gone forth to any God but thee:  So help us, Maghavan, with thine assistance now.

verses.sanskrit: नह्यङग नर्तो तवदन्यं विन्दामि राधसे राये दयुम्नायशवसे च गिर्वणः |||
verses.transliteration: nahyaṅgha nṛto tvadanyaṃ vindāmi rādhase rāye dyumnāyaśavase ca ghirvaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: For, Dancer, verily I find none else for bounty, saving thee,  For splendid wealth and power, thou Lover of the Song.

verses.sanskrit: एन्दुमिन्द्राय सिञ्चत पिबति सोम्यं मधु पर राधसा चोदयाते महित्वना |||
verses.transliteration: endumindrāya siñcata pibati somyaṃ madhu pra rādhasā codayāte mahitvanā

translations.griffith: For Indra pour ye out the drops meath blent with Soma let him drink  With bounty and with majesty will he further us.

verses.sanskrit: उपो हरीणां पतिं दक्षं पर्ञ्चन्तमब्रवम नूनं शरुधि सतुवतो अश्व्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: upo harīṇāṃ patiṃ dakṣaṃ pṛñcantamabravam nūnaṃ śrudhi stuvato aśvyasya

translations.griffith: I spake to the Bay Coursers' Lord, to him who gives ability:  Now hear the son of Asva as he praises thee.

verses.sanskrit: नह्यङग पुरा चन जज्ञे वीरतरस्त्वत नकी राया नैवथा न भन्दना |||
verses.transliteration: nahyaṅgha purā cana jajñe vīratarastvat nakī rāyā naivathā na bhandanā

translations.griffith: Never was any Hero born before thee mightier than thou:  None certairdy like thee in goodness and in wealth.

verses.sanskrit: एदु मध्वो मदिन्तरं सिञ्च वाध्वर्यो अन्धसः एवा हि वीर सतवते सदाव्र्धः |||
verses.transliteration: edu madhvo madintaraṃ siñca vādhvaryo andhasaḥ evā hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: O ministering priest, pour out of the sweet juice what gladdens most:  So is the Hero praised who ever prospers us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सथातर्हरीणां नकिष टे पूर्व्यस्तुतिम उदानंशशवसा न भन्दना |||
verses.transliteration: indra sthātarharīṇāṃ nakiṣ ṭe pūrvyastutim udānaṃśaśavasā na bhandanā

translations.griffith: Indra, whom Tawny Coursers bear, praise such as thine, preeminent,  None by his power or by his goodness hath attained.

verses.sanskrit: तं वो वाजानां पतिमहूमहि शरवस्यवः अप्रायुभिर्यज्ञेभिर्वाव्र्धेन्यम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo vājānāṃ patimahūmahi śravasyavaḥ aprāyubhiryajñebhirvāvṛdhenyam

translations.griffith: We, seeking glory, have invoked this Master of all power and might  Who must be glorified by constant sacri fice.

verses.sanskrit: एतो नविन्द्रं सतवाम सखायः सतोम्यं नरम कर्ष्तीर्यो विश्वा अभ्यस्त्येक इत |||
verses.transliteration: eto nvindraṃ stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyaṃ naram kṛṣtīryo viśvā abhyastyeka it

translations.griffith: Come, sing we praise to Indra, friends, the Hero who deserves the laud,  Him who with none to aid o’ercomes all tribes of men.

verses.sanskrit: अगोरुधाय गविषे दयुक्षाय दस्म्यं वचः घर्तात सवादीयो मधुनश्च वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: aghorudhāya ghaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyaṃ vacaḥ ghṛtāt svādīyo madhunaśca vocata

translations.griffith: To him who wins the kine, who keeps no cattle back, Celestial God,  Speak wondrous speech more sweet than butter and than meath.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यामितानि वीर्या न राधः पर्येतवे जयोतिर्न विश्वमभ्यस्ति दक्षिणा |||
verses.transliteration: yasyāmitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave jyotirna viśvamabhyasti dakṣiṇā

translations.griffith: Whose hero powers are measureless, whose bounty ne’er may be surpassed,  Whose liberality, like light, is over all.

verses.sanskrit: सतुहीन्द्रं वयश्ववदनूर्मिं वाजिनं यमम अर्यो गयम्मंहमानं वि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: stuhīndraṃ vyaśvavadanūrmiṃ vājinaṃ yamam aryo ghayammaṃhamānaṃ vi dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: As Vyaśva did, praise Indra, praise the Strong unfluctuating Guide,  Who gives the foe's possessions to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: एवा नूनमुप सतुहि वैयश्व दशमं नवम सुविद्वांसं चर्क्र्त्यं चरणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: evā nūnamupa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamaṃ navam suvidvāṃsaṃ carkṛtyaṃ caraṇīnām

translations.griffith: Now, son of Vyaśva, praise thou him who to the tenth time still is new,  The very Wise, whom living men must glorify

verses.sanskrit: वेत्था हि निरतीनां वज्रहस्त परिव्र्जम अहर-अहः शुन्ध्युः परिपदामिव |||
verses.transliteration: vetthā hi nirtīnāṃ vajrahasta parivṛjam ahar-ahaḥ śundhyuḥ paripadāmiva

translations.griffith: Thou knowest, Indra, Thunder-armed, how to avoid destructive powers,  As one secure from pitfalls each returning day.

verses.sanskrit: तदिन्द्राव आ भर येना दंसिष्ठ कर्त्वने दविता कुत्साय शिश्नथो नि चोदय |||
verses.transliteration: tadindrāva ā bhara yenā daṃsiṣṭha kṛtvane dvitā kutsāya śiśnatho ni codaya

translations.griffith: O Indra, bring that aid wherewith of old, Most Wondrous! thou didst slay  His foes for active Kutsa: send it down to us.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा नूनमीमहे नव्यं दंसिष्ठ सन्यसे स तवंनो विश्वा अभिमातीः सक्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā nūnamīmahe navyaṃ daṃsiṣṭha sanyase sa tvaṃno viśvā abhimātīḥ sakṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: So now we seek thee fresh in might, Most Wonderful in act! for gain:  For thou art he who conquers all our foes for us.

verses.sanskrit: य रक्षादंहसो मुचद यो वार्यात सप्त सिन्धुषु वधर्दासस्य तुविन्र्म्ण नीनमः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛkṣādaṃhaso mucad yo vāryāt sapta sindhuṣu vadhardāsasya tuvinṛmṇa nīnamaḥ

translations.griffith: Who will set free from ruinous woe, or Ārya on the Seven Streams:  O valiant Hero, bend the Dāsa's weapon down.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वरो सुषाम्णे सनिभ्य आवहो रयिम वयश्वेभ्यः सुभगे वजिनीवति |||
verses.transliteration: yathā varo suṣāmṇe sanibhya āvaho rayim vyaśvebhyaḥ subhaghe vajinīvati

translations.griffith: As to Varosusaman thou broughtest great riches, for their gain,  To Vyaśva's sons, Blest Lady, rich in ample wealth!

verses.sanskrit: आ नार्यस्य दक्षिणा वयश्वानेतु सोमिनः सथूरं च राधः शतवत सहस्रवत |||
verses.transliteration: ā nāryasya dakṣiṇā vyaśvānetu sominaḥ sthūraṃ ca rādhaḥ śatavat sahasravat

translations.griffith: Let Narya's sacrificial meed reach Vyaśva's Soma-bearing sons:  In hundreds and in thousands be the great reward.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा पर्छादीजानः कुहया कुहयाक्र्ते एषो अपश्रितोवलो गोमतीमव तिष्ठति |||
verses.transliteration: yat tvā pṛchādījānaḥ kuhayā kuhayākṛte eṣo apaśritovalo ghomatīmava tiṣṭhati

translations.griffith: If one should ask thee, Where is he who sacrificed? Whither lookest thou?  Like Vala he hath passed away and dwelleth now on Gomati.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां विश्वस्य गोपा देवा देवेषु यज्ञिय रतावाना यजसे पुतदक्षसा |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ viśvasya ghopā devā deveṣu yajñiya ṛtāvānā yajase putadakṣasā

translations.griffith: I WORSHIP you who guard this All, Gods, holiest among the Gods,  You, faithful to the Law, whose power is sanctified.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रा तना न रथ्या वरुणो यश्च सुक्रतुः सनात सुजाता तनया धर्तव्रता |||
verses.transliteration: mitrā tanā na rathyā varuṇo yaśca sukratuḥ sanāt sujātā tanayā dhṛtavratā

translations.griffith: So, too, like charioteers are they, Mitra and sapient Varuṇa,  Sons high-born from of old, whose holy laws stand fast.

verses.sanskrit: ता माता विश्ववेदसासुर्याय परमहसा महि जजानादितिरतावरी |||
verses.transliteration: tā mātā viśvavedasāsuryāya pramahasā mahi jajānāditirtāvarī

translations.griffith: These Twain, possessors of all wealth, most glorious, for supremest sway  Aditi, Mighty Mother, true to Law, brought forth.

verses.sanskrit: महान्ता मित्रावरुणा सम्राजा देवावसुरा रतावानाव्र्तमा घोषतो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: mahāntā mitrāvaruṇā samrājā devāvasurā ṛtāvānāvṛtamā ghoṣato bṛhat

translations.griffith: Great Varuṇa and Mitra, Gods, Asuras and imperial Lords,  True to Eternal Law proclaim the high decree.

verses.sanskrit: नपाता शवसो महः सूनू दक्षस्य सुक्रतु सर्प्रदानू इषो वास्त्वधि कषितः |||
verses.transliteration: napātā śavaso mahaḥ sūnū dakṣasya sukratu sṛpradānū iṣo vāstvadhi kṣitaḥ

translations.griffith: The offspring of a lofty Power, Dakṣa's Two Sons exceeding strong,  Who, Lords of flowing rain, dwell in the place of food.

verses.sanskrit: सं या दानूनि येमथुर्दिव्याः पार्थिवीरिषः नभस्वतीरा वां चरन्तु वर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yā dānūni yemathurdivyāḥ pārthivīriṣaḥ nabhasvatīrā vāṃ carantu vṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye who have gathered up your gifts, celestial and terrestrial food,  Let your rain come to us fraught with the mist of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अधि या बर्हतो दिवो.अभि यूथेव पश्यतः रतावाना सम्राजा नमसे हिता |||
verses.transliteration: adhi yā bṛhato divo.abhi yūtheva paśyataḥ ṛtāvānā samrājā namase hitā

translations.griffith: The Twain, who from the lofty sky seem to look down on herds below,  Holy, imperial Lords, are set to be revered.

verses.sanskrit: रतावाना नि षेदतुः साम्राज्याय सुक्रतू धर्तव्रता कषत्रिया कषत्रमशतुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānā ni ṣedatuḥ sāmrājyāya sukratū dhṛtavratā kṣatriyā kṣatramaśatuḥ

translations.griffith: They, true to Law, exceeding strong, have sat them down for savran rule:  Princes whose laws stand fast, they have obtained their sway.

verses.sanskrit: अक्ष्णश्चिद गातुवित्तरनुल्बणेन चक्षसा नि चिन मिषन्ता निचिरा नि चिक्यतुः |||
verses.transliteration: akṣṇaścid ghātuvittaranulbaṇena cakṣasā ni cin miṣantā nicirā ni cikyatuḥ

translations.griffith: Pathfinders even better than the eye, with unobstructed sight,  Even when they close their lids, observant, they perceive.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो देव्यदितिरुरुष्यतां नासत्या उरुष्यन्तु मरुतो वर्द्धशवसः |||
verses.transliteration: uta no devyaditiruruṣyatāṃ nāsatyā uruṣyantu maruto vṛddhaśavasaḥ

translations.griffith: So may the Goddess Aditi, may the Nāsatyas guard us well,  The Martits guard us well,.endowed with mighty strength.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो नावमुरुष्यत दिवा नक्तं सुदानवः अरिष्यन्तो निपायुभिः सचेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: te no nāvamuruṣyata divā naktaṃ sudānavaḥ ariṣyanto nipāyubhiḥ sacemahi

translations.griffith: Do ye, O Bounteous Gods, protect our dwelling lace by day and night:  With you for our defenders may we go unharmed.

verses.sanskrit: अघ्नते विष्णवे वयमरिष्यन्तः सुदानवे शरुधि सवयावन सिन्धो पूर्वचित्तये |||
verses.transliteration: aghnate viṣṇave vayamariṣyantaḥ sudānave śrudhi svayāvan sindho pūrvacittaye

translations.griffith: May we, unharmed, serve bountiful Viṣṇu, the God who slayeth none:  Self-moving Sindhu hear and be the first to mark.

verses.sanskrit: तद वार्यं वर्णीमहे वरिष्ठं गोपयत्यम मित्रो यत पान्ति वरुणो यदर्यमा |||
verses.transliteration: tad vāryaṃ vṛṇīmahe variṣṭhaṃ ghopayatyam mitro yat pānti varuṇo yadaryamā

translations.griffith: This sure protection we elect, desirable and reaching far,  Which Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman afford.

verses.sanskrit: उत नः सिन्धुरपां तन मरुतस्तदश्विना इन्द्रो विष्णुर्मीढ्वांसः सजोषसः |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ sindhurapāṃ tan marutastadaśvinā indro viṣṇurmīḍhvāṃsaḥ sajoṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: And may the Sindhu of the floods, the Maruts, and the ASvin Pair,  Boon Indra, and boon Viṣṇu have one mind with us.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि षमा वनुषो नरो.अभिमातिं कयस्य चित तिग्मं नक्षोदः परतिघ्नन्ति भूर्णयः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi ṣmā vanuṣo naro.abhimātiṃ kayasya cit tighmaṃ nakṣodaḥ pratighnanti bhūrṇayaḥ

translations.griffith: Because these warring Heroes stay the enmity of every foe,  As the fierce water-flood repels the furious ones.

verses.sanskrit: अयमेक इत्था पुरूरु चष्टे वि विष्पतिः तस्य वरतान्यनु वश्चरमसि |||
verses.transliteration: ayameka itthā purūru caṣṭe vi viṣpatiḥ tasya vratānyanu vaścaramasi

translations.griffith: Here this one God, the Lord of men, looks forth exceeding far and wide:  And we, for your advantage, keep his holy laws.

verses.sanskrit: अनु पूर्वाण्योक्या साम्राज्यस्य सश्चिम मित्रस्य वरता वरुणस्य दिर्घश्रुत |||
verses.transliteration: anu pūrvāṇyokyā sāmrājyasya saścima mitrasya vratā varuṇasya dirghaśrut

translations.griffith: We keep the old accustomed laws, the statutes of supremacy,  The Iong-known laws of Mitra and of Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: परि यो रश्मिना दिवो.अन्तान ममे पर्थिव्याः उभे आ पप्रौरोदसी महित्वा |||
verses.transliteration: pari yo raśminā divo.antān mame pṛthivyāḥ ubhe ā papraurodasī mahitvā

translations.griffith: He who hath measured with his ray the boundaries of heaven and earth,  And with his majesty hath filled the two worlds full,

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय शरणे दिवो जयोतिरयंस्त सूर्यः अग्निर्न शुक्रः समिधान आहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya śaraṇe divo jyotirayaṃsta sūryaḥ aghnirna śukraḥ samidhāna āhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Sūrya hath spread his light aloft up to the region of the sky,  Like Agni all aflame when gifts are offered him.

verses.sanskrit: वचो दीर्घप्रसद्मनीशे वाजस्य गोमतः ईशे हि पित्वोऽविषस्य दावने |||
verses.transliteration: vaco dīrghaprasadmanīśe vājasya ghomataḥ īśe hi pitvo'viṣasya dāvane

translations.griffith: With him who sits afar the word is lord of food that comes from kine,  Controller of the gift of unempoisoned food.

verses.sanskrit: तत सूर्यं रोदसी उभे दोषा वस्तोरुप बरुवे भोजेष्वस्मानभ्युच्चरा सदा |||
verses.transliteration: tat sūryaṃ rodasī ubhe doṣā vastorupa bruve bhojeṣvasmānabhyuccarā sadā

translations.griffith: So unto Sūrya, Heaven, and Earth at morning and at eve I speak.  Bringing enjoyments ever rise thou up for us.

verses.sanskrit: रज्रमुक्षण्यायने रजतं हरयाणे रथं युक्तमसनाम सुषामणि |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjramukṣaṇyāyane rajataṃ harayāṇe rathaṃ yuktamasanāma suṣāmaṇi

translations.griffith: From Uksanyayana a bay, from Harayana a white steed,  And from Susaman we obtained a hamessed car.

verses.sanskrit: ता मे अश्व्यानां हरीणां नितोशना उतो नु कर्त्व्यानां नर्वाहसा |||
verses.transliteration: tā me aśvyānāṃ harīṇāṃ nitośanā uto nu kṛtvyānāṃ nṛvāhasā

translations.griffith: These two shall bring me further gain of troops of tawny-coloured steeds,  The carriers shall they be of active men of war.

verses.sanskrit: समदभीषू कशावन्ता विप्रा नविष्ठया मती महो वाजिनावर्वन्ता सचासनम |||
verses.transliteration: smadabhīṣū kaśāvantā viprā naviṣṭhayā matī maho vājināvarvantā sacāsanam

translations.griffith: And the two sages have I gained who hold the reins and bear the whip,  And the two great strong coursers, with my newest song.

verses.sanskrit: युवोरु षू रथं हुवे सधस्तुत्याय सुरिषु अतुर्तदक्षाव्र्षणा वर्षण्वसू |||
verses.transliteration: yuvoru ṣū rathaṃ huve sadhastutyāya suriṣu aturtadakṣāvṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū

translations.griffith: I CALL your chariot to receive united praise mid princely men,  Strong Gods who pour down wealth, of never vanquished might!

verses.sanskrit: युवं वरो सुषाम्णे महे तने नासत्या अवोभिर्यथो वर्षण वर्षण्वसू |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ varo suṣāmṇe mahe tane nāsatyā avobhiryatho vṛṣaṇa vṛṣaṇvasū

translations.griffith: Ye to Varosusaman come, Nāsatyas, for this glorious rite.  With your protecting aid. Strong Gods, who pour down wealth.

verses.sanskrit: ता वामद्य हवामहे हव्येभिर्वजिनीवसू पूर्वीरिष इषयन्तावति कषपः |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāmadya havāmahe havyebhirvajinīvasū pūrvīriṣa iṣayantāvati kṣapaḥ

translations.griffith: So with oblations we invoke you, rich in ample wealth, to-day,  When night hath passed, O ye who send us plenteous food.  O Aśvins, Heroes, let your car, famed, best to travel, come to us,  And, for his glory, mark your zealous servant's lauds.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां वाहिष्ठो अश्विना रथो यातु शरुतो नर उप सतोमान तुरस्य दर्शथः शरिये |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ vāhiṣṭho aśvinā ratho yātu śruto nara upa stomān turasya darśathaḥ śriye

translations.griffith: Aśvins, who send us precious gifts, even when offended, think of him:  For ye, O Rudras, lead us safe beyond our foes.

verses.sanskrit: जुहुराणा चिदश्विना मन्येथां वर्षण्वसू युवं हि रुद्रा पर्षथो अति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: juhurāṇā cidaśvinā manyethāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū yuvaṃ hi rudrā parṣatho ati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: For, Wonder-Workers, with fleet steeds ye fly completely round this All,  Stirring our thoughts, ye Lords of splendour, honey-hued.

verses.sanskrit: दस्रा हि विश्वमानुषं मक्षूभिः परिदीयथः धियंजिन्वा मधुवर्णा शुभस पती |||
verses.transliteration: dasrā hi viśvamānuṣaṃ makṣūbhiḥ paridīyathaḥ dhiyaṃjinvā madhuvarṇā śubhas patī

translations.griffith: With all-sustaining opulence, Aśvins, come hitherward to us,  Ye rich and noble Heroes, ne’er to be o’erthrown.

verses.sanskrit: उप नो यातमश्विना राया विश्वपुषा सह मघवाना सुवीरावनपच्युता |||
verses.transliteration: upa no yātamaśvinā rāyā viśvapuṣā saha maghavānā suvīrāvanapacyutā

translations.griffith: To welcome this mine offering, O ye Indra-like Nāsatyas, come  As Gods of best accord this day with other Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ मे अस्य परतीव्यमिन्द्रनासत्या गतम देवा देवेभिरद्य सचनस्तमा |||
verses.transliteration: ā me asya pratīvyamindranāsatyā ghatam devā devebhiradya sacanastamā

translations.griffith: For we, like Vyaśva, lifting up our voice like oxen, call on you:  With all your loving kindness, Sages, come to us.

verses.sanskrit: वयं हि वां हवामह उक्षण्यन्तो वयश्ववत सुमतिभिरुप विप्राविहा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmaha ukṣaṇyanto vyaśvavat sumatibhirupa viprāvihā ghatam

translations.griffith: O Ṛṣi, laud the Aśvins well. Will they not listen to thy call?  Will they not burn the Paṇis who are nearer them?

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना सव रषे सतुहि कुवित ते शरवतो हवम नेदीयसः कूळयातः पणीन्रुत |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā sv ṛṣe stuhi kuvit te śravato havam nedīyasaḥ kūḷayātaḥ paṇīnruta

translations.griffith: O Heroes, listen to the son of Vyaśva, and regard me here,  Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, of one accord.

verses.sanskrit: वैयश्वस्य शरुतं नरोतो मे अस्य वेदथः सजोषसा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |||
verses.transliteration: vaiyaśvasya śrutaṃ naroto me asya vedathaḥ sajoṣasā varuṇo mitro aryamā

translations.griffith: Gods whom we yearn for, of your gifts, of what ye bring to us, bestow  By princes' hands on me, ye Mighty, day by day.

verses.sanskrit: युवादत्तस्य धिष्ण्या युवानीतस्य सूरिभिः अहर-अहर्व्र्षण मह्यं शिक्षतम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvādattasya dhiṣṇyā yuvānītasya sūribhiḥ ahar-aharvṛṣaṇa mahyaṃ śikṣatam

translations.griffith: Him whom your sacrifices clothe, even as a woman with her robe,  The Aśvins help to glory honouring him well.

verses.sanskrit: यो वां यज्ञेभिराव्र्तो.अधिवस्त्र वधूरिव सपर्यन्त शुभे चक्राते अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāṃ yajñebhirāvṛto.adhivastra vadhūriva saparyanta śubhe cakrāte aśvinā

translations.griffith: Whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach,  About his dwelling go, ye Aśvins, loving us.

verses.sanskrit: यो वामुरुव्यचस्तमं चिकेतति नर्पाय्यम वर्तिरश्विना परि यातमस्मयू |||
verses.transliteration: yo vāmuruvyacastamaṃ ciketati nṛpāyyam vartiraśvinā pari yātamasmayū

translations.griffith: Come to us ye who pour down wealth, come to the home which men must guard:  Like shafts, ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं सु वर्षण्वसू यातं वर्तिर्न्र्पय्यम विषुद्रुहेव यज्ञमूहथुर्गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ su vṛṣaṇvasū yātaṃ vartirnṛpayyam viṣudruheva yajñamūhathurghirā

translations.griffith: Most fetching of all calls, the laud, as envoy, Heroes, called to you  Be it your own, O Aśvin Pair.

verses.sanskrit: वाहिष्ठो वां हवानां सतोमो दूतो हुवन नरा युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: vāhiṣṭho vāṃ havānāṃ stomo dūto huvan narā yuvābhyāṃ bhūtvaśvinā

translations.griffith: Be ye in yonder sea of heaven, or joying in the home of food,  Listen to me, Immortal Ones.

verses.sanskrit: यददो दिवो अर्णव इषो व मदथो गर्हे शरुतमिन मे अमर्त्या |||
verses.transliteration: yadado divo arṇava iṣo va madatho ghṛhe śrutamin me amartyā

translations.griffith: This river with his lucid flow attracts you, more than all the streams,—  Even Sindhu with his path of gold.

verses.sanskrit: उत सया शवेतयावरी वाहिष्ठा वां नदीनाम सिन्धुर्हिरण्यवर्तनिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta syā śvetayāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vāṃ nadīnām sindhurhiraṇyavartaniḥ

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, with that glorious fame come hither, through our brilliant song,  Come ye whose ways are marked with light.

verses.sanskrit: समदेतय सुकीर्त्याश्विना शवेतया धिया वहेथे शुभ्रयावाना |||
verses.transliteration: smadetaya sukīrtyāśvinā śvetayā dhiyā vahethe śubhrayāvānā

translations.griffith: Harness the steeds who draw the car, O Vasu, bring the well-fed pair.  O Vāyu, drink thou of our meath: come unto our drink-offerings.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हि तवं रथासहा युवस्व पोष्या वसो आन नो वायो मधु पिबास्माकं सवना गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā hi tvaṃ rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso ān no vāyo madhu pibāsmākaṃ savanā ghahi

translations.griffith: Wonderful Vāyu, Lord of Right, thou who art Tvaṣṭar's son-in-law,  Thy saving succour we elect.

verses.sanskrit: तव वायव रतस्पते तवष्टुर्जामातरद्भुत अवांस्या वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭurjāmātaradbhuta avāṃsyā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: To Tvaṣṭar's son-in-law we pray for wealth whereof he hath control:  For glory we seek vayu, men with juice effused.

verses.sanskrit: तवष्टुर्जामातरं वयमीशानं राय ईमहे सुतावन्तो वयुं दयुम्ना जनासः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṣṭurjāmātaraṃ vayamīśānaṃ rāya īmahe sutāvanto vayuṃ dyumnā janāsaḥ

translations.griffith: From heaven, auspicious Vāyu, come drive hither with thy noble steeds:  Come on thy mighty car with wide-extending seat.

verses.sanskrit: वायो याहि शिवा दिवो वहस्व सु सवश्व्यम वहस्व महःप्र्थुपक्षसा रथे |||
verses.transliteration: vāyo yāhi śivā divo vahasva su svaśvyam vahasva mahaḥpṛthupakṣasā rathe

translations.griffith: We call thee to the homes of men, thee wealthiest in noble food,  And liberal as a press-stone with a horse's back.

verses.sanskrit: तवां हि सुप्सरस्तमं नर्षदनेषु हूमहे गरावाणं नाश्वप्र्ष्ठं मंहना |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hi supsarastamaṃ nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe ghrāvāṇaṃ nāśvapṛṣṭhaṃ maṃhanā

translations.griffith: So, glad and joyful in thine heart, do thou, God, Vāyu, first of all  Vouchsafe us water, strength, and thought.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं नो देव मनसा वायो मन्दानो अग्रियः कर्धि वाजानपो धियः |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ no deva manasā vāyo mandāno aghriyaḥ kṛdhi vājānapo dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निरुक्थे पुरोहितो गरावाणो बर्हिरध्वरे रचा यामि मरुतो बरह्मणस पतिं देवानवो वरेण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirukthe purohito ghrāvāṇo barhiradhvare ṛcā yāmi maruto brahmaṇas patiṃ devānavo vareṇyam

translations.griffith: CHEIF Priest is Agni at the laud, as stones and grass at sacrifice:  With song I seek the Maruts, Brahmaṇaspati, Gods for help much to be desired.

verses.sanskrit: आ पशुं गासि पर्थिवीं वनस्पतीनुषासा नक्तमोषधीः विश्वे च नो वसवो विश्ववेदसो धीनां भूत परावितारः |||
verses.transliteration: ā paśuṃ ghāsi pṛthivīṃ vanaspatīnuṣāsā naktamoṣadhīḥ viśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso dhīnāṃ bhūta prāvitāraḥ

translations.griffith: I sing to cattle and to Earth, to trees, to Dawns, to Night, to plants.  O all ye Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, be ye the furtherers of our thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: पर सू न एत्वध्वरो.अग्ना देवेषु पूर्व्यः आदित्येषु पर वरुणे धर्तव्रते मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु |||
verses.transliteration: pra sū na etvadhvaro.aghnā deveṣu pūrvyaḥ ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛtavrate marutsu viśvabhānuṣu

translations.griffith: Forth go, with Agni, to the Gods our sacrifice of ancient use,  To the Ādityas, Varuṇa whose Law stands fast, and the all-lightening Marut troop.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे हि षमा मनवे विश्ववेदसो भुवन वर्धे रिशादसः अरिष्टेभिः पायुभिर्विश्ववेदसो यन्ता नो.अव्र्कं छर्दिः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve hi ṣmā manave viśvavedaso bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhirviśvavedaso yantā no.avṛkaṃ chardiḥ

translations.griffith: Lords of all wealth, may they be strengtheners of man, destroyers of his enemies.  Lords of all wealth, do ye, with guards which none may harm, preserve our dwelling free from foes.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अद्य समनसो गन्ता विश्वे सजोषसः रचा गिरा मरुतो देव्यदिते सदने पस्त्ये महि |||
verses.transliteration: ā no adya samanaso ghantā viśve sajoṣasaḥ ṛcā ghirā maruto devyadite sadane pastye mahi

translations.griffith: Come to us with one mind to-day, come to us all with one accord,  Maruts with holy song, and, Goddess Aditi, Mighty One, to our house and home.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परिया मरुतो या वो अश्व्या हव्या मित्र परयाथन आबर्हिरिन्द्रो वरुणस्तुरा नर आदित्यासो सदन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi priyā maruto yā vo aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana ābarhirindro varuṇasturā nara ādityāso sadantu naḥ

translations.griffith: Send us delightful things, ye Maruts, on your steeds: come ye, O Mitra, to our gifts.  Let Indra, Varuṇa, and the Ādityas sit, swift Heroes, on our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: वयं वो वर्क्तबर्हिषो हितप्रयस आनुषक सुतसोमासो वरुण हवामहे मनुष्वदिद्धाग्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ vo vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa ānuṣak sutasomāso varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvadiddhāghnayaḥ

translations.griffith: We who have trimmed the grass for you, and set the banquet in array,  And pressed the Soma, call you, Varuina, like men, with sacrificial fires aflame.

verses.sanskrit: आ पर यात मरुतो विष्णो अश्विना पूषन माकीनया धिया इन्द्र आ यातु परथमः सनिष्युभिर्व्र्षा यो वर्त्रहा गर्णे |||
verses.transliteration: ā pra yāta maruto viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā indra ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhirvṛṣā yo vṛtrahā ghṛṇe

translations.griffith: O Maruts, Visinu, Aśvins, Pūṣan, haste away with minds turned hitherward to Me.  Let the Strong Indra, famed as Vṛtra's slayer, come first with the winners of the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: वि नो देवासो अद्रुहो.अछिद्रं शर्म यछत न यद दूराद वसवो नू चिदन्तितो वरूथमादधर्षति |||
verses.transliteration: vi no devāso adruho.achidraṃ śarma yachata na yad dūrād vasavo nū cidantito varūthamādadharṣati

translations.griffith: Ye Guileless Gods, bestow on us a refuge strong on every side,  A sure protection, Vasus, unassailable from near at hand or from afar.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ति हि वः सजात्यं रिशादसो देवासो अस्त्याप्यम पर णः पूर्वस्मै सुविताय वोचत मक्षू सुम्नाय नव्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: asti hi vaḥ sajātyaṃ riśādaso devāso astyāpyam pra ṇaḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase

translations.griffith: Kinship have I with you, and close alliance O ye Gods, destroyers of our foes.  Call us to our prosperity of former days, and soon to new klicity.

verses.sanskrit: इदा हि व उपस्तुतिमिदा वामस्य भक्तये उप वो विश्ववेदसो नमस्युरानस्र्क्ष्यन्यामिव |||
verses.transliteration: idā hi va upastutimidā vāmasya bhaktaye upa vo viśvavedaso namasyurānasṛkṣyanyāmiva

translations.griffith: For now have I sent forth to you, that I may win a fair reward,  Lords of all wealth, with homage, this my song of praise. like a milch-cow that faileth not.

verses.sanskrit: उदु षय वः सविता सुप्रणीतयो.अस्थादूर्ध्वो वरेण्यः नि दविपादश्चतुष्पादो अर्थिनो.अविश्रन पतयिष्णवः |||
verses.transliteration: udu ṣya vaḥ savitā supraṇītayo.asthādūrdhvo vareṇyaḥ ni dvipādaścatuṣpādo arthino.aviśran patayiṣṇavaḥ

translations.griffith: Excellent Savitar hath mounted up on high for you, ye sure and careful Guides.  Bipeds and quadrupeds, with several hopes and aims, and birds have settled to their tasks.

verses.sanskrit: देवं-देवं वो.अवसे देवं-देवमभिष्टये देवं-देवं हुवेम वाजसातये गर्णन्तो देव्या धिया |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ vo.avase devaṃ-devamabhiṣṭaye devaṃ-devaṃ huvema vājasātaye ghṛṇanto devyā dhiyā

translations.griffith: Singing their praise with God-like thought let us invoke each God for grace,  Each God to bring you help, each God to strengthen you.

verses.sanskrit: देवासो हि षमा मनवे समन्यवो विश्वे साकं सरातयः ते नो अद्य ते अपरं तुचे तु नो भवन्तु वरिवोविदः |||
verses.transliteration: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākaṃ sarātayaḥ te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ

translations.griffith: For of one spirit are the Gods with mortal man, co-sharers all of gracious gifts.  May they increase our strength hereafter and to-day, providing case and ample room.

verses.sanskrit: पर वः शंसाम्यद्रुहः संस्थ उपस्तुतीनाम न तं धूर्तिर्वरुण मित्र मर्त्यं यो वो धामभ्यो.अविधत |||
verses.transliteration: pra vaḥ śaṃsāmyadruhaḥ saṃstha upastutīnām na taṃ dhūrtirvaruṇa mitra martyaṃ yo vo dhāmabhyo.avidhat

translations.griffith: I laud you, O ye Guileless Gods, here where we meet to render praise.  None, Varuṇa and Mitra, harins the mortal, man who honours and obeys your laws.

verses.sanskrit: पर स कषयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति पर परजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस पर्यरिष्टः सर्व एधते |||
verses.transliteration: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas paryariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate

translations.griffith: He makes his house endure, he gathers plenteous food who pays obedience to your will.  Born in his sons anew he spreads as Law commands, and prospers every way unharmed.

verses.sanskrit: रते स विन्दते युधः सुगेभिर्यात्यध्वनः अर्यमा मित्रोवरुणः सरातयो यं तरायन्ते सजोषसः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sughebhiryātyadhvanaḥ aryamā mitrovaruṇaḥ sarātayo yaṃ trāyante sajoṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: E’en without war he gathers wealth, and goes hisway on pleasant paths,  Whom Mitra, Varuṇa and Aryaman protect, sharing the gift,of one accord.

verses.sanskrit: अज्रे चिदस्मै कर्णुथा नयञ्चनं दुर्गे चिदा सुसरणम एषा चिदस्मादशनिः परो नु सास्रेधन्ती वि नश्यतु |||
verses.transliteration: ajre cidasmai kṛṇuthā nyañcanaṃ durghe cidā susaraṇam eṣā cidasmādaśaniḥ paro nu sāsredhantī vi naśyatu

translations.griffith: E’en on the plain for him ye make a sloping path, an easy way where road is none:  And far away from him the ineffectual shaft must vanish, shot at him in vain.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य सूर्य उद्यति परियक्षत्रा रतं दध यन निम्रुचि परबुधि विश्ववेदसो यद वा मध्यन्दिने दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya sūrya udyati priyakṣatrā ṛtaṃ dadha yan nimruci prabudhi viśvavedaso yad vā madhyandine divaḥ

translations.griffith: If ye appoint the rite to-day, kind Rulers, when the Sun ascends,  Lords of all wealth, at sunset or at wakingtime, or be it at the noon of day,

verses.sanskrit: यद वाभिपित्वे असुरा रतं यते छर्दिर्येम वि दाशुषे वयं तद वो वसवो विश्ववेदस उप सथेयाम मध्य आ |||
verses.transliteration: yad vābhipitve asurā ṛtaṃ yate chardiryema vi dāśuṣe vayaṃ tad vo vasavo viśvavedasa upa stheyāma madhya ā

translations.griffith: Or, Asuras, when ye have sheltered the worshipper who goes to sacrifice, at eve  may we, O Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, come then into the midst of You.

verses.sanskrit: यदद्य सूर उदिते यन मध्यन्दिन आतुचि वामं धत्थ मनवे विश्ववेदसो जुह्वानाय परचेतसे |||
verses.transliteration: yadadya sūra udite yan madhyandina ātuci vāmaṃ dhattha manave viśvavedaso juhvānāya pracetase

translations.griffith: If ye to-day at sunrise, or at noon, or in the gloom of eve,  Lords of all riches, give fair treasure to the man, the wise man who hath sacrificed,

verses.sanskrit: वयं तद वः सम्राज आ वर्णीमहे पुत्रो न बहुपाय्यम अश्याम तदादित्या जुह्वतो हविर्येन वस्यो.अनशामहै |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ tad vaḥ samrāja ā vṛṇīmahe putro na bahupāyyam aśyāma tadādityā juhvato haviryena vasyo.anaśāmahai

translations.griffith: Then we, imperial Rulers, claim of you this boon, your wide protection, as a son.  May we, Ādityas, offering holy gifts, obtain that which shall bring us greater bliss.

verses.sanskrit: ये तरिंशति तरयस परो देवासो बर्हिरासदन विदन्नहद्वितासनन |||
verses.transliteration: ye triṃśati trayas paro devāso barhirāsadan vidannahadvitāsanan

translations.griffith: THE Thirty Gods and Three besides, whose seat hath been the sacred grass,  From time of old have found and gained.

verses.sanskrit: वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा समद्रातिषाचो अग्नयः पत्नीवन्तो वषट्क्र्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: varuṇo mitro aryamā smadrātiṣāco aghnayaḥ patnīvanto vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ

translations.griffith: Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Agnis, with Consorts, sending boons,  To whom our Vaṣaṭ! is addressed:

verses.sanskrit: ते नो गोपा अपाच्यास्त उदक त इत्था नयक पुरस्तात सर्वया विशा |||
verses.transliteration: te no ghopā apācyāsta udak ta itthā nyak purastāt sarvayā viśā

translations.griffith: These are our guardians in the west, and northward here, and in the south,  And on the cast, with all the tribe.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वशन्ति देवास्तथेदसत तदेषां नकिरा मिनत अरावा चन मर्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā vaśanti devāstathedasat tadeṣāṃ nakirā minat arāvā cana martyaḥ

translations.griffith: Even as the Gods desire so verily shall it be. None minisheth this power of theirs,  No demon, and no mortal

verses.sanskrit: सप्तानां सप्त रष्टयः सप्त दयुम्नान्येषाम सप्तो अधि शरियो धिरे |||
verses.transliteration: saptānāṃ sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnānyeṣām sapto adhi śriyo dhire

translations.griffith: The Seven carry seven spears; seven are the splendours they possess,  And seven the glories they assume.

verses.sanskrit: बभ्रुरेको विषुणः सूनरो युवाञ्ज्यङकते हिरण्ययम ||
verses.transliteration: babhrureko viṣuṇaḥ sūnaro yuvāñjyaṅkte hiraṇyayam

translations.griffith: ONE is a youth brown, active, manifold he decks the golden one with ornament.

verses.sanskrit: योनिमेक आ ससाद दयोतनो.अन्तर्देवेषु मेधिरः ||
verses.transliteration: yonimeka ā sasāda dyotano.antardeveṣu medhiraḥ

translations.griffith: Another, luminous, occupies the place of sacritice, Sage, among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: वाशीमेको बिभर्ति हस्त आयसीमन्तर्देवेषु निध्रुविः ||
verses.transliteration: vāśīmeko bibharti hasta āyasīmantardeveṣu nidhruviḥ

translations.griffith: One brandishes in his hand an iron knife, firm, in his seat amid the Deities.

verses.sanskrit: वज्रमेको बिभर्ति हस्त आहितं तेन वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते ||
verses.transliteration: vajrameko bibharti hasta āhitaṃ tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate

translations.griffith: Another holds the thunderbolt, wherewith he slays the Vṛtras, resting in his hand.

verses.sanskrit: तिग्ममेको बिभर्ति हस्त आयुधं शुचिरुग्रो जलाषभेषजः ||
verses.transliteration: tighmameko bibharti hasta āyudhaṃ śucirughro jalāṣabheṣajaḥ

translations.griffith: Another bears a pointed weapon: bright is he, and strong, with healing medicines.

verses.sanskrit: पथ एकः पीपाय तस्करो यथा एष वेद निधीनाम ||
verses.transliteration: patha ekaḥ pīpāya taskaro yathā eṣa veda nidhīnām

translations.griffith: Another, thief-like, watches well the ways, and knows the places where the treasures lie.

verses.sanskrit: तरीण्येक उरुगायो वि चक्रमे यत्र देवासो मदन्ति ||
verses.transliteration: trīṇyeka urughāyo vi cakrame yatra devāso madanti

translations.griffith: Another with his mighty stride hath made his three steps thither where the Gods rejoice.

verses.sanskrit: विभिर्द्वा चरत एकया सह पर परवासेव वसतः ||
verses.transliteration: vibhirdvā carata ekayā saha pra pravāseva vasataḥ

translations.griffith: Two with one Dame ride on with winged steeds, and journey forth like travellers on their way.

verses.sanskrit: सदो दवा चक्राते उपमा दिवि सम्राजा सर्पिरासुती ||
verses.transliteration: sado dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpirāsutī

translations.griffith: Two, highest, in the heavens have set their seat, worshipped with holy oil, imperial Kings.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चन्त एके महि साम मन्वत तेन सूर्यमरोचयन ||
verses.transliteration: arcanta eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryamarocayan

translations.griffith: Some, singing lauds, conceived the Sāma-hymn, great hymn whereby they caused the Sun to shine.

verses.sanskrit: नहि वो अस्त्यर्भको देवासो न कुमारकः विश्वे सतोमहान्त इत |||
verses.transliteration: nahi vo astyarbhako devāso na kumārakaḥ viśve satomahānta it

translations.griffith: NOT one of you, ye Gods, is small, none of you is a feeble child:  All of you, verily, are great.

verses.sanskrit: इति सतुतासो असथा रिशादसो ये सथ तरयश्च तरिंशच्च मनोर्देवा यज्ञियासः |||
verses.transliteration: iti stutāso asathā riśādaso ye stha trayaśca triṃśacca manordevā yajñiyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Thus be ye lauded, ye destroyers of the foe, ye Three-and-Thirty Deities,  The Gods of man, the Holy Ones.

verses.sanskrit: ते नस्त्राध्वं ते.अवत त उ नो अधि वोचत मा नः पथः पित्र्यान मानवादधि दूरं नैष्ट परावतः |||
verses.transliteration: te nastrādhvaṃ te.avata ta u no adhi vocata mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryān mānavādadhi dūraṃ naiṣṭa parāvataḥ

translations.griffith: As such defend and succour us, with benedictions speak to us:  Lead us not from our fathers' and from Manu's path into the distance far away.

verses.sanskrit: ये देवास इह सथन विश्वे वैश्वानरा उत अस्मभ्यं शर्म सप्रथो गवे.अश्वाय यछत |||
verses.transliteration: ye devāsa iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarā uta asmabhyaṃ śarma sapratho ghave.aśvāya yachata

translations.griffith: Ye Deities who stay with us, and all ye Gods of all mankind,  Give us your wide protection, give shelter for cattle and for steed.

verses.sanskrit: यो यजाति यजात इत सुनवच्च पचाति च बरह्मेदिन्द्रस्यचाकनत |||
verses.transliteration: yo yajāti yajāta it sunavacca pacāti ca brahmedindrasyacākanat

translations.griffith: THAT Brahman pleases Indra well, who worships, sacrifices, pours Libation, and prepares the meal.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळाशं यो अस्मै सोमं ररत आशिरम पादित तं शक्रो अंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ yo asmai somaṃ rarata āśiram pādit taṃ śakro aṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Śakra protects from woe the man who gives him sacrificial cake.  And offers Soma blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य दयुमानसद रथो देवजूतः स शूशुवत विश्वा वन्वन्नमित्रिया |||
verses.transliteration: tasya dyumānasad ratho devajūtaḥ sa śūśuvat viśvā vanvannamitriyā

translations.griffith: His chariot shall be glorious, sped by Gods, and mighty shall he be,  Subduing all hostilities.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य परजावती गर्हे.असश्चन्ती दिवे-दिवे इळा धेनुमती दुहे |||
verses.transliteration: asya prajāvatī ghṛhe.asaścantī dive-dive iḷā dhenumatī duhe

translations.griffith: Each day that passes, in his house flows his libation, rich in milk,  Exhaustless, bringing progeny.

verses.sanskrit: या दम्पती समनसा सुनुत आ च धावतः देवासो नित्ययाशिरा |||
verses.transliteration: yā dampatī samanasā sunuta ā ca dhāvataḥ devāso nityayāśirā

translations.griffith: O Gods, with constant draught of milk, husband and wife with one accord  Press out and wash the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: परति पराशव्यानितः सम्यञ्चा बर्हिराशाते न ता वाजेषु वायतः |||
verses.transliteration: prati prāśavyānitaḥ samyañcā barhirāśāte na tā vājeṣu vāyataḥ

translations.griffith: They gain sufficient food: they come united to the sacred grass,  And never do they fail in strength.

verses.sanskrit: न देवानामपि हनुतः सुमतिं न जुगुक्षतः शरवो बर्हद विवासतः |||
verses.transliteration: na devānāmapi hnutaḥ sumatiṃ na jughukṣataḥ śravo bṛhad vivāsataḥ

translations.griffith: Never do they deny or seek to hide the favour of the Gods:  They win high glory for themselves.

verses.sanskrit: पुत्रिणा ता कुमारिणा विश्वमायुर्व्यश्नुतः उभा हिरण्यपेशसा |||
verses.transliteration: putriṇā tā kumāriṇā viśvamāyurvyaśnutaḥ ubhā hiraṇyapeśasā

translations.griffith: With sons and daughters by their side they reach their full extent of life,  Both decked with ornaments of gold.

verses.sanskrit: वीतिहोत्रा कर्तद्वसू दशस्यन्ताम्र्ताय कम समुधो रोमशं हतो देवेषू कर्णुतो दुवः |||
