verses.transliteration: vītihotrā kṛtadvasū daśasyantāmṛtāya kam samudho romaśaṃ hato deveṣū kṛṇuto duvaḥ

translations.griffith: Serving the Immortal One with gifts of sacrificial meal and wealth,  They satisfy the claims of love and pay due honour to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ शर्म पर्वतानां वर्णीमहे नदीनाम आ विष्णोः सचाभुवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā śarma parvatānāṃ vṛṇīmahe nadīnām ā viṣṇoḥ sacābhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: We claim protection from the Hills, we claim protection of the Floods,  Of him who stands by Viṣṇu's side.

verses.sanskrit: ऐतु पूषा रयिर्भगः सवस्ति सर्वधातमः उरुरध्वा सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: aitu pūṣā rayirbhaghaḥ svasti sarvadhātamaḥ ururadhvā svastaye

translations.griffith: May Pūṣan come, and Bhaga, Lord of wealth, All-bounteous, for our weal  Broad be the path that leads to bliss:

verses.sanskrit: अरमतिरनर्वणो विश्वो देवस्य मनसा आदित्यानामनेहैत |||
verses.transliteration: aramatiranarvaṇo viśvo devasya manasā ādityānāmanehait

translations.griffith: Aramati, and, free from foes, Visva with spirit of a God,  And the Ādityas’ peerless might.

verses.sanskrit: यथा नो मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणः सन्ति गोपाः सुगा रतस्यपन्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā no mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ santi ghopāḥ sughā ṛtasyapanthāḥ

translations.griffith: Seeing that Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa are guarding us,  The paths of Law are fair to tread.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं वः पूर्व्यं गिरा देवमीळे वसूनाम सपर्यन्तःपुरुप्रियं मित्रं न कषेत्रसाधसम |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ vaḥ pūrvyaṃ ghirā devamīḷe vasūnām saparyantaḥpurupriyaṃ mitraṃ na kṣetrasādhasam

translations.griffith: I glorify with song, for wealth, Agni the God, the first of you.  We honour as a well-loved Friend the God who prospereth our fields.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू देववतो रथः शूरो वा पर्त्सु कासु चित देवानां य इन मनो यजमान इयक्षत्यभीदयज्वनो भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū devavato rathaḥ śūro vā pṛtsu kāsu cit devānāṃ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣatyabhīdayajvano bhuvat

translations.griffith: As in all frays the hero, so swift moves his car whom Gods attend.  The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.

verses.sanskrit: न यजमान रिष्यसि न सुन्वान न देवयो देवानां य इन मनो ... |||
verses.transliteration: na yajamāna riṣyasi na sunvāna na devayo devānāṃ ya in mano ...

translations.griffith: Ne’er are ye injured, worshipper, presser of juice, or pious man.  The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.

verses.sanskrit: नकिष टं कर्मणा नशन न पर योषन न योषति देवानां य इन मनो ... |||
verses.transliteration: nakiṣ ṭaṃ karmaṇā naśan na pra yoṣan na yoṣati devānāṃ ya in mano ...

translations.griffith: None in his action equals him, none holds him far or keeps him off.  The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.

verses.sanskrit: असदत्र सुवीर्यमुत तयदाश्वश्व्यम देवानां य इन्मनो ... |||
verses.transliteration: asadatra suvīryamuta tyadāśvaśvyam devānāṃ ya inmano ...

translations.griffith: Such strength of heroes shall be his, such mastery of fleet-foot steeds.  The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.

verses.sanskrit: पर कर्तान्य रजीषिणः कण्वा इन्द्रस्य गाथया मदे सोमस्य वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: pra kṛtāny ṛjīṣiṇaḥ kaṇvā indrasya ghāthayā made somasya vocata

translations.griffith: KANVAS, tell forth with song the deeds of Indra, the Impetuous,  Wrought in the Soma's wild delight.

verses.sanskrit: यः सर्बिन्दमनर्शनिं पिप्रुं दासमहीशुवम वधीदुग्रो रिणन्नपः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sṛbindamanarśaniṃ pipruṃ dāsamahīśuvam vadhīdughro riṇannapaḥ

translations.griffith: Strong God, he slew Anarsani, Srbinda, Pipru, and the fiend,  Ahīśuva, and loosed the floods.

verses.sanskrit: नयर्बुदस्य विष्टपं वर्ष्माणं बर्हतस्तिर कर्षे तदिन्द्र पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: nyarbudasya viṣṭapaṃ varṣmāṇaṃ bṛhatastira kṛṣe tadindra pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: Thou broughtest down the dwelling-place, the height of lofty Arbuda.  That exploit, Indra, must be famed.

verses.sanskrit: परति शरुताय वो धर्षत तूर्णाशं न गिरेरधि हुवेसुशिप्रमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: prati śrutāya vo dhṛṣat tūrṇāśaṃ na ghireradhi huvesuśipramūtaye

translations.griffith: Bold, to your famous Soma I call the fair-visored God for aid,  Down like a torrent from the hill.

verses.sanskrit: स गोरश्वस्य वि वरजं मन्दानः सोम्येभ्यः पुरं नशूर दर्षसि |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghoraśvasya vi vrajaṃ mandānaḥ somyebhyaḥ puraṃ naśūra darṣasi

translations.griffith: Rejoicing in the Soma-draughts, Hero, burst open, like a fort,  The stall of horses and of kine.

verses.sanskrit: यदि मे रारणः सुत उक्थे वा दधसे चनः आरादुपस्वधा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yadi me rāraṇaḥ suta ukthe vā dadhase canaḥ ārādupasvadhā ghahi

translations.griffith: If my libation gladdens, if thou takest pleasure in my laud,  Come with thy Godhead from afar.

verses.sanskrit: वयं घा ते अपि षमसि सतोतार इन्द्र गिर्वणः तवं नो जिन्व सोमपाः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ ghā te api ṣmasi stotāra indra ghirvaṇaḥ tvaṃ no jinva somapāḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, Lover of the Song, the singers of thy praise are we:  O Soma-drinker, quicken us.

verses.sanskrit: उत नः पितुमा भर संरराणो अविक्षितम मघवन भूरि ते वसु |||
verses.transliteration: uta naḥ pitumā bhara saṃrarāṇo avikṣitam maghavan bhūri te vasu

translations.griffith: And, taking thy delight with us bring us still undiminished food:  Great is thy wealth, O Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोमतस कर्धि हिरण्यवतो अश्विनः इळाभिः सं रभेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghomatas kṛdhi hiraṇyavato aśvinaḥ iḷābhiḥ saṃ rabhemahi

translations.griffith: Make thou us rich in herds of kine, in steeds, in gold: let us exert  Our strength in sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit: बर्बदुक्थं हवामहे सर्प्रकरस्नमूतये साधु कर्ण्वन्तमवसे |||
verses.transliteration: bṛbadukthaṃ havāmahe sṛprakarasnamūtaye sādhu kṛṇvantamavase

translations.griffith: Let us call him to aid whose hands stretch far, to whom high laud is due.  Who worketh well to succour us.

verses.sanskrit: यः संस्थे चिच्छतक्रतुरादीं कर्णोति वर्त्रहा जरित्र्भ्यः पुरूवसुः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ saṃsthe cicchatakraturādīṃ kṛṇoti vṛtrahā jaritṛbhyaḥ purūvasuḥ

translations.griffith: He, Śatakratu, even in fight acts as a Vṛtra-slayer s,till:  He gives his worshippers much wealth.

verses.sanskrit: स नः शक्रश्चिदा शकद दानवानन्तराभरः इन्द्रोविश्वाभिरूतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ śakraścidā śakad dānavānantarābharaḥ indroviśvābhirūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: May he, this A;akra, strengthen us, Boon God who satisfies our needs,  Indra, with all lhis saving helps.

verses.sanskrit: यो रायो.अवनिर्महान सुपारः सुन्वतः सखा तमिन्द्रमभि गायत |||
verses.transliteration: yo rāyo.avanirmahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā tamindramabhi ghāyata

translations.griffith: To him, the mighty stream of wealth, the Soma-presser's rescuing Friend,  To Indra sing your song of praise;

verses.sanskrit: आयन्तारं महि सथिरं पर्तनासु शरवोजितम भूरेरीशानमोजसा |||
verses.transliteration: āyantāraṃ mahi sthiraṃ pṛtanāsu śravojitam bhūrerīśānamojasā

translations.griffith: Who bringeth what is great and firm, who winneth glory in his wars,  Lord of vast wealth through power and might.

verses.sanskrit: नकिरस्य शचीनां नियन्ता सून्र्तानाम नकिर्वक्ता नदादिति |||
verses.transliteration: nakirasya śacīnāṃ niyantā sūnṛtānām nakirvaktā nadāditi

translations.griffith: There liveth none to cheek or stay his energies and gracious deeds:  None who can say, He giveth not.

verses.sanskrit: न नूनं बरह्मणां रणं पराशूनामस्ति सुन्वताम न सोमो अप्रता पपे |||
verses.transliteration: na nūnaṃ brahmaṇāṃ ṛṇaṃ prāśūnāmasti sunvatām na somo apratā pape

translations.griffith: No debt is due by Brahmans now, by active men who press the juice:  Well hath each Soma-draught been paid.

verses.sanskrit: पन्य इदुप गायत पन्य उक्थानि शंसत बरह्मा कर्णोतपन्य इत |||
verses.transliteration: panya idupa ghāyata panya ukthāni śaṃsata brahmā kṛṇotapanya it

translations.griffith: Sing ye to him who must be praised, say lauds to him who must be praised,  Bring prayer to him who must be praised.

verses.sanskrit: पन्य आ दर्दिरच्छता सहस्रा वाज्यव्र्तः इन्द्रो यो यज्वनो वर्धः |||
verses.transliteration: panya ā dardiracchatā sahasrā vājyavṛtaḥ indro yo yajvano vṛdhaḥ

translations.griffith: May be, unchecked, strong, meet for praise, bring hundreds, thousands forth to light,  Indra who aids the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: वि षू चर सवधा अनु कर्ष्टीनामन्वाहुवः इन्द्र पिब सुतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣū cara svadhā anu kṛṣṭīnāmanvāhuvaḥ indra piba sutānām

translations.griffith: Go with thy God-like nature forth, go where the folk are calling thee:  Drink, Indra, of the drops we pour.

verses.sanskrit: पिब सवधैनवानामुत यस्तुग्र्ये सचा उतायमिन्द्र यस्तव |||
verses.transliteration: piba svadhainavānāmuta yastughrye sacā utāyamindra yastava

translations.griffith: Drink milky draughts which are thine own, this too which was with Tugrya once,  This is it, Indra, that is thine.

verses.sanskrit: अतीहि मन्युषाविणं सुषुवांसमुपारणे इमं रातंसुतं पिब |||
verses.transliteration: atīhi manyuṣāviṇaṃ suṣuvāṃsamupāraṇe imaṃ rātaṃsutaṃ piba

translations.griffith: Pass him who psours libations out in angry mood or after sin:  Here drink the juice we offer thee.

verses.sanskrit: इहि तिस्रः परावत इहि पञ्च जनानति धेना इन्द्रावचाकशत |||
verses.transliteration: ihi tisraḥ parāvata ihi pañca janānati dhenā indrāvacākaśat

translations.griffith: Over the three great distances, past the Five Peoples go thy way,  O Indra, noticing our voice.

verses.sanskrit: सूर्यो रश्मिं यथा सर्जा तवा यछन्तु मे गिरः निम्नमापो न सध्र्यक |||
verses.transliteration: sūryo raśmiṃ yathā sṛjā tvā yachantu me ghiraḥ nimnamāpo na sadhryak

translations.griffith: Send forth thy ray like Sūrya: let my songs attract thee hitherward,  Like waters gathering to the vale.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवा तु हि षिञ्च सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे भरासुतस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavā tu hi ṣiñca somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe bharāsutasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Now to the Hero fair of cheek, Adhvaryu, pour the Soma forth:  Bring of the juice that he may drink

verses.sanskrit: य उद्नः फलिगं भिनन नयक सिन्धून्रवास्र्जत यो गोषुपक्वं धारयत |||
verses.transliteration: ya udnaḥ phalighaṃ bhinan nyak sindhūnravāsṛjat yo ghoṣupakvaṃ dhārayat

translations.griffith: Who cleft the water-cloud in twain, loosed rivers for their downward flow,  And set the ripe milk in the kine.

verses.sanskrit: अहन वर्त्रं रचीषम और्णवाभमहीशुवम हिमेनाविध्यदर्बुदम |||
verses.transliteration: ahan vṛtraṃ ṛcīṣama aurṇavābhamahīśuvam himenāvidhyadarbudam

translations.griffith: He, meet for praise, slew Vṛtra, slew Ahīśuva, Urnavabha's son,  And pierced th:rough Arbuda with frost.

verses.sanskrit: पर व उग्राय निष्टुरे.अषाळ्हाय परसक्षिणे देवत्तं बरह्म गायत |||
verses.transliteration: pra va ughrāya niṣṭure.aṣāḷhāya prasakṣiṇe devattaṃ brahma ghāyata

translations.griffith: To him your matchless Mighty One, unconquerable Conqueror,  Sing forth the prayer which Gods have given:

verses.sanskrit: यो विश्वान्यभि वरता सोमस्य मदे अन्धसः इन्द्रो देवेषु चेतति |||
verses.transliteration: yo viśvānyabhi vratā somasya made andhasaḥ indro deveṣu cetati

translations.griffith: Indra, who in the wild delight of Soma juice considers here  All holy Laws among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: इह तया सधमाद्या हरी हिरण्यकेश्या वोळ्हामभि परयो हितम |||
verses.transliteration: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇyakeśyā voḷhāmabhi prayo hitam

translations.griffith: Hither let these thy Bays who share thy banquet, Steeds with golden manes,  Convey thee to the feast prepared.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चं तवा पुरुष्टुत परियमेधस्तुता हरी सोमपेयायवक्षतः |||
verses.transliteration: arvāñcaṃ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī somapeyāyavakṣataḥ

translations.griffith: Hither, O thou whom many laud, the Bays whom Priyamedha praised,  Shall bring thee to the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit: वयं घ तवा सुतावन्त आपो न वर्क्तबर्हिषः पवित्रस्यप्रस्रवणेषु वर्त्रहन परि सतोतार आसते |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ pavitrasyaprasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate

translations.griffith: WE compass thee like waters, we whose grass is trimmed and Soma pressed.  Here where the filter pours its stream, thy worshippers round thee, O Vṛtra-slayer, sit.

verses.sanskrit: सवरन्ति तवा सुते नरो वसो निरेक उक्थिनः कदा सुतं तर्षाण ओक आ गम इन्द्र सवब्दीव वंसगः |||
verses.transliteration: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ kadā sutaṃ tṛṣāṇa oka ā ghama indra svabdīva vaṃsaghaḥ

translations.griffith: Men, Vasu! by the Soma, with lauds call thee to the foremost place:  When comest thou athirst unto the juice as home, O Indra, like a bellowing bull?

verses.sanskrit: कण्वेभिर्ध्र्ष्णवा धर्षद वाजं दर्षि सहस्रिणम पिशङगरूपं मघवन विचर्षणे मक्षू गोमन्तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: kaṇvebhirdhṛṣṇavā dhṛṣad vājaṃ darṣi sahasriṇam piśaṅgharūpaṃ maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū ghomantamīmahe

translations.griffith: Boldly, Bold Hero, bring us spoil in thousands for the Kaṇvas' sake.  O active Maghavan, with eager prayer we crave the yellow-hued with store ol kine.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि गायान्धसो मद इन्द्राय मेध्यातिथे यः सम्मिश्लोहर्योर्यः सुते सचा वज्री रथो हिरण्ययः |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi ghāyāndhaso mada indrāya medhyātithe yaḥ sammiśloharyoryaḥ sute sacā vajrī ratho hiraṇyayaḥ

translations.griffith: Medhyātithi, to Indra sing, drink of the juice to make thee glad.  Close-knit to his Bay Steeds, bolt-armed, beside the juice is he: his chariot is of gold.

verses.sanskrit: यः सुषव्यः सुदक्षिण इनो यः सुक्रतुर्ग्र्णे य आकरः सहस्रा यः शतामघ इन्द्रो यः पूर्भिदारितः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ suṣavyaḥ sudakṣiṇa ino yaḥ sukraturghṛṇe ya ākaraḥ sahasrā yaḥ śatāmagha indro yaḥ pūrbhidāritaḥ

translations.griffith: He Who is praised as strong of hand both right and left, most wise and hold:  Indra who, rich in hundreds, gathers thousands up, honoured as breaker-down of forts.

verses.sanskrit: यो धर्षितो यो.अव्र्तो यो अस्ति शमश्रुषु शरितः विभूतद्युम्नश्च्यवनः पुरुष्टुतः करत्वा गौरिव शाकिनः |||
verses.transliteration: yo dhṛṣito yo.avṛto yo asti śmaśruṣu śritaḥ vibhūtadyumnaścyavanaḥ puruṣṭutaḥ kratvā ghauriva śākinaḥ

translations.griffith: The bold of heart whom none provokes, who stands in bearded confidence;  Much-lauded, very glorious, overthrowing foes, strong Helper, like a bull with might.

verses.sanskrit: क ईं वेद सुते सचा पिबन्तं कद वयो दधे अयं यःपुरो विभिनत्त्योजसा मन्दानः शिप्र्यन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kad vayo dadhe ayaṃ yaḥpuro vibhinattyojasā mandānaḥ śipryandhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Who knows what vital ower he wins, drinking beside the flowing juice?  This is the fair-checked God who, joying in the draught, breaks down the castles in his strength.

verses.sanskrit: दाना मर्गो न वारणः पुरुत्रा चरथं दधे नकिष टवा नि यमदा सुते गमो महांश्चरस्योजसा |||
verses.transliteration: dānā mṛgho na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṃ dadhe nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamadā sute ghamo mahāṃścarasyojasā

translations.griffith: As a wild elephant rushes on this way and that way, mad with heat,'  None may compel thee, yet come hither to the draught: thou movest mighty in thy power.

verses.sanskrit: य उग्रः सन्ननिष्ट्र्त सथिरो रणाय संस्क्र्तः यदि सतोतुर्मघवा शर्णवद धवं नेन्द्रो योषत्या गमत |||
verses.transliteration: ya ughraḥ sannaniṣṭṛta sthiro raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ yadi stoturmaghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṃ nendro yoṣatyā ghamat

translations.griffith: When he, the Mighty, ne’er o’erthrown, steadfast, made ready for the fight,  When Indra Maghavan lists to his praiser's call, he will not stand aloof, but come.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यमित्था वर्षेदसि वर्षजूतिर्नो.अव्र्तः वर्षा हयुग्र शर्ण्विषे परावति वर्षो अर्वावति शरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: satyamitthā vṛṣedasi vṛṣajūtirno.avṛtaḥ vṛṣā hyughra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣo arvāvati śrutaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, verily, thou art a Bull, with a bull's rush. whom none may stay:  Thou Mighty One, art celebrated as a Bull, famed as a Bull both near and far.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षणस्ते अभीशवो वर्षा कशा हिरण्ययी वर्षा रथो मघवन वर्षणा हरी वर्षा तवं सतक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣaṇaste abhīśavo vṛṣā kaśā hiraṇyayī vṛṣā ratho maghavan vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvaṃ satakrato

translations.griffith: Thy reins are very bulls in strength, bulls' strength is in thy golden whip.  Thy car, O Maghavan, thy Bays are strong as bulls: thou, Śatakratu, art a Bull.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा सोता सुनोतु ते वर्षन्न्र्जीपिन्ना भर वर्षा दधन्वे वर्षणं नदीष्वा तुभ्यं सथातर्हरीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā sotā sunotu te vṛṣannṛjīpinnā bhara vṛṣā dadhanve vṛṣaṇaṃ nadīṣvā tubhyaṃ sthātarharīṇām

translations.griffith: Let the strong presser press for thee. Bring hither, thou straight-rushing Bull.  The mighty makes the mighty run in flowing streams for thee whom thy Bay Horses bear.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्र याहि पीतये मधु शविष्ठ सोम्यम नायमछा मघवा शर्णवद गिरो बरह्मोक्था च सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: endra yāhi pītaye madhu śaviṣṭha somyam nāyamachā maghavā śṛṇavad ghiro brahmokthā ca sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Come, thou most potent Indra, come to drink the savoury Soma juice.  Maghavan, very wise, will quickly come to hear the songs, the prayer, the hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: वहन्तु तवा रथेष्ठामा हरयो रथयुजः तिरश्चिदर्यं सवनानि वर्त्रहन्नन्येषां या शतक्रतो |||
verses.transliteration: vahantu tvā ratheṣṭhāmā harayo rathayujaḥ tiraścidaryaṃ savanāni vṛtrahannanyeṣāṃ yā śatakrato

translations.griffith: When thou hast mounted on thy car let thy yoked Bay Steeds carry thee,  Past other men's libations, Lord of Hundred Powers, thee, Vṛtra-slayer, thee our Friend.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकमद्यान्तमं सतोमं धिष्व महामह अस्माकं ते सवना सन्तु शन्तमा मदाय दयुक्ष सोमपाः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākamadyāntamaṃ stomaṃ dhiṣva mahāmaha asmākaṃ te savanā santu śantamā madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ

translations.griffith: O thou Most Lofty One, accept our laud as nearest to thine heart.  May our libations be most sweet to make thee glad, O Soma-drinker, Heavenly Lord.

verses.sanskrit: नहि षस्तव नो मम शास्त्रे अन्यस्य रण्यति यो अस्मान्वीर आनयत |||
verses.transliteration: nahi ṣastava no mama śāstre anyasya raṇyati yo asmānvīra ānayat

translations.griffith: Neither in thy decree nor mine, but in another's he delights,—  The man who brought us unto this.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रश्चिद घा तदब्रवीत सत्रिया अशास्यं मनः उतो अह करतुं रघुम |||
verses.transliteration: indraścid ghā tadabravīt striyā aśāsyaṃ manaḥ uto aha kratuṃ raghum

translations.griffith: Indra himself hath said, The mind of woman brooks not discipline,  Her intellect hath little weight.

verses.sanskrit: सप्ती चिद घा मदच्युता मिथुना वहतो रथम एवेद धूर्व्र्ष्ण उत्तरा |||
verses.transliteration: saptī cid ghā madacyutā mithunā vahato ratham eved dhūrvṛṣṇa uttarā

translations.griffith: His pair of horses, rushing on in their wild transport, draw his car:  High-lifted is the stallion's yoke.

verses.sanskrit: अधः पश्यस्व मोपरि सन्तरां पादकौ हर मा ते कषप्लकौ दर्शन सत्री हि बरह्मा बभूविथ |||
verses.transliteration: adhaḥ paśyasva mopari santarāṃ pādakau hara mā te kaṣaplakau dṛśan strī hi brahmā babhūvitha

translations.griffith: Cast down thine eyes and look not up. More closely set thy feet. Let none  See what thy garment veils, for thou, a Brahman, hast become a dame.

verses.sanskrit: एन्द्र याहि हरिभिरुप कण्वस्य सुष्टुतिम दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो |||
verses.transliteration: endra yāhi haribhirupa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim divo amuṣya śāsato divaṃ yaya divāvaso

translations.griffith: Come hither, Indra, with thy Bays, come thou to Kaṇva's eulogy.  Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा गरावा वदन्निह सोमी घोषेण यछतु दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā ghrāvā vadanniha somī ghoṣeṇa yachatu divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: May the stone draw thee as it speaks, the Soma-stone with ringing voice.  Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रा वि नेमिरेषामुरां न धूनुते वर्कः दिवो अमुष्य... |||
verses.transliteration: atrā vi nemireṣāmurāṃ na dhūnute vṛkaḥ divo amuṣya...

translations.griffith: The stones' rim shakes the Soma here like a wolf worrying a sheep.  Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा कण्वा इहावसे हवन्ते वाजसातये दिवो अमुष्य .. . |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā kaṇvā ihāvase havante vājasātaye divo amuṣya .. .

translations.griffith: The Kaṇvas call thee hitherward for succour and to win the spoil.  Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: दधामि ते सुतानां वर्ष्णे न पूर्वपाय्यम दिवो अमुष्य... |||
verses.transliteration: dadhāmi te sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe na pūrvapāyyam divo amuṣya...

translations.griffith: I set for thee, as for the Strong, the first draught of the juices shed.

verses.sanskrit: समत्पुरन्धिर्न आ गहि विश्वतोधीर्न ऊतये दिवो अमुष्य... |||
verses.transliteration: smatpurandhirna ā ghahi viśvatodhīrna ūtaye divo amuṣya...

translations.griffith: Come with abundant blessings, come with perfect care to succour us.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो याहि महेमते सहस्रोते शतामघ दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yāhi mahemate sahasrote śatāmagha divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Come, Lord of lofty thought, who hast infinite wealth and countless aids.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा होता मनुर्हितो देवत्रा वक्षदीड्यः दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā hotā manurhito devatrā vakṣadīḍyaḥ divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Adorable mid Gods, the Priest good to mankind shall bring thee near.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा मदच्युता हरी शयेनं पक्षेव वक्षतः दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā madacyutā harī śyenaṃ pakṣeva vakṣataḥ divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: As wings the falcon, so thy Bays rushing in joy shall carry thee.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्यर्य आ परि सवाहा सोमस्य पीतये दिवो अमुष्य... |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhyarya ā pari svāhā somasya pītaye divo amuṣya...

translations.griffith: Come from the enemy to us, to svaha and the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो याह्युपश्रुत्युक्थेषु रणया इह दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yāhyupaśrutyuktheṣu raṇayā iha divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Come hither with thine car inclined to hear, take pleasure in our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: सरूपैरा सु नो गहि सम्भ्र्तैः सम्भ्र्ताश्वः दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: sarūpairā su no ghahi sambhṛtaiḥ sambhṛtāśvaḥ divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Lord of well-nourished Horses, come with well-fed Steeds alike in hue.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि पर्वतेभ्यः समुद्रस्याधि विष्टपः दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi parvatebhyaḥ samudrasyādhi viṣṭapaḥ divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Come hither from the mountains, come from regions of the sea of air.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गव्यान्यश्व्या सहस्रा शूर दर्द्र्हि दिवो अमुष्य .. . |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghavyānyaśvyā sahasrā śūra dardṛhi divo amuṣya .. .

translations.griffith: Disclose to us O Hero, wealth in thousands both of kine and steeds.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सहस्रशो भरायुतानि शतानि च दिवो अमुष्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ sahasraśo bharāyutāni śatāni ca divo amuṣya ...

translations.griffith: Bring riches hitherward to us in hundreds, thousands, myriads.  Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ यदिन्द्रश्च दद्वहे सहस्रं वसुरोचिषः ओजिष्ठमश्व्यं पशुम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yadindraśca dadvahe sahasraṃ vasurociṣaḥ ojiṣṭhamaśvyaṃ paśum

translations.griffith: The thousand steeds, the mightiest troop, which we and Indra have received  From Vasurocis as a gift,

verses.sanskrit: य रज्रा वातरंहसो.अरुषासो रघुष्यदः भराजन्ते सूर्या इव |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛjrā vātaraṃhaso.aruṣāso raghuṣyadaḥ bhrājante sūryā iva

translations.griffith: The brown that match the wind in speed, and bright bay coursers fleet of foot,  Like Suns, resplendent are they all.

verses.sanskrit: पारावतस्य रातिषु दरवच्चक्रेष्वाशुषु तिष्ठं वनस्य मध्य आ |||
verses.transliteration: pārāvatasya rātiṣu dravaccakreṣvāśuṣu tiṣṭhaṃ vanasya madhya ā

translations.griffith: Mid the Pargvata's rich gifts, swift steeds whose wheels run rapidly,  I seemed to stand amid a wood.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निनेन्द्रेण वरुणेन विष्णुनादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं पिबतमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: aghninendreṇa varuṇena viṣṇunādityai rudrairvasubhiḥ sacābhuvā sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ pibatamaśvinā

translations.griffith: WITH Agni and with Indra, Viṣṇu. Varuṇa, with the Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, closely leagued;  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वाभिर्धीभिर्भुवनेन वाजिना दिवा पर्थिव्याद्रिभिः सचाभुवा सजोषसा उषसा ... |||
verses.transliteration: viśvābhirdhībhirbhuvanena vājinā divā pṛthivyādribhiḥ sacābhuvā sajoṣasā uṣasā ...

translations.griffith: With all the Holy Thoughts, all being Mighty Ones! in close alliance wil the Mountains, Heaven, and Earth;  Accordant. of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वैर्देवैस्त्रिभिरेकादशैरिहाद्भिर्मरुद्भिर्भ्र्गुभिः सचाभुवा सजोषसा उषसा ... |||
verses.transliteration: viśvairdevaistribhirekādaśairihādbhirmarudbhirbhṛghubhiḥ sacābhuvā sajoṣasā uṣasā ...

translations.griffith: With all the Deities, three times eleven, here, in close alliance with the Maruts, Bhṛgus, Floods;  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं नो वोळ्हमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ bodhataṃ havasya me viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ no voḷhamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Accept the sacrifice, attend to this my call: come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमं जुषेथां युवशेव कन्यनां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येन चेषं ... |||
verses.transliteration: stomaṃ juṣethāṃ yuvaśeva kanyanāṃ viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryena ceṣaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Accept our praise-song as a youth accepts a maid. Come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

verses.sanskrit: गिरो जुषेथामध्वरं जुषेथां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गछतम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं ... |||
verses.transliteration: ghiro juṣethāmadhvaraṃ juṣethāṃ viśveha devau savanāva ghachatam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Accept the songs we sing, accept the solemn rite. Come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, bring us strengthening food.

verses.sanskrit: हारिद्रवेव पतथो वनेदुप सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर्वर्तिर्यातमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: hāridraveva patatho vanedupa somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trirvartiryātamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Ye fly as starlings fly unto the forest trees; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

verses.sanskrit: हंसाविव पतथो अध्वगाविव सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर... |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsāviva patatho adhvaghāviva somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir...

translations.griffith: Ye fly like swans, like those who travel on their way; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

verses.sanskrit: शयेनाविव पतथो हव्यदातये सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गछथः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च तरिर... |||
verses.transliteration: śyenāviva patatho havyadātaye somaṃ sutaṃ mahiṣevāva ghachathaḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir...

translations.griffith: Ye fly to our oblation like a pair of hawks; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Aśvins, to our home.

verses.sanskrit: पिबतं च तर्प्णुतं चा च गछतं परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं नो धत्तमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: pibataṃ ca tṛpṇutaṃ cā ca ghachataṃ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ no dhattamaśvinā

translations.griffith: Come hitherward and drink and satisfy yourselves, bestow upon us progeny and affluence.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: जयतं च पर सतुतं च पर चावतं परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं ... |||
verses.transliteration: jayataṃ ca pra stutaṃ ca pra cāvataṃ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Conquer your foes, protect us, praise your worshippers; bestow upon us progeny and affluence.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: हतं च शत्रून यततं च मित्रिणः परजां च धत्तं दरविणं च धत्तम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं ... |||
verses.transliteration: hataṃ ca śatrūn yatataṃ ca mitriṇaḥ prajāṃ ca dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Slay enemies, animate men whom ye befriend; bestow upon us progeny and affluence.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, O Aśvins, grant us vigorous strength.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रावरुणवन्ता उत धर्मवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर्यातमश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: mitrāvaruṇavantā uta dharmavantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityairyātamaśvinā

translations.griffith: With Mitra, Varuṇa, Dharma, and the Maruts in your company approach unto your praiser's call.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

verses.sanskrit: अङगिरस्वन्ता उत विष्णुवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर... |||
verses.transliteration: aṅghirasvantā uta viṣṇuvantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair...

translations.griffith: With Viṣṇu and the Aṅgirases attending you, and with the Maruts come unto your praiser's call.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

verses.sanskrit: रभुमन्ता वर्षणा वाजवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गछथो हवम सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चादित्यैर... |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhumantā vṛṣaṇā vājavantā marutvantā jariturghachatho havam sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair...

translations.griffith: With Ṛbhus and With Vājas. O ye Mighty Ones, leagued with the Maruts come ye to your praiser's call.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, and with the Ādityas, Aśvins! come.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्म जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं धियो हतं रक्षांसि सेधतममीवाः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं सुन्वतो अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: brahma jinvatamuta jinvataṃ dhiyo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatamamīvāḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ sunvato aśvinā

translations.griffith: Give spirit to our prayer and animate our thoughts; slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.  Accordant, of One mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, -the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

verses.sanskrit: कषत्रं जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं नॄन हतं रक्षाण्सि सेधतममीवाः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं ... |||
verses.transliteration: kṣatraṃ jinvatamuta jinvataṃ nṝn hataṃ rakṣāṇsi sedhatamamīvāḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Strengthen the Ruling Power, strengthen the men of war; slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

verses.sanskrit: धेनूर्जिन्वतमुत जिन्वतं विशो हतं रक्षांसि सेधतममीवाः सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं ... |||
verses.transliteration: dhenūrjinvatamuta jinvataṃ viśo hataṃ rakṣāṃsi sedhatamamīvāḥ sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Give strength unto the milch-kine, give the people strength, slay ye the Rākṣasas and drive away disease.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, the presser's Soma, Aśvins drink.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रेरिव शर्णुतं पूर्व्यस्तुतिं शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येन चाश्विना तिरोह्न्यम |||
verses.transliteration: atreriva śṛṇutaṃ pūrvyastutiṃ śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryena cāśvinā tiroahnyam

translations.griffith: As ye heard Atri's earliest eulogy, so hear Śyāvāśva, Soma-presser, ye who reel in joy.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

verses.sanskrit: सर्गानिव सर्जतं सुष्टुतीरुप शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चाश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: sarghāniva sṛjataṃ suṣṭutīrupa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā

translations.griffith: Further like running streams Śyāvāśva's eulogies who presses out the Soma, ye who reel in joy.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

verses.sanskrit: रश्मीन्रिव यछतमध्वरानुप शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो मदच्युता सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चाश्विना ... |||
verses.transliteration: raśmīnriva yachatamadhvarānupa śyāvāśvasya sunvato madacyutā sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cāśvinā ...

translations.griffith: Seize, as ye grasp the reins, Śyāvāśva's solemn rites who presses out the Soma, ye who reel in joy.  Accordant, of one mind with Sūrya and with Dawn, drink juice, O Aśvins, three days old.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाग रथं नि यछतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु आ यातमश्विना गतमवस्युर्वामहं हुवे धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: arvāgh rathaṃ ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu ā yātamaśvinā ghatamavasyurvāmahaṃ huve dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Drive down your chariot hitherward drink ye the Soma's savoury juice.  Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: नमोवाके परस्थिते अध्वरे नरा विवक्षणस्य पीतये आ यातं ... |||
verses.transliteration: namovāke prasthite adhvare narā vivakṣaṇasya pītaye ā yātaṃ ...

translations.griffith: When sacrifice which tells our reverence hath begun. Heroes! to drink the gushing juice,  Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: सवाहाक्र्तस्य तर्म्पतं सुतस्य देवावन्धसः आ यातं ... |||
verses.transliteration: svāhākṛtasya tṛmpataṃ sutasya devāvandhasaḥ ā yātaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Sate you with consecrated drink, with juice effused, ye Deities.  Approach, ye Aśvins, come to us: I call you, eager for your aid. Grant treasures to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: अवितासि सुन्वतो वर्क्तबर्हिषः पिबा सोमं मदाय कं शतक्रतो यं ते भागमधारयन विश्वाः सेहानः पर्तना उरु जरयः समप्सुजिन मरुत्वानिन्द्र सत्पते |||
verses.transliteration: avitāsi sunvato vṛktabarhiṣaḥ pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃ śatakrato yaṃ te bhāghamadhārayan viśvāḥ sehānaḥ pṛtanā uru jrayaḥ samapsujin marutvānindra satpate

translations.griffith: THOU helpest him whose grass is trimmed, who sheds the juice, O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.  The share which they have fixed for thee, thou, Indra, Victor o’er all hosts and space, begirt with Maruts, Lord of Heroes, winner of the floods.

verses.sanskrit: पराव सतोतारं मघवन्नव तवां पिबा सोमं मदाय कंशतक्रतो यं ते भागं ... |||
verses.transliteration: prāva stotāraṃ maghavannava tvāṃ pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃśatakrato yaṃ te bhāghaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Maghavan, help thy worshipper: let him help thee. O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.  The share which they have fixed for thee, etc.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जा देवानवस्योजसा तवां पिबा सोमं मदाय कं शतक्रतो यं ते भागं ... |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjā devānavasyojasā tvāṃ pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃ śatakrato yaṃ te bhāghaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Thou aidest Gods with food, and that with might aids thee,  O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit: जनिता दिवो जनिता पर्थिव्याः पिबा सोमं मदाय कं शतक्रतो यं ते भागं ... |||
verses.transliteration: janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃ śatakrato yaṃ te bhāghaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Creator of the heaven, creator of the earth, O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit: जनिताश्वानां जनिता गवामसि पिबा सोमं मदाय कं शतक्रतो यं ते भागं ... |||
verses.transliteration: janitāśvānāṃ janitā ghavāmasi pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃ śatakrato yaṃ te bhāghaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Father of cattle, father of all steeds art thou. O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रीणां सतोममद्रिवो महस कर्धि पिबा सोमं मदाय कंशतक्रतो यं ते भागं ... |||
verses.transliteration: atrīṇāṃ stomamadrivo mahas kṛdhi pibā somaṃ madāya kaṃśatakrato yaṃ te bhāghaṃ ...

translations.griffith: Stone-hurler, glorify the Atris' hymn of praise. O Śatakratu, drink Soma to make thee glad.

verses.sanskrit: शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतस्तथा शर्णु यथाश्र्णोरत्रेः कर्माणि कर्ण्वतः पर तरसदस्युमाविथ तवमेक इन नर्षाह्य इन्द्र बरह्माणि वर्धयन |||
verses.transliteration: śyāvāśvasya sunvatastathā śṛṇu yathāśṛṇoratreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ pra trasadasyumāvitha tvameka in nṛṣāhya indra brahmāṇi vardhayan

translations.griffith: Hear thou Śyāvāśva while he pours to thee, as erst thou heardest Atri when he wrought his holy rites.  Indra, thou only gavest Trasadasyu aid in the fierce fight with heroes, strengthening his prayers.

verses.sanskrit: परेदं बरह्म वर्त्रतूर्येष्वाविथ पर सुन्वतः शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य वर्त्रहन्ननेद्य पिबा सोमस्य वज्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: predaṃ brahma vṛtratūryeṣvāvitha pra sunvataḥ śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya savanasya vṛtrahannanedya pibā somasya vajrivaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS prayer, and those who shed the juice, in wars with Vṛtra thou holpest, Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy succours.  O Vṛtra-slayer, from libation poured at noon, drink of the Soma juice, thou blameless Thunderer.

verses.sanskrit: सेहान उग्र पर्तना अभि दरुहः शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: sehāna ughra pṛtanā abhi druhaḥ śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya ...

translations.griffith: Thou mighty Conqueror of hostile armaments, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit: एकराळ अस्य भुवनस्य राजसि शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: ekarāḷ asya bhuvanasya rājasi śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya ...

translations.griffith: Sole Ruler, thou art Sovran of this world of life, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit: सस्थावाना यवयसि तवमेक इच्छचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: sasthāvānā yavayasi tvameka icchacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya ...

translations.griffith: Thou only sunderest these two consistent worlds, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit: कषेमस्य च परयुजश्च तवमीशिषे शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: kṣemasya ca prayujaśca tvamīśiṣe śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya ...

translations.griffith: Thou art the Lord supreme o’er rest and energy, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit: कषत्राय तवमवसि न तवमाविथ शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः माध्यन्दिनस्य ... |||
verses.transliteration: kṣatrāya tvamavasi na tvamāvitha śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ mādhyandinasya ...

translations.griffith: Thou helpest one to power, and one thou hast not helped, O Indra, Lord of Strength, with all thy saving aid.

verses.sanskrit: शयावाश्वस्य रेभतस्तथा शर्णु यथाश्र्णोरत्रेः कर्माणि कर्ण्वतः पर तरसदस्युमाविथ तवमेक इन नर्षाह्य इन्द्र कषत्राणि वर्धयन |||
verses.transliteration: śyāvāśvasya rebhatastathā śṛṇu yathāśṛṇoratreḥ karmāṇi kṛṇvataḥ pra trasadasyumāvitha tvameka in nṛṣāhya indra kṣatrāṇi vardhayan

translations.griffith: Hear thou Śyāvāśva while he sings to thee, as erst thou heardest Atri when he wrought his holy rites.  Indra, thou only gavest Trasadasyu aid in the fierce fight with heroes, strengthening his powers.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य हि सथ रत्विजा सस्नी वाजेषु कर्मसु इन्द्राग्नीतस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: yajñasya hi stha ṛtvijā sasnī vājeṣu karmasu indrāghnītasya bodhatam

translations.griffith: YE Twain are Priests of sacrifice, winners in war and holy works:  Indra and Agni, mark this well.

verses.sanskrit: तोशासा रथयावाना वर्त्रहणापराजिता इन्द्राग्नी तस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: tośāsā rathayāvānā vṛtrahaṇāparājitā indrāghnī tasya bodhatam

translations.griffith: Ye bounteous riders on the car, ye Vṛtra-slayers unsubdued:  Indra and Agni, mark this well.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वां मदिरं मध्वधुक्षन्नद्रिभिर्नरः इन्द्राग्नी तस्य बोधतम |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vāṃ madiraṃ madhvadhukṣannadribhirnaraḥ indrāghnī tasya bodhatam

translations.griffith: The men with pressing-stones have pressed this meath of yours which gives delight:  Indra, and Agni, mark this well.

verses.sanskrit: जुषेथां यज्ञमिष्टये सुतं सोमं सधस्तुती इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: juṣethāṃ yajñamiṣṭaye sutaṃ somaṃ sadhastutī indrāghnī ā ghataṃ narā

translations.griffith: Accept our sacrifice for weal, sharers of praise! the Soma shed:  Indra and Agni, Heroes, come.

verses.sanskrit: इमा जुषेथां सवना येभिर्हव्यान्यूहथुः इन्द्राग्नीा गतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: imā juṣethāṃ savanā yebhirhavyānyūhathuḥ indrāghnīā ghataṃ narā

translations.griffith: Be pleased with these libations which attract you to our sacred gifts  Indra and Agni, Heroes, come.

verses.sanskrit: इमां गायत्रवर्तनिं जुषेथां सुष्टुतिं मम इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं नरा |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ ghāyatravartaniṃ juṣethāṃ suṣṭutiṃ mama indrāghnī ā ghataṃ narā

translations.griffith: Accept this eulogy of mine whose model is the Gāyatrī:  Indra and Agni, Heroes, Come.

verses.sanskrit: परातर्यावभिरा गतं देवेभिर्जेन्यावसू इन्द्राग्नी सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryāvabhirā ghataṃ devebhirjenyāvasū indrāghnī somapītaye

translations.griffith: Come with the early-faring Gods, ye who are Lords of genuine wealth:  Indra-Agni, to the Soma-draught

verses.sanskrit: शयावाश्वस्य सुन्वतो.अत्रीणां शर्णुतं हवम इन्द्राग्नीसोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: śyāvāśvasya sunvato.atrīṇāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havam indrāghnīsomapītaye

translations.griffith: Hear ye the call of Atris, hear Śyāvāśva as he sheds the juice:  Indra-Agni to the Soma-draught

verses.sanskrit: एवा वामह्व ऊतये यथाहुवन्त मेधिराः इन्द्रग्नी सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: evā vāmahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ indraghnī somapītaye

translations.griffith: Thus have I called you to our aid as sages called on you of old:  Indra-Agni to the Soma draught!

verses.sanskrit: आहं सरस्वतीवतोरिन्द्राग्न्योरवो वर्णे याभ्यां गायत्रं रच्यते |||
verses.transliteration: āhaṃ sarasvatīvatorindrāghnyoravo vṛṇe yābhyāṃ ghāyatraṃ ṛcyate

translations.griffith: Indra's and Agni's grace I claim, Sarasvatī's associates  To whom this psalm of praise is sung.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निमस्तोष्य रग्मियमग्निमीळा यजध्यै अग्निर्देवाननक्तु न उभे हि विदथे कविरन्तश्चरति दूत्यं नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnimastoṣy ṛghmiyamaghnimīḷā yajadhyai aghnirdevānanaktu na ubhe hi vidathe kavirantaścarati dūtyaṃ nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: THE glorious Agni have I praised, and worshipped with. the sacred food.  May Agni deck the Gods for us. Between both gathering-places he goes on his embassy, the Sage. May all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: नयग्ने नव्यसा वचस्तनूषु शंसमेषाम नयराती रराव्णां विश्वा अर्यो अरातीरितो युछन्त्वामुरो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: nyaghne navyasā vacastanūṣu śaṃsameṣām nyarātī rarāvṇāṃ viśvā aryo arātīrito yuchantvāmuro nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni, burn down the word within their bodies through our newest speech,  All hatreds of the godless, all the wicked man's malignities. Away let the destroyers go. May all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने मन्मानि तुभ्यं कं घर्तं न जुह्व आसनि स देवेषु पर चिकिद्धि तवं हयसि पूर्व्यः शिवो दूतो विवस्वतो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne manmāni tubhyaṃ kaṃ ghṛtaṃ na juhva āsani sa deveṣu pra cikiddhi tvaṃ hyasi pūrvyaḥ śivo dūto vivasvato nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni, I offer hymns to thee, like holy oil within thy mouth.  Acknowledge them. among the Gods, for thou art the most excellent, the worshipper's blissful messenger. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: तत-तदग्निर्वयो दधे यथा-यथा कर्पण्यति ऊर्जाहुतिर्वसूनां शं च योश्च मयो दधे विश्वस्यै देवहूत्यै नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: tat-tadaghnirvayo dadhe yathā-yathā kṛpaṇyati ūrjāhutirvasūnāṃ śaṃ ca yośca mayo dadhe viśvasyai devahūtyai nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni bestows all vital power even as each man supplicates.  He brings the Vasus strengthening gifts, and grants delight, in rest and stir, for every calling on the Gods. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: स चिकेत सहीयसाग्निश्चित्रेण कर्मणा स होता शश्वतीनां दक्षिणाभिरभीव्र्त इनोति च परतीव्यं नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: sa ciketa sahīyasāghniścitreṇa karmaṇā sa hotā śaśvatīnāṃ dakṣiṇābhirabhīvṛta inoti ca pratīvyaṃ nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni hath made himself renowned by wonderful victorious act.  He is the Priest of all the tribes, chosen with sacrificial meeds. He urges Deities to receive. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्जाता देवानामग्निर्वेद मर्तानामपीच्यम अग्निःस दरविणोदा अग्निर्द्वारा वयूर्णुते सवाहुतो नवीयसा नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirjātā devānāmaghnirveda martānāmapīcyam aghniḥsa draviṇodā aghnirdvārā vyūrṇute svāhuto navīyasā nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni knows all that springs from Gods, he knows the mystery of men.  Giver of wealth is Agni, he uncloses both the doors to us when worshipped with our newest gift. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्देवेषु संवसुः स विक्षु यज्ञियास्वा स मुदा काव्या पुरु विश्वं भूमेव पुष्यति देवो देवेषु यज्ञियो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirdeveṣu saṃvasuḥ sa vikṣu yajñiyāsvā sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvaṃ bhūmeva puṣyati devo deveṣu yajñiyo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni inhabiteth with Gods and men who offer sacrifice.  He cherisheth with great delight much wisdom, as all things that be, God among Gods adorable. May all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निः सप्तमानुषः शरितो विश्वेषु सिन्धुषु तमागन्म तरिपस्त्यं मन्धातुर्दस्युहन्तममग्निं यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं नभन्तां अन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniḥ saptamānuṣaḥ śrito viśveṣu sindhuṣu tamāghanma tripastyaṃ mandhāturdasyuhantamamaghniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ nabhantāṃ anyake same

translations.griffith: Agni who liveth in all streams, Lord of the Sevenfold Race of men,  Him dweller in three homes we seek, best slayer of the Dasyus for Mandhātar, first in sacrifice. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निस्त्रीणि तरिधातून्या कषेति विदथा कविः स तरीन्रेकादशानिह यक्षच्च पिप्रयच्च नो विप्रो दूतः परिष्क्र्तो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
verses.transliteration: aghnistrīṇi tridhātūnyā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ sa trīnrekādaśāniha yakṣacca piprayacca no vipro dūtaḥ pariṣkṛto nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Agni the Wise inhabiteth three gathering-places, triply formed.  Decked as our envoy let the Sage bring hither and conciliate the Thrice Eleven Deities. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्न आयुषु तवं देवेषु पूर्व्य वस्व एक इरज्यसि तवामापः परिस्रुतः परि यन्ति सवसेतवो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghna āyuṣu tvaṃ deveṣu pūrvya vasva eka irajyasi tvāmāpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti svasetavo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Our Agni, thou art first among the Gods, and first mid living men.  Thou only rulest over wealth. Round about thee, as natural dams, circumfluous the waters run. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी युवं सु नः सहन्ता दासथो रयिम येन दर्ळ्हा समत्स्वा वीळु चित साहिषीमह्यग्निर्वनेव वात इन नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī yuvaṃ su naḥ sahantā dāsatho rayim yena dṛḷhā samatsvā vīḷu cit sāhiṣīmahyaghnirvaneva vāta in nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: INDRA and Agni, surely ye as Conquerors will give us wealth,  Whereby in fight we may o’ercome that which is strong and firmly fixed, as Agni burns the woods with wind. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: नहि वां वव्रयामहे.अथेन्द्रमिद यजामहे शविष्ठं नर्णां नरम स नः कदा चिदर्वता गमदा वाजसातयेगमदा मेधसातये नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: nahi vāṃ vavrayāmahe.athendramid yajāmahe śaviṣṭhaṃ nṛṇāṃ naram sa naḥ kadā cidarvatā ghamadā vājasātayeghamadā medhasātaye nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: We set no snares to tangle you; Indra we worship and adore, Hero of heroes mightiest.  Once may he come unto us with his Steed, come unto us to win us strength, and to complete the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि मध्यं भराणामिन्द्राग्नी अधिक्षितः ता उ कवित्वना कवी पर्छ्यमाना सखीयते सं धीतमश्नुतं नरा नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi madhyaṃ bharāṇāmindrāghnī adhikṣitaḥ tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛchyamānā sakhīyate saṃ dhītamaśnutaṃ narā nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: For, famous Indra-Agni, ye are dwellers in the midst of frays.  Sages in wisdom, ye are knit to him who seeketh you as friends. Heroes, bestow on him his wish.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यर्च नभाकवदिन्द्राग्नी यजसा गिरा ययोर्विश्वमिदं जगदियं दयौः पर्थिवी मह्युपस्थे बिभ्र्तो वसु नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: abhyarca nabhākavadindrāghnī yajasā ghirā yayorviśvamidaṃ jaghadiyaṃ dyauḥ pṛthivī mahyupasthe bibhṛto vasu nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Nabhāka-like, with sacred song Indra's and Agni's praise I sing,  Theirs to whom all this world belongs, this heaven and this mighty earth which bear rich treasure in their lap.

verses.sanskrit: पर बरह्माणि नभाकवदिन्द्राग्निभ्यामिरज्यत या सप्तबुध्नमर्णवं जिह्मबारमपोर्णुत इन्द्र ईशान ओजसा नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: pra brahmāṇi nabhākavadindrāghnibhyāmirajyata yā saptabudhnamarṇavaṃ jihmabāramaporṇuta indra īśāna ojasā nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Agni send your prayers, as was Nabhāka's wont,—  Who oped with sideway opening the sea with its foundations seven—Indra all powerful in his might.

verses.sanskrit: अपि वर्श्च पुराणवद वरततेरिव गुष्पितमोजो दासस्य दम्भय वयं तदस्य सम्भ्र्तं वस्विन्द्रेण वि भजेमहि नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratateriva ghuṣpitamojo dāsasya dambhaya vayaṃ tadasya sambhṛtaṃ vasvindreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Tear thou asunder, as of old, like tangles of a creeping plant,  Demolish thou the Dāsa's might. May we with Indra's help divide the treasure he hath gathered up.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी जना इमे विह्वयन्ते तना गिरा अस्माकेभिर्न्र्भिर्वयं सासह्याम पर्तन्यतो वनुयाम वनुष्यतो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yadindrāghnī janā ime vihvayante tanā ghirā asmākebhirnṛbhirvayaṃ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyato nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: What time with this same song these men call Indra-Agni sundry ways,  May we with our own heroes quell those who provoke us to the fight, and conquer those who strive with us.

verses.sanskrit: या नु शवेताववो दिव उच्चरात उप दयुभिः इन्द्राग्न्योरनु वरतमुहाना यन्ति सिन्धवो यान सीं बन्धादमुञ्चतां नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yā nu śvetāvavo diva uccarāta upa dyubhiḥ indrāghnyoranu vratamuhānā yanti sindhavo yān sīṃ bandhādamuñcatāṃ nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: The Two refulgent with their beams rise and come downward from the sky.  By Indra's and by Agni's hest, flowing away, the rivers, run which they released from their restraint.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीष ट इन्द्रोपमातयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः सूनोहिन्वस्य हरिवः वस्वो वीरस्याप्र्चो या नु साधन्त नो धियो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvīṣ ṭa indropamātayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ sūnohinvasya harivaḥ vasvo vīrasyāpṛco yā nu sādhanta no dhiyo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: O Indra, many are thine aids, many thy ways of guiding us,  Lord of the Bay Steeds, Hinva's Son. To a Good Hero come our prayers, which soon shall have accomplishment.

verses.sanskrit: तं शिशीता सुव्र्क्तिभिस्त्वेषं सत्वानं रग्मियम उतो नुचिद य ओजसा शुष्णस्याण्डानि भेदति जेषत सवर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ śiśītā suvṛktibhistveṣaṃ satvānaṃ ṛghmiyam uto nucid ya ojasā śuṣṇasyāṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Inspire him with your holy hymns, the Hero bright and glorious,  Him who with might demolisheth even the brood of Śuṣṇa, and winneth for us the heavenly streams.

verses.sanskrit: तं शिशीता सवध्वरं सत्यं सत्वानं रत्वियम उतो नुचिद य ओहत आण्डा शुष्णस्य भेदत्यजैः सवर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ śiśītā svadhvaraṃ satyaṃ satvānaṃ ṛtviyam uto nucid ya ohata āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedatyajaiḥ svarvatīrapo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Inspire him worshipped with fair rites, the glorious Hero truly brave.  He brake in pieces Śuṣṇa's brood who still expected not the stroke, and won for us the heavenly streams. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्यां पित्र्वन नवीयो मन्धात्र्वदङगिरस्वदवाचि तरिधातुना शर्मणा पातमस्मान वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: evendrāghnibhyāṃ pitṛvan navīyo mandhātṛvadaṅghirasvadavāci tridhātunā śarmaṇā pātamasmān vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Thus have we sung anew to Indra-Agni, as sang our sires, Aṅgirases, and Mandhātar.  Guard us with triple shelter and preserve us: may we be masters of a store of riches.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा ऊ षु परभूतये वरुणाय मरुद्भ्यो.अर्चा विदुष्टरेभ्यः यो धीता मानुषाणां पश्वो गा इव रक्षति नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: asmā ū ṣu prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyo.arcā viduṣṭarebhyaḥ yo dhītā mānuṣāṇāṃ paśvo ghā iva rakṣati nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: To make this Varuṇa come forth sing thou a song unto the band of Maruts wiser than thyself,—  This Varuṇa who guardeth well the thoughts of men like herds of kine.  Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: तमू षु समना गिरा पितॄणां च मन्मभिः नाभाकस्यप्रशस्तिभिर्यः सिन्धूनामुपोदये सप्तस्वसा स मध्यमो नभन्तामन्यके समे ||
verses.transliteration: tamū ṣu samanā ghirā pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ nābhākasyapraśastibhiryaḥ sindhūnāmupodaye saptasvasā sa madhyamo nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Him altogether praise I with the song and hymns our fathers sang, and with Nabhāka's eulogies,—  Him dwelling at the rivers’ source, surrounded by his Sisters Seven.

verses.sanskrit: स कषपः परि षस्वजे नयुस्रो मायया दधे स विश्वं परि दर्शतः तस्य वेनीरनु वरतमुषस्तिस्रो अवर्धयन्नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: sa kṣapaḥ pari ṣasvaje nyusro māyayā dadhe sa viśvaṃ pari darśataḥ tasya venīranu vratamuṣastisro avardhayannabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: The nights he hath encompassed, and stablished the morns with magic art visible over all is he.  His dear Ones, following his Law, have prospered the Three Dawns for him.

verses.sanskrit: यः ककुभो निधारयः पर्थिव्यामधि दर्शतः स माता पूर्व्यं पदं तद वरुणस्य सप्त्यं स हि गोपा इवेर्योनभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ kakubho nidhārayaḥ pṛthivyāmadhi darśataḥ sa mātā pūrvyaṃ padaṃ tad varuṇasya saptyaṃ sa hi ghopā iveryonabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: He, visible o’er all the earth, stablished the quarters of the sky:  He measured out the eastern place, that is the fold of Varuṇa: like a strong herdsman is the God.

verses.sanskrit: यो धर्ता भुवनानां य उस्राणामपीच्या वेद नामानिगुह्या स कविः काव्या पुरु रूपं दयौरिव पुष्यति नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yo dhartā bhuvanānāṃ ya usrāṇāmapīcyā veda nāmānighuhyā sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpaṃ dyauriva puṣyati nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: He who supports the worlds of life, he who well knows the hidden names mysterious of the morning beams,  He cherishes much wisdom, Sage, as heaven brings forth each varied form.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मिन विश्वानि काव्या चक्रे नाभिरिव शरिता तरितं जूती सपर्यत वरजे गावो न संयुजे युजे अश्वानयुक्षत नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhiriva śritā tritaṃ jūtī saparyata vraje ghāvo na saṃyuje yuje aśvānayukṣata nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: In whom all wisdom centres, as the nave is set within the wheel.  Haste ye to honour Trita, as kine haste to gather in the fold, even as they muster steeds to yoke.

verses.sanskrit: य आस्वत्क आशये विश्वा जातान्येषाम परि धामानि मर्म्र्शद वरुणस्य पुरो गये विश्वे देवा अनु वरतं नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: ya āsvatka āśaye viśvā jātānyeṣām pari dhāmāni marmṛśad varuṇasya puro ghaye viśve devā anu vrataṃ nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: He wraps these regions as a robe; he contemplates the tribes of Gods and all the works of mortal men.  Before the home of Varuṇa all the Gods follow his decree.

verses.sanskrit: स समुद्रो अपीच्यस्तुरो दयामिव रोहति नि यदासु यजुर्दधे स माया अर्चिना पदास्त्र्णान नाकमारुहन नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: sa samudro apīcyasturo dyāmiva rohati ni yadāsu yajurdadhe sa māyā arcinā padāstṛṇān nākamāruhan nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: He is an Ocean far-removed, yet through the heaven to him ascends the worship which these realms possess.  With his bright foot he overthrew their magic, and went up to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य शवेता विचक्षणा तिस्रो भूमीरधिक्षितः तरिरुत्तराणि पप्रतुर्वरुणस्य धरुवं सदः स सप्तानामिरज्यति नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yasya śvetā vicakṣaṇā tisro bhūmīradhikṣitaḥ triruttarāṇi papraturvaruṇasya dhruvaṃ sadaḥ sa saptānāmirajyati nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Ruler, whose bright far-seeing rays, pervading all three earths, have filled the three superior realms of heaven.  Firm is the seat of Varuṇa: over the Seven he rules as King.

verses.sanskrit: यः शवेतानधिनिर्णिजश्चक्रे कर्ष्णाननु वरता स धाम पूर्व्यं ममे य सकम्भेन वि रोदसी अजो न दयामधारयन नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śvetānadhinirṇijaścakre kṛṣṇānanu vratā sa dhāma pūrvyaṃ mame ya skambhena vi rodasī ajo na dyāmadhārayan nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Who, after his decree, o’erspread the Dark Ones with a robe of light;  Who measured out the ancient seat, who pillared both the worlds apart as the Unborn supported heaven. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: अस्तभ्नाद दयामसुरो विश्ववेदा अमिमीत वरिमाणं पर्थिव्याः आसीदद विश्वा भुवनानि सम्राड विश्वेत तानि वरुणस्य वरतानि |||
verses.transliteration: astabhnād dyāmasuro viśvavedā amimīta varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyāḥ āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni

translations.griffith: LORD of all wealth, the Asura propped the heavens, and measured out the broad earth's wide expanses.  He, King supreme, approached all living creatures. All these are Varuṇa's holy operations.

verses.sanskrit: एवा वन्दस्व वरुणं बर्हन्तं नमस्या धीरमम्र्तस्य गोपाम स नः शर्म तरिवरूथं वि यंसत पातं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी उपस्थे |||
verses.transliteration: evā vandasva varuṇaṃ bṛhantaṃ namasyā dhīramamṛtasya ghopām sa naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsat pātaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe

translations.griffith: So humbly worship Varuṇa the Mighty revere the wise Guard of World Immortal.  May he vouchsafe us triply-barred protection. O Earth and Heaven, within your lap preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: इमां धियं शिक्षमाणस्य देव करतुं दक्षं वरुण सं शिशाधि ययाति विश्वा दुरिता तरेम सुतर्माणमधि नावं रुहेम |||
verses.transliteration: imāṃ dhiyaṃ śikṣamāṇasya deva kratuṃ dakṣaṃ varuṇa saṃ śiśādhi yayāti viśvā duritā tarema sutarmāṇamadhi nāvaṃ ruhema

translations.griffith: Sharpen this song of him who strives his utmost, sharpen, God Varuṇa, his strength and insight;  May we ascend the ship that bears us safely, whereby we may pass over all misfortune.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां गरावाणो अश्विना धीभिर्विप्रा अचुच्यवुः नासत्या सोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ ghrāvāṇo aśvinā dhībhirviprā acucyavuḥ nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: Aśvins, with songs the singer stones have made you hasten hitherward,  Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वामत्रिरश्विना गीर्भिर्विप्रो अजोहवीत नासत्यासोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: yathā vāmatriraśvinā ghīrbhirvipro ajohavīt nāsatyāsomapītaye nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: As the sage Atri with his hymns, O Aśvins, called you eagerly,  Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: एवा वामह्व ऊतये यथाहुवन्त मेधिराः नासत्या सोमपीतये नभन्तामन्यके समे |||
verses.transliteration: evā vāmahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantāmanyake same

translations.griffith: So have I called you to our aid, even as the wise have called of old,  Nāsatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.

verses.sanskrit: इमे विप्रस्य वेधसो.अग्नेरस्त्र्तयज्वनः गिरः सतोमास ईरते |||
verses.transliteration: ime viprasya vedhaso.aghnerastṛtayajvanaḥ ghiraḥ stomāsa īrate

translations.griffith: THESE songs of mine go forth as lauds of Agni, the disposing Sage,  Whose worshipper is ne’er o’erthrown.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मै ते परतिहर्यते जातवेदो विचर्षणे अग्ने जनामि सुष्टुतिम |||
verses.transliteration: asmai te pratiharyate jātavedo vicarṣaṇe aghne janāmi suṣṭutim

translations.griffith: Wise Agni Jātavedas, I beget a song of praise for thee.  Who willingly receivest it.

verses.sanskrit: आरोका इव घेदह तिग्मा अग्ने तव तविषः दद्भिर्वनानि बप्सति |||
verses.transliteration: ārokā iva ghedaha tighmā aghne tava tviṣaḥ dadbhirvanāni bapsati

translations.griffith: Thy sharpened flames, O Agni, like the gleams of light that glitter through,  Devour the forests with their teeth.

verses.sanskrit: हरयो धूमकेतवो वातजूता उप दयवि यतन्ते वर्थगग्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: harayo dhūmaketavo vātajūtā upa dyavi yatante vṛthaghaghnayaḥ

translations.griffith: Gold-coloured, bannered with the smoke, urged by the wind, aloft to heaven  Rise, lightly borne, the flames of fire.

verses.sanskrit: एते तये वर्थगग्नय इद्धासः समद्र्क्षत उषसामिव केतवः |||
verses.transliteration: ete tye vṛthaghaghnaya iddhāsaḥ samadṛkṣata uṣasāmiva ketavaḥ

translations.griffith: These lightly kindled fiery flames are all around made visible,  Even as the gleanings of the Dawns.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णा रजांसि पत्सुतः परयाणे जातवेदसः अग्निर्यद रोधति कषमि |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi patsutaḥ prayāṇe jātavedasaḥ aghniryad rodhati kṣami

translations.griffith: As Jātavedas speeds along, the dust is black beneath his feet,  When Agni spreads upon the earth.

verses.sanskrit: धासिं कर्ण्वान ओषधीर्बप्सदग्निर्न वायति पुनर्यन तरुणीरपि |||
verses.transliteration: dhāsiṃ kṛṇvāna oṣadhīrbapsadaghnirna vāyati punaryan taruṇīrapi

translations.griffith: Making the plants his nourishment, Agni devours and wearies not,  Seeking the tender shrubs again.

verses.sanskrit: जिह्वाभिरह नन्नमदर्चिषा जञ्जणाभवन अग्निर्वनेषु रोचते |||
verses.transliteration: jihvābhiraha nannamadarciṣā jañjaṇābhavan aghnirvaneṣu rocate

translations.griffith: Bending him down with all his tongues, he flickers with his fiery glow  Splendid is Agni in the woods.

verses.sanskrit: अप्स्वग्ने सधिष टव सौशधीरनु रुध्यसे गर्भे सञ्जायसे पुनः |||
verses.transliteration: apsvaghne sadhiṣ ṭava sauśadhīranu rudhyase gharbhe sañjāyase punaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, thine home is in the floods: into the plants thou forcest way,  And as their Child art born anew.

verses.sanskrit: उदग्ने तव तद घर्तादर्ची रोचत आहुतम निंसानं जुह्वो मुखे |||
verses.transliteration: udaghne tava tad ghṛtādarcī rocata āhutam niṃsānaṃ juhvo mukhe

translations.griffith: Worshipped with offerings shines thy flame, O Agni, from the sacred oil,  With kisses on the ladle's mouth.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षान्नाय वशान्नाय सोमप्र्ष्ठाय वेधसे सतोमैर्विधेमाग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣānnāya vaśānnāya somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase stomairvidhemāghnaye

translations.griffith: Let us serve Agni with our hymns, Disposer, fed on ox and cow,  Who bears the Soma on his back.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवा नमसा वयं होतर्वरेण्यक्रतो अग्ने समिद्भिरीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvā namasā vayaṃ hotarvareṇyakrato aghne samidbhirīmahe

translations.griffith: Yea, thee, O Agni, do we seek with homage and with fuel, Priest  Whose wisdom is most excellent.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवा भर्गुवच्छुचे मनुष्वदग्न आहुत अङगिरस्वद धवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvā bhṛghuvacchuce manuṣvadaghna āhuta aṅghirasvad dhavāmahe

translations.griffith: O worshipped with oblations, pure Agni, we call on thee as erst,  Did Bhṛgu, Manus, Aṅgiras.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हयग्ने अग्निना विप्रो विप्रेण सन सता सखा सख्या समिध्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne aghninā vipro vipreṇa san satā sakhā sakhyā samidhyase

translations.griffith: For thou, O Agni, by the fire, Sage by the Sage, Good by the Good,  Friend by the Friend, art lighted up.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं विप्राय दाशुषे रयिं देहि सहस्रिणम अग्ने वीरवतीमिषम |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ viprāya dāśuṣe rayiṃ dehi sahasriṇam aghne vīravatīmiṣam

translations.griffith: So wealth in thousands, food with store of heroes give thou to the sage,  O Agni, to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने भरातः सहस्क्र्त रोहिदश्व शुचिव्रत इमं सतोमंजुषस्व मे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne bhrātaḥ sahaskṛta rohidaśva śucivrata imaṃ stomaṃjuṣasva me

translations.griffith: O Agni, Brother, made by strength, Lord of red steeds and brilliant sway,  Take pleasure in this laud of mine.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवाग्ने मम सतुतो वाश्राय परतिहर्यते गोष्ठं गाव इवाशत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvāghne mama stuto vāśrāya pratiharyate ghoṣṭhaṃ ghāva ivāśata

translations.griffith: My praises, Agni, go to thee, as the cows seek the stall to meet,  The lowing calf that longs for milk.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं ता अङगिरस्तम विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पर्थक अग्ने कामाय येमिरे |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ tā aṅghirastama viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak aghne kāmāya yemire

translations.griffith: Agni, best Aṅgiras, to thee all people who have pleasant homes,  Apart, have turned as to their wish.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं धीभिर्मनीषिणो मेधिरासो विपश्चितः अद्मसद्याय हिन्विरे |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ dhībhirmanīṣiṇo medhirāso vipaścitaḥ admasadyāya hinvire

translations.griffith: The sages skilled in holy song and thinkers with their thoughts have urged  Agni to share the sacred feast.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवामज्मेषु वाजिनं तन्वाना अग्ने अध्वरम वह्निंहोतारमीळते |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvāmajmeṣu vājinaṃ tanvānā aghne adhvaram vahniṃhotāramīḷate

translations.griffith: So, Agni, unto thee the Priest, Invoker, strong in forays, pray  Those who spin out the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुत्रा हि सद्रंं असि विशो विश्वा अनु परभुः समत्सुत्वा हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: purutrā hi sadṛṃṃ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ samatsutvā havāmahe

translations.griffith: In many a place, the same in look art thou, a Prince o’er all the tribes  In battles we invoke thine aid.

verses.sanskrit: तमीळिष्व य आहुतो.अग्निर्विभ्राजते घर्तैः इमं नःश्र्णवद धवम |||
verses.transliteration: tamīḷiṣva ya āhuto.aghnirvibhrājate ghṛtaiḥ imaṃ naḥśṛṇavad dhavam

translations.griffith: Pray thou to Agni, pray to him who blazes served with sacred oil:  Let him give ear to this our call.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा वयं हवामहे शर्ण्वन्तं जातवेदसम अग्ने घनन्तमप दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe śṛṇvantaṃ jātavedasam aghne ghnantamapa dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: We call on thee as such, as one who hears, as Jātavedas, one,  Agni! who beats away our foes.

verses.sanskrit: विशां राजानमद्भुतमध्यक्षं धर्मणामिमम अग्निमीळे स उ शरवत |||
verses.transliteration: viśāṃ rājānamadbhutamadhyakṣaṃ dharmaṇāmimam aghnimīḷe sa u śravat

translations.griffith: I pray to Agni, King of men, the Wonderful, the President  Of holy Laws: may he give ear.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं विश्वायुवेपसं मर्यं न वाजिनं हितम सप्तिं न वाजयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ viśvāyuvepasaṃ maryaṃ na vājinaṃ hitam saptiṃ na vājayāmasi

translations.griffith: Him like a bridegroom, him who stirs all people, like a noble horse,  Like a fleet steed, we instigate.

verses.sanskrit: घनन मर्ध्राण्यप दविषो दहन रक्षांसि विश्वहा अग्नेतिग्मेन दीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: ghnan mṛdhrāṇyapa dviṣo dahan rakṣāṃsi viśvahā aghnetighmena dīdihi

translations.griffith: Slaying things deadly, burning up foes, Rākṣasas, on every side,  Shine, Agni, with thy sharpened flame.

verses.sanskrit: यं तवा जनास इन्धते मनुष्वदङगिरस्तम अग्ने स बोधिमे वचः |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ tvā janāsa indhate manuṣvadaṅghirastama aghne sa bodhime vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou whom the people kindle even as Manus did, best Aṅgiras!  O Agni, mark thou this my speech.

verses.sanskrit: यदग्ने दिविजा अस्यप्सुजा वा सहस्क्र्त तं तवा गीर्भिर्हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yadaghne divijā asyapsujā vā sahaskṛta taṃ tvā ghīrbhirhavāmahe

translations.griffith: O Agni, made by strength! be thou born in the heavens or born in floods,  As such we call on thee with songs.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यं घेत ते जना इमे विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पर्थक धासिं हिन्वन्त्यत्तवे |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyaṃ ghet te janā ime viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak dhāsiṃ hinvantyattave

translations.griffith: Yea, all the people, all the folk who have good dwellings, each apart,  Send food for thee to eat thereof.

verses.sanskrit: ते घेदग्ने सवाध्यो.अहा विश्वा नर्चक्षसः तरन्तः सयाम दुर्गहा |||
verses.transliteration: te ghedaghne svādhyo.ahā viśvā nṛcakṣasaḥ tarantaḥ syāma durghahā

translations.griffith: O Agni, so may we, devout, gazed at by men, throughout our days,  Pass lightly over all distress.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं मन्द्रं पुरुप्रियं शीरं पावकशोचिषम हर्द्भिर्मन्द्रेभिरीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ mandraṃ purupriyaṃ śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣam hṛdbhirmandrebhirīmahe

translations.griffith: We venerate with cheerful hearts the cheerful Agni, dear to all,  Burning, with purifying flame.

verses.sanskrit: स तवमग्ने विभावसुः सर्जन सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः शर्धन तमांसि जिघ्नसे |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvamaghne vibhāvasuḥ sṛjan sūryo na raśmibhiḥ śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase

translations.griffith: So thou, O Agni rich in light, beaming like Sūrya with thy rays  Boldly demolishest the gloom,

verses.sanskrit: तत ते सहस्व ईमहे दात्रं यन नोपदस्यति तवदग्ने वार्यं वसु |||
verses.transliteration: tat te sahasva īmahe dātraṃ yan nopadasyati tvadaghne vāryaṃ vasu

translations.griffith: We pray to thee for this thy gift, Victor the gift that faileth not,  O Agni, choicest wealth from thee.

verses.sanskrit: समिधाग्निं दुवस्यत घर्तैर्बोधयतातिथिम आस्मिन हव्याजुहोतन |||
verses.transliteration: samidhāghniṃ duvasyata ghṛtairbodhayatātithim āsmin havyājuhotana

translations.griffith: PAY service unto Agni with your fuel, rouse your Guest with oil:  In him present your offerings.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सतोमं जुषस्व मे वर्धस्वानेन मन्मना परति सूक्तानि हर्य नः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne stomaṃ juṣasva me vardhasvānena manmanā prati sūktāni harya naḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, do thou accept my laud, be magnified by this my song:  Welcome my sweetly-spoken words.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं दूतं पुरो दधे हव्यवाहमुप बरुवे देवाना सादयादिह |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ puro dadhe havyavāhamupa bruve devānā sādayādiha

translations.griffith: Agni, envoy, I place in front; the oblation-bearer I address:  Here let him seat the Deities.

verses.sanskrit: उत ते बर्हन्तो अर्चयः समिधानस्य दीदिवः अग्ने शुक्रासीरते |||
verses.transliteration: ut te bṛhanto arcayaḥ samidhānasya dīdivaḥ aghne śukrāsaīrate

translations.griffith: Agni, the lofty flames of thee enkindled have gone up on high,  Thy bright flames, thou Refulgent One.

verses.sanskrit: उप तवा जुह्वो मम घर्ताचीर्यन्तु हर्यत अग्ने हव्या जुषस्व नः |||
verses.transliteration: upa tvā juhvo mama ghṛtācīryantu haryata aghne havyā juṣasva naḥ

translations.griffith: Beloved! let my ladles full of sacred oil come near to thee:  Agni, accept our offerings.

verses.sanskrit: मन्द्रं होतारं रत्विजं चित्रभानुं विभावसुम अग्निमीळे स उ शरवत |||
verses.transliteration: mandraṃ hotāraṃ ṛtvijaṃ citrabhānuṃ vibhāvasum aghnimīḷe sa u śravat

translations.griffith: I worship Agni—may he hear!—the cheerful, the Invoker, Priest,  Of varied splendour, rich in light.

verses.sanskrit: परत्नं होतारमीड्यं जुष्टमग्निं कविक्रतुम अध्वराणामभिश्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: pratnaṃ hotāramīḍyaṃ juṣṭamaghniṃ kavikratum adhvarāṇāmabhiśriyam

translations.griffith: Ancient Invoker, meet for praise, beloved Agni, wise and strong,  The visitant of solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit: जुषानो अङगिरस्तमेमा हव्यान्यानुषक अग्ने यज्ञं नयर्तुथा |||
verses.transliteration: juṣāno aṅghirastamemā havyānyānuṣak aghne yajñaṃ nayaṛtuthā

translations.griffith: Agni, best Aṅgiras, accept straightway these offerings, and guide  The seasonable sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: समिधान उ सन्त्य शुक्रशोच इहा वह चिकित्वान दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: samidhāna u santya śukraśoca ihā vaha cikitvān daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: Excellent God, with brilliant flames, enkindled bring thou hitherward,  Knowing the way, the Heavenly Host.

verses.sanskrit: विप्रं होतारमद्रुहं धूमकेतुं विभावसुम यज्ञानां केतुमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: vipraṃ hotāramadruhaṃ dhūmaketuṃ vibhāvasum yajñānāṃ ketumīmahe

translations.griffith: Him, Sage and Herald, void of guile, ensign of sacrifices, him  Smoke-bannered, rich in light, we seek.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने नि पाहि नस्त्वं परति षम देव रीषतः भिन्धि दवेषः सहस्क्र्त |||
verses.transliteration: aghne ni pāhi nastvaṃ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ bhindhi dveṣaḥ sahaskṛta

translations.griffith: O Agni, be our Guardian thou, God, against those who injure us:  Destroy our foes, thou Son of Strength.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः परत्नेन मन्मना शुम्भानस्तन्वं सवाम कविर्विप्रेण वाव्र्धे |||
verses.transliteration: aghniḥ pratnena manmanā śumbhānastanvaṃ svām kavirvipreṇa vāvṛdhe

translations.griffith: Making his body beautiful, Agni the Sage hath waxen by  The singer and his ancient hymn.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्जो नपातमा हुवे.अग्निं पावकशोचिषम अस्मिन यज्ञे सवध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: ūrjo napātamā huve.aghniṃ pāvakaśociṣam asmin yajñe svadhvare

translations.griffith: I invocate the Child of Strength, Agni with purifying flame,  At this well-ordered sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: स नो मित्रमहस्त्वमग्ने शुक्रेण सोचिषा देवैरा सत्सिबर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: sa no mitramahastvamaghne śukreṇa sociṣā devairā satsibarhiṣi

translations.griffith: So Agni, rich in many friends, with fiery splendour, seat thyself  With Gods upon our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: यो अग्निं तन्वो दमे देवं मर्तः सपर्यति तस्मा इद दीदयद वसु |||
verses.transliteration: yo aghniṃ tanvo dame devaṃ martaḥ saparyati tasmā id dīdayad vasu

translations.griffith: The mortal man who serves the God Agni within his own abode,  For him he causes wealth to shine.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्मूर्धा दिवः ककुत पतिः पर्थिव्या अयम अपां रेतांसि जिन्वति |||
verses.transliteration: aghnirmūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam apāṃ retāṃsi jinvati

translations.griffith: Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth is he:  He quickeneth the waters’ seed.

verses.sanskrit: उदग्ने शुचयस्तव शुक्रा भराजन्त ईरते तव जयोतींष्यर्चयः |||
verses.transliteration: udaghne śucayastava śukrā bhrājanta īrate tava jyotīṃṣyarcayaḥ

translations.griffith: Upward, O Agni, rise thy flames, pure and resplendent, blazing high,  Thy lustres, fair effulgences.

verses.sanskrit: ईषिषे वार्यस्य हि दात्रस्याग्ने सवर्पतिः सतोता सयां तव शर्मणि |||
verses.transliteration: īṣiṣe vāryasya hi dātrasyāghne svarpatiḥ stotā syāṃ tava śarmaṇi

translations.griffith: For, Agni, thou as Lord of Light rulest o’er choicest gifts: may I,  Thy singer, find defence in thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवामग्ने मनीषिणस्त्वां हिन्वन्ति चित्तिभिः तवां वर्धन्तु नो गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvāmaghne manīṣiṇastvāṃ hinvanti cittibhiḥ tvāṃ vardhantu no ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, they who understand stir thee to action with their thoughts:  So let our songs enhance thy might.

verses.sanskrit: अदब्धस्य सवधावतो दूतस्य रेभतः सदा अग्नेः सख्यं वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: adabdhasya svadhāvato dūtasya rebhataḥ sadā aghneḥ sakhyaṃ vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: We ever claim the friendship of Agni, the singing messenger,  Of God-like nature, void of guile.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निः शुचिव्रततमः शुचिर्विप्रः शुचिः कविः शुचीरोचत आहुतः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniḥ śucivratatamaḥ śucirvipraḥ śuciḥ kaviḥ śucīrocata āhutaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni who bears most holy sway, the holy Singer, holy Sage,  Shines holy when we worship him.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवा धीतयो मम गिरो वर्धन्तु विश्वहा अग्ने सख्यस्य बोधि नः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvā dhītayo mama ghiro vardhantu viśvahā aghne sakhyasya bodhi naḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, let my meditations, let my songs exalt thee evermore.  Think, Agni, of our friendly bond,

verses.sanskrit: यदग्ने सयामहं तवं तवं वा घा सया अहम सयुष टे सत्या इहाशिषः |||
verses.transliteration: yadaghne syāmahaṃ tvaṃ tvaṃ vā ghā syā aham syuṣ ṭe satyā ihāśiṣaḥ

translations.griffith: If I were thou and thou wert I, O Agni, every prayer of thine  Should have its due fulfilment here.

verses.sanskrit: वसुर्वसुपतिर्हि कमस्यग्ने विभावसुः सयाम ते सुमतावपि |||
verses.transliteration: vasurvasupatirhi kamasyaghne vibhāvasuḥ syāma te sumatāvapi

translations.griffith: For Excellent and Lord of wealth. art thou O Agni, rich in light:  May we enjoy thy favouring grace.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने धर्तव्रताय ते समुद्रायेव सिन्धवः गिरो वाश्रासीरते |||
verses.transliteration: aghne dhṛtavratāya te samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ ghiro vāśrāsaīrate

translations.griffith: Agni, to thee whose laws stand fast our resonant songs of praise speed forth,  As rivers hasten to the sea.

verses.sanskrit: युवानं विश्पतिं कविं विश्वादं पुरुवेपसम अग्निं शुम्भामि मन्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvānaṃ viśpatiṃ kaviṃ viśvādaṃ puruvepasam aghniṃ śumbhāmi manmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, the Youthful Lord of men, who stirreth much and eateth all,  The Sage, I glorify with hymns.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञानां रथ्ये वयं तिग्मजम्भाय वीळवे सतोमैरिषेमाग्नये |||
verses.transliteration: yajñānāṃ rathye vayaṃ tighmajambhāya vīḷave stomairiṣemāghnaye

translations.griffith: To Agni let us haste with lauds, the Guide of sacrificial rites,  Armed with sharp teeth, the Mighty One.

verses.sanskrit: अयमग्ने तवे अपि जरिता भूतु सन्त्य तस्मै पावक मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: ayamaghne tve api jaritā bhūtu santya tasmai pāvaka mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: And let this man, good Agni, be with thee the singer of thy praise:  Be gracious, Holy One, to him.

verses.sanskrit: धीरो हयस्यद्मसद विप्रो न जाग्र्विः सदा अग्ने दीदयसि दयवि |||
verses.transliteration: dhīro hyasyadmasad vipro na jāghṛviḥ sadā aghne dīdayasi dyavi

translations.griffith: For thou art sharer of our feast, wise, ever watchful as a Sage:  Agni, thou shinest in the sky.

verses.sanskrit: पुराग्ने दुरितेभ्यः पुरा मर्ध्रेभ्यः कवे पर ण आयुर्वसो तिर |||
verses.transliteration: purāghne duritebhyaḥ purā mṛdhrebhyaḥ kave pra ṇa āyurvaso tira
