translations.griffith: O Agni, Sage, before our foes, before misfortunes fall on us,  Excellent Lord, prolong our lives.

verses.sanskrit: आ घा ये अग्निमिन्धते सत्र्णन्ति बर्हिरानुषक येषामिन्द्रो युवा सखा |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghā ye aghnimindhate stṛṇanti barhirānuṣak yeṣāmindro yuvā sakhā

translations.griffith: HITHERWARD! they who light flame and straightway trim the sacred grass.  Whose Friend is Indra ever young.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हन्निदिध्म एषां भूरि शस्तं पर्थुः सवरुः येषामिन्द्रो युवा सखा |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhannididhma eṣāṃ bhūri śastaṃ pṛthuḥ svaruḥ yeṣāmindro yuvā sakhā

translations.griffith: High is their fuel, great their laud, wide is their splinter from the stake,  Whose Friend is Indra ever young.

verses.sanskrit: अयुद्ध इद युधा वर्तं शूर आजति सत्वभिः येषामिन्द्रो युवा सखा |||
verses.transliteration: ayuddha id yudhā vṛtaṃ śūra ājati satvabhiḥ yeṣāmindro yuvā sakhā

translations.griffith: Unequalled  in fight the hero leads his army with the warrior chiefs.  Whose Friend is Indra ever young.

verses.sanskrit: आ बुन्दं वर्त्रहा ददे जातः पर्छद वि मातरम क उग्राः के ह शर्ण्विरे |||
verses.transliteration: ā bundaṃ vṛtrahā dade jātaḥ pṛchad vi mātaram ka ughrāḥ ke ha śṛṇvire

translations.griffith: The new-born Vṛtra-slayer asked his Mother, as he seized his shaft,  Who are the fierce? Who are renowned?

verses.sanskrit: परति तवा शवसी वदद गिरावप्सो न योधिषत यस्ते शत्रुत्वमाचके |||
verses.transliteration: prati tvā śavasī vadad ghirāvapso na yodhiṣat yaste śatrutvamācake

translations.griffith: Śavasī answered, He who seeks thine enmity will battle like  A stately elephant on a hill.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवं मघवञ्छ्र्णु यस्ते वष्टि ववक्षि तत यद वीळयासि वीळु तत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvaṃ maghavañchṛṇu yaste vaṣṭi vavakṣi tat yad vīḷayāsi vīḷu tat

translations.griffith: And hear, O Maghavan; to him who craves of thee thou grantest all  Whate’er thou makest firm is firm.

verses.sanskrit: यदाजिं यात्याजिक्र्दिन्द्रः सवश्वयुरुप रथीतमो रथीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: yadājiṃ yātyājikṛdindraḥ svaśvayurupa rathītamo rathīnām

translations.griffith: What time the Warrior Indra goes to battle, borne by noble steeds,  Best of all charioteers is he.

verses.sanskrit: वि षु विश्वा अभियुजो वज्रिन विष्वग यथा वर्ह भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣu viśvā abhiyujo vajrin viṣvagh yathā vṛha bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ

translations.griffith: Repel, O Thunder-armed, in all directions all attacks on us:  And be our own most glorious God.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं सु रथं पुर इन्द्रः कर्णोतु सातये न यं धूर्वन्ति धूर्तयः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ su rathaṃ pura indraḥ kṛṇotu sātaye na yaṃ dhūrvanti dhūrtayaḥ

translations.griffith: May Indra set our car in front, in foremost Place to win the spoil,  He whom the wicked injure not.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ज्याम ते परि दविषो.अरं ते शक्र दावने गमेमेदिन्द्रगोमतः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛjyāma te pari dviṣo.araṃ te śakra dāvane ghamemedindraghomataḥ

translations.griffith: Thine enmity may we escape, and, Śakra, for thy bounty, rich  In kine, may we come near to thee

verses.sanskrit: शनैश्चिद यन्तो अद्रिवो.अश्वावन्तः शतग्विनः विवक्षणा अनेहसः |||
verses.transliteration: śanaiścid yanto adrivo.aśvāvantaḥ śataghvinaḥ vivakṣaṇā anehasaḥ

translations.griffith: Softly approaching, Thunder-armed wealthy by hundreds, rich in steeds,  Unrivalled, ready with our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वा हि ते दिवे-दिवे सहस्रा सून्र्ता शता जरित्रिभ्योविमंहते |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā hi te dive-dive sahasrā sūnṛtā śatā jaritribhyovimaṃhate

translations.griffith: For thine exalted excellence gives to thy worshippers each day  Hundreds and thousands of thy boons.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हि तवा धनंजयमिन्द्र दर्ळ्हा चिदारुजम आदारिणं यथा गयम |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṃjayamindra dṛḷhā cidārujam ādāriṇaṃ yathā ghayam

translations.griffith: Indra, we know thee breaker-down even of strong forts, winner of spoil,  As one who conquers wealth for us.

verses.sanskrit: ककुहं चित तवा कवे मन्दन्तु धर्ष्णविन्दवः आ तवा पणिं यदीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: kakuhaṃ cit tvā kave mandantu dhṛṣṇavindavaḥ ā tvā paṇiṃ yadīmahe

translations.griffith: Though thou art highest, Sage and Bold! let the drops cheer thee when we come  To thee as to a trafficker.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते रेवानदाशुरिः परममर्ष मघत्तये तस्य नो वेद आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: yaste revānadāśuriḥ pramamarṣa maghattaye tasya no veda ā bhara

translations.griffith: Bring unto us the treasure of the opulent man who, loth to give,  Hath slighted thee for gain of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: इम उ तवा वि चक्षते सखाय इन्द्र सोमिनः पुष्टावन्तो यथा पशुम |||
verses.transliteration: ima u tvā vi cakṣate sakhāya indra sominaḥ puṣṭāvanto yathā paśum

translations.griffith: Indra, these friends of ours, supplied with Soma, wait and look to thee,  As men with fodder to the herd.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवाबधिरं वयं शरुत्कर्णं सन्तमूतये दूरादिह हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvābadhiraṃ vayaṃ śrutkarṇaṃ santamūtaye dūrādiha havāmahe

translations.griffith: And thee who art not deaf, whose cars are quick to listen, for our aid,  We call to us from far away.

verses.sanskrit: यच्छुश्रूया इमं हवं दुर्मर्षं चक्रिया उत भवेरापिर्नो अन्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: yacchuśrūyā imaṃ havaṃ durmarṣaṃ cakriyā uta bhaverāpirno antamaḥ

translations.griffith: When thou hast listened, make our call one which thou never wilt forget,  And be our very nearest Friend.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि ते अपि वयथिर्जगन्वांसो अमन्महि गोदा इदिन्द्र बोधि नः |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi te api vyathirjaghanvāṃso amanmahi ghodā idindra bodhi naḥ

translations.griffith: When even now, when we have been in trouble, we have thought of thee,  O Indra, give us gifts of kine.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा रम्भं न जिव्रयो ररभ्मा शवसस पते उश्मसि तवा सधस्थ आ |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā rambhaṃ na jivrayo rarabhmā śavasas pate uśmasi tvā sadhastha ā

translations.griffith: O Lord of Strength, we rest on thee, as old men rest upon a staff:  We long to have. thee dwell with us.

verses.sanskrit: सतोत्रमिन्द्राय गायत पुरुन्र्म्णाय सत्वने नकिर्यं वर्ण्वते युधि |||
verses.transliteration: stotramindrāya ghāyata purunṛmṇāya satvane nakiryaṃ vṛṇvate yudhi

translations.griffith: To Indra sing a song of praise, Hero of mighty valour, him  Whom no one challenges to war.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा वर्षभा सुते सुतं सर्जामि पीतये तर्म्पा वयश्नुही मदम |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā vṛṣabhā sute sutaṃ sṛjāmi pītaye tṛmpā vyaśnuhī madam

translations.griffith: Hero, the Soma being shed, I pour the juice for thee to drink:  Sate thee and finish thy carouse.

verses.sanskrit: मा तवा मूरा अविष्यवो मोपहस्वान आ दभन माकीं बरह्मद्विषो वनः |||
verses.transliteration: mā tvā mūrā aviṣyavo mopahasvāna ā dabhan mākīṃ brahmadviṣo vanaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not the fools, or those who mock beguile thee when they seek thine aid  Love not the enemies of prayer.

verses.sanskrit: इह तवा गोपरीणसा महे मन्दन्तु राधसे सरो गौरो यथा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: iha tvā ghoparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase saro ghauro yathā piba

translations.griffith: Here let them with rich milky draught cheer thee to great munificence:  Drink as the wild-bull drinks the lake.

verses.sanskrit: या वर्त्रहा परावति सना नवा च चुच्युवे ता संसत्सुप्र वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: yā vṛtrahā parāvati sanā navā ca cucyuve tā saṃsatsupra vocata

translations.griffith: Proclaim in our assemblies what deeds, new and ancient, far away,  The Vṛtra-slayer hath achieved.

verses.sanskrit: अपिबत कद्रुवः सुतमिन्द्रः सहस्रबाह्वे अत्रादेदिष्ट पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: apibat kadruvaḥ sutamindraḥ sahasrabāhve atrādediṣṭa pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: In battle of a thousand arms Indra drank Kadrū's Soma juice:  There he displayed his manly might.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यं तत तुर्वशे यदौ विदानो अह्नवाय्यम वयानट तुर्वणे शमि |||
verses.transliteration: satyaṃ tat turvaśe yadau vidāno ahnavāyyam vyānaṭ turvaṇe śami

translations.griffith: True undeniable strength he found in Yadu and in Turvaśa,  And conquered through the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: तरणिं वो जनानां तरदं वाजस्य गोमतः समानमु पर शंसिषम |||
verses.transliteration: taraṇiṃ vo janānāṃ tradaṃ vājasya ghomataḥ samānamu pra śaṃsiṣam

translations.griffith: Him have I magnified, our Lord in, common, Guardian of your folk,  Discloser of great wealth in kine;

verses.sanskrit: रभुक्षणं न वर्तव उक्थेषु तुग्र्याव्र्धम इन्द्रं सोमेसचा सुते |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhukṣaṇaṃ na vartava uktheṣu tughryāvṛdham indraṃ somesacā sute

translations.griffith: Ṛbhukṣan, not to be restrained, who strengthened Tugra's son in lauds,  Indra beside the flowing juice;

verses.sanskrit: यः कर्न्तदिद वि योन्यं तरिशोकाय गिरिं पर्थुम गोभ्यो गातुं निरेतवे |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ kṛntadid vi yonyaṃ triśokāya ghiriṃ pṛthum ghobhyo ghātuṃ niretave

translations.griffith: Who for Triśoka clave the hill that formed a wide receptacle,  So that the cows might issue forth.

verses.sanskrit: यद दधिषे मनस्यसि मन्दानः परेदियक्षसि मा तत करिन्द्र मर्ळय |||
verses.transliteration: yad dadhiṣe manasyasi mandānaḥ prediyakṣasi mā tat karindra mṛḷaya

translations.griffith: Whate’er thy plan or purpose be, whate’er, in transport, thou wouldst do,  Do it not, Indra, but be kind.

verses.sanskrit: दभ्रं चिद धि तवावतः कर्तं शर्ण्वे अधि कषमि जिगात्विन्द्र ते मनः |||
verses.transliteration: dabhraṃ cid dhi tvāvataḥ kṛtaṃ śṛṇve adhi kṣami jighātvindra te manaḥ

translations.griffith: But little hath been heard of done upon the earth by one like thee i  Let thine heart, Indra, turn to us.

verses.sanskrit: तवेदु ताः सुकीर्तयो.असन्नुत परशस्तयः यदिन्द्र मर्ळयासि नः |||
verses.transliteration: tavedu tāḥ sukīrtayo.asannuta praśastayaḥ yadindra mṛḷayāsi naḥ

translations.griffith: Thine then shall be this high renown, thine shall these lofty praises be,  When, Indra, thou art kind to us.

verses.sanskrit: मा न एकस्मिन्नागसि मा दवयोरुत तरिषु वधीर्मा शूर भूरिषु |||
verses.transliteration: mā na ekasminnāghasi mā dvayoruta triṣu vadhīrmā śūra bhūriṣu

translations.griffith: Not for one trespass, not for two, O Hero, slay us, nor for three,  Nor yet for many trespasses.

verses.sanskrit: बिभया हि तवावत उग्रादभिप्रभङगिणः दस्मादहम्र्तीषहः |||
verses.transliteration: bibhayā hi tvāvata ughrādabhiprabhaṅghiṇaḥ dasmādahamṛtīṣahaḥ

translations.griffith: I fear one powerful like thee, the crusher-down of enemies,  Mighty, repelling all attacks.

verses.sanskrit: मा सख्युः शूनमा विदे मा पुत्रस्य परभूवसो आव्र्त्वद भूतु ते मनः |||
verses.transliteration: mā sakhyuḥ śūnamā vide mā putrasya prabhūvaso āvṛtvad bhūtu te manaḥ

translations.griffith: O wealthy God, ne’er may I live to see my friend or son in need:  Hitherward let thy heart be turned.

verses.sanskrit: को नु मर्या अमिथितः सखा सखायमब्रवीत जहा को अस्मदीषते |||
verses.transliteration: ko nu maryā amithitaḥ sakhā sakhāyamabravīt jahā ko asmadīṣate

translations.griffith: What friend, O people, unprovoked, hath ever said unto a friend,  He turns and leaves us in distress?

verses.sanskrit: एवारे वर्षभा सुते.असिन्वन भूर्यावयः शवघ्नीव निवता चरन |||
verses.transliteration: evāre vṛṣabhā sute.asinvan bhūryāvayaḥ śvaghnīva nivatā caran

translations.griffith: Hero, insatiate enjoy this Soma juice so near to thee,  Even as a hunter rushing down.

verses.sanskrit: आ त एता वचोयुजा हरी गर्भ्णे सुमद्रथा यदीं बरह्मभ्य इद ददः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ta etā vacoyujā harī ghṛbhṇe sumadrathā yadīṃ brahmabhya id dadaḥ

translations.griffith: Hither I draw those Bays of thine yoked  by our hymn, with splendid car,  That thou mayst give unto the priests.

verses.sanskrit: भिन्धि विश्वा अप दविषः परि बाधो जही मर्धः वसुस्पार्हं तदा भर |||
verses.transliteration: bhindhi viśvā apa dviṣaḥ pari bādho jahī mṛdhaḥ vasuspārhaṃ tadā bhara

translations.griffith: Drive all our enemies away, smite down the foes who press around,  And bring the wealth for which we long:

verses.sanskrit: यद वीळाविन्द्र यत सथिरे यत पर्शाने पराभ्र्तम वसुस्पार्हं तदा भर |||
verses.transliteration: yad vīḷāvindra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam vasuspārhaṃ tadā bhara

translations.griffith: O Indra, that which is concealed in strong firm place precipitous:  Bring us the wealth for which we long

verses.sanskrit: यस्य ते विश्वमानुषो भूरेर्दत्तस्य वेदति वसु सपार्हं तदा भर |||
verses.transliteration: yasya te viśvamānuṣo bhūrerdattasya vedati vasu spārhaṃ tadā bhara

translations.griffith: Great riches which the world of men shall recognize as sent by thee:  Bring us the wealth for which we long.

verses.sanskrit: तवावतः पुरूवसो वयमिन्द्र परणेतः समसि सथातर्हरीणाम ||
verses.transliteration: tvāvataḥ purūvaso vayamindra praṇetaḥ smasi sthātarharīṇām

translations.griffith: WE, Indra, Lord of ample wealth, our Guide, depend on one like thee,  Thou driver of the Tawny Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: तवां हि सत्यमद्रिवो विद्म दातारमिषाम विद्म दातारं रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hi satyamadrivo vidma dātāramiṣām vidma dātāraṃ rayīṇām

translations.griffith: For, Hurler of the Bolt, we know thee true, the giver of our food,  We know the giver of our wealth.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस्य ते महिमानं शतमूते शतक्रतो गीर्भिर्ग्र्णन्ति कारवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yasya te mahimānaṃ śatamūte śatakrato ghīrbhirghṛṇanti kāravaḥ

translations.griffith: O thou whose majesty the bards celebrate with their songs, thou Lord,  Of hundred powers and hundred aids.

verses.sanskrit: सुनीथो घा स मर्त्यो यं मरुतो यमर्यमा मित्रः पान्त्यद्रुहः |||
verses.transliteration: sunītho ghā sa martyo yaṃ maruto yamaryamā mitraḥ pāntyadruhaḥ

translations.griffith: Fair guidance hath the mortal man whom Aryaman, the Marut host,  And Mitra, void of guile, protect.

verses.sanskrit: दधानो गोमदश्ववद सुवीर्यमादित्यजूत एधते सदा राया पुरुस्प्र्हा |||
verses.transliteration: dadhāno ghomadaśvavad suvīryamādityajūta edhate sadā rāyā puruspṛhā

translations.griffith: Kine, steeds, and hero strength he gains, and prospers, by the Ādityas sped,  Ever in wealth which all desire.

verses.sanskrit: तमिन्द्रं दानमीमहे शवसानमभीर्वम ईशानं राय ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: tamindraṃ dānamīmahe śavasānamabhīrvam īśānaṃ rāya īmahe

translations.griffith: We pray to Indra for his gift, to him the Fearless and the Strong,  We pray to him the Lord of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मिन हि सन्त्यूतयो विश्वा अभीरवः सचा तमा वहन्तु सप्तयः पुरूवसुं मदाय हरयः सुतम |||
verses.transliteration: tasmin hi santyūtayo viśvā abhīravaḥ sacā tamā vahantu saptayaḥ purūvasuṃ madāya harayaḥ sutam

translations.griffith: For verily combined in him are all the fearless powers of aid.  Him, rich in wealth, let swift Steeds bring to us, his Bays, to Soma juice for his carouse:

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते मदो वरेण्यो य इन्द्र वर्त्रहन्तमः य आददिः सवर्न्र्भिर्यः पर्तनासु दुष्टरः |||
verses.transliteration: yaste mado vareṇyo ya indra vṛtrahantamaḥ ya ādadiḥ svarnṛbhiryaḥ pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, that most excellent carouse, Indra, which slays most enemies,  With Heroes wins the light of heaven, and is invincible in war:

verses.sanskrit: यो दुष्टरो विश्ववार शरवाय्यो वाजेष्वस्ति तरुता सनः शविष्ठ सवना वसो गहि गमेम गोमति वरजे |||
verses.transliteration: yo duṣṭaro viśvavāra śravāyyo vājeṣvasti tarutā sanaḥ śaviṣṭha savanā vaso ghahi ghamema ghomati vraje

translations.griffith: Which merits fame, all-bountiful! and, unsubdued, hath victory in deeds of might.  So come to our libations, Strongest! Excellent! May we obtain a stall of kine.

verses.sanskrit: गव्यो षु णो यथा पुराश्वयोत रथया वरिवस्य महामह |||
verses.transliteration: ghavyo ṣu ṇo yathā purāśvayota rathayā varivasya mahāmaha

translations.griffith: Responding to our wish for cows, for steeds, and chariots, as of old,  Be gracious, Greatest of the Great

verses.sanskrit: नहि ते शूर राधसो.अन्तं विन्दामि सत्रा दशस्या नो मघवन नू चिदद्रिवो धियो वाजेभिराविथ |||
verses.transliteration: nahi te śūra rādhaso.antaṃ vindāmi satrā daśasyā no maghavan nū cidadrivo dhiyo vājebhirāvitha

translations.griffith: For, Hero, nowhere can I find the bounds of thy munificence.  Still do thou favour us, O Bolt-armed Maghavan: with strength hast thou rewarded hymns.

verses.sanskrit: य रष्वः शरावयत्सखा विश्वेत स वेद जनिमा पुरुष्टुतः तं विश्वे मानुषा युगेन्द्रं हवन्ते तविषं यतस्रुचः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛṣvaḥ śrāvayatsakhā viśvet sa veda janimā puruṣṭutaḥ taṃ viśve mānuṣā yughendraṃ havante taviṣaṃ yatasrucaḥ

translations.griffith: High, glorifier of his friend, he knows all generations, he whom many praise.  All races of mankind with ladies lifted up invoke that Mighty Indra's aid.

verses.sanskrit: स नो वाजेष्वविता पुरूवसुः पुरःस्थाता मघवा वर्त्रहा भुवत ||
verses.transliteration: sa no vājeṣvavitā purūvasuḥ puraḥsthātā maghavā vṛtrahā bhuvat

translations.griffith: Be he our Champion and Protector in great deeds, rich in all wealth, the Vṛtra-slayer, Maghavan.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वो वीरमन्धसो मदेषु गाय गिरा महा विचेतसम इन्द्रं नाम शरुत्यं शाकिनं वचो यथा |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vo vīramandhaso madeṣu ghāya ghirā mahā vicetasam indraṃ nāma śrutyaṃ śākinaṃ vaco yathā

translations.griffith: In the wild raptures of the juice sing to your Hero with high laud, to him the Wise,  To Indra, glorious in his name, the Mighty One, even as the hymn alloweth it.

verses.sanskrit: ददी रेक्णस्तन्वे ददिर्वसु ददिर्वाजेषु पुरुहूत वाजिनम नूनमथ |||
verses.transliteration: dadī rekṇastanve dadirvasu dadirvājeṣu puruhūta vājinam nūnamatha

translations.griffith: Thou givest wealth to me myself, thou givest treasure, Excellent! and the strong steed,  O Much-invoked, in deeds of might, yea, even now.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेषामिरज्यन्तं वसूनां सासह्वांसं चिदस्य वर्पसः कर्पयतो नूनमत्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: viśveṣāmirajyantaṃ vasūnāṃ sāsahvāṃsaṃ cidasya varpasaḥ kṛpayato nūnamatyatha

translations.griffith: Him, Sovran Ruler of all precious things, who even hath power o’er this fair form of his,  As now it taketh shape, and afterward,

verses.sanskrit: महः सु वो अरमिषे सतवामहे मीळ्हुषे अरंगमाय जग्मये यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिर्विश्वमनुषां मरुतामियक्षसि गायेत्वा नमसा गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: mahaḥ su vo aramiṣe stavāmahe mīḷhuṣe araṃghamāya jaghmaye yajñebhirghīrbhirviśvamanuṣāṃ marutāmiyakṣasi ghāyetvā namasā ghirā

translations.griffith: We praise, so that the Mighty One may speed to you, Pourer of  bounties  , Traveller, prepared to go.  Thou favourest the Maruts known to all, by song and sacrifice.  With song and praise I sing to thee.

verses.sanskrit: ये पातयन्ते अज्मभिर्गिरीणां सनुभिरेषाम यज्ञं महिष्वणीनां सुम्नं तुविष्वणीनां पराध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: ye pātayante ajmabhirghirīṇāṃ snubhireṣām yajñaṃ mahiṣvaṇīnāṃ sumnaṃ tuviṣvaṇīnāṃ prādhvare

translations.griffith: We in the sacrifice perform their will whose voice is lifted high,  The worship of those Thundering Ones who o’er the ridges of these mountains fly in troops.

verses.sanskrit: परभङगं दुर्मतीनामिन्द्र शविष्ठा भर रयिमस्मभ्यं युज्यं चोदयन्मते जयेष्ठं चोदयन्मते |||
verses.transliteration: prabhaṅghaṃ durmatīnāmindra śaviṣṭhā bhara rayimasmabhyaṃ yujyaṃ codayanmate jyeṣṭhaṃ codayanmate

translations.griffith: O Indra, Mightiest, bring us that which crushes men of evil minds,  Wealth suited to our needs, O Stirrer of the thought, best wealth, O thou who stirrest thought.

verses.sanskrit: सनितः सुसनितरुग्र चित्र चेतिष्ठ सून्र्त परासहा सम्राट सहुरिं सहन्तं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sanitaḥ susanitarughra citra cetiṣṭha sūnṛta prāsahā samrāṭ sahuriṃ sahantaṃ bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrvyam

translations.griffith: O Winner, noble winner, strong, wondrous, most splendid, excellent,  Sole Lord of victory, bring all-overpowering wealth, joy-giving, chief in deeds of might.

verses.sanskrit: आ स एतु य ईवदानदेवः पूर्तमाददे यथा चिद वशो अश्व्यः पर्थुश्रवसि कानीते.अस्या वयुष्याददे |||
verses.transliteration: ā sa etu ya īvadānadevaḥ pūrtamādade yathā cid vaśo aśvyaḥ pṛthuśravasi kānīte.asyā vyuṣyādade

translations.griffith: Now let the godless man approach who hath received reward so great  As Vaśa, Aśvya, when this light of morning dawned, received from Pṛthuśravas, from Kanīta's son.

verses.sanskrit: षष्टिं सहस्राश्व्यस्यायुतासनमुष्ट्रानां विंशतिंशता दश शयावीनां शता दश तर्यरुषीणां दश गवां सहस्रा |||
verses.transliteration: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāśvyasyāyutāsanamuṣṭrānāṃ viṃśatiṃśatā daśa śyāvīnāṃ śatā daśa tryaruṣīṇāṃ daśa ghavāṃ sahasrā

translations.griffith: Steeds sixty thousand and ten thousand kine, and twenty hundred camels I obtained;  Ten hundred brown in hue, and other ten red in three spots: in all, ten thousand kine.

verses.sanskrit: दश शयावा रधद्रयो वीतवारास आशवः मथ्रा नेमिं नि वाव्र्तुः |||
verses.transliteration: daśa śyāvā ṛdhadrayo vītavārāsa āśavaḥ mathrā nemiṃ ni vāvṛtuḥ

translations.griffith: Ten browns that make my wealth increase, fleet steeds whose tails are long and fair,  Turn with swift whirl my chariot wheel;

verses.sanskrit: दानासः पर्थुश्रवसः कानीतस्य सुराधसः रथं हिरण्ययं ददन मंहिष्टः सूरिरभूद वर्षिष्ठमक्र्त शरवः |||
verses.transliteration: dānāsaḥ pṛthuśravasaḥ kānītasya surādhasaḥ rathaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ dadan maṃhiṣṭaḥ sūrirabhūd varṣiṣṭhamakṛta śravaḥ

translations.griffith: The gifts which Pṛthuśravas gave, Kanīta's son munificent.  He gave a chariot wrought of gold: the prince was passing bountiful, and won himself most lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो वायो महे तने याहि मखाय पाजसे वयं हि ते चक्र्मा भूरि दावने सद्यश्चिन महि दावने |||
verses.transliteration: ā no vāyo mahe tane yāhi makhāya pājase vayaṃ hi te cakṛmā bhūri dāvane sadyaścin mahi dāvane

translations.griffith: Come thou to this great rite of ours, Vāyu! to give us vigorous light.  We have served thee that thou mightest give much to us, yea, mightest quickly give great wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यो अश्वेभिर्वहते वस्त उस्रास्त्रिः सप्त सप्ततीनाम एभिः सोमेभिः सोमसुद्भिः सोमपा दानाय शुक्रपूतपाः |||
verses.transliteration: yo aśvebhirvahate vasta usrāstriḥ sapta saptatīnām ebhiḥ somebhiḥ somasudbhiḥ somapā dānāya śukrapūtapāḥ

translations.griffith: Who with thrice seven times seventy horses comes to us, invested with the rays of morn,  Through these our Soma-draughts and those who press, to give, drinker of pure bright Soma Juice.

verses.sanskrit: यो म इमं चिदु तमनामन्दच्चित्रं दावने अरट्वे अक्षेनहुषे सुक्र्त्वनि सुक्र्त्तराय सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: yo ma imaṃ cidu tmanāmandaccitraṃ dāvane araṭve akṣenahuṣe sukṛtvani sukṛttarāya sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Who hath inclined this glorious one, bounteous himself, to give me gifts.  Borne on firm chariot with the prosperous Nahuṣa, wise, to a man yet more devout.

verses.sanskrit: उचथ्ये वपुषि यः सवराळ उत वायो घर्तस्नाः अश्वेषितं रजेषितं शुनेषितं पराज्म तदिदं नु तत |||
verses.transliteration: ucathye vapuṣi yaḥ svarāḷ uta vāyo ghṛtasnāḥ aśveṣitaṃ rajeṣitaṃ śuneṣitaṃ prājma tadidaṃ nu tat

translations.griffith: Sole Lord in beauty meet for praise, O Vāyu, dropping fatness down,  Hurried along by steeds, by camels, and by hounds, spreads forth thy train: even this it is.

verses.sanskrit: अध परियमिषिराय षस्टिं सहस्रासनम अश्वानामिन न वर्ष्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: adha priyamiṣirāya ṣasṭiṃ sahasrāsanam aśvānāmin na vṛṣṇām

translations.griffith: So, as a prize dear to the strong, the sixty thousand have I gained,  Bulls that resemble vigorous steeds.

verses.sanskrit: गावो न यूथमुप यन्ति वध्रय उप मा यन्ति वध्रयः ||
verses.transliteration: ghāvo na yūthamupa yanti vadhraya upa mā yanti vadhrayaḥ

translations.griffith: To me come oxen like a herd, yea, unto me the oxen come.

verses.sanskrit: अध यच्चारथे गणे शतमुष्ट्रानचिक्रदत अध शवित्नेषु विंशतिं शता |||
verses.transliteration: adha yaccārathe ghaṇe śatamuṣṭrānacikradat adha śvitneṣu viṃśatiṃ śatā

translations.griffith: And in the grazing herd he made a hundred camels bleat for me,  And twenty hundred mid the white.

verses.sanskrit: शतं दासे बल्बूथे विप्रस्तरुक्ष आ ददे ते ते वायविमे जना मदन्तीन्द्रगोपा मदन्ति देवगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ dāse balbūthe viprastarukṣa ā dade te te vāyavime janā madantīndraghopā madanti devaghopāḥ

translations.griffith: A hundred has the sage received, Dāsa Balbūtha's and Tarukṣa's gifts.  These are thy people, Vāyu, who rejoice with Indra for their guard, rejoice with Gods for guards.

verses.sanskrit: अध सया योषणा मही परतीची वशमश्व्यम अधिरुक्मा वि नीयते |||
verses.transliteration: adha syā yoṣaṇā mahī pratīcī vaśamaśvyam adhirukmā vi nīyate

translations.griffith: And now to Vaśa Aśvya here this stately woman is led forth,  Adorned with ornaments of gold.

verses.sanskrit: महि वो महतामवो वरुण मित्र दाशुषे यमादित्या अभि दरुहो रक्षथा नेमघं नशदनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: mahi vo mahatāmavo varuṇa mitra dāśuṣe yamādityā abhi druho rakṣathā nemaghaṃ naśadanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: GREAT help ye give the worshipper, Varuṇa, Mitra, Mighty Ones! No sorrow ever reaches him whom ye, Ādityas, keep from harm. Yours are incomparable aids, and good the succour they afford.

verses.sanskrit: विदा देवा अघानामादित्यासो अपाक्र्तिम पक्षा वयो यथोपरि वयस्मे शर्म यछतानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: vidā devā aghānāmādityāso apākṛtim pakṣā vayo yathopari vyasme śarma yachatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: O Gods, Ādityas, well ye know the way to keep all woes afar.  As the birds spread their sheltering wings, spread your protection over us.

verses.sanskrit: वयस्मे अधि शर्म तत पक्षा वयो न यन्तन विश्वानि विश्ववेदसो वरूथ्या मनामहे.अनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: vyasme adhi śarma tat pakṣā vayo na yantana viśvāni viśvavedaso varūthyā manāmahe.anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: As the birds spread their sheltering wings let your protection cover us.  We mean all shelter and defence, ye who have all things for your own.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मा अरासत कषयं जीवातुं च परचेतसः मनोर्विश्वस्य घेदिम आदित्या राय ईशते.अनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yasmā arāsata kṣayaṃ jīvātuṃ ca pracetasaḥ manorviśvasya ghedima ādityā rāya īśate.anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: To whomsoever they, Most Wise, have given a home and means of life,  O'er the whole riches of this man they, the Ādityas, have control.

verses.sanskrit: परि णो वर्णजन्नघा दुर्गाणि रथ्यो यथा सयामेदिन्द्रस्य शर्मण्यादित्यानामुतावस्यनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: pari ṇo vṛṇajannaghā durghāṇi rathyo yathā syāmedindrasya śarmaṇyādityānāmutāvasyanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: As drivers of the car avoid ill roads, let sorrows pass us by.  May we be under Indra's guard, in the Ādityas’ favouring grace.

verses.sanskrit: परिह्व्र्तेदना जनो युष्मादत्तस्य वायति देवा अदभ्रमाश वो यमादित्या अहेतनानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: parihvṛtedanā jano yuṣmādattasya vāyati devā adabhramāśa vo yamādityā ahetanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: For verily men sink and faint through loss of wealth which ye have given.  Much hath he gained from you, O Gods, whom ye, Ādityas, have approached.

verses.sanskrit: न तं तिग्मं चन तयजो न दरासदभि तं गुरु यस्मा उ शर्म सप्रथ आदित्यासो अराध्वमनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: na taṃ tighmaṃ cana tyajo na drāsadabhi taṃ ghuru yasmā u śarma sapratha ādityāso arādhvamanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: On him shall no fierce anger fall, no sore distress shall visit him,  To whom, Ādityas, ye have lent your shelter that extendeth far.

verses.sanskrit: युष्मे देवा अपि षमसि युध्यन्त इव वर्मसु यूयं महो न एनसो यूयमर्भादुरुष्यतानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣme devā api ṣmasi yudhyanta iva varmasu yūyaṃ maho na enaso yūyamarbhāduruṣyatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Resting in you, O Gods, we are like men who fight in coats of mail.  Ye guard us from each great offence, ye guard us from each lighter fault.

verses.sanskrit: अदितिर्न उरुष्यत्वदितिः शर्म यछतु माता मित्रस्य रेवतो.अर्यम्णो वरुणस्य चानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: aditirna uruṣyatvaditiḥ śarma yachatu mātā mitrasya revato.aryamṇo varuṇasya cānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: May Aditi defend us, may Aditi guard and shelter us,  Mother of wealthy Mitra and of Aryaman and Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: यद देवाः शर्म शरणं यद भद्रं यदनातुरम तरिधातु यद वरूथ्यं तदस्मासु वि यन्तनानेहसो व उतयःसुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yad devāḥ śarma śaraṇaṃ yad bhadraṃ yadanāturam tridhātu yad varūthyaṃ tadasmāsu vi yantanānehaso va utayaḥsuūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: The shelter, Gods, that is secure, auspicious, free from malady,  A sure protection, triply strong, even that do ye extend to us.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्या अव हि खयताधि कूलादिव सपशः सुतीर्थमर्वतो यथानु नो नेषथा सुगमनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: ādityā ava hi khyatādhi kūlādiva spaśaḥ sutīrthamarvato yathānu no neṣathā sughamanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Look down on us, Ādityas, as a guide exploring from the bank.  Lead us to pleasant ways as men lead horses to an easy ford.

verses.sanskrit: नेह भद्रं रक्षस्विने नावयै नोपया उत गवे च भद्रं धेनवे वीराय च शरवस्यते.अनेहसो न ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: neha bhadraṃ rakṣasvine nāvayai nopayā uta ghave ca bhadraṃ dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate.anehaso na ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Ill be it for the demons' friend to find us or come near to us.  But for the milch-cow be it well, and for the man who strives for fame.

verses.sanskrit: यदाविर्यदपीच्यं देवासो अस्ति दुष्क्र्तम तरिते तद विश्वमाप्त्य आरे अस्मद दधातनानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयोव ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yadāviryadapīcyaṃ devāso asti duṣkṛtam trite tad viśvamāptya āre asmad dadhātanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayova ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Each evil deed made manifest, and that which is concealed, O Gods,  The whole thereof remove from us to Trita Āptya far away.

verses.sanskrit: यच्च गोषु दुष्वप्न्यं यच्चास्मे दुहितर्दिवः तरिताय तद विभावर्याप्त्याय परा वहानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yacca ghoṣu duṣvapnyaṃ yaccāsme duhitardivaḥ tritāya tad vibhāvaryāptyāya parā vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Daughter of Heaven, the dream that bodes evil to us or to our kine,  Remove, O Lady of the Light, to Trita Āptya far away.

verses.sanskrit: निष्कं वा घा कर्णवते सरजं वा दुहितर्दिवः तरिते दुष्वप्न्यं सर्वमाप्त्ये परि दद्मस्यनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: niṣkaṃ vā ghā kṛṇavate srajaṃ vā duhitardivaḥ trite duṣvapnyaṃ sarvamāptye pari dadmasyanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Even if, O Child of Heaven, it make a garland or a chain of gold,  The whole bad dream, whate’er it be, to Trita Āptya we consign.

verses.sanskrit: तदन्नाय तदपसे तं भागमुपसेदुषे तरिताय च दविताय चोषो दुष्वप्न्यं वहानेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: tadannāya tadapase taṃ bhāghamupaseduṣe tritāya ca dvitāya coṣo duṣvapnyaṃ vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: To him whose food and work is this, who comes to take his share therein,  To Trita, and to Dvita, Dawn! bear thou the evil dream away.

verses.sanskrit: यथा कलां यथा शफं यथ रणं संनयामसि एवा दुष्वप्न्यं सर्वमाप्त्ये सं नयामस्यनेहसो व ऊतयःसुूतयो व ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā kalāṃ yathā śaphaṃ yatha ṛṇaṃ saṃnayāmasi evā duṣvapnyaṃ sarvamāptye saṃ nayāmasyanehaso va ūtayaḥsuūtayo va ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: As we collect the utmost debt, even the eighth and sixteenth part,  So unto Āptya we transfer together all the evil dream.

verses.sanskrit: अजैष्माद्यासनाम चाभूमानागसो वयम उषो यस्माद दुष्वप्न्यादभैष्माप तदुछत्वनेहसो व ऊतयः सुूतयोव ऊतयः |||
verses.transliteration: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāghaso vayam uṣo yasmād duṣvapnyādabhaiṣmāpa taduchatvanehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayova ūtayaḥ

translations.griffith: Now have we conquered and obtained, and from our trespasses are free.  Shine thou away the evil dream, O Dawn, whereof we are afraid. Yours are incomparable aids, and good the succour they afford.

verses.sanskrit: सवादोरभक्षि वयसः सुमेधाः सवाध्यो वरिवोवित्तरस्य विश्वे यं देवा उत मर्त्यासो मधु बरुवन्तो अभि संचरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: svādorabhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyo varivovittarasya viśve yaṃ devā uta martyāso madhu bruvanto abhi saṃcaranti

translations.griffith: WISELY have I enjoyed the savoury viand, religious-thoughted, best to find out treasure,  The food to which all Deities and mortals, calling it meath, gather themselves together.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तश्च परागा अदितिर्भवास्यवयाता हरसो दैव्यस्य इन्दविन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणः शरौष्टीव धुरमनु राय रध्याः |||
verses.transliteration: antaśca prāghā aditirbhavāsyavayātā haraso daivyasya indavindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭīva dhuramanu rāya ṛdhyāḥ

translations.griffith: Tlou shalt be Aditi as thou hast entered within, appeaser of celestial anger.  Indu, enjoying Indra's friendship, bring us—as a swift steed the car—forward to riches.

verses.sanskrit: अपाम सोममम्र्ता अभूमागन्म जयोतिरविदाम देवान किं नूनमस्मान कर्णवदरातिः किमु धूर्तिरम्र्त मर्त्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: apāma somamamṛtā abhūmāghanma jyotiravidāma devān kiṃ nūnamasmān kṛṇavadarātiḥ kimu dhūrtiramṛta martyasya

translations.griffith: We have drunk Soma and become immortal; we have attained the light, the Gods discovered.  Now what may foeman's malice do to harm us? What, O Immortal, mortal man's deception?

verses.sanskrit: शं नो भव हर्द आ पीत इन्दो पितेव सोम सूनवे सुशेवः सखेव सख्य उरुशंस धीरः पर ण आयुर्जीवसे सोमतारीः |||
verses.transliteration: śaṃ no bhava hṛda ā pīta indo piteva soma sūnave suśevaḥ sakheva sakhya uruśaṃsa dhīraḥ pra ṇa āyurjīvase somatārīḥ

translations.griffith: Absorbed into the heart, be sweet, O Indu, as a kind father to his son, O Soma,  As a wise Friend to friend: do thou, wide-ruler, O Soma, lengthen out our days for living.

verses.sanskrit: इमे मा पीता यशस उरुष्यवो रथं न गावः समनाहपर्वसु ते मा रक्षन्तु विस्रसश्चरित्रादुत मा सरामाद्यवयन्त्विन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: ime mā pītā yaśasa uruṣyavo rathaṃ na ghāvaḥ samanāhaparvasu te mā rakṣantu visrasaścaritrāduta mā srāmādyavayantvindavaḥ

translations.griffith: These glorious drops that give me freedom have I drunk. Closely they knit my joints as straps secure a car.  Let them protect my foot from slipping on the way: yea, let the drops I drink preserve me from disease.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं न मा मथितं सं दिदीपः पर चक्षय कर्णुहि वस्यसो नः अथा हि ते मद आ सोम मन्ये रेवानिव पर चरापुष्टिमछ |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ na mā mathitaṃ saṃ didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyaso naḥ athā hi te mada ā soma manye revāniva pra carāpuṣṭimacha

translations.griffith: Make me shine bright like fire produced by friction: give us a clearer sight and make us better.  For in carouse I think of thee, O Soma, Shall I, as a rich man, attain to comfort?

verses.sanskrit: इषिरेण ते मनसा सुतस्य भक्षीमहि पित्र्यस्येव रायः सोम राजन पर ण आयूंषि तारीरहानीव सूर्यो वासराणि |||
verses.transliteration: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasyeva rāyaḥ soma rājan pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tārīrahānīva sūryo vāsarāṇi

translations.griffith: May we enjoy with an enlivened spirit the juice thou givest, like ancestral riches.  O Soma, King, prolong thou our existence as Sūrya makes the shining days grow longer.

verses.sanskrit: सोम राजन मर्ळया नः सवस्ति तव समसि वरत्यास्तस्य विद्धि अलर्ति दक्ष उत मन्युरिन्दो मा नो अर्यो अनुकामं परादाः |||
verses.transliteration: soma rājan mṛḷayā naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyāstasya viddhi alarti dakṣa uta manyurindo mā no aryo anukāmaṃ parādāḥ

translations.griffith: King Soma, favour us and make us prosper: we are thy devotees; of this be mindful.  Spirit and power are fresh in us, O Indu give us not up unto our foeman's pleasure.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि नस्तन्वः सोम गोपा गात्रे-गात्रे निषसत्था नर्चक्षाः यत ते वयं परमिनाम वरतानि स नो मर्ळ सुषखादेव वस्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi nastanvaḥ soma ghopā ghātre-ghātre niṣasatthā nṛcakṣāḥ yat te vayaṃ pramināma vratāni sa no mṛḷa suṣakhādeva vasyaḥ

translations.griffith: For thou hast settled in each joint, O Soma, aim of men's eyes and guardian of our bodies.  When we offend against thine holy statutes, as a kind Friend, God, best of all, be gracious.

verses.sanskrit: रदूदरेण साख्या सचेय यो मा न रिष्येद धर्यश्व पीतः अयं यः सोमो नयधाय्यस्मे तस्मा इन्द्रं परतिरमेम्यायुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛdūdareṇa sākhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ ayaṃ yaḥ somo nyadhāyyasme tasmā indraṃ pratiramemyāyuḥ

translations.griffith: May I be with the Friend whose heart is tender, who, Lord of Bays! when quaffed will never harm me-  This Soma now deposited within me. For this, I pray for longer life to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अप तया अस्थुरनिरा अमीवा निरत्रसन तमिषीचीरभैषुः आ सोमो अस्मानरुहद विहाया अगन्म यत्र परतिरन्त आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: apa tyā asthuranirā amīvā niratrasan tamiṣīcīrabhaiṣuḥ ā somo asmānaruhad vihāyā aghanma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Our maladies have lost their strength and vanished: they feared, and passed away into the darkness.  Soma hath risen in us, exceeding mighty, and we are come where men prolong existence.  12, Fathers, that Indu which our hearts have drunken, Immortal in himself, hath entered mortals.  So let us serve this Soma with oblation, and rest securely in his grace and favour.

verses.sanskrit: यो न इन्दुः पितरो हर्त्सु पीतो.अमर्त्यो मर्त्यानाविवेश तस्मै सोमाय हविषा विधेम मर्ळीके अस्य सुमतौ सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: yo na induḥ pitaro hṛtsu pīto.amartyo martyānāviveśa tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḷīke asya sumatau syāma

translations.griffith: Associate with the Fathers thou, O Soma, hast spread thyself abroad through earth and heaven.  So with oblation let us serve thee, Indu, and so let us become the lords of riches,

verses.sanskrit: तवं सोम पित्र्भिः संविदानो.अनु दयावाप्र्थिवी आ ततन्थ तस्मै त इन्दो हविषा विधेम वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno.anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Give us your blessing, O ye Gods’ preservers. Never may sleep or idle talk control us.  But evermore may we, as friends of Soma, speak to the synod with brave sons around us.

verses.sanskrit: तरातारो देवा अधि वोचता नो मा नो निद्रा ईशत मोत जल्पिः वयं सोमस्य विश्वह परियासः सुवीरासो विदथमावदेम |||
verses.transliteration: trātāro devā adhi vocatā no mā no nidrā īśata mota jalpiḥ vayaṃ somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidathamāvadema

translations.griffith: On all sides,. Soma, thou art our life-giver: aim of all eyes, light-finder, come within us.  Indu, of one accord with thy protections both from behind and from before preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो वयोधास्त्वं सवर्विदा विशा नर्चक्षाः तवं न इन्द ऊतिभिः सजोषाः पाहि पश्चातादुत वा पुरस्तात |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato vayodhāstvaṃ svarvidā viśā nṛcakṣāḥ tvaṃ na inda ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātāduta vā purastāt

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अभि पर वः सुराधसमिन्द्रमर्च यथा विदे यो जरित्रिभ्यो मघवा पुरूवसुः सहस्रेणेव शिक्षति |||
verses.transliteration: abhi pra vaḥ surādhasamindramarca yathā vide yo jaritribhyo maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇeva śikṣati

translations.griffith: AGNI, come hither with thy fires; we choose thee as Invoking Priest.  Let the extended ladle full of oil balm thee, best Priest, to sit on sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: शतानीकेव पर जिगाति धर्ष्णुया हन्ति वर्त्राणि दाशुषे गिरेरिव पर रसा अस्य पिन्विरे दत्राणि पुरुभोजसः |||
verses.transliteration: śatānīkeva pra jighāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe ghireriva pra rasā asya pinvire datrāṇi purubhojasaḥ

translations.griffith: For unto thee, O Aṅgiras, O Son of Strength, move ladles in the sacrifice.  To Agni, Child of Force, whose locks drop oil, we seek, foremost in sacrificial rites.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा सुतास इन्दवो मदा य इन्द्र गिर्वणः आपो न वज्रिन्नन्वोक्यं सरः पर्णन्ति शूर राधसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā sutāsa indavo madā ya indra ghirvaṇaḥ āpo na vajrinnanvokyaṃ saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase

translations.griffith: Agni, thou art Disposer, Sage, Herald, bright God! and worshipful,  Best offerer, cheerful, to be praised in holy rites, pure Lord! by singers with their hymns.

verses.sanskrit: अनेहसं परतरणं विवक्षणं मध्वः सवादिष्ठमीं पिब आ यथा मन्दसानः किरासि नः पर कषुद्रेव तमना धर्षत |||
verses.transliteration: anehasaṃ prataraṇaṃ vivakṣaṇaṃ madhvaḥ svādiṣṭhamīṃ piba ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudreva tmanā dhṛṣat

translations.griffith: Most Youthful and Eternal, bring the longing Gods to me, the guileless, for the feast.  Come, Vasu, to the banquet that is well-prepared: rejoice thee, gracious, with our songs.

verses.sanskrit: आ न सतोममुप दरवद धियानो अश्वो न सोत्र्भिः यं तेस्वधावन सवदयन्ति धेनव इन्द्र कण्वेषु रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā na stomamupa dravad dhiyāno aśvo na sotṛbhiḥ yaṃ tesvadhāvan svadayanti dhenava indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Famed art thou, Agni, far and wide, Preserver, righteous, and a Sage.  The holy singers, O refulgent kindled God! arrangers, call on thee to come.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रं न वीरं नमसोप सेदिम विभूतिमक्षितावसुम उद्रीव वज्रिन्नवतो न सिञ्चते कषरन्तीन्द्र धीतयः |||
verses.transliteration: ughraṃ na vīraṃ namasopa sedima vibhūtimakṣitāvasum udrīva vajrinnavato na siñcate kṣarantīndra dhītayaḥ

translations.griffith: Shine, Most Resplendent! blaze, send bliss unto the folk, and to thy worshipper  Great art thou.  So may my princes, with good fires, subduing foes, rest in the keeping of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध नूनं यद वा यज्ञे यद वा पर्थिव्यामधि अतो नो यज्ञमाशुभिर्महेमत उग्र उग्रेभिरा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha nūnaṃ yad vā yajñe yad vā pṛthivyāmadhi ato no yajñamāśubhirmahemata ughra ughrebhirā ghahi

translations.griffith: O Agni, as thou burnest down to earth even high-grown underwood,  So, bright as Mitra is, burn him who injures us, him who plots ill against thy friend.

verses.sanskrit: अजिरासो हरयो ये त आशवो वाता इव परसक्षिणः येभिरपत्यं मनुषः परीयसे येभिर्विश्वं सवर्द्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: ajirāso harayo ye ta āśavo vātā iva prasakṣiṇaḥ yebhirapatyaṃ manuṣaḥ parīyase yebhirviśvaṃ svardṛśe

translations.griffith: Give us not as a prey to mortal enemy, nor to the wicked friend of fiends.  With conquering guards, auspicious, unassailable, protect us, O Most Youthful God.

verses.sanskrit: एतावतस्त ईमह इन्द्र सुम्नस्य गोमतः यथा परावो मघवन मेध्यातिथिं यथा नीपातिथिं धने |||
verses.transliteration: etāvatasta īmaha indra sumnasya ghomataḥ yathā prāvo maghavan medhyātithiṃ yathā nīpātithiṃ dhane

translations.griffith: Protect us, Agni, through the first, protect us through the second hymn,  Protect us through three hymns, O Lord of Power and Might, through four hymns, Vasu, guard thou us.

verses.sanskrit: यथा कण्वे मघवन तरसदस्यवि यथा पक्थे दशव्रजे यथा गोशर्ये असनोरजिश्वनीन्द्र गोमद धिरण्यवत |||
verses.transliteration: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje yathā ghośarye asanorjiśvanīndra ghomad dhiraṇyavat

translations.griffith: Preserve us from each fiend who brings the Gods no gift, preserve thou us in deeds of strength:  For we possess in thee the nearest Friend of all, for service of the Gods and weal.

verses.sanskrit: पर सु शरुतं सुराधसमर्चा शक्रमभिष्टये यः सुन्वते सतुवते काम्यं वसु सहस्रेणेव मंहते |||
verses.transliteration: pra su śrutaṃ surādhasamarcā śakramabhiṣṭaye yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sahasreṇeva maṃhate

translations.griffith: BOTH boons,—may Indra, hitherward turned, listen to this prayer of ours,  And mightiest Maghavan with thought inclined to us come near to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: शतानीका हेतयो अस्य दुष्टरा इन्द्रस्य समिषो महीः गिरिर्न भुज्मा मघवत्सु पिन्वते यदीं सुता अमन्दिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: śatānīkā hetayo asya duṣṭarā indrasya samiṣo mahīḥ ghirirna bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yadīṃ sutā amandiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: For him, strong, independent Ruler, Heaven and Earth have fashioned forth for power and might.  Thou seatest thee as first among thy peers in place, for thy soul longs for Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: यदीं सुतास इन्दवो.अभि परियममन्दिषुः आपो न धायि सवनं म आ वसो दुघा इवोप दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: yadīṃ sutāsa indavo.abhi priyamamandiṣuḥ āpo na dhāyi savanaṃ ma ā vaso dughā ivopa dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Fill thyself full, O Lord of wealth, O Indra, with the juice we shed.  We know thee, Lord of Bay Steeds victor in the fight, vanquishing e’en the invincible.

verses.sanskrit: अनेहसं वो हवमानमूतये मध्वः कषरन्ति धीतयः आ तवा वसो हवमानास इन्दव उप सतोत्रेषु दधिरे |||
verses.transliteration: anehasaṃ vo havamānamūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ ā tvā vaso havamānāsa indava upa stotreṣu dadhire

translations.griffith: Changeless in truth, O Maghavan Indra, let it be as thou in wisdom willest it.  May we, O fair of check, win booty with thine aid, O Thunderer, swiftly seeking it.

verses.sanskrit: आ नः सोमे सवध्वर इयानो अत्यो न तोशते यं ते सवदावन सवदन्ति गूर्तयः पौरे छन्दयसे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā naḥ some svadhvara iyāno atyo na tośate yaṃ te svadāvan svadanti ghūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam

translations.griffith: Indra, with all thy saving helps give us assistance, Lord of power.  For after thee we follow even as glorious bliss, thee, Hero, finder-out of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: पर वीरमुग्रं विविचिं धनस्प्र्तं विभूतिं राधसो महः उद्रीव वज्रिन्नवतो वसुत्वना सदा पीपेथ दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vīramughraṃ viviciṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ vibhūtiṃ rādhaso mahaḥ udrīva vajrinnavato vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Increaser of our steeds and multiplying kine, a golden well, O God, art thou,  For no one may impair the gifts laid up in thee. Bring me whatever thing I ask.

verses.sanskrit: यद ध नूनं परावति यद वा पर्थिव्यां दिवि युजान इन्द्र हरिभिर्महेमत रष्व रष्वेभिरा गहि |||
verses.transliteration: yad dha nūnaṃ parāvati yad vā pṛthivyāṃ divi yujāna indra haribhirmahemata ṛṣva ṛṣvebhirā ghahi

translations.griffith: For thou,—come to the worshipper!—wilt find great wealth to make us rich.  Fill thyself full, O Maghavan, for gain of kine, full, Indra, for the gain of steeds.

verses.sanskrit: रथिरासो हरयो ये ते अस्रिध ओजो वातस्य पिप्रति येभिर्नि दस्युं मनुषो निघोषयो येभिः सवः परीयसे |||
verses.transliteration: rathirāso harayo ye te asridha ojo vātasya piprati yebhirni dasyuṃ manuṣo nighoṣayo yebhiḥ svaḥ parīyase

translations.griffith: Thou as thy gift bestowest many hundred herds, yea, many thousands dost thou give.  With singers' hymns have we brought the Fort-render near, singing to Indra for his grace.

verses.sanskrit: एतावतस्ते वसो विद्याम शूर नव्यसः यथा पराव एतशं कर्त्व्ये धने यथा वशं दशव्रजे |||
verses.transliteration: etāvataste vaso vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ yathā prāva etaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśaṃ daśavraje

translations.griffith: Whether the simple or the sage, Indra, have offered praise to thee,  He Śatakratu! by his love hath gladdened thee, ambitious! ever pressing on!

verses.sanskrit: यथा कण्वे मघवन मेधे अध्वरे दीर्घनीथे दमूनसि यथा गोशर्ये असिषासो अद्रिवो मयि गोत्रं हरिश्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrghanīthe damūnasi yathā ghośarye asiṣāso adrivo mayi ghotraṃ hariśriyam

translations.griffith: If he the Strong of arm, the breaker-down of forts, the great Destroyer, hear my call,  We, seeking riches cry to Indra, Lord of wealth, to Śatakratu with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: यथा मनौ सांवरणौ सोममिन्द्रापिबः सुतम नीपातिथौ मघवन मेध्यातिथौ पुष्टिगौ शरुष्टिगौ सचा |||
verses.transliteration: yathā manau sāṃvaraṇau somamindrāpibaḥ sutam nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭighau śruṣṭighau sacā

translations.griffith: OFFER ye up as praise to him that wherein Indra takes delight.  The Soma-bringers magnify Indra's great energy with hymns. Good are the gifts that Indra gives.

verses.sanskrit: पार्षद्वाणः परस्कण्वं समसादयच्छयानं जिव्रिमुद्धितम सहस्राण्यसिषासद गवां रषिस्त्वोतो दस्यवे वर्कः |||
verses.transliteration: pārṣadvāṇaḥ praskaṇvaṃ samasādayacchayānaṃ jivrimuddhitam sahasrāṇyasiṣāsad ghavāṃ ṛṣistvoto dasyave vṛkaḥ

translations.griffith: Sole among chiefs, companionless, impetuous, and peerless, he  Hath waxen great o’er many folk, yea., over all things born, in might.

verses.sanskrit: य उक्थेभिर्न विन्धते चिकिद य रषिचोदनः इन्द्रं तमछा वद नव्यस्या मत्यरिष्यन्तं न भोजसे |||
verses.transliteration: ya ukthebhirna vindhate cikid ya ṛṣicodanaḥ indraṃ tamachā vada navyasyā matyariṣyantaṃ na bhojase

translations.griffith: Lord of swift bounty, he will win e’en with a steed of worthless sort.  This, Indra, must be told of thee who wilt perform heroic deeds.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मा अर्कं सप्तशीर्षाणमान्र्चुस्त्रिधातुमुत्तमे पदे स तविमा विश्वा भुवनानि चिक्रददादिज्जनिष्ट पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmā arkaṃ saptaśīrṣāṇamānṛcustridhātumuttame pade sa tvimā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradadādijjaniṣṭa pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: Come to us hither: let us pay devotions that enhance thy might,  For which, Most Potent! thou wouldst fain bless the man here who strives for fame.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो दाता वसूनामिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम विद्मा हयस्य सुमतिं नवीयसीं गमेम गोमति वरजे |||
verses.transliteration: yo no dātā vasūnāmindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam vidmā hyasya sumatiṃ navīyasīṃ ghamema ghomati vraje

translations.griffith: For thou, O Indra, makest yet more bold the spirit of the bold  Who with strong Soma serveth thee, still ready with his reverent prayers.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवं वसो दानाय शिक्षसि स रायस पोषमश्नुते तं तवा वयं मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः सुतावन्तो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyas poṣamaśnute taṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavannindra ghirvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe

translations.griffith: Worthy of song, he looketh down as a man looketh into wells.  Pleased with the Soma-bringer's skill he maketh him his mate and friend.

verses.sanskrit: कदा चन सतरीरसि नेन्द्र सश्चसि दाशुषे उपोपेन नु मघवन भूय इन नु ते दानं देवस्य पर्च्यते |||
verses.transliteration: kadā cana starīrasi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate

translations.griffith: In strength and wisdom all the Gods, Indra, have yielded unto thee.  Be thou the Guard of all, O thou whom many praise.

verses.sanskrit: पर यो ननक्षे अभ्योजसा करिविं वधैः शुष्णं निघोषयन यदेदस्तम्भीत परथयन्नमूं दिवमादिज्जनिष्ट पार्थिवः |||
verses.transliteration: pra yo nanakṣe abhyojasā kriviṃ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇaṃ nighoṣayan yadedastambhīt prathayannamūṃ divamādijjaniṣṭa pārthivaḥ

translations.griffith: Praised, Indra, is this might of thine, best for the service of the Gods,  That thou with power dost slay Vṛtra, O Lord of Strength.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यायं विश्व आर्यो दासः शेवधिपा अरिः तिरश्चिदर्ये रुशमे परीरवि तुभ्येत सो अज्यते रयिः |||
verses.transliteration: yasyāyaṃ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ tiraścidarye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ

translations.griffith: He makes the races of mankind like synods of the Beauteous One.  Indra knows this his manifest deed, and is renowned.

verses.sanskrit: तुरण्यवो मधुमन्तं घर्तश्चुतं विप्रासो अर्कमान्र्चुः अस्मे रयिः पप्रथे वर्ष्ण्यं शवो.अस्मे सुवानास इन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: turaṇyavo madhumantaṃ ghṛtaścutaṃ viprāso arkamānṛcuḥ asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo.asme suvānāsa indavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thy might, O Indra, at its birth, thee also, and thy mental power,  In thy care, Maghavan rich in kine! they have increased exceedingly.

verses.sanskrit: यथा मनौ विवस्वति सोमं शक्रापिबः सुतम यथा तरिते छन्द इन्द्र जुजोषस्यायौ मादयसे सचा |||
verses.transliteration: yathā manau vivasvati somaṃ śakrāpibaḥ sutam yathā trite chanda indra jujoṣasyāyau mādayase sacā

translations.griffith: WITH powers of Mighty Ones hath he, Ancient, Beloved, been equipped,  Through whom the Father Manu made prayers efficacious with the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: पर्षध्रे मेध्ये मातरिश्वनीन्द्र सुवाने अमन्दथाः यथा सोमं दशशिप्रे दशोण्ये सयूमरश्माव रजूनसि |||
verses.transliteration: pṛṣadhre medhye mātariśvanīndra suvāne amandathāḥ yathā somaṃ daśaśipre daśoṇye syūmaraśmāv ṛjūnasi

translations.griffith: Him, Maker of the sky, let stones wet with the Soma ne’er forsake,  Nor hymns and prayer that must be said.

verses.sanskrit: य उक्था केवला दधे यः सोमं धर्षितापिबत यस्मै विष्णुस्त्रीणि पदा विचक्रम उप मित्रस्य धर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ukthā kevalā dadhe yaḥ somaṃ dhṛṣitāpibat yasmai viṣṇustrīṇi padā vicakrama upa mitrasya dharmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Indra who knew full well disclosed the kine to the Aṅgirases.  This his great deed must be extolled.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तवमिन्द्र सतोमेषु चाकनो वाजे वाजिञ्छतक्रतो तं तवा वयं सुदुघामिव गोदुहो जुहूमसि शरवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tvamindra stomeṣu cākano vāje vājiñchatakrato taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudughāmiva ghoduho juhūmasi śravasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, promoter of the song, the sage's Strengthener as of old,  Shall come to bless and succour us at presentation of this laud.

verses.sanskrit: यो नो दाता स नः पिता महानुग्र ईशानक्र्त अयामन्नुग्रो मघवा पुरूवसुर्गोरश्वस्य पर दातु नः |||
verses.transliteration: yo no dātā sa naḥ pitā mahānughra īśānakṛt ayāmannughro maghavā purūvasurghoraśvasya pra dātu naḥ

translations.griffith: Now after their desire's intent the pious singers with the cry  Of Hail! have sung loud hymns to thee, Indra, to gain a stall of kine.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवं वसो दानाय मंहसे स रायस पोषमिन्वति वसूयवो वसुपतिं शतक्रतुं सतोमैरिन्द्रं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ vaso dānāya maṃhase sa rāyas poṣaminvati vasūyavo vasupatiṃ śatakratuṃ stomairindraṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: With Indra rest all deeds of might, deeds done and yet to be performed,  Whom singers know devoid of guile.

verses.sanskrit: कदा चन पर युछस्युभे नि पासि जन्मनी तुरीयादित्य हवनं त इन्द्रियमा तस्थावम्र्तं दिवि |||
verses.transliteration: kadā cana pra yuchasyubhe ni pāsi janmanī turīyāditya havanaṃ ta indriyamā tasthāvamṛtaṃ divi

translations.griffith: When the Five Tribes with all their men to Indra have sent out their voice,  And when the priest hath strewn much grass, this is the Friend's own dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवं मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः शिक्षो शिक्षसि दाशुषे अस्माकं गिर उत सुष्टुतिं वसो कण्ववच्छ्र्णुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ maghavannindra ghirvaṇaḥ śikṣo śikṣasi dāśuṣe asmākaṃ ghira uta suṣṭutiṃ vaso kaṇvavacchṛṇudhī havam

translations.griffith: This praise is verily thine own: thou hast performed these manly deeds,  And sped the wheel upon its way.

verses.sanskrit: अस्तावि मन्म पूर्व्यं बरह्मेन्द्राय वोचत पूर्वीरतस्य बर्हतीरनूषत सतोतुर्मेधा अस्र्क्षत |||
verses.transliteration: astāvi manma pūrvyaṃ brahmendrāya vocata pūrvīrtasya bṛhatīranūṣata stoturmedhā asṛkṣata

translations.griffith: At the o’erflowing of this Steer, boldly he strode for life, and took  Soma as cattle take their corn.

verses.sanskrit: समिन्द्रो रायो बर्हतीरधूनुत सं कषोणी समु सूर्यम सं शुक्रासः शुचयः सं गवाशिरः सोमा इन्द्रममन्दिषुः |||
verses.transliteration: samindro rāyo bṛhatīradhūnuta saṃ kṣoṇī samu sūryam saṃ śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ saṃ ghavāśiraḥ somā indramamandiṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Receiving this and craving help, we, who with you are Dakṣa's sons,  Would fain exalt the Maruts’ Lord.

verses.sanskrit: उपमं तवा मघोनां जयेष्ठं च वर्षभाणाम पूर्भित्तमं मघवन्निन्द्र गोविदमीशानं राय ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: upamaṃ tvā maghonāṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca vṛṣabhāṇām pūrbhittamaṃ maghavannindra ghovidamīśānaṃ rāya īmahe

translations.griffith: MAY our hymns give thee great delight. Display thy bounty, Thunderer.  Drive off the enemies of prayer.

verses.sanskrit: य आयुं कुत्समतिथिग्वमर्दयो वाव्र्धानो दिवे-दिवे तं तवा वयं हर्यश्वं शतक्रतुं वाजयन्तो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: ya āyuṃ kutsamatithighvamardayo vāvṛdhāno dive-dive taṃ tvā vayaṃ haryaśvaṃ śatakratuṃ vājayanto havāmahe

translations.griffith: Crush with thy foot the niggard churls who bring no gifts. Mighty art thou  There is not one to equal thee.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वेषां रसं मध्वः सिञ्चन्त्वद्रयः ये परावति सुन्विरे जनेष्वा ये अर्वावतीन्दवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśveṣāṃ rasaṃ madhvaḥ siñcantvadrayaḥ ye parāvati sunvire janeṣvā ye arvāvatīndavaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou art the Lord of Soma pressed, Soma impressed is also thine.  Thou art the Sovran of the folk.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा दवेषांसि जहि चाव चा कर्धि विश्वे सन्वन्त्वा वसु शीष्टेषु चित ते मदिरासो अंशवो यत्रा सोमस्य तर्म्पसि |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā dveṣāṃsi jahi cāva cā kṛdhi viśve sanvantvā vasu śīṣṭeṣu cit te madirāso aṃśavo yatrā somasya tṛmpasi

translations.griffith: Come, go thou forth, dwelling in heaven and listening to the prayers of men:  Thou fillest both the heavens and earth.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र नेदीय एदिहि मितमेधाभिरूतिभिः आ शन्तम शन्तमाभिरभिष्टिभिरा सवापे सवापिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: indra nedīya edihi mitamedhābhirūtibhiḥ ā śantama śantamābhirabhiṣṭibhirā svāpe svāpibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Even that hill with rocky heights, with hundreds, thousands, held within.  Thou for thy worshippers brakest through.

verses.sanskrit: आजितुरं सत्पतिं विश्वचर्षणिं कर्धि परजास्वाभगम पर सू तिरा शचीभिर्ये त उक्थिनः करतुं पुनत आनुषक |||
verses.transliteration: ājituraṃ satpatiṃ viśvacarṣaṇiṃ kṛdhi prajāsvābhagham pra sū tirā śacībhirye ta ukthinaḥ kratuṃ punata ānuṣak

translations.griffith: We call on thee both night and day to taste the flowing Soma juice:  Do thou fulfil our heart's desire.

verses.sanskrit: यस्ते साधिष्ठो.अवसे ते सयाम भरेषु ते वयं होत्राभिरुत देवहूतिभिः ससवांसो मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yaste sādhiṣṭho.avase te syāma bhareṣu te vayaṃ hotrābhiruta devahūtibhiḥ sasavāṃso manāmahe

translations.griffith: Where is that ever-youthful Steer, strong. necked and never yet bent down?  What Brahman ministers to him?

verses.sanskrit: अहं हि ते हरिवो बरह्म वाजयुराजिं यामि सदोतिभिः तवामिदेव तममे समश्वयुर्गव्युरग्रे मथीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ hi te harivo brahma vājayurājiṃ yāmi sadotibhiḥ tvāmideva tamame samaśvayurghavyuraghre mathīnām

translations.griffith: To whose libation doth the Steer, betake him with delight therein?  Who takes delight in Indra now?

verses.sanskrit: एतत त इन्द्र वीर्यं गीर्भिर्ग्र्णन्ति कारवः ते सतोभन्त ऊर्जमावन घर्तश्चुतं पौरासो नक्षन धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: etat ta indra vīryaṃ ghīrbhirghṛṇanti kāravaḥ te stobhanta ūrjamāvan ghṛtaścutaṃ paurāso nakṣan dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men from east and west, from north and south,  Come hither quickly with fleet steeds

verses.sanskrit: नक्षन्त इन्द्रमवसे सुक्र्त्यया येषां सुतेषु मन्दसे यथा संवर्ते अमदो यथा कर्श एवास्मे इन्द्र मत्स्व |||
verses.transliteration: nakṣanta indramavase sukṛtyayā yeṣāṃ suteṣu mandase yathā saṃvarte amado yathā kṛśa evāsme indra matsva

translations.griffith: If in the effluence of heaven, rich in its light, thou takest joy,  Or in the sea in Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो गन्तनोप नः वसवो रुद्रावसे न आ गमञ्छ्र्ण्वन्तु मरुतो हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśve sajoṣaso devāso ghantanopa naḥ vasavo rudrāavase na ā ghamañchṛṇvantu maruto havam

translations.griffith: With songs I call thee, Great and Wide, even as a cow to profit us,  Indra, to drink the Soma-draught.

verses.sanskrit: पूषा विष्णुर्हवनं मे सरस्वत्यवन्तु सप्त सिन्धवः आपो वातः पर्वतासो वनस्पतिः शर्णोतु पर्थिवी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: pūṣā viṣṇurhavanaṃ me sarasvatyavantu sapta sindhavaḥ āpo vātaḥ parvatāso vanaspatiḥ śṛṇotu pṛthivī havam

translations.griffith: Hither, O Indra, let thy Bays bear up and, bring upon thy car  Thy glory, God! and majesty.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र राधो अस्ति ते माघोनं मघवत्तम तेन नो बोधि सधमाद्यो वर्धे भगो दानाय वर्त्रहन |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra rādho asti te māghonaṃ maghavattama tena no bodhi sadhamādyo vṛdhe bhagho dānāya vṛtrahan

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, wouldst be sung and praised as great, strong, lordly in thy deeds  Come hither, drink our Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: आजिपते नर्पते तवमिद धि नो वाज आ वक्षि सुक्रतो वीतीहोत्राभिरुत देववीतिभिः ससवांसो वि शर्ण्विरे |||
verses.transliteration: ājipate nṛpate tvamid dhi no vāja ā vakṣi sukrato vītīhotrābhiruta devavītibhiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire

translations.griffith: We who have shed the Soma and prepared the feast are calling thee.  To sit on this our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: सन्ति हयर्य आशिष इन्द्र आयुर्जनानाम अस्मान नक्षस्वमघवन्नुपावसे धुक्षस्व पिप्युषीमिषम |||
verses.transliteration: santi hyarya āśiṣa indra āyurjanānām asmān nakṣasvamaghavannupāvase dhukṣasva pipyuṣīmiṣam

translations.griffith: As, Indra, thou art evermore the common Lord of all alike,  As such we invocate thee now.

verses.sanskrit: वयं त इन्द्र सतोमेभिर्विधेम तवमस्माकं शतक्रतो महि सथूरं शशयं राधो अह्रयं परस्कण्वाय नि तोशय |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ ta indra stomebhirvidhema tvamasmākaṃ śatakrato mahi sthūraṃ śaśayaṃ rādho ahrayaṃ praskaṇvāya ni tośaya

translations.griffith: The men with stones have milked for thee this nectar of the Soma juice:  Indra, be pleased with it, and drink.

verses.sanskrit: भूरीदिन्द्रस्य वीर्यं वयख्यमभ्यायति राधस्ते दस्यवे वर्क |||
verses.transliteration: bhūrīdindrasya vīryaṃ vyakhyamabhyāyati rādhaste dasyave vṛka

translations.griffith: LOUD singing at the sacred rite where Soma flows we priests invoke  With haste, that he may help, as the bard's Cherisher, Indra who findeth wealth for you.

verses.sanskrit: शतं शवेतास उक्षणो दिवि तारो न रोचन्ते मह्ना दिवं न तस्तभुः |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ śvetāsa ukṣaṇo divi tāro na rocante mahnā divaṃ na tastabhuḥ

translations.griffith: Whom with fair helm, in rapture of the juice, the firm resistless slayers hinder not:  Giver of glorious wealth to him who sing a his praise, honouring him who toils and pours:

verses.sanskrit: शतं वेणूञ्छतं शुनः शतं चर्माणि मलातानि शतं मे बल्बजस्तुका अरुषीणां चतुःशतम |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ veṇūñchataṃ śunaḥ śataṃ carmāṇi mlātāni śataṃ me balbajastukā aruṣīṇāṃ catuḥśatam

translations.griffith: Śakra, who like a curry-comb for horses or a golden goad,  Indra, the Vṛtra-slayer, urges eagerly the opening of the stall of kine:

verses.sanskrit: सुदेवाः सथ काण्वायना वयो-वयो विचरन्तः अश्वासो नचङकरमत |||
verses.transliteration: sudevāḥ stha kāṇvāyanā vayo-vayo vicarantaḥ aśvāso nacaṅkramata

translations.griffith: Who for the worshipper scatters forth ample wealth, even though buried, piled in heaps:  May Indra, Lord of Bay Steeds, fair-helmed Thunderer, act at his pleasure, as he lists.

verses.sanskrit: आदित साप्तस्य चर्किरन्नानूनस्य महि शरवः शयावीरतिध्वसन पथश्चक्षुषा चन संनशे |||
verses.transliteration: ādit sāptasya carkirannānūnasya mahi śravaḥ śyāvīratidhvasan pathaścakṣuṣā cana saṃnaśe

translations.griffith: Hero whom many praise, what thou hast longed for, oven of old, from men.  All that we offer unto thee, O Indra, now, sacrifice, laud, effectual speech.

verses.sanskrit: परति ते दस्यवे वर्क राधो अदर्श्यह्रयम दयौर्न परथिना शवः |||
verses.transliteration: prati te dasyave vṛka rādho adarśyahrayam dyaurna prathinā śavaḥ

translations.griffith: Now pray we to these Ksatriyas, to the Ādityas for their aid,  These who are gracious to assist.

verses.sanskrit: दश मह्यं पौतक्रतः सहस्रा दस्यवे वर्कः नित्याद रायो अमंहत |||
verses.transliteration: daśa mahyaṃ pautakrataḥ sahasrā dasyave vṛkaḥ nityād rāyo amaṃhata

translations.griffith: May Mitra bear us o’er distress, and Varuṇa and Aryaman,  Yea, the Ādityas, as they know.

verses.sanskrit: शतं मे गर्दभानां शतमूर्णावतीनाम शतं दासानति सरजः |||
verses.transliteration: śataṃ me ghardabhānāṃ śatamūrṇāvatīnām śataṃ dāsānati srajaḥ

translations.griffith: For wonderful and meet for praise is these Ādityas’ saving help  To him who offers and prepares.

verses.sanskrit: तत्रो अपि पराणीयत पूतक्रतायै वयक्ता अश्वानामिन न यूथ्याम |||
verses.transliteration: tatro api prāṇīyata pūtakratāyai vyaktā aśvānāmin na yūthyām

translations.griffith: The mighty aid of you, the Great, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  We claim to be our sure defence.

verses.sanskrit: अचेत्यग्निश्चिकितुर्हव्यवाट स सुमद्रथः अग्निः शुक्रेण शोचिषा बर्हत सूरो अरोचत दिवि सूर्यो अरोचत |||
verses.transliteration: acetyaghniścikiturhavyavāṭ sa sumadrathaḥ aghniḥ śukreṇa śociṣā bṛhat sūro arocata divi sūryo arocata

translations.griffith: Guard us, Ādityas, still alive, before the deadly weapon strike:  Are yc not they who hear our call?

verses.sanskrit: युवं देवा करतुना पूर्व्येण युक्ता रथेन तविषं यजत्रा आगछतं नासत्या शचीभिरिदं तर्तीयं सवनं पिबाथः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ devā kratunā pūrvyeṇa yuktā rathena taviṣaṃ yajatrā āghachataṃ nāsatyā śacībhiridaṃ tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ pibāthaḥ

translations.griffith: EVEN as a car to give us aid, we draw thee hither for our bliss,  Strong in thy deeds, checking assault, Lord, Mightiest Indra, of the brave!

verses.sanskrit: युवां देवास्त्रय एकादशासः सत्याः सत्यस्य दद्र्शे पुरस्तात अस्माकं यज्ञं सवनं जुषाणा पातं सोममश्विना दीद्यग्नी |||
verses.transliteration: yuvāṃ devāstraya ekādaśāsaḥ satyāḥ satyasya dadṛśe purastāt asmākaṃ yajñaṃ savanaṃ juṣāṇā pātaṃ somamaśvinā dīdyaghnī

translations.griffith: Great in thy power and wisdom, Strong, with thought that comprehendeth all  Thou hast filled full with majesty.

verses.sanskrit: पनाय्यं तदश्विना कर्तं वां वर्षभो दिवो रजसः पर्थिव्याः सहस्रं शंसा उत ये गविष्टौ सर्वानित तानुप याता पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: panāyyaṃ tadaśvinā kṛtaṃ vāṃ vṛṣabho divo rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta ye ghaviṣṭau sarvānit tānupa yātā pibadhyai

translations.griffith: Thou very Mighty One, whose hands by virtue of thy greatness grasp,  The golden bolt that breaks its way.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वां भागो निहितो यजत्रेमा गिरो नासत्योप यातम पिबतं सोमं मधुमन्तमस्मे पर दाश्वांसमवतं शचीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ bhāgho nihito yajatremā ghiro nāsatyopa yātam pibataṃ somaṃ madhumantamasme pra dāśvāṃsamavataṃ śacībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Your Lord of might that ne’er hath bent, that ruleth over all mankind,  I call, that he, as he is wont, may aid the chariots and the men.

verses.sanskrit: यं रत्विजो बहुधा कल्पयन्तः सचेतसो यज्ञमिमं वहन्ति यो अनूचानो बराह्मणो युक्त आसीत का सवित तत्र यजमानस्य संवित |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ ṛtvijo bahudhā kalpayantaḥ sacetaso yajñamimaṃ vahanti yo anūcāno brāhmaṇo yukta āsīt kā svit tatra yajamānasya saṃvit

translations.griffith: I SEND you forth the song of praise for Indu, hero-gladdener.  With hymn and plenty he invites you to complete the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: एक एवाग्निर्बहुधा समिद्ध एकः सूर्यो विश्वमनु परभूतः एकैवोषाः सर्वमिदं वि भात्येकं वा इदंवि बभूव सर्वम |||
verses.transliteration: eka evāghnirbahudhā samiddha ekaḥ sūryo viśvamanu prabhūtaḥ ekaivoṣāḥ sarvamidaṃ vi bhātyekaṃ vā idaṃvi babhūva sarvam

translations.griffith: Thou wishest for thy kine a bull, for those who long for his approach,  For those who turn away from him, lord of thy cows whom none may kill.

verses.sanskrit: जयोतिष्मन्तं केतुमन्तं तरिचक्रं सुखं रथं सुषदं भूरिवारम चित्रामघा यस्य योगे.अधिजज्ञे तं वां हुवेति रिक्तं पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: jyotiṣmantaṃ ketumantaṃ tricakraṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ suṣadaṃ bhūrivāram citrāmaghā yasya yoghe.adhijajñe taṃ vāṃ huveati riktaṃ pibadhyai

translations.griffith: The dappled kine who stream with milk prepare his draught of Soma juice:  Clans in the birth-place of the Gods, in the three luminous realms of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इमानि वां भागधेयानि सिस्रत इन्द्रावरुणा पर महे सुतेषु वाम यज्ञे-यज्ञे ह सवना भुरण्यथो यत सुन्वते यजमानाय शिक्षथः |||
verses.transliteration: imāni vāṃ bhāghadheyāni sisrata indrāvaruṇā pra mahe suteṣu vām yajñe-yajñe ha savanā bhuraṇyatho yat sunvate yajamānāya śikṣathaḥ

translations.griffith: HE who, as Sovran Lord of men, moves with his chariots unrestrained,  The Vṛtra-slayer vanquisher, of fighting hosts, preeminent, is praised with song.

verses.sanskrit: निष्षिध्वरीरोषधीराप आस्तामिन्द्रावरुणा महिमानमाशत या सिस्रतू रजसः पारे अध्वनो ययोः शत्रुर्नकिरादेव ओहते |||
verses.transliteration: niṣṣidhvarīroṣadhīrāpa āstāmindrāvaruṇā mahimānamāśata yā sisratū rajasaḥ pāre adhvano yayoḥ śatrurnakirādeva ohate

translations.griffith: Honour that Indra, Puruhanman! for his aid, in whose sustaining hand of old,  The splendid bolt of thunder was deposited, as the great Sun was set in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यं तदिन्द्रावरुणा कर्शस्य वां मध्व ऊर्मिं दुहते सप्त वाणीः ताभिर्दाश्वांसमवतं शुभस पती यो वामदब्धो अभि पाति चित्तिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: satyaṃ tadindrāvaruṇā kṛśasya vāṃ madhva ūrmiṃ duhate sapta vāṇīḥ tābhirdāśvāṃsamavataṃ śubhas patī yo vāmadabdho abhi pāti cittibhiḥ

translations.griffith: No one by deed attains to him who works and strengthens evermore:  No, not by sacrifice, to Indra. praised o all, resistless, daring, bold in might.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तप्रुषः सौम्या जीरदानवः सप्त सवसारः सदन रतस्य या ह वामिन्द्रावरुणा घर्तश्चुतस्ताभिर्धत्तं यजमानाय शिक्षतम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtapruṣaḥ saumyā jīradānavaḥ sapta svasāraḥ sadana ṛtasya yā ha vāmindrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutastābhirdhattaṃ yajamānāya śikṣatam

translations.griffith: The potent Conqueror, invincible in war, him at whose birth the Mighty Ones,  The Kine who spread  afar  , sent their loud voices out, heavens, earths seat their loud voices out,

verses.sanskrit: अवोचाम महते सौभगाय सत्यं तवेषाभ्यां महिमानमिन्द्रियम अस्मान सविन्द्रावरुणा घर्तश्चुतस्त्रिभिः साप्तेभिरवतं शुभस पती |||
verses.transliteration: avocāma mahate saubhaghāya satyaṃ tveṣābhyāṃ mahimānamindriyam asmān svindrāvaruṇā ghṛtaścutastribhiḥ sāptebhiravataṃ śubhas patī

translations.griffith: O Indra, if a hundred heavens and if a hundred earths were thine—  No, not a thousand Suns could match thee at thy birth, not both the worlds, O Thunderer.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा यद रषिभ्यो मनीषां वाचो मतिं शरुतमदत्तमग्रे यानि सथानान्यस्र्जन्त धीरा यज्ञं तन्वानास्तपसाभ्यपश्यम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā yad ṛṣibhyo manīṣāṃ vāco matiṃ śrutamadattamaghre yāni sthānānyasṛjanta dhīrā yajñaṃ tanvānāstapasābhyapaśyam

translations.griffith: Thou, Hero, hast performed thy hero deeds with might, yea, all with strength, O Strongest One.  Maghavan, help us to a stable full of kine, O Thunderer, with wondrous aids.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा सौमनसमद्र्प्तं रायस पोषं यजमानेषु धत्तम परजां पुष्टिं भूतिमस्मासु धत्तं दीर्घायुत्वाय पर तिरतं न आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāvaruṇā saumanasamadṛptaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhattam prajāṃ puṣṭiṃ bhūtimasmāsu dhattaṃ dīrghāyutvāya pra tirataṃ na āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Let not a godless mortal gain this food, O thou whose life is long!  But one who yokes the bright-hued steeds, the Etasas, even Indra yoker of the Bays.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न आ याह्यग्निभिर्होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे आ तवामनक्तु परयता हविष्मती यजिष्ठं बर्हिरासदे |||
verses.transliteration: aghna ā yāhyaghnibhirhotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe ā tvāmanaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭhaṃ barhirāsade

translations.griffith: O AGNI, come here with the fires, we choose you as our invoking priest; let the presented offering anoint

verses.sanskrit: अछा हि तवा सहसः सूनो अङगिरः सरुचश्चरन्त्यध्वरे ऊर्जो नपातं घर्तकेशमीमहे.अग्निं यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यम |||
verses.transliteration: achā hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅghiraḥ srucaścarantyadhvare ūrjo napātaṃ ghṛtakeśamīmahe.aghniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam

translations.griffith: Aṅgirasa, son of strength, the ladles go to find you in the sacrifice; we praise the ancient Agni in ourofferings, the grandson of food, butter-haired.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने कविर्वेधा असि होता पावक यक्ष्यः मन्द्रो यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्वीड्यो विप्रेभिः शुक्र मन्मबिः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne kavirvedhā asi hotā pāvaka yakṣyaḥ mandro yajiṣṭho adhvareṣvīḍyo viprebhiḥ śukra manmabiḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, you, wise, are the creator (of consequences); O purifier, you are the involving priest, worthy ofworship; bright one, you are to be praised in our sacrifices by the priests with hymns, yourself the chief ministrantworthy to be rejoiced in.

verses.sanskrit: अद्रोघमा वहोशतो यविष्ठ्य देवानजस्र वीतये अभि परयांसि सुधिता वसो गहि मन्दस्व धीतिभिर्हितः |||
verses.transliteration: adroghamā vahośato yaviṣṭhya devānajasra vītaye abhi prayāṃsi sudhitā vaso ghahi mandasva dhītibhirhitaḥ

translations.griffith: Most youthful, eternal one, bring the longing gods to me guileless, to eat (the oblation); giver ofdwellings, approach the well-plural ced food; rejoice, being set in your plural ce with praises

verses.sanskrit: तवमित सप्रथा अस्यग्ने तरातरतस कविः तवां विप्रासः समिधान दीदिव आ विवासन्ति वेधसः |||
verses.transliteration: tvamit saprathā asyaghne trātartas kaviḥ tvāṃ viprāsaḥ samidhāna dīdiva ā vivāsanti vedhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Deliverer Agni, you, the truthful and the seer, are widely spread; O kindled blazing one, the wisepraisers wait on you.

verses.sanskrit: शोचा शोचिष्ठ दीदिहि विशे मयो रास्व सतोत्रे महानसि देवानां शर्मन मम सन्तु सूरयः शत्रूषाहः सवग्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: śocā śociṣṭha dīdihi viśe mayo rāsva stotre mahānasi devānāṃ śarman mama santu sūrayaḥ śatrūṣāhaḥ svaghnayaḥ

translations.griffith: Most resplendent (Agni), shine forth and illuminate (us); give happiness to your people, to yourworshipper, for you are great; may my priests abide in the bliss of the gods, subduing their enemies, possessingbright fires.

verses.sanskrit: यथा चिद वर्द्धमतसमग्ने संजूर्वसि कषमि एवा दहमित्रमहो यो अस्मध्रुग दुर्मन्मा कश्च वेनति |||
verses.transliteration: yathā cid vṛddhamatasamaghne saṃjūrvasi kṣami evā dahamitramaho yo asmadhrugh durmanmā kaśca venati

translations.griffith: As, Agni, you consume old timber on the earth, so, cherisher of friends, do you burn our injurer,whosoever evil-minded wishes (our ill)

verses.sanskrit: मा नो मर्ताय रिपवे रक्षस्विने माघशंसाय रीरधः अस्रेधद्भिस्तरणिभिर्यविष्ठ्य शिवेभिः पाहि पायुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no martāya ripave rakṣasvine māghaśaṃsāya rīradhaḥ asredhadbhistaraṇibhiryaviṣṭhya śivebhiḥ pāhi pāyubhiḥ

translations.griffith: Subject us not to a strong mortal enemy, nor to the malevolent; O most youthful, guard us with yourunharming delivering auspicious protections.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि नो अग्न एकया पाह्युत दवितीयया पाहि गीर्भिस्तिस्र्भिरूर्जां पते पाहि चतस्र्भिर्वसो |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi no aghna ekayā pāhyuta dvitīyayā pāhi ghīrbhistisṛbhirūrjāṃ pate pāhi catasṛbhirvaso

translations.griffith: Agni, protect us by one (rich), or protect us by a second; lord of strength, protect us by three sons;protect us, giver of dwellings, by four.

verses.sanskrit: पाहि विश्वस्माद रक्षसो अराव्णः पर सम वाजेषु नो.अव तवामिद धि नेदिष्ठं देवतातय आपिं नक्षामहे वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: pāhi viśvasmād rakṣaso arāvṇaḥ pra sma vājeṣu no.ava tvāmid dhi nediṣṭhaṃ devatātaya āpiṃ nakṣāmahe vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Protect us from every impious rākṣasa, shield us in battles; we approach you, our nearest neighbour,our kinsman, for sacrifice and for increase.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो अग्ने वयोव्र्धं रयिं पावक शंस्यम रास्वा च न उपमाते पुरुस्प्र्हं सुनीती सवयशस्तरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no aghne vayovṛdhaṃ rayiṃ pāvaka śaṃsyam rāsvā ca na upamāte puruspṛhaṃ sunītī svayaśastaram

translations.griffith: Purifying Agni, bestow upon us food-augmenting excellent wealth; and (bring) us, O meter-out of good,by auspicious guidance, (a treasure) desired by many and bringing its own fame.

verses.sanskrit: येन वंसाम पर्तनासु शर्धतस्तरन्तो अर्य आदिशः स तवं नो वर्ध परयसा शचीवसो जिन्वा धियो वसुविदः |||
verses.transliteration: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śardhatastaranto arya ādiśaḥ sa tvaṃ no vardha prayasā śacīvaso jinvā dhiyo vasuvidaḥ

translations.griffith: By which we may escape and destroy in battles our impetuous weapon- aiming enemies; O you who bywisdom establish our rites, bless us with food, prosper our wealth-obtaining offerings.

verses.sanskrit: शिशानो वर्षभो यथाग्निः शर्ङगे दविध्वत तिग्मा अस्य ननवो न परतिध्र्षे सुजम्भः सहसो यहुः |||
verses.transliteration: śiśāno vṛṣabho yathāghniḥ śṛṅghe davidhvat tighmā asya nanavo na pratidhṛṣe sujambhaḥ sahaso yahuḥ

translations.griffith: Agni tosses his horns, sharpening them as a bull; his sharp jaws are not to be resisted; he is mightytoothed, this son of strength.

verses.sanskrit: नहि ते अग्ने वर्षभ परतिध्र्षे जम्भासो यद वितिष्टसे सत्वं नो होतः सुहुतं हविष कर्धि वंस्वा नो वार्या पुरु |||
verses.transliteration: nahi te aghne vṛṣabha pratidhṛṣe jambhāso yad vitiṣṭase satvaṃ no hotaḥ suhutaṃ haviṣ kṛdhi vaṃsvā no vāryā puru

translations.griffith: Since you spread out on all sides, your teeth, bull Agni, are not to be resisted; O offerer, do you makeour oblation rightly presented; give us many precious (gifts).

verses.sanskrit: शेषे वनेषु मात्रोः सं तवा मर्तास इन्धते अतन्द्रो हव्या वहसि हविष्क्र्त आदिद देवेषु राजसि |||
verses.transliteration: śeṣe vaneṣu mātroḥ saṃ tvā martāsa indhate atandro havyā vahasi haviṣkṛta ādid deveṣu rājasi

translations.griffith: You sleep within your mothers in the woods, mortals kindle you; unwearied you bear the offerings of thesacrificer, then you shine among the gods.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त होतारस्तमिदीळते तवाग्ने सुत्यजमह्रयम भिनत्स्यद्रिं तपसा वि शोचिषा पराग्ने तिष्ठ जनानति |||
verses.transliteration: sapta hotārastamidīḷate tvāghne sutyajamahrayam bhinatsyadriṃ tapasā vi śociṣā prāghne tiṣṭha janānati

translations.griffith: The seven priests praise you, Agni, giver of good things and unfailing; you cleave the cloud with yourfierce splendour; go forth, having overcome our enemies.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निम-अग्निं वो अध्रिगुं हुवेम वर्क्तबर्हिषः अग्निं हितप्रयसः शश्वतीष्वा होतारं चर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ vo adhrighuṃ huvema vṛktabarhiṣaḥ aghniṃ hitaprayasaḥ śaśvatīṣvā hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: Now that we have cut the sacred grass, let us invoke for you Agni, Agni the irresistible; having plural cedthe oblations, let us invoke Agni, abiding in many (plural ces), the offerer of sacrifices for men.

verses.sanskrit: केतेन शर्मन सचते सुषामण्यग्ने तुभ्यं चिकित्वना इषण्यया नः पुरुरूपमा भर वाजं नेदिष्ठमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: ketena śarman sacate suṣāmaṇyaghne tubhyaṃ cikitvanā iṣaṇyayā naḥ pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye

translations.griffith: (The sacrificer) worships you by praises, Agni, with the experienced (priests) in the rite celebrated withbeautiful Sāman hymns;bring us of your own accord for our protection food of various kinds which may bealways in our reach.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने जरितर्विश्पतिस्तेपानो देव रक्षसः अप्रोषिवान गर्हपतिर्महानसि दिवस पायुर्दुरोणयुः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne jaritarviśpatistepāno deva rakṣasaḥ aproṣivān ghṛhapatirmahānasi divas pāyurduroṇayuḥ

translations.griffith: Divine Agni, worthy of praise, you are the guardian of men, the consumer of the rākṣasas; you aregreat, you the never-absent guardian of the (worshipper's) house, the protector of heaven, ever present in thedwelling.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो रक्ष आ वेशीदाघ्र्णीवसो मा यातुर्यातुमावताम परोगव्यूत्यनिरामप कषुधमग्ने सेध रक्षस्विनः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no rakṣa ā veśīdāghṛṇīvaso mā yāturyātumāvatām paroghavyūtyanirāmapa kṣudhamaghne sedha rakṣasvinaḥ

translations.griffith: O you brilliant wealth, let not the rākṣasa enter us, nor the torment of the evil spirits; Agni, drive awayfurther than a gavyūti from us poverty, hunger and the strong demons.

verses.sanskrit: उभयं शर्णवच्च न इन्द्रो अर्वागिदं वचः सत्राच्यामघवा सोमपीतये धिया शविष्ठ आ गमत |||
verses.transliteration: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavacca na indro arvāghidaṃ vacaḥ satrācyāmaghavā somapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā ghamat
