translations.griffith: PREPARE oblation: let him come; and let the minister serve again  Who knows the ordering thereof,

verses.sanskrit: तं हि सवराजं वर्षभं तमोजसे धिषणे निष्टतक्षतुः उतोपमानां परथमो नि षीदसि सोमकामं हि ते मनः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ hi svarājaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tamojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ utopamānāṃ prathamo ni ṣīdasi somakāmaṃ hi te manaḥ

translations.griffith: Rejoicing in his friendship, let the priest be seated over man,  Beside the shoot of active power.

verses.sanskrit: आ वर्षस्व पुरूवसो सुतस्येन्द्रान्धसः विद्मा हि तवा हरिवः पर्त्सु सासहिमध्र्ष्टं चिद दध्र्ष्वणिम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vṛṣasva purūvaso sutasyendrāndhasaḥ vidmā hi tvā harivaḥ pṛtsu sāsahimadhṛṣṭaṃ cid dadhṛṣvaṇim

translations.griffith: Him, glowing bright beyond all thought, they seek among the race of man;  With him for  tongue  they seize the food.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रामिसत्य मघवन तथेदसदिन्द्र करत्वा यथा वशः सनेम वाजं तव शिप्रिन्नवसा मक्षू चिद यन्तो अद्रिवः |||
verses.transliteration: aprāmisatya maghavan tathedasadindra kratvā yathā vaśaḥ sanema vājaṃ tava śiprinnavasā makṣū cid yanto adrivaḥ

translations.griffith: He hath inflamed the twofold plain: life-giving, he hath climbed the wood,  And with his tongue hath struck the rock.

verses.sanskrit: शग्ध्यू षु शचीपत इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिः भगंन हि तवा यशसं वसुविदमनु शूर चरामसि |||
verses.transliteration: śaghdhyū ṣu śacīpata indra viśvābhirūtibhiḥ bhaghaṃna hi tvā yaśasaṃ vasuvidamanu śūra carāmasi

translations.griffith: Wandering here the radiant Calf finds none to fetter him, and seeks  The Mother to declare his praise.

verses.sanskrit: पौरो अश्वस्य पुरुक्र्द गवामस्युत्सो देव हिरण्ययः नकिर्हि दानं परिमर्धिषत तवे यद-यद यामि तदा भर |||
verses.transliteration: pauro aśvasya purukṛd ghavāmasyutso deva hiraṇyayaḥ nakirhi dānaṃ parimardhiṣat tve yad-yad yāmi tadā bhara

translations.griffith: And now that great and mighty team, the team of horses that are his,  And traces of his car, are seen.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हयेहि चेरवे विदा भगं वसुत्तये उद वाव्र्षस्व मघवन गविष्टय उदिन्द्राश्वमिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hyehi cerave vidā bhaghaṃ vasuttaye ud vāvṛṣasva maghavan ghaviṣṭaya udindrāśvamiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: The seven milk a single cow; the two set other five to work,  On the stream's loud-resounding bank.

verses.sanskrit: तवं पुरू सहस्राणि शतानि च यूथा दानाय मंहसे आ पुरन्दरं चक्र्म विप्रवचस इन्द्रं गायन्तो.अवसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ purū sahasrāṇi śatāni ca yūthā dānāya maṃhase ā purandaraṃ cakṛma vipravacasa indraṃ ghāyanto.avase

translations.griffith: Entreated by Vivasvān's ten, Indra cast down the water-jar  With threefold hammer from the sky.

verses.sanskrit: अविप्रो वा यदविधद विप्रो वेन्द्र ते वचः स पर ममन्दत्त्वाया शतक्रतो पराचामन्यो अहंसन |||
verses.transliteration: avipro vā yadavidhad vipro vendra te vacaḥ sa pra mamandattvāyā śatakrato prācāmanyo ahaṃsana

translations.griffith: Three times the newly-kindled flame proceeds around the sacrifice:  The priests anoint it with the meath.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रबाहुर्म्रक्षक्र्त्वा पुरन्दरो यदि मे शर्णवद धवम वसूयवो वसुपतिं शतक्रतुं सतोमैरिन्द्रं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: ughrabāhurmrakṣakṛtvā purandaro yadi me śṛṇavad dhavam vasūyavo vasupatiṃ śatakratuṃ stomairindraṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: With reverence they drain the fount that circles with its wheel above,  Exhaustless, with the mouth below.

verses.sanskrit: न पापासो मनामहे नारायासो न जळ्हवः यदिन नविन्द्रं वर्षणं सचा सुते सखायं कर्णवामहै |||
verses.transliteration: na pāpāso manāmahe nārāyāso na jaḷhavaḥ yadin nvindraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute sakhāyaṃ kṛṇavāmahai

translations.griffith: The pressing-stones are set at work: the meath is poured into the tank,  At the out-shedding of the fount.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रं युयुज्म पर्तनासु सासहिं रणकातिमदाभ्यम वेदा भर्मं चित सनिता रथीतमो वाजिनं यमिदू नशत |||
verses.transliteration: ughraṃ yuyujma pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ ṛṇakātimadābhyam vedā bhṛmaṃ cit sanitā rathītamo vājinaṃ yamidū naśat

translations.griffith: Ye cows, protect the fount: the two Mighty Ones bless the sacrifice.  The handles twain are wrought of gold.

verses.sanskrit: यत इन्द्र भयामहे ततो नो अभयं कर्धि मघवञ्छग्धितव तन न ऊतिभिर्वि दविषो वि मर्धो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: yata indra bhayāmahe tato no abhayaṃ kṛdhi maghavañchaghdhitava tan na ūtibhirvi dviṣo vi mṛdho jahi

translations.griffith: Pour on the juice the ornament which reaches both the heaven and earth  Supply the liquid to the Bull.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि राधस्पते राधसो महः कषयस्यासि विधतः तं तवा वयं मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः सुतावन्तो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi rādhaspate rādhaso mahaḥ kṣayasyāsi vidhataḥ taṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavannindra ghirvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe

translations.griffith: These know their own abiding-place: like calves beside the mother cows  They meet together with their kin.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र सपळ उत वर्त्रहा परस्पा नो वरेण्यः स नो रक्षिषच्चरमं स मध्यमं स पश्चात पातु नः पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: indra spaḷ uta vṛtrahā paraspā no vareṇyaḥ sa no rakṣiṣaccaramaṃ sa madhyamaṃ sa paścāt pātu naḥ puraḥ

translations.griffith: Devouring in their greedy jaws, they make sustaining food in heaven,  To Indra, Agni light and prayer.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नः पश्चादधरादुत्तरात पुर इन्द्र नि पाहि विश्वतः आरे अस्मत कर्णुहि दैव्यं भयमारे हेतीरदेवीः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ paścādadharāduttarāt pura indra ni pāhi viśvataḥ āre asmat kṛṇuhi daivyaṃ bhayamāre hetīradevīḥ

translations.griffith: The Pious One milked out rich food, sustenance dealt in portions seven,  Together with the Sun's seven rays.

verses.sanskrit: अद्याद्या शवः-शव इन्द्र तरास्व परे च नः विश्वा च नोजरितॄन सत्पते अहा दिवा नक्तं च रक्षिषः |||
verses.transliteration: adyādyā śvaḥ-śva indra trāsva pare ca naḥ viśvā ca nojaritṝn satpate ahā divā naktaṃ ca rakṣiṣaḥ

translations.griffith: I took some Soma when the Sun rose up, O Mitra, Varuṇa.  That is the sick man's medicine.

verses.sanskrit: परभङगी शूरो मघवा तुवीमघः सम्मिष्लो विर्याय कम उभा ते बाहू वर्षणा शतक्रतो नि या वज्रं मिमिक्षतुः |||
verses.transliteration: prabhaṅghī śūro maghavā tuvīmaghaḥ sammiṣlo viryāya kam ubhā te bāhū vṛṣaṇā śatakrato ni yā vajraṃ mimikṣatuḥ

translations.griffith: From where oblations must be laid, which is the Well-beloved's home,  He with his tongue hath compassed heaven.

verses.sanskrit: परो अस्मा उपस्तुतिं भरता यज्जुजोषति उक्थैरिन्द्रस्य माहिनं वयो वर्धन्ति सोमिनो भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: pro asmā upastutiṃ bharatā yajjujoṣati ukthairindrasya māhinaṃ vayo vardhanti somino bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: ROUSE ye for him who keeps the Law, yoke your steeds, Aśvins, to your car  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: अयुजो असमो नर्भिरेकः कर्ष्टीरयास्यः पूर्वीरति पर वाव्र्धे विश्वा जातान्योजसा भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ayujo asamo nṛbhirekaḥ kṛṣṭīrayāsyaḥ pūrvīrati pra vāvṛdhe viśvā jātānyojasā bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Come, Aśvins, with your car more swift than is the twinkling of an eye  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: अहितेन चिदर्वता जीरदानुः सिषासति परवाच्यमिन्द्र तत तव वीर्याणि करिष्यतो भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ahitena cidarvatā jīradānuḥ siṣāsati pravācyamindra tat tava vīryāṇi kariṣyato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Aśvins, ye overlaid with cold the fiery pit for Atri's sake:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: आ याहि कर्णवाम त इन्द्र बरह्माणि वर्धना येभिः शविष्ठ चाकनो भद्रमिह शरवस्यते भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhi kṛṇavāma ta indra brahmāṇi vardhanā yebhiḥ śaviṣṭha cākano bhadramiha śravasyate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Where are ye? whither are ye gone? whither, like falcons, have ye flown?  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: धर्षतश्चिद धर्षन मनः कर्णोषीन्द्र यत तवम तीव्रैः सोमैः सपर्यतो नमोभिः परतिभूषतो भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: dhṛṣataścid dhṛṣan manaḥ kṛṇoṣīndra yat tvam tīvraiḥ somaiḥ saparyato namobhiḥ pratibhūṣato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: If ye at any time this day are listening to this my call,  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: अव चष्ट रचीषमो.अवतानिव मानुषः जुष्ट्वी दक्षस्य सोमिनः सखायं कर्णुते युजं भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ava caṣṭa ṛcīṣamo.avatāniva mānuṣaḥ juṣṭvī dakṣasya sominaḥ sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute yujaṃ bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: The Aśvins, first to hear our prayer, for closest kinship I approach:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे त इन्द्र वीर्यं देवा अनु करतुं ददुः भुवो विश्वस्य गोपतिः पुरुष्टुत भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve ta indra vīryaṃ devā anu kratuṃ daduḥ bhuvo viśvasya ghopatiḥ puruṣṭuta bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: For Atri ye, O Aśvins, made a dwelling-place to shield him well,  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: गर्णे तदिन्द्र ते शव उपमं देवतातये यद धंसि वर्त्रमोजसा शचीपते भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṇe tadindra te śava upamaṃ devatātaye yad dhaṃsi vṛtramojasā śacīpate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye warded off the fervent heat for Atri when he sweetly spake:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: समनेव वपुष्यतः कर्णवन मानुषा युगा विदे तदिन्द्रश्चेतनमध शरुतो भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: samaneva vapuṣyataḥ kṛṇavan mānuṣā yughā vide tadindraścetanamadha śruto bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Erst Saptavadhri by his prayer obtained the trenchant edge of fire:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: उज्जातमिन्द्र ते शव उत तवामुत तव करतुम भूरिगो भूरि वाव्र्धुर्मघवन तव शर्मणि भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ujjātamindra te śava ut tvāmut tava kratum bhūrigho bhūri vāvṛdhurmaghavan tava śarmaṇi bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: Come hither, O ye Lords of wealth, and listen to this call of mine:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: अहं च तवं च वर्त्रहन सं युज्याव सनिभ्य आ अरातीवा चिदद्रिवो.अनु नौ शूर मंसते भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ ca tvaṃ ca vṛtrahan saṃ yujyāva sanibhya ā arātīvā cidadrivo.anu nau śūra maṃsate bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: What is this praise told forth of you as Elders in the ancient way?  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यमिद वा उ तं वयमिन्द्रं सतवाम नान्र्तम महानसुन्वतो वधो भूरि जयोतींषि सुन्वतो भद्रा इन्द्रस्य रातयः |||
verses.transliteration: satyamid vā u taṃ vayamindraṃ stavāma nānṛtam mahānasunvato vadho bhūri jyotīṃṣi sunvato bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ

translations.griffith: One common brotherhood is yours, Aśvins your kindred is the same:  Let your protecting help be near.

verses.sanskrit: स पूर्व्यो महानां वेनः करतुभिरानजे यस्य दवारा मनुष पिता देवेषु धिय आनजे |||
verses.transliteration: sa pūrvyo mahānāṃ venaḥ kratubhirānaje yasya dvārā manuṣ pitā deveṣu dhiya ānaje

translations.griffith: EXERTING all our strength with thoughts of power we glorify in speech  Agni your dear familiar Friend, the darling Guest in every home.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो मानं नोत सदन सोमप्र्ष्ठासो अद्रयः उक्था बरह्मच शंस्या |||
verses.transliteration: divo mānaṃ not sadan somapṛṣṭhāso adrayaḥ ukthā brahmaca śaṃsyā

translations.griffith: Whom, served with sacrificial oil like Mitra, men presenting gifts  Eulogize with their songs of praise

verses.sanskrit: स विद्वानङगिरोभ्य इन्द्रो गा अव्र्णोदप सतुषे तदस्यपौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa vidvānaṅghirobhya indro ghā avṛṇodapa stuṣe tadasyapauṃsyam

translations.griffith: Much-lauded Jātavedas, him who bears oblations up to heaven  Prepared in service of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स परत्नथा कविव्र्ध इन्द्रो वाकस्य वक्षणिः शिवो अर्कस्य होमन्यस्मत्रा गन्त्ववसे |||
verses.transliteration: sa pratnathā kavivṛdha indro vākasya vakṣaṇiḥ śivo arkasya homanyasmatrā ghantvavase

translations.griffith: To noblest Agni, Friend of man, best Vṛtra-slayer, are we come,  Him in whose presence Rksa's son, mighty Srutarvan, waxes great;

verses.sanskrit: आदू नु ते अनु करतुं सवाहा वरस्य यज्यवः शवात्रमर्का अनूषतेन्द्र गोत्रस्य दावने |||
verses.transliteration: ādū nu te anu kratuṃ svāhā varasya yajyavaḥ śvātramarkā anūṣatendra ghotrasya dāvane

translations.griffith: To deathless Jātavedas, meet for praise, adored, with sacred oil,  Visible through the gloom of night

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रे विश्वानि वीर्या कर्तानि कर्त्वानि च यमर्का अध्वरं विदुः |||
verses.transliteration: indre viśvāni vīryā kṛtāni kartvāni ca yamarkā adhvaraṃ viduḥ

translations.griffith: Even Agni whom these priestly men worship with sacrificial gifts,  With lifted ladles offering them.

verses.sanskrit: यत पाञ्चजन्यया विशेन्द्रे घोषा अस्र्क्षत अस्त्र्णाद बर्हणा विपो.अर्यो मानस्य स कषयः |||
verses.transliteration: yat pāñcajanyayā viśendre ghoṣā asṛkṣata astṛṇād barhaṇā vipo.aryo mānasya sa kṣayaḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, this our newest hymn hath been addressed from us to thee,  O cheerful Guest, well-born, most wise, worker of wonders, ne’er deceived.

verses.sanskrit: इयमु ते अनुष्टुतिश्चक्र्षे तानि पौंस्या परावश्चक्रस्य वर्तनिम |||
verses.transliteration: iyamu te anuṣṭutiścakṛṣe tāni pauṃsyā prāvaścakrasya vartanim

translations.griffith: Agni, may it be dear to thee, most grateful, and exceeding sweet:  Grow mightier, eulogized therewith.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वर्ष्णो वयोदन उरु करमिष्ट जीवसे यवं न पश्वा ददे |||
verses.transliteration: asya vṛṣṇo vyodana uru kramiṣṭa jīvase yavaṃ na paśvaā dade

translations.griffith: Splendid with splendours may it be, and in the battle with the foe  Add loftier glory to thy fame.

verses.sanskrit: तद दधाना अवस्यवो युष्माभिर्दक्षपितरः सयाम मरुत्वतो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: tad dadhānā avasyavo yuṣmābhirdakṣapitaraḥ syāma marutvato vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Steed, cow, a lord of heroes, bright like Indra, who shall fill the car.  Whose high renown ye celebrate, and people praise each glorious deed.

verses.sanskrit: बळ रत्वियाय धाम्न रक्वभिः शूर नोनुमः जेषामेन्द्र तवया युजा |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ ṛtviyāya dhāmna ṛkvabhiḥ śūra nonumaḥ jeṣāmendra tvayā yujā

translations.griffith: Thou whom Gopavana made glad with song, O Agni Aṅgiras,  Hear this my call, thou Holy One.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे रुद्रा मेहना पर्वतासो वर्त्रहत्ये भरहूतौ सजोषाः यः शंसते सतुवते धायि पज्र इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अस्मानवन्तु देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: asme rudrā mehanā parvatāso vṛtrahatye bharahūtau sajoṣāḥ yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate dhāyi pajra indrajyeṣṭhā asmānavantu devāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou whom the priestly folk implore to aid the gathering of the spoil,  Such be thou in the fight with foes.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवा मन्दन्तु सतोमः कर्णुष्व राधो अद्रिवः अव बरह्मद्विषो जहि |||
verses.transliteration: ut tvā mandantu stomaḥ kṛṇuṣva rādho adrivaḥ ava brahmadviṣo jahi

translations.griffith: YOKE, Agni, as a charioteer, thy steeds who best invite the Gods: As ancient Herald seat thyself.

verses.sanskrit: पदा पणीन्रराधसो नि बाधस्व महानसि नहि तवा कश्चन परति |||
verses.transliteration: padā paṇīnrarādhaso ni bādhasva mahānasi nahi tvā kaścana prati

translations.griffith: And, God, as skilfullest of all, call for us hitherward the Gods:  Give all our wishes sure effect.

verses.sanskrit: तवमीशिषे सुतानामिन्द्र तवमसुतानाम तवं राजा जनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvamīśiṣe sutānāmindra tvamasutānām tvaṃ rājā janānām

translations.griffith: For thou, Most Youthful, Son of Strength, thou to whom sacrifice is paid,  Art holy, faithful to the Law.

verses.sanskrit: एहि परेहि कषयो दिव्याघोषञ्चर्षणीनाम ओभे पर्णासिरोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: ehi prehi kṣayo divyāghoṣañcarṣaṇīnām obhe pṛṇāsirodasī

translations.griffith: This Agni, Lord of wealth and spoil hundredfold, thousandfold, is head  And chief of riches and a Sage.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चित पर्वतं गिरिं शतवन्तं सहस्रिणम वि सतोत्र्भ्यो रुरोजिथ |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cit parvataṃ ghiriṃ śatavantaṃ sahasriṇam vi stotṛbhyo rurojitha

translations.griffith: As craftsmen bend the felly, so bend at our general call: come nigh,  Aṅgiras, to the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: वयमु तवा दिवा सुते वयं नक्तं हवामहे अस्माकं काममा पर्ण |||
verses.transliteration: vayamu tvā divā sute vayaṃ naktaṃ havāmahe asmākaṃ kāmamā pṛṇa

translations.griffith: Now, O Virūpa, rouse for him, Strong God who shines at early morn,  Fair praise with voice that ceases not.

verses.sanskrit: कव सय वर्षभो युवा तुविग्रीवो अनानतः बरह्मा कस्तं सपर्यति |||
verses.transliteration: kva sya vṛṣabho yuvā tuvighrīvo anānataḥ brahmā kastaṃ saparyati

translations.griffith: With missile of this Agni, his who looks afar, will we lay low  The thief in combat for the kine.

verses.sanskrit: कस्य सवित सवनं वर्षा जुजुष्वानव गछति इन्द्रं कौ सविदा चके |||
verses.transliteration: kasya svit savanaṃ vṛṣā jujuṣvānava ghachati indraṃ kau svidā cake

translations.griffith: Let not the Companies of Gods fail us, like Dawns that float away,  Like cows who leave the niggardly.

verses.sanskrit: कं ते दाना असक्षत वर्त्रहन कं सुवीर्या उक्थे क उ सविदन्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: kaṃ te dānā asakṣata vṛtrahan kaṃ suvīryā ukthe ka u svidantamaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not the sinful tyranny of any fiercely hating foe  Smite us, as billows smite a ship.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते मानुषे जने सोमः पूरुषु सूयते तस्येहि पर दरवा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te mānuṣe jane somaḥ pūruṣu sūyate tasyehi pra dravā piba

translations.griffith: O Agni, God, the people sing reverent praise to thee for strength:  With terrors trouble thou the foe.

verses.sanskrit: अयं ते शर्यणावति सुषोमायामधि परियः आर्जीकीयेमदिन्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ te śaryaṇāvati suṣomāyāmadhi priyaḥ ārjīkīyemadintamaḥ

translations.griffith: Wilt thou not, Agni, lend us aid in winning cattle, winning wealth?  Maker of room, make room for us.

verses.sanskrit: तमद्य राधसे महे चारुं मदाय घर्ष्वये एहीमिन्द्रद्रवा पिब |||
verses.transliteration: tamadya rādhase mahe cāruṃ madāya ghṛṣvaye ehīmindradravā piba

translations.griffith: In this great battle cast us not aside as one who bears a load:  Snatch up the wealth and win it all.

verses.sanskrit: यदिन्द्र परागपागुदं नयग वा हूयसे नर्भिः आ याहि तूयमाशुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yadindra prāghapāghudaṃ nyagh vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ ā yāhi tūyamāśubhiḥ

translations.griffith: NOT to forsake me, I invoke this Indra girt by Maruts,  Lord Of magic power who rules with might.

verses.sanskrit: यद वा परस्रवणे दिवो मादयासे सवर्णरे यद वा समुद्रेन्धसः |||
verses.transliteration: yad vā prasravaṇe divo mādayāse svarṇare yad vā samudreandhasaḥ

translations.griffith: This Indra with his Marut Friends clave into pieces Vṛtra's bead  With hundred-knotted thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा गीर्भिर्महामुरुं हुवे गामिव भोजसे इन्द्र सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā ghīrbhirmahāmuruṃ huve ghāmiva bhojase indra somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Indra, with Marut Friends grown strong, hath rent asunder Vṛtra, and  Released the waters of the sea.

verses.sanskrit: आ त इन्द्र महिमानं हरयो देव ते महः रथे वहन्तु बिभ्रतः |||
verses.transliteration: ā ta indra mahimānaṃ harayo deva te mahaḥ rathe vahantu bibhrataḥ

translations.griffith: This is that Indra who, begirt by Maruts, won the light of heaven  That he might drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र गर्णीष उ सतुषे महानुग्र ईशानक्र्त एहि नः सुतं पिब |||
verses.transliteration: indra ghṛṇīṣa u stuṣe mahānughra īśānakṛt ehi naḥ sutaṃ piba

translations.griffith: Mighty, impetuous, begirt by Maruts, him who loudly roars,  Indra we invocate with songs.

verses.sanskrit: सुतावन्तस्त्वा वयं परयस्वन्तो हवामहे इदं नो बर्हिरासदे |||
verses.transliteration: sutāvantastvā vayaṃ prayasvanto havāmahe idaṃ no barhirāsade

translations.griffith: Indra begirt by Maruts we invoke after the ancient plan,  That he may drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चिद धि शश्वतामसीन्द्र साधारणस्त्वम तं तवा वयं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yaccid dhi śaśvatāmasīndra sādhāraṇastvam taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: O liberal Indra, Marut-girt, much-lauded Śatakratu, drink  The Soma at this sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ते सोम्यं मध्वधुक्षन्नद्रिभिर्नरः जुषाण इन्द्र तत पिब |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ te somyaṃ madhvadhukṣannadribhirnaraḥ juṣāṇa indra tat piba

translations.griffith: To thee, O Indra, Marut-girt, these Soma juices, Thunderer!  Are offered from the heart with lauds.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानर्यो विपश्चितो.अति खयस्तूयमा गहि अस्मे धेहिश्रवो बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: viśvānaryo vipaścito.ati khyastūyamā ghahi asme dhehiśravo bṛhat

translations.griffith: Drink, Indra, with thy Marut Friends, pressed Soma at the morning rites,  Whetting thy thunderbolt with strength.

verses.sanskrit: दाता मे पर्षतीनां राजा हिरण्यवीनाम मा देवा मघवा रिषत |||
verses.transliteration: dātā me pṛṣatīnāṃ rājā hiraṇyavīnām mā devā maghavā riṣat

translations.griffith: Arising in thy might, thy jaws thou shookest, Indra, having quaffed  The Soma which the mortar pressed.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रे पर्षतीनामधि शचन्द्रं बर्हत पर्थु शुक्रं हिरण्यमा ददे |||
verses.transliteration: sahasre pṛṣatīnāmadhi ścandraṃ bṛhat pṛthu śukraṃ hiraṇyamā dade

translations.griffith: Indra, both worlds complained to thee when uttering thy fearful roar,  What time thou smotest Dasyus dead.

verses.sanskrit: नपातो दुर्गहस्य मे सहस्रेण सुराधसः शरवो देवेष्वक्रत |||
verses.transliteration: napāto durghahasya me sahasreṇa surādhasaḥ śravo deveṣvakrata

translations.griffith: From Indra have I measured out a song eight-footed with nine parts,  Delicate, faithful. to the Law.

verses.sanskrit: तरोभिर्वो विदद्वसुमिन्द्रं सबाध ऊतये बर्हद गायन्तः सुतसोमे अध्वरे हुवे भरं न कारिणम |||
verses.transliteration: tarobhirvo vidadvasumindraṃ sabādha ūtaye bṛhad ghāyantaḥ sutasome adhvare huve bharaṃ na kāriṇam

translations.griffith: Thronging together, (worship) for your protection Indra full of might and the revealer of wealth; (worship him), chanting the Bṛhat-sāman at his sacrifice where the Soma is effused, I invoke him as (men invoke) abeneficent master of a household.

verses.sanskrit: न यं दुध्रा वरन्ते न सथिरा मुरो मदे सुषिप्रमन्धसः य आद्र्त्या शशमानाय सुन्वते दाता जरित्र उक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: na yaṃ dudhrā varante na sthirā muro made suṣipramandhasaḥ ya ādṛtyā śaśamānāya sunvate dātā jaritra ukthyam

translations.griffith: He, the handsome-jawed, whom, inthe intoxication of the Soma, the fierce (demons) withstand not, north firm gods, nor mortal (men)-- who confers glorious wealth on him who reverently praises him, offers the Soma and sings hymns.

verses.sanskrit: यः शक्रो मर्क्षो अश्व्यो यो वा कीजो हिरण्ययः स ऊर्वस्य रेजयत्यपाव्र्तिमिन्द्रो गव्यस्य वर्त्रहा |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śakro mṛkṣo aśvyo yo vā kījo hiraṇyayaḥ sa ūrvasya rejayatyapāvṛtimindro ghavyasya vṛtrahā

translations.griffith: He Śakra, who is the purifier (of his worshippers), and well-skilled in horses, who is wonderful andgolden-bodied-- he, Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, shakes the hiding-plural ce of the numerous herd of kine.

verses.sanskrit: निखातं चिद यः पुरुसम्भ्र्तं वसूदिद वपति दाशुषे वज्री सुशिप्रो हर्यश्व इत करदिन्द्रः करत्वा यथा वशत |||
verses.transliteration: nikhātaṃ cid yaḥ purusambhṛtaṃ vasūdid vapati dāśuṣe vajrī suśipro haryaśva it karadindraḥ kratvā yathā vaśat

translations.griffith: He who verily pours forth to the offerer the buried wealth accusative ulated by many, he, Indra, thethunderer, handsome-jawed, borne on bay steeds, does as he plural ases, (when propitiated) with sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यद वावन्थ पुरुष्टुत पुरा चिच्छूर नर्णाम वयं तत्त इन्द्र सं भरामसि यज्ञमुक्थं तुरं वचः |||
verses.transliteration: yad vāvantha puruṣṭuta purā cicchūra nṛṇām vayaṃ tatta indra saṃ bharāmasi yajñamukthaṃ turaṃ vacaḥ

translations.griffith: Hero, praised of many, what of old time you did desire from your votaries, that, Indra, we hasten to bringto you-- oblation and recited praise.

verses.sanskrit: सचा सोमेषु पुरुहूत वज्रिवो मदाय दयुक्ष सोमपाः तवमिद धि बरह्मक्र्ते काम्यं वसु देष्ठः सुन्वते भुवः |||
verses.transliteration: sacā someṣu puruhūta vajrivo madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ tvamid dhi brahmakṛte kāmyaṃ vasu deṣṭhaḥ sunvate bhuvaḥ

translations.griffith: Bearer of the thunderbolt, invoked of many, radiant, drinker of the Soma, be present at our libations foryour exhilaration; for you are an abundant giver of desirable wealth to him who utters your praises and effusesthe Soma.

verses.sanskrit: वयमेनमिदा हयो.अपीपेमेह वज्रिणम तस्मा उ अद्य समना सुतं भरा नूनं भूषत शरुते |||
verses.transliteration: vayamenamidā hyo.apīpemeha vajriṇam tasmā u adya samanā sutaṃ bharā nūnaṃ bhūṣata śrute

translations.griffith: Today and yesterday we have here refreshed him, the thunderer; bring to him today our libation effusedfor (success in) battle; let him now hasten here on hearing our praise.

verses.sanskrit: वर्कश्चिदस्य वारण उरामथिरा वयुनेषु भूषति सेमं नः सतोमं जुजुषाण आ गहीन्द्र पर चित्रया धिया |||
verses.transliteration: vṛkaścidasya vāraṇa urāmathirā vayuneṣu bhūṣati semaṃ naḥ stomaṃ jujuṣāṇa ā ghahīndra pra citrayā dhiyā

translations.griffith: The obstructing robber, the destroyer of travelling enemies, is obedient to him in hiw ways; hasten,Indra, (drawn) by our gorgeous rite, welcoming this our hymn.

verses.sanskrit: कदू नवस्याक्र्तमिन्द्रस्यास्ति पौंस्यम केनो नु कं शरोमतेन न शुश्रुवे जनुषः परि वर्त्रहा |||
verses.transliteration: kadū nvasyākṛtamindrasyāsti pauṃsyam keno nu kaṃ śromatena na śuśruve januṣaḥ pari vṛtrahā

translations.griffith: What act of might is there, unperformed by Indra? Who has not heard of his famous (heroism)? He, theslayer of Vṛtra, (is renowned) from his birth.

verses.sanskrit: कदू महीरध्र्ष्टा अस्य तविषीः कदु वर्त्रघ्नो अस्त्र्तम इन्द्रो विश्वान बेकनाटानहर्द्र्श उत करत्वा पणीन्रभि |||
verses.transliteration: kadū mahīradhṛṣṭā asya taviṣīḥ kadu vṛtraghno astṛtam indro viśvān bekanāṭānahardṛśa uta kratvā paṇīnrabhi

translations.griffith: When were his mighty forces ever languid? When was aught undestroyed before the slayer of Vṛtra?Indra by his energy overpowers all the huckstering usurers who see only this world's days.

verses.sanskrit: वयं घा ते अपूर्व्येन्द्र बरह्माणि वर्त्रहन पुरूतमासःपुरुहूत वज्रिवो भर्तिं न पर भरामसि |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ ghā te apūrvyendra brahmāṇi vṛtrahan purūtamāsaḥpuruhūta vajrivo bhṛtiṃ na pra bharāmasi

translations.griffith: Indra, slayer of Vṛra, invoked of many, we, your many worshippers, offer new hymns to you, thunderer,as your wages.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीश्चिद धि तवे तुविकूर्मिन्नाशसो हवन्त इन्द्रोतयः तिरश्चिदर्यः सवना वसो गहि शविष्ठ शरुधि मे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvīścid dhi tve tuvikūrminnāśaso havanta indrotayaḥ tiraścidaryaḥ savanā vaso ghahi śaviṣṭha śrudhi me havam

translations.griffith: Indra, doer of many great deeds, (other worshippers) invoke the manifold hopes and protections whichabide in you; but rejecting the enemy's oblations, come to us bestower of dwellings; O mightiest, hear my appeal.

verses.sanskrit: वयं घा ते तवे इद विन्द्र विप्र अपि षमसि नहि तवदन्यः पुरुहूत कश्चन मघवन्नस्ति मर्डिता |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ ghā te tve id vindra vipra api ṣmasi nahi tvadanyaḥ puruhūta kaścana maghavannasti marḍitā

translations.griffith: Indra, we are your, therefore we, your worshippers, depend on you; other than you, Maghavan, invokedof many, there is no giver of happiness.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अस्या अमतेरुत कषुधो.अभिशस्तेरव सप्र्धि तवं न उती तव चित्रया धिया शिक्षा शचिष्ठ गातुवित |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no asyā amateruta kṣudho.abhiśasterava spṛdhi tvaṃ na utī tava citrayā dhiyā śikṣā śaciṣṭha ghātuvit

translations.griffith: Deliver from us this poverty, hunger and calumny; give us (our desire) by your protection and wondrousworking; O mightiest, you know the right way.

verses.sanskrit: सोम इद वः सुतो अस्तु कलयो मा बिभीतन अपेदेष धवस्मायति सवयं घैषो अपायति |||
verses.transliteration: soma id vaḥ suto astu kalayo mā bibhītana apedeṣa dhvasmāyati svayaṃ ghaiṣo apāyati

translations.griffith: Let your effused Soma be only (for Indra); O sons of Kali, fear not; that malignant (spirit) departs, of hisown accord he departs.

verses.sanskrit: तयान नु कषत्रियानव आदित्यान याचिषामहे सुम्र्ळीकानभिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: tyān nu kṣatriyānava ādityān yāciṣāmahe sumṛḷīkānabhiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: We solicit for protection those kṣatriyas, the Ādityas who bless (their votaries) abundantly to theattainment of their desires.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रो नो अत्यंहतिं वरुणः पर्षदर्यमा आदित्यासो यथा विदुः |||
verses.transliteration: mitro no atyaṃhatiṃ varuṇaḥ parṣadaryamā ādityāso yathā viduḥ

translations.griffith: May the Ādityas, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman, bear us across our distress, as they know it well.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां हि चित्रमुक्थ्यं वरूथमस्ति दाशुषे आदित्यानामरंक्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: teṣāṃ hi citramukthyaṃ varūthamasti dāśuṣe ādityānāmaraṃkṛte

translations.griffith: To those Ādityas belongs wonderful wealth, worthy of all praise, (laid up) for the offerer of oblationsand the sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit: महि वो महतामवो वरुण मित्रार्यमन अवांस्या वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: mahi vo mahatāmavo varuṇa mitrāryaman avāṃsyā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: You are great, Varuṇa, Mitra and Aryaman, and great is your protection; your protections we implore.

verses.sanskrit: जीवान नो अभि धेतनादित्यासः पुरा हथात कद ध सथहवनश्रुतः |||
verses.transliteration: jīvān no abhi dhetanādityāsaḥ purā hathāt kad dha sthahavanaśrutaḥ

translations.griffith: Ādityas, hasten to us before our death, while we are yet alive; where are you, hearers of prayer?

verses.sanskrit: यद वः शरान्ताय सुन्वते वरूथमस्ति यच्छर्दिः तेना नो अधि वोचत |||
verses.transliteration: yad vaḥ śrāntāya sunvate varūthamasti yacchardiḥ tenā no adhi vocata

translations.griffith: Whatever wealh, whatever dwelling is yours (to give) to the wearied offerer of libations-- with thesespeak to us a kindly answer.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ति देवा अंहोरुर्वस्ति रत्नमनागसः आदित्या अद्भुतैनसः |||
verses.transliteration: asti devā aṃhorurvasti ratnamanāghasaḥ ādityā adbhutainasaḥ

translations.griffith: Great, O deities, is (the guild) of the sinner, but to the sinless is happiness; Ādityas, you are void of sin.

verses.sanskrit: मा नः सेतुः सिषेदयं महे वर्णक्तु नस परि इन्द्र इद धि शरुतो वशी |||
verses.transliteration: mā naḥ setuḥ siṣedayaṃ mahe vṛṇaktu nas pari indra id dhi śruto vaśī

translations.griffith: Let not the snare bind us; may Indra, the renowned, the subduer of all, deliver us for a glorious act.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो मर्चा रिपूणां वर्जिनानामविष्यवः देवा अभि पर मर्क्षत |||
verses.transliteration: mā no mṛcā ripūṇāṃ vṛjinānāmaviṣyavaḥ devā abhi pra mṛkṣata

translations.griffith: O deities, ready to protect, move us not with the destructive net of our wicked enemieṣ

verses.sanskrit: उत तवामदिते मह्यहं देव्युप बरुवे सुम्र्ळीकामभिष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvāmadite mahyahaṃ devyupa bruve sumṛḷīkāmabhiṣṭaye

translations.griffith: I address you, who give abundant delight, the great goddess, Aditi, for the attainment of my desire.

verses.sanskrit: पर्षि दीने गभीर आनुग्रपुत्रे जिघांसतः माकिस्तोकस्य नो रिषत |||
verses.transliteration: parṣi dīne ghabhīra ānughraputre jighāṃsataḥ mākistokasya no riṣat

translations.griffith: You protect on every side; let not (the net) of the destroyer hurt our children, in this shallow water full ofmighhty offspring.

verses.sanskrit: अनेहो न उरुव्रज उरूचि वि परसर्तवे कर्धि तोकाय जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: aneho na uruvraja urūci vi prasartave kṛdhi tokāya jīvase

translations.griffith: Wide-traversing, far-reaching goddess, put forth your power to come to us, innocent ones, that ourchildren may live.

verses.sanskrit: ये मूर्धानः कषितीनामदब्धासः सवयशसः वरता रक्षन्ते अद्रुहः |||
verses.transliteration: ye mūrdhānaḥ kṣitīnāmadabdhāsaḥ svayaśasaḥ vratā rakṣante adruhaḥ

translations.griffith: You who are the heads of men, unharming, and of self-sustained glory, who, benevolent ones, protectour rites.

verses.sanskrit: ते न आस्नो वर्काणामादित्यासो मुमोचत सतेनं बद्धमिवादिते |||
verses.transliteration: te na āsno vṛkāṇāmādityāso mumocata stenaṃ baddhamivādite

translations.griffith: Ādityas, deliver us from the jaws of the destroyers like a bound thief; O Aditi, (deliver us).

verses.sanskrit: अपो षु ण इयं शरुरादित्या अप दुर्मतिः अस्मदेत्वजघ्नुषी |||
verses.transliteration: apo ṣu ṇa iyaṃ śarurādityā apa durmatiḥ asmadetvajaghnuṣī

translations.griffith: Ādityas, let this net, let the malevolent design turn away from us innocuous

verses.sanskrit: शश्वद धि वः सुदानव आदित्या ऊतिभिर्वयम पुरा नूनं बुभुज्महे |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvad dhi vaḥ sudānava ādityā ūtibhirvayam purā nūnaṃ bubhujmahe

translations.griffith: Bounteous Ādityas, by your protections we have continually possessed enjoyments from of old.

verses.sanskrit: शश्वन्तं हि परचेतसः परतियन्तं चिदेनसः देवाः कर्णुथ जीवसे |||
verses.transliteration: śaśvantaṃ hi pracetasaḥ pratiyantaṃ cidenasaḥ devāḥ kṛṇutha jīvase

translations.griffith: Wise deities, keep away from us, that we may live, the many doers of sin who come against us.

verses.sanskrit: तत सु नो नव्यं सन्यस आदित्या यन मुमोचति बन्धाद बद्धमिवादिते |||
verses.transliteration: tat su no navyaṃ sanyasa ādityā yan mumocati bandhād baddhamivādite

translations.griffith: Ādityas and Aditi, let that which releases us as a prisoner from his bond, be ever the object of ourpraise and worship.

verses.sanskrit: नास्माकमस्ति तत तर आदित्यासो अतिष्कदे यूयमस्मभ्यं मर्ळत |||
verses.transliteration: nāsmākamasti tat tara ādityāso atiṣkade yūyamasmabhyaṃ mṛḷata

translations.griffith: Not to us is there strength enough to burst from this (net); O Ādityas, do you grant us your favour.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो हेतिर्विवस्वत आदित्याः कर्त्रिमा शरुः पुरा नुजरसो वधीत |||
verses.transliteration: mā no hetirvivasvata ādityāḥ kṛtrimā śaruḥ purā nujaraso vadhīt

translations.griffith: Let not this weapon of Vivasvat, this net made with hands, Ādityas, destroy us before old age.

verses.sanskrit: वि षु दवेषो वयंहतिमादित्यासो वि संहितम विष्वग वि वर्हता रपः |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣu dveṣo vyaṃhatimādityāso vi saṃhitam viṣvagh vi vṛhatā rapaḥ

translations.griffith: Let not this weapon of Vivasvat, this net made with hands, Ādityas, destroy us before old age.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र कषुमन्तं चित्रं गराभं सं गर्भाय महाहस्ती दक्षिणेन |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū na indra kṣumantaṃ citraṃ ghrābhaṃ saṃ ghṛbhāya mahāhastī dakṣiṇena

translations.griffith: INVITE ye Indra with a song to drink your draught of Soma juice,  All-conquering Śatakratu, most munificent of all who live.

verses.sanskrit: विद्मा हि तवा तुविकूर्मिं तुविदेष्णं तुवीमघम तुविमात्रमवोभिः |||
verses.transliteration: vidmā hi tvā tuvikūrmiṃ tuvideṣṇaṃ tuvīmagham tuvimātramavobhiḥ

translations.griffith: Lauded by many, much-invoked, leader of song, renowned of old:  His name is Indra, tell it forth.

verses.sanskrit: नहि तवा शूर देवा न मर्तासो दित्सन्तम भीमं न गां वारयन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: nahi tvā śūra devā na martāso ditsantam bhīmaṃ na ghāṃ vārayante

translations.griffith: Indra the Dancer be to us the giver of abundant strength:  May he, the mighty, bring it near.

verses.sanskrit: एतो नविन्द्रं सतवामेशानं वस्वः सवराजम न राधसा मर्धिषन नः |||
verses.transliteration: eto nvindraṃ stavāmeśānaṃ vasvaḥ svarājam na rādhasā mardhiṣan naḥ

translations.griffith: Indra whose jaws are strong hath drunk of worshipping Sudaksa's draught,  The Soma juice with barley mixt.

verses.sanskrit: पर सतोषदुप गासिषच्छ्रवत साम गीयमानम अभि राधसा जुगुरत |||
verses.transliteration: pra stoṣadupa ghāsiṣacchravat sāma ghīyamānam abhi rādhasā jughurat

translations.griffith: Call Indra loudly with your songs of praise to drink the Soma juice.  For this is what augments his stiength.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो भर दक्षिणेनाभि सव्येन पर मर्श इन्द्र मा नो वसोर्निर्भाक |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bhara dakṣiṇenābhi savyena pra mṛśa indra mā no vasornirbhāk

translations.griffith: When he hath drqnk its gladdening drops, the God with vigour of a God  Hath far surpassed all things that are.

verses.sanskrit: उप करमस्वा भर धर्षता धर्ष्णो जनानाम अदाशूष्टरस्य वेदः |||
verses.transliteration: upa kramasvā bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo janānām adāśūṣṭarasya vedaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou speedest down to succour us this ever-conquering God of yours,  Him who is drawn to all our songs

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र य उ नु ते अस्ति वाजो विप्रेभिः सनित्वः अस्माभिःसु तं सनुहि |||
verses.transliteration: indra ya u nu te asti vājo viprebhiḥ sanitvaḥ asmābhiḥsu taṃ sanuhi

translations.griffith: The Warrior not to he restrained, the Soma-drinker ne’er o’erthrown,  The Chieftain of resistless might.

verses.sanskrit: सद्योजुवस्ते वाजा अस्मभ्यं विश्वश्चन्द्राः वशैश्च मक्षू जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: sadyojuvaste vājā asmabhyaṃ viśvaścandrāḥ vaśaiśca makṣū jarante

translations.griffith: O Indra, send us riches, thou Omniscient, worthy of our praise:  Help us in the decisive fray.

verses.sanskrit: आ पर दरव परावतो.अर्वावतश्च वर्त्रहन मध्वः परतिप्रभर्मणि |||
verses.transliteration: ā pra drava parāvato.arvāvataśca vṛtrahan madhvaḥ pratiprabharmaṇi

translations.griffith: SURYA, thou mountest up to meet the Hero famous for his wealth,  Who hurls the bolt and works for man

verses.sanskrit: तीव्राः सोमास आ गहि सुतासो मादयिष्णवः पिबा दध्र्ग यथोचिषे |||
verses.transliteration: tīvrāḥ somāsa ā ghahi sutāso mādayiṣṇavaḥ pibā dadhṛgh yathociṣe

translations.griffith: Him who with might of both his arms brake nine-and-ninety castles down,  Slew Vṛtra and smote Ahi dead.

verses.sanskrit: इषा मन्दस्वादु ते.अरं वराय मन्यवे भुवत त इन्द्र शं हर्दे |||
verses.transliteration: iṣā mandasvādu te.araṃ varāya manyave bhuvat ta indra śaṃ hṛde

translations.griffith: This Indra is our gracious Friend. He sends us in a full broad stream  Riches in horses, kine, and corn.

verses.sanskrit: आ तवशत्रवा गहि नयुक्थानि च हूयसे उपमे रोचने दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvaśatravā ghahi nyukthāni ca hūyase upame rocane divaḥ

translations.griffith: Whatever, Vṛtra-slayer! thou, Sūrya, hast risen upon to-day,  Tbat, Indra, all is in thy power.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यायमद्रिभिः सुतो गोभिः शरीतो मदाय कम पर सोम इन्द्र हूयते |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyāyamadribhiḥ suto ghobhiḥ śrīto madāya kam pra soma indra hūyate

translations.griffith: When, Mighty One, Lord of the brave, thou thinkest thus, I shall not die,  That thought of thine is true indeed.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र शरुधि सु मे हवमस्मे सुतस्य गोमतः वि पीतिन्त्र्प्तिमश्नुहि |||
verses.transliteration: indra śrudhi su me havamasme sutasya ghomataḥ vi pītintṛptimaśnuhi

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, goest unto all Soma libations shed for thee,  Both far away and near at hand.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्र चमसेष्वा सोमश्चमूषु ते सुतः पिबेदस्य तवमीशिषे |||
verses.transliteration: ya indra camaseṣvā somaścamūṣu te sutaḥ pibedasya tvamīśiṣe

translations.griffith: We make this Indra very strong to strike the mighty Vṛtra dead:  A vigorous Hero shall he be.

verses.sanskrit: यो अप्सु चन्द्रमा इव सोमश्चमूषु दद्र्शे पिबेदस्य तवमीशिषे |||
verses.transliteration: yo apsu candramā iva somaścamūṣu dadṛśe pibedasya tvamīśiṣe

translations.griffith: Indra was made for giving, set, most mighty, o’er the joyous draught.  Bright, meet for Soma, famed in song.

verses.sanskrit: यं ते शयेनः पदाभरत तिरो रजांस्यस्प्र्तम पिबेदस्य तवमीशिषे |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ te śyenaḥ padābharat tiro rajāṃsyaspṛtam pibedasya tvamīśiṣe

translations.griffith: By song as ’twere, the powerful bolt which none may parry was prepared  Lofty, invincible he grew.

verses.sanskrit: देवानामिदवो महत तदा वर्णीमहे वयम वर्ष्णामस्मभ्यमूतये |||
verses.transliteration: devānāmidavo mahat tadā vṛṇīmahe vayam vṛṣṇāmasmabhyamūtaye

translations.griffith: THE Cow, the famous Mother of the wealthy Maruts, pours her milk:  Both horses of the cars are yoked,—

verses.sanskrit: ते नः सन्तु युजः सदा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वर्धासश्च परचेतसः |||
verses.transliteration: te naḥ santu yujaḥ sadā varuṇo mitro aryamā vṛdhāsaśca pracetasaḥ

translations.griffith: She in whose bosom all the Gods, and Sun and Moon for men to see,  Maintain their everlasting Laws.

verses.sanskrit: अति नो विष्पिता पुरु नौभिरपो न पर्षथ यूयं रतस्यरथ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ati no viṣpitā puru naubhirapo na parṣatha yūyaṃ ṛtasyarathyaḥ

translations.griffith: This all the pious sing to us, and sacred poets evermore:  The Maruts to the Soma-draught

verses.sanskrit: वामं नो अस्त्वर्यमन वामं वरुण शंस्यम वामं हयाव्र्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: vāmaṃ no astvaryaman vāmaṃ varuṇa śaṃsyam vāmaṃ hyāvṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: Here is the Soma ready pressed of this the Maruts drink, of this  Self-luminous the Aśvins drink.

verses.sanskrit: वामस्य हि परचेतस ईशानाशो रिशादसः नेमादित्या अघस्य यत |||
verses.transliteration: vāmasya hi pracetasa īśānāśo riśādasaḥ nemādityā aghasya yat

translations.griffith: Of this, moreover, purified, set in three places, procreant,  Drink Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit: वयमिद वः सुदानवः कषियन्तो यान्तो अध्वन्ना देवा वर्धाय हूमहे |||
verses.transliteration: vayamid vaḥ sudānavaḥ kṣiyanto yānto adhvannā devā vṛdhāya hūmahe

translations.griffith: And Indra, like the Herald Priest, desirous of the milky juice,  At early morn will quaff thereof.

verses.sanskrit: अधि न इन्द्रैषां विष्णो सजात्यानाम इता मरुतो अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: adhi na indraiṣāṃ viṣṇo sajātyānām itā maruto aśvinā

translations.griffith: When have the Princes gleamed and shone through waters as through troops of foes'?  When hasten they whose might ispure?

verses.sanskrit: पर भरात्र्त्वं सुदानवो.अध दविता समान्या मातुर्गर्भे भरामहे |||
verses.transliteration: pra bhrātṛtvaṃ sudānavo.adha dvitā samānyā māturgharbhe bharāmahe

translations.griffith: What favour do I claim this day of you  great Deities, you who are  Wondrously splendid in yourselves?

verses.sanskrit: यूयं हि षठा सुदानव इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अभिद्यवः अधाचिद व उत बरुवे |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ adhācid va uta bruve

translations.griffith: 1 call, to drink the Soma, those Maruts who spread all realms of earth  And luminous regions of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: परेष्ठं वो अतिथिं सतुषे मित्रमिव परियम अग्निं रथं न वेद्यम |||
verses.transliteration: preṣṭhaṃ vo atithiṃ stuṣe mitramiva priyam aghniṃ rathaṃ na vedyam

translations.griffith: SONG-LOVER! like a charioteer come songs to thee when Soma flows.  O Indra, they have called to thee as mother-kine unto their calves.

verses.sanskrit: कविमिव परचेतसं यं देवासो अध दविता नि मर्त्येष्वादधुः |||
verses.transliteration: kavimiva pracetasaṃ yaṃ devāso adha dvitā ni martyeṣvādadhuḥ

translations.griffith: Bright juices bitherward have sped thee, Indra, Lover of the Song.  Drink, Indra, of this flowing sap: in every house ’tis set for thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवं यविष्ठ दाशुषो नॄन पाहि शर्णुधी गिरः रक्षा तोकमुत तमना |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṝn pāhi śṛṇudhī ghiraḥ rakṣā tokamuta tmanā

translations.griffith: Drink Soma to inspirit thee, juice, Indra, which the Falcon brought:  For thou art King and Sovran Lord of all the families of men.

verses.sanskrit: कया ते अग्ने अङगिर ऊर्जो नपादुपस्तुतिम वराय देव मन्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: kayā te aghne aṅghira ūrjo napādupastutim varāya deva manyave

translations.griffith: O Indra, hear Tirasci's call, the call of him who serveth thee.  Satisfy him with wealth of kine and valiant offspring: Great art thou.

verses.sanskrit: दाशेम कस्य मनसा यज्ञस्य सहसो यहो कदु वोच इदंनमः |||
verses.transliteration: dāśema kasya manasā yajñasya sahaso yaho kadu voca idaṃnamaḥ

translations.griffith: For he, O Indra, hath produced for thee the newest gladdening song,  A hymn that springs from careful thought, ancient, and full of sacred truth.

verses.sanskrit: अधा तवं हि नस करो विश्वा अस्मभ्यं सुक्षितीः वाजद्रविणसो गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā tvaṃ hi nas karo viśvā asmabhyaṃ sukṣitīḥ vājadraviṇaso ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: That Indra will we laud whom songs and hymns of praise have magnified.  Striving to win, we celebrate his many deeds of hero might.

verses.sanskrit: कस्य नूनं परीणसो धियो जिन्वसि दम्पते गोषाता यस्यते गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ parīṇaso dhiyo jinvasi dampate ghoṣātā yasyate ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Come now and let us glorify pure Indra with pure Sāma hymns.  Let the pure milky draught delight him strengthened by pure songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit: तं मर्जयन्त सुक्रतुं पुरोयावानमाजिषु सवेषु कषयेषुवाजिनम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ marjayanta sukratuṃ puroyāvānamājiṣu sveṣu kṣayeṣuvājinam

translations.griffith: O Indra, come thou pure to us, with pure assistance, pure thyself.  Pure, send thou riches down to us, and, meet for Soma, pure, be glad.

verses.sanskrit: कषेति कषेमेभिः साधुभिर्नकिर्यं घनन्ति हन्ति यः अग्ने सुवीर एधते |||
verses.transliteration: kṣeti kṣemebhiḥ sādhubhirnakiryaṃ ghnanti hanti yaḥ aghne suvīra edhate

translations.griffith: O Indra, pure, vouchsafe us wealth, and, pure, enrich the worshipper.  Pure, thou dost strike the Vṛtras dead, and strivest, pure, to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: आ मे हवं नासत्याश्विना गछतं युवम मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā me havaṃ nāsatyāśvinā ghachataṃ yuvam madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: FOR him the Mornings made their courses longer, and Nights with pleasant voices spake to Indra.  For him the Floods stood still, the Seven Mothers, Streams easy for the heroes to pass over.

verses.sanskrit: इमं मे सतोममश्विनेमं मे शर्णुतं हवम मध्वः सोमस्यपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ me stomamaśvinemaṃ me śṛṇutaṃ havam madhvaḥ somasyapītaye

translations.griffith: The Darter penetrated, though in trouble, thrice-seven close-pressed ridges of the mountains.  Neither might God nor mortal man accomplish what the Strong Hero wrought in full-grown vigour.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वां कर्ष्णो अश्विना हवते वाजिनीवसू मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ kṛṣṇo aśvinā havate vājinīvasū madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: The mightiest force is Indra's bolt of iron when firmly grasped in both the arms of Indra.  His head and mouth have powers that pass all others, and all his people hasten near to listen.

verses.sanskrit: शर्णुतं जरितुर्हवं कर्ष्णस्य सतुवतो नरा मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇutaṃ jariturhavaṃ kṛṣṇasya stuvato narā madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: 1 count thee as the Holiest of the Holy, the caster-down of what hath ne’er been shaken.  I count thee as the Banner of the heroes, I count thee as the Chief of all men living.

verses.sanskrit: छर्दिर्यन्तमदाभ्यं विप्राय सतुवते नरा मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: chardiryantamadābhyaṃ viprāya stuvate narā madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: What time, O Indra, in thine arms thou tookest thy wildly rushing bolt to Slay the Dragon,  The mountains roared, the cattle loudly bellowed, the Brahmans with their hymns drew nigh to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: गछतं दाशुषो गर्हमित्था सतुवतो अश्विना मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ghachataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhamitthā stuvato aśvinā madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Let us praise him who made these worlds and creatures, all things that after him sprang into being.  May we win Mitra with our songs, and Indra, and. wait upon our Lord with adoration.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जाथां रासभं रथे वीड्वङगे वर्षण्वसू मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: yuñjāthāṃ rāsabhaṃ rathe vīḍvaṅghe vṛṣaṇvasū madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Flying in terror from the snort of Vṛtra, all Deities who were thy friends forsook thee.  So, Indra, be thy friendship with the Maruts: in all these battles thou shalt be the victor.

verses.sanskrit: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता रथेना यातमश्विना मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā rathenā yātamaśvinā madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Thrice-sixty Maruts, waxing strong, were with thee, like piles of beaming light, worthy of worship.  We come to thee: grant us a happy portion. Let us adore thy might with this oblation.

verses.sanskrit: नू मे गिरो नासत्याश्विना परावतं युवम मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: nū me ghiro nāsatyāśvinā prāvataṃ yuvam madhvaḥ somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: A sharpened weapon is the host of Maruts. Who, Indra, dares withstand thy bolt of thunder?  Weaponless are the Asuras, the godless: scatter them with thy wheel, Impetuous Hero.

verses.sanskrit: उभा हि दस्रा भिषजा मयोभुवोभा दक्षस्य वचसो बभूवथुः ता वां विश्वको हवते तनूक्र्थे मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम |||
verses.transliteration: ubhā hi dasrā bhiṣajā mayobhuvobhā dakṣasya vacaso babhūvathuḥ tā vāṃ viśvako havate tanūkṛthe mā no vi yauṣṭaṃ sakhyā mumocatam

translations.griffith: O INDRA, Lord of Light, what joys thou broughtest from the Asuras,  Prosper therewith, O Maghavan, him who lauds that deed, and those whose grass is trimmed for thee.

verses.sanskrit: कथा नूनं वां विमना उप सतवद युवं धियं ददथुर्वस्यैष्तये ता वां विश्वको ... |||
verses.transliteration: kathā nūnaṃ vāṃ vimanā upa stavad yuvaṃ dhiyaṃ dadathurvasyaiṣtaye tā vāṃ viśvako ...

translations.griffith: The unwasting share of steeds and kine which, Indra, thou hast fast secured,  Grant to the worshipper who presses Soma and gives guerdon, not unto the churl.

verses.sanskrit: युवं हि षमा पुरुभुजेममेधतुं विष्णाप्वे ददथुर्वस्यैष्टये ता वां विश्वको ... |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ hi ṣmā purubhujemamedhatuṃ viṣṇāpve dadathurvasyaiṣṭaye tā vāṃ viśvako ...

translations.griffith: The riteless, godless man who sleeps, O Indra, his unbroken steep,—  May he by following his own devices die. Hide from him wealth that nourishes.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयं वीरं धनसां रजीषिणं दूरे चित सन्तमवसे हवामहे यस्य सवादिष्ठा सुमतिः पितुर्यथा मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyaṃ vīraṃ dhanasāṃ ṛjīṣiṇaṃ dūre cit santamavase havāmahe yasya svādiṣṭhā sumatiḥ pituryathā mā no vi yauṣṭaṃ sakhyā mumocatam

translations.griffith: Whether, O Śakra, thou be far, or, Vṛtra-slayer, near at hand,  Thence by heaven-reaching songs he who hath pressed the juice invites thee with thy long-maned Steeds.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन देवः सविता शमायत रतस्य शर्ङगमुर्विया वि पप्रथे रतं सासाह महि चित पर्तन्यतो मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena devaḥ savitā śamāyata ṛtasya śṛṅghamurviyā vi paprathe ṛtaṃ sāsāha mahi cit pṛtanyato mā no vi yauṣṭaṃ sakhyā mumocatam

translations.griffith: Whether thou art in heaven's bright sphere, or in the basin of the sea;  Whether, chief Vṛtra-slayer, in some place on earth, or in the firmament, approach.

verses.sanskrit: दयुम्नी वां सतोमो अश्विना करिविर्न सेक आ गतम मध्वःसुतस्य स दिवि परियो नरा पातं गौराविवेरिणे |||
verses.transliteration: dyumnī vāṃ stomo aśvinā krivirna seka ā ghatam madhvaḥsutasya sa divi priyo narā pātaṃ ghaurāviveriṇe

translations.griffith: To Indra sing a Sāma hymn, a lofty song to Lofty Sage,  To him who guards the Law, inspired, and fain for praise.

verses.sanskrit: पिबतं घर्मं मधुमन्तमश्विना बर्हिः सीदतं नरा ता मन्दसाना मनुषो दुरोण आ नि पातं वेदसा वयः |||
verses.transliteration: pibataṃ gharmaṃ madhumantamaśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā ni pātaṃ vedasā vayaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, art the Conqueror: thou gavest splendour to the Sun.  Maker of all things, thou art Mighty and All-God.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां विश्वाभिरूतिभिः परियमेधा अहूषत ता वर्तिर्यातमुप वर्क्तबर्हिषो जुष्टं यज्ञं दिविष्टिषु |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ viśvābhirūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata tā vartiryātamupa vṛktabarhiṣo juṣṭaṃ yajñaṃ diviṣṭiṣu

translations.griffith: Radiant with light thou wentest to the sky, the luminous realm of heaven.  ne Deities, Indra strove to win thee for their Friend.

verses.sanskrit: पिबतं सोमं मधुमन्तमश्विना बर्हिः सीदतं सुमत ता वाव्र्धाना उप सुष्टुतिं दिवो गन्तं गौराविवेरिणम |||
verses.transliteration: pibataṃ somaṃ madhumantamaśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṃ sumat tā vāvṛdhānā upa suṣṭutiṃ divo ghantaṃ ghaurāviveriṇam

translations.griffith: Come unto us, O Indra, dear, still conquering, unconcealable,  Vast as a mountain spread on all sides, Lord of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आ नूनं यातमश्विनाश्वेभिः परुषितप्सुभिः दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी शुभस पती पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा |||
verses.transliteration: ā nūnaṃ yātamaśvināśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ dasrā hiraṇyavartanī śubhas patī pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā

translations.griffith: O truthful Soma-drinker, thou art mightier than both the worlds.  Thou strengthenest him who pours libation, Lord of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वयं हि वां हवामहे विपन्यवो विप्रासो वाजसातये तावल्गू दस्रा पुरुदंससा धियाश्विना शरुष्ट्या गतम |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ hi vāṃ havāmahe vipanyavo viprāso vājasātaye tāvalghū dasrā purudaṃsasā dhiyāśvinā śruṣṭyā ghatam

translations.griffith: For thou art he, O Indra, wiio stormeth all castles of the foe,  Slayer of Dasyus, man's Supporter, Lord of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तं वो दस्मं रतीषहं वसोर्मन्दानमन्धसः अभि वत्सं न सवसरेषु धेनव इन्द्रं गीर्भिर्नवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo dasmaṃ ṛtīṣahaṃ vasormandānamandhasaḥ abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ ghīrbhirnavāmahe

translations.griffith: O THUNDERER, zealous worshippers gave thee drink this time yesterday.  So, Indra, listen here to those who bring the laud: come near unto our dwellingplace.

verses.sanskrit: दयुक्षं सुदानुं तविषीभिराव्र्तं गिरिं न पुरुभोजसम कषुमन्तं वाजं शतिनं सहस्रिणं मक्षू गोमन्तमीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: dyukṣaṃ sudānuṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtaṃ ghiriṃ na purubhojasam kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ makṣū ghomantamīmahe

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, fair-helmed, rejoice thee: this we crave. Here the disposers wait on thee.  Thy loftiest glories claim our lauds beside the juice, O Indra, Lover of the Song.

verses.sanskrit: न तवा बर्हन्तो अद्रयो वरन्त इन्द्र वीळवः यद दित्ससि सतुवते मावते वसु नकिष टदा मिनाति ते |||
verses.transliteration: na tvā bṛhanto adrayo varanta indra vīḷavaḥ yad ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakiṣ ṭadā mināti te

translations.griffith: Turning, as ’twere, to meet the Sun, enjoy from Indra all good things.  When he who will be born is born with power we look to treasures as our heritage.

verses.sanskrit: योद्धासि करत्वा शवसोत दंसना विश्वा जाताभि मज्मना आ तवायमर्क ऊतये ववर्तति यं गोतमा अजीजनन |||
verses.transliteration: yoddhāsi kratvā śavasota daṃsanā viśvā jātābhi majmanā ā tvāyamarka ūtaye vavartati yaṃ ghotamā ajījanan

translations.griffith: Praise him who sends us wealth, whose bounties injure none: good are the gifts which Indra. grants.  He is not worth with one who satisfies his wish: he turns his mind to giving boons.

verses.sanskrit: पर हि रिरिक्ष ओजसा दिवो अन्तेभ्यस परि न तवा विव्याचरज इन्द्र पार्थिवमनु सवधां ववक्षिथ |||
verses.transliteration: pra hi ririkṣa ojasā divo antebhyas pari na tvā vivyācaraja indra pārthivamanu svadhāṃ vavakṣitha

translations.griffith: Thou in thy battles, Indra, art subduer of all hostile bands.  Father art thou, aIl-conquering, cancelling the curse, thou victor of the vanquisher.

verses.sanskrit: नकिः परिष्टिर्मघवन मघस्य ते यद दाशुषे दशस्यसि अस्माकं बोध्युचथस्य चोदिता मंहिष्ठो वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: nakiḥ pariṣṭirmaghavan maghasya te yad dāśuṣe daśasyasi asmākaṃ bodhyucathasya coditā maṃhiṣṭho vājasātaye

translations.griffith: The Earth and Heaven clung close to thy victorious might as to their calf two mother-cows.  When thou attackest Vṛtra all the hostile bands shrink and faint, Indra, at thy wrath.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हदिन्द्राय गायत मरुतो वर्त्रहन्तमम येन जयोतिरजनयन्न्र्ताव्र्धो देवं देवाय जाग्र्वि |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhadindrāya ghāyata maruto vṛtrahantamam yena jyotirajanayannṛtāvṛdho devaṃ devāya jāghṛvi

translations.griffith: I MOVE before thee here present in person, and all the Deities follow behind me.  When, Indra, thou securest me my portion, with me thou shalt perform heroic actions.

verses.sanskrit: अपाधमदभिशस्तीरशस्तिहाथेन्द्रो दयुम्न्याभवत देवास्त इन्द्र सख्याय येमिरे बर्हद्भानो मरुद्गण |||
verses.transliteration: apādhamadabhiśastīraśastihāthendro dyumnyābhavat devāsta indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhadbhāno marudghaṇa

translations.griffith: The food of meath in foremost place I give thee, thy Soma shall be pressed, thy share appointed.  Thou on my right shalt be my friend and comrade: then shall we two smite dead full many a foeman.

verses.sanskrit: पर व इन्द्राय बर्हते मरुतो बरह्मार्चत वर्त्रं हनति वर्त्रहा शतक्रतुर्वज्रेण शतपर्वणा |||
verses.transliteration: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata vṛtraṃ hanati vṛtrahā śatakraturvajreṇa śataparvaṇā

translations.griffith: Striving for strength bring forth a laud to Indra, a truthful hymn if he in truth existeth.  One and another say, There is no Indra. Who hath beheld him? Whom then shall we honour?

verses.sanskrit: अभि पर भर धर्षता धर्षन्मनः शरवश्चित ते असद बर्हत अर्षन्त्वापो जवसा वि मातरो हनो वर्त्रं जया सवः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣanmanaḥ śravaścit te asad bṛhat arṣantvāpo javasā vi mātaro hano vṛtraṃ jayā svaḥ

translations.griffith: Here am I, look upon me here, O singer. All that existeth 1 surpass in greatness.  The Holy Law's commandments make me mighty. Rending with strength I rend the worlds asunder.

verses.sanskrit: यज्जायथा अपूर्व्य मघवन वर्त्रहत्याय तत पर्थिवीमप्रथयस्तदस्तभ्ना उत दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: yajjāyathā apūrvya maghavan vṛtrahatyāya tat pṛthivīmaprathayastadastabhnā uta dyām

translations.griffith: When the Law's lovers mounted and ap. proached me as 1 sate lone upon the dear sky's summit.  Then spake my spirit to the heart within me, My friends have cried unto me with their children.

verses.sanskrit: तत ते यज्ञो अजायत तदर्क उत हस्क्र्तिः तद विश्वमभिभूरसि यज्जातं यच्च जन्त्वम |||
verses.transliteration: tat te yajño ajāyata tadarka uta haskṛtiḥ tad viśvamabhibhūrasi yajjātaṃ yacca jantvam

translations.griffith: All these thy deeds must be declared at Soma-feasts, wrought, Indra, Bounteous Lord, for him who sheds the juice,  When thou didst open wealth heaped up by many, brought from far away to Sarablia, the Ṛṣi's kin.

verses.sanskrit: आमासु पक्वमैरय आ सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि घर्मं न सामन तपता सुव्र्क्तिभिर्जुष्टं गिर्वणसे बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: āmāsu pakvamairaya ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi gharmaṃ na sāman tapatā suvṛktibhirjuṣṭaṃ ghirvaṇase bṛhat

translations.griffith: Now run ye forth your several ways: he is not here who kept you back.  For hath not Indra sunk his bolt deep down in Vṛtra's vital part?

verses.sanskrit: आ नो विश्वासु हव्य इन्द्रः समत्सु भूषतु उप बरह्माणि सवनानि वर्त्रहा परमज्या रचीषमः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no viśvāsu havya indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyā ṛcīṣamaḥ

translations.griffith: YEA, specially that mortal man hath toiled for service of the Gods,  Who quickly hath brought near Mitra and Varuṇa. to share his sacrificial gifts.

verses.sanskrit: तवं दाता परथमो राधसामस्यसि सत्य ईशानक्र्त तुविद्युम्नस्य युज्या वर्णीमहे पुत्रस्य शवसो महः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ dātā prathamo rādhasāmasyasi satya īśānakṛt tuvidyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavaso mahaḥ

translations.griffith: Supreme in sovran power, far-sighted, Chiefs and Kings, most swift to hear from far away,  Both, wondrously, set them in motion as with arms, in company with Sūrya's beams.

verses.sanskrit: बरह्मा त इन्द्र गिर्वणः करियन्ते अनतिद्भुता इमा जुषस्वहर्यश्व योजनेन्द्र या ते अमन्महि |||
verses.transliteration: brahmā ta indra ghirvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā imā juṣasvaharyaśva yojanendra yā te amanmahi

translations.griffith: The rapid messenger who runs before you, Mitra-Varuṇa, with iron head, swift to the draught,

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि सत्यो मघवन्ननानतो वर्त्रा भूरि नय्र्ञ्जसे सत्वं शविष्ठ वज्रहस्त दाशुषे.अर्वाञ्चं रयिमा कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi satyo maghavannanānato vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase satvaṃ śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe.arvāñcaṃ rayimā kṛdhi

translations.griffith: He whom no man may question, none may summon back, who stands not still for colloquy,—  From hostile clash with him keep ye us safe this day: keep us in safety with your arms.

verses.sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र यशा अस्य रजीषी शवसस पते तवं वर्त्राणि हंस्यप्रतीन्येक इदनुत्ता चर्षणीध्र्ता |||
verses.transliteration: tvamindra yaśā asy ṛjīṣī śavasas pate tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi haṃsyapratīnyeka idanuttā carṣaṇīdhṛtā

translations.griffith: To Aryaman and Mitra sing a reverent song, O pious one,  A pleasant hymn that shall protect to Varuṇa: sing forth a laud unto the Kings.

verses.sanskrit: तमु तवा नूनमसुर परचेतसं राधो भागमिवेमहे महीव कर्त्तिः शरणा त इन्द्र पर ते सुम्ना नो अश्नवन |||
verses.transliteration: tamu tvā nūnamasura pracetasaṃ rādho bhāghamivemahe mahīva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā ta indra pra te sumnā no aśnavan

translations.griffith: The true, Red Treasure they have sent, one only Son born of the Three.  They, the Immortal Ones, never deceived, survey the families of mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: कन्या वारवायती सोममपि सरुताविदत अस्तं भरन्त्यब्रवीदिन्द्राय सुनवै तवा शक्राय सुनवै तवा |||
verses.transliteration: kanyā vāravāyatī somamapi srutāvidat astaṃ bharantyabravīdindrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā

translations.griffith: LORD of the house, Sage, ever young, high power of life, O Agni, God,  Thou givest to thy worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: असौ य एषि वीरको गर्हं-गर्हं विचाकशद इमं जम्भसुतं पिब धानावन्तं करम्भिणमपूपवन्तमुक्थिनम |||
verses.transliteration: asau ya eṣi vīrako ghṛhaṃ-ghṛhaṃ vicākaśad imaṃ jambhasutaṃ piba dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇamapūpavantamukthinam

translations.griffith: So with our song that prays and serves, attentive, Lord of spreading light,  Agni, bring hitherward the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ चन तवा चिकित्सामो.अधि चन तवा नेमसि शनैरिव शनकैरिवेन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव |||
verses.transliteration: ā cana tvā cikitsāmo.adhi cana tvā nemasi śanairiva śanakairivendrāyendo pari srava

translations.griffith: For, Ever-Youthful One, with thee, best Furtherer, as our ally,  We overcome, to win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: कुविच्छकत कुवित करत कुविन नो वस्यसस करत कुवित पतिद्विषो यतीरिन्द्रेण संगमामहै |||
verses.transliteration: kuvicchakat kuvit karat kuvin no vasyasas karat kuvit patidviṣo yatīrindreṇa saṃghamāmahai

translations.griffith: As Aurva Bhṛgu used, as Apnavāna used, I call the pure  Agni who clothes him with the sea.

verses.sanskrit: इमानि तरीणि विष्टपा तानीन्द्र वि रोहय शिरस्ततस्योर्वरामादिदं म उपोदरे |||
verses.transliteration: imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tānīndra vi rohaya śirastatasyorvarāmādidaṃ ma upodare

translations.griffith: 1 call the Sage who sounds like wind, the Might that like Parjanya roars,  Agni who clothes him with the sea.

verses.sanskrit: असौ च या न उर्वरादिमां तन्वं मम अथो ततस्य यच्छिरः सर्वा ता रोमशा कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: asau ca yā na urvarādimāṃ tanvaṃ mama atho tatasya yacchiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi

translations.griffith: As Savitar's productive Power, as him who sends down bliss, I call  Agni who clothes him with the sea.

verses.sanskrit: खे रथस्य खे.अनसः खे युगस्य शतक्रतो अपालामिन्द्रत्रिष पूत्व्यक्र्णोः सूर्यत्वचम |||
verses.transliteration: khe rathasya khe.anasaḥ khe yughasya śatakrato apālāmindratriṣ pūtvyakṛṇoḥ sūryatvacam

translations.griffith: Hither, for powerful kirship, I call Agni, him Who prospers you,  Most frequent at our solemn rites

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा गिरो रथीरिवास्थुः सुतेषु गिर्वणः अभि तवा समनूषतेन्द्र वत्सं न मातरः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā ghiro rathīrivāsthuḥ suteṣu ghirvaṇaḥ abhi tvā samanūṣatendra vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ

translations.griffith: As with Manu Samvarani, Indra, thou drankest Soma juice,  And, Maghavan, with Nipatithi, Medbyatithi, with Pustigu and Srustigu,—

verses.sanskrit: आ तवा शुक्रा अचुच्यवुः सुतास इन्द्र गिर्वणः पिबा तवस्यान्धस इन्द्र विश्वासु ते हितम |||
verses.transliteration: ā tvā śukrā acucyavuḥ sutāsa indra ghirvaṇaḥ pibā tvasyāndhasa indra viśvāsu te hitam

translations.griffith: T'he son of Prsadvana was Praskaniva's host, who lay decrepit and forlorn.  Aided by thee the Ṛṣi Dasyave-vrka strove to obtain thousands of kine.

verses.sanskrit: पिबा सोमं मदाय कमिन्द्र शयेनाभ्र्तं सुतम तवं हिशश्वतीनां पती राजा विशामसि |||
verses.transliteration: pibā somaṃ madāya kamindra śyenābhṛtaṃ sutam tvaṃ hiśaśvatīnāṃ patī rājā viśāmasi

translations.griffith: Call hither with thy newest song Indra who lacks not hymns of praise,  Him who observes and knows, inspirer of the sage, him who seems eager to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit: शरुधी हवं तिरश्च्या इन्द्र यस्त्वा सपर्यति सुवीर्यस्य गोमतो रायस पूर्धि महानसि |||
verses.transliteration: śrudhī havaṃ tiraścyā indra yastvā saparyati suvīryasya ghomato rāyas pūrdhi mahānasi

translations.griffith: He unto whom they sang the seven-headed hymn, three-parted, in the loftiest place,  He sent his thunder down on all these living things, and so displayed heroic might.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र यस्ते नवायसीं गिरं मन्द्रामजीजनत चिकित्विन्मनसं धियं परत्नां रतस्य पिप्युषीम |||
verses.transliteration: indra yaste navāyasīṃ ghiraṃ mandrāmajījanat cikitvinmanasaṃ dhiyaṃ pratnāṃ ṛtasya pipyuṣīm

translations.griffith: We invocate that Indra who bestoweth precious things on us.  Now do we know his newest favour; may we gain a stable that is full of kine.

verses.sanskrit: तमु षटवाम यं गिर इन्द्रमुक्थानि वाव्र्धुः पुरूण्यस्य पौंस्या सिषासन्तो वनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: tamu ṣṭavāma yaṃ ghira indramukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ purūṇyasya pauṃsyā siṣāsanto vanāmahe

translations.griffith: He whom thou aidest, gracious Lord, to give again, obtains great wealth to nourish him.  We with our Soma ready, Lover of the Song! call, Indra Maghavan, on thee.

verses.sanskrit: एतो नविन्द्रं सतवाम शुद्धं शुद्धेन साम्ना शुद्धैरुक्थैर्वाव्र्ध्वांसं शुद्ध आशीर्वान ममत्तु |||
verses.transliteration: eto nvindraṃ stavāma śuddhaṃ śuddhena sāmnā śuddhairukthairvāvṛdhvāṃsaṃ śuddha āśīrvān mamattu

translations.griffith: Ne’er art thou fruitless, Indra ne’er dost thou desert the worshipper  But now, O Maghavan, thy bounty as a God is poured forth ever more and more.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र शुद्धो न आ गहि शुद्धः शुद्धाभिरूतिभिः शुद्धो रयिं नि धारय शुद्धो ममद्धि सोम्यः |||
verses.transliteration: indra śuddho na ā ghahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhirūtibhiḥ śuddho rayiṃ ni dhāraya śuddho mamaddhi somyaḥ

translations.griffith: He who hath. overtaken Krvi with his might, and silenced Śuṣṇa with deathbolts,—  When he supported yonder heaven and spread it out, then first the son of earth was born.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र शुद्धो हि नो रयिं शुद्धो रत्नानि दाशुषे शुद्धो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नसे शुद्धो वाजं सिषाससि |||
verses.transliteration: indra śuddho hi no rayiṃ śuddho ratnāni dāśuṣe śuddho vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddho vājaṃ siṣāsasi

translations.griffith: Good Lord of wealth is he to whom all Āryas, Dāsas here belong.  Directly unto thee, the pious Ruśama Paviru, is that wealth brought nigh.
